23144	39	4	5	[]
23145	39	4	6	[]
23146	40	1	1	  The  Genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham.
23147	40	1	2	 Abraham was the father of Isaac; Isaac of Jacob; Jacob of Judah and his brothers.
23148	40	1	3	 Judah was the father (by Tamar) of  Perez and Zerah; Perez of Hezron; Hezron of Ram;
23149	40	1	4	 Ram of Amminadab; Amminadab of Nahshon; Nahshon of Salmon;
23150	40	1	5	 Salmon (by Rahab) of Boaz; Boaz (by Ruth) of Obed; Obed of Jesse;
23151	40	1	6	 Jesse of David--the King. David (by Uriah's widow) was the father of Solomon;
23152	40	1	7	 Solomon of Rehoboam; Rehoboam of Abijah; Abijah of Asa;
23153	40	1	8	 Asa of Jehoshaphat; Jehoshaphat of Jehoram; Jehoram of Uzziah;
23154	40	1	9	 Uzziah of Jotham; Jotham of Ahaz; Ahaz of Hezekiah;
23155	40	1	10	 Hezekiah of Manasseh; Manasseh of Amon; Amon of Josiah;
23156	40	1	11	 Josiah of Jeconiah and his brothers at the period of the Removal to Babylon.
23157	40	1	12	 After the Removal to Babylon Jeconiah had a son Shealtiel; Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel;
23158	40	1	13	 Zerubbabel of Abiud; Abiud of Eliakim; Eliakim of Azor;
23159	40	1	14	 Azor of Zadok; Zadok of Achim; Achim of Eliud;
23160	40	1	15	 Eliud of Eleazar; Eleazar of Matthan; Matthan of Jacob;
23161	40	1	16	 and Jacob of Joseph the husband of Mary, who was the mother of JESUS who is called CHRIST.
23162	40	1	17	 There are therefore, in all, fourteen generations from Abraham to David; fourteen from David to the Removal to Babylon; and fourteen from the Removal to Babylon to the Christ.
23163	40	1	18	 The circumstances of the birth  of Jesus Christ were these. After his mother Mary was betrothed to Joseph, before they were united in marriage, she was found to be with child through the Holy Spirit.
23164	40	1	19	 But Joseph her husband, being a  kind-hearted man and unwilling publicly to disgrace her, had determined to release her privately from the betrothal.
23165	40	1	20	 But while he  was contemplating this step, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, "Joseph, son of David, do not be afraid to bring home your wife Mary, for she is with child through the Holy Spirit.
23166	40	1	21	 She will give birth to a Son, and you are to call His name  JESUS for He it is who will save His People from their sins."
23167	40	1	22	 All this  took place in  fulfilment of what the Lord had spoken through the Prophet,
23168	40	1	23	 <"Mark! The maiden will be with child and will give birth to a son, and they will call His name Immanuel"> --a word which signifies <`God with us'>.
23169	40	1	24	 When Joseph awoke, he did as the angel of the Lord had commanded, and brought home his wife,
23170	40	1	25	 but did not live with her until she had given birth to  a son. The child's name he called JESUS.
23171	40	2	1	 Now after the birth of Jesus, which took place at Bethlehem in Judaea  in the reign of King Herod,  excitement was produced in Jerusalem by the arrival of certain  Magi from the east,
23172	40	2	2	 inquiring, "Where is the newly born king of the Jews? For we have seen his Star in the east, and have come here to do him homage."
23173	40	2	3	 Reports of this soon reached the king, and greatly agitated not only him but all the people of Jerusalem.
23174	40	2	4	 So he assembled all the  High Priests and Scribes of the people, and  anxiously asked them where the Christ was to be born.
23175	40	2	5	 "At Bethlehem in Judaea," they replied; "for so it stands written in the words of the Prophet,
23176	40	2	6	 <"`And thou,  Bethlehem in the land of Judah, by no means the least honorable art thou among  princely places in Judah! For from thee shall come a prince--one who shall be the Shepherd of My People Israel.'">
23177	40	2	7	 Thereupon Herod sent privately for the Magi and ascertained from them the exact time  of the star's appearing.
23178	40	2	8	 He then directed them to go to Bethlehem, adding, "Go and make careful inquiry about the child, and when you have found him, bring me word, that I too may come and  do him homage."
23179	40	2	9	 After hearing what the king said, they went to Bethlehem, while,  strange to say, the star  they had seen in the east led them on until it came and stood over the place where the babe was.
23180	40	2	10	 When they saw the star, the sight filled them with intense joy.
23181	40	2	11	 So they entered the house; and when they  saw the babe  with His mother Mary, they prostrated themselves and did Him homage, and opening their treasure-chests offered gifts to Him--gold, frankincense, and myrrh.
23182	40	2	12	 But being  forbidden by God in a dream to return to Herod, they went back to their own country by a different route.
23183	40	2	13	 When they were  gone, and angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream and said, "Rise: take the babe and His mother and escape to Egypt, and remain there till I bring you word. For Herod is about to make search for the child in order to destroy Him."
23184	40	2	14	 So Joseph roused himself and took the babe and His mother by night and departed into Egypt.
23185	40	2	15	 There he remained till Herod's death, that what the Lord had said through the Prophet might be  fulfilled, <"Out of Egypt I called My Son.">
23186	40	2	16	 Then Herod, finding that the Magi had trifled with him, was furious, and sent and massacred all the boys under two years of age, in Bethlehem and all its neighbourhood, according to the date he had so carefully ascertained from the Magi.
23187	40	2	17	 Then were these words, spoken by the Prophet Jeremiah,  fulfilled,
23188	40	2	18	 <"A voice was heard in Ramah, wailing and bitter lamentation: It was Rachel  bewailing her children, and she refused to be comforted because there were no more.">
23189	40	2	19	 But after Herod's death an angel of the Lord appeared in a dream to Joseph in Egypt, and said to him,
23190	40	2	20	 "Rise from sleep, and take the child and His mother, and go into the land of Israel, for those who were seeking the child's life are dead."
23191	40	2	21	 So he roused himself and took the child and His mother and came into the land of Israel.
23192	40	2	22	 But hearing that Archelaus had succeeded his father Herod on the throne of Judaea, he was afraid to go there; and being instructed  by God in a dream he withdrew into Galilee,
23193	40	2	23	 and went and settled in a town called Nazareth, in order that these words spoken through the Prophets might be fulfilled, <"He shall be called a  Nazarene.">
23194	40	3	1	  About this time John  the Baptist made his appearance, preaching in the Desert of Judaea.
23195	40	3	2	  "Repent," he said, "for the Kingdom of the Heavens is now close at hand."
23196	40	3	3	 He it is who was spoken of through the Prophet Isaiah when he said, <"The voice of one crying aloud,  `In the desert prepare ye a road for the Lord: make His highway straight.'">
23197	40	3	4	  This man John wore a garment of camel's hair, and a loincloth of leather; and he lived upon locusts and wild honey.
23198	40	3	5	 Then large numbers of people went out to him--people from Jerusalem and from all Judaea, and from the whole of the Jordan valley--
23199	40	3	6	 and were baptized by him in the Jordan, making full confession of their sins.
23200	40	3	7	 But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming for baptism, he exclaimed, "O vipers'  brood, who has  warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
23201	40	3	8	 Therefore let your lives prove your  change of heart;
23202	40	3	9	 and  do not imagine that you can say  to yourselves, `We have Abraham as our forefather,' for I tell you that God can  raise up descendants for Abraham from these stones.
23203	40	3	10	 And already the axe is lying at the root of the trees, so that every tree which does not produce good fruit will quickly be hewn down and thrown into the fire.
23204	40	3	11	  I indeed am baptizing you  in water  on a profession of repentance; but He who is coming after me is mightier than I: His sandals I am not worthy to carry for a moment; He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and in fire.
23205	40	3	12	 His winnowing-shovel is in His hand, and He will make a thorough clearance of His threshing-floor, gathering His wheat into the storehouse, but  burning up the  chaff in unquenchable fire."
23206	40	3	13	  Just at that time Jesus, coming from Galilee to the Jordan, presents Himself to John to be baptized by him.
23207	40	3	14	 John  protested. "It is I," he said, "who have need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?"
23208	40	3	15	 "Let it be so on this occasion," Jesus replied; "for so we ought to fulfil every religious duty." Then he consented;
23209	40	3	16	 and Jesus was baptized, and immediately went up from the water.  At that moment the heavens  opened, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a  dove and alighting upon Him,
23210	40	3	17	 while a voice came from Heaven, saying, "This is My Son, the dearly loved, in whom is My delight."
23211	40	4	1	  At that time Jesus was  led up by the Spirit into the Desert in order to be tempted by the Devil.
23212	40	4	2	 There He fasted for forty days and nights; and after that He suffered from hunger.
23213	40	4	3	 So the Tempter came and said,  "If you are the Son of God, command these stones to turn into loaves."
23214	40	4	4	 "It is written," replied Jesus, <"`It is not on bread alone that a man shall live, but on whatsoever God shall appoint.'">
23215	40	4	5	 Then the Devil took Him to the Holy City and caused Him to stand on the roof of the  Temple,
23216	40	4	6	 and said,  "If you are God's Son, throw yourself down; for it is written, <"`To His angels He will give orders concerning thee, and on their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any moment thou shouldst strike thy foot against a stone.'">
23217	40	4	7	 "Again it is written," replied Jesus,  <"`Thou shalt not put the Lord thy God to the proof.'">
23218	40	4	8	 Then the Devil took Him to the top of an exceedingly lofty mountain, from which he caused Him to see all the Kingdoms of the world and their splendour,
23219	40	4	9	 and said to Him, "All this I will give you,  if you will kneel down and do me homage."
23220	40	4	10	 "Begone, Satan!" Jesus replied; "for it is written, <`To the Lord thy God thou shalt do homage, and to Him alone shalt thou render worship.'">
23221	40	4	11	 Thereupon the Devil left Him, and angels  at once came and ministered to Him.
23222	40	4	12	  Now when Jesus heard that John was  thrown into prison, He withdrew into Galilee,
23223	40	4	13	 and leaving Nazareth He went and settled at  Capernaum, a town by the  Lake on the frontiers of Zebulun and Naphtali,
23224	40	4	14	 in order that these words, spoken through the Prophet Isaiah, might be fulfilled,
23225	40	4	15	 <"Zebulun's land and Naphtali's land; the road by the  Lake; the country beyond the Jordan;  Galilee of the Nations!
23226	40	4	16	 The people who were  dwelling in darkness have seen a brilliant light; and on those who were dwelling in the  region of the shadow of death, on them light has dawned.">
23227	40	4	17	 From that time Jesus began to preach. "Repent," He said, "for the Kingdom of the Heavens is now close at hand."
23228	40	4	18	 And walking along the shore of the Lake of Galilee He saw two brothers--Simon called Peter and his brother Andrew--throwing a drag-net into the Lake; for they were fishers.
23229	40	4	19	 And He said to them, "Come and follow me, and I will make you fishers of men."
23230	40	4	20	 So they immediately left their nets and followed Him. As He went further on,
23231	40	4	21	 He saw two other brothers, James the son of  Zabdi and his brother John, in the boat with their father Zabdi mending their nets; and He called them.
23232	40	4	22	 And they at once left the boat and their father, and followed Him.
23233	40	4	23	 Then Jesus  travelled through all Galilee, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming  the Good News of the Kingdom, and curing every kind of disease and infirmity among the people.
23234	40	4	24	 Thus His fame spread through all Syria; and they brought all the sick to Him, the people who were  suffering from various diseases and pains--demoniacs, epileptics, paralytics; and He cured them.
23235	40	4	25	 And great crowds followed Him, coming from Galilee, from the Ten Towns, from Jerusalem, and from beyond the district on the other side of the Jordan.
23236	40	5	1	 Seeing the multitude of people, Jesus went up  the Hill. There He  seated Himself, and when His disciples came to Him,
23237	40	5	2	  He proceeded to teach them, and said:
23238	40	5	3	   "Blessed are the  poor in spirit, for to them belongs the Kingdom of the Heavens.
23239	40	5	4	  "Blessed are the mourners, for they shall be comforted.
23240	40	5	5	  "Blessed are  the meek, for they as heirs shall obtain possession of the earth.
23241	40	5	6	 "Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they shall be completely satisfied.
23242	40	5	7	 "Blessed are the compassionate, for they shall receive compassion.
23243	40	5	8	 "Blessed are the pure in heart, for they shall see God.
23244	40	5	9	 "Blessed are the peacemakers, for  it is they who will be recognized as sons of God.
23245	40	5	10	 "Blessed are those who have borne persecution in the cause of Righteousness, for to them belongs the Kingdom of the Heavens.
23246	40	5	11	  "Blessed are you when they have insulted and persecuted you, and have said every cruel thing about you falsely for my sake.
23247	40	5	12	 Be joyful and triumphant, because your reward is great in the Heavens; for so were the Prophets before you persecuted.
23248	40	5	13	  "*You* are the salt of the earth; but if salt has become  tasteless, in what way can it regain its saltness? It is no longer good for anything but to be thrown away and trodden on by the passers by.
23249	40	5	14	 *You* are the light of the world; a town cannot be hid if built on a hill-top.
23250	40	5	15	 Nor is a lamp lighted to be put under a bushel, but on the lampstand; and then it gives light to all in the house.
23251	40	5	16	 Just so let your light shine before all men, in order that they may see  your holy lives and may give glory to your Father who is in Heaven.
23252	40	5	17	 "Do not for a moment suppose that I have come to abrogate  the Law or the Prophets: I have not come to abrogate them but to give them their completion.
23253	40	5	18	  Solemnly I tell you that until  Heaven and earth pass away, not one iota or smallest detail will pass away from the Law until all has taken place.
23254	40	5	19	 Whoever therefore  breaks one of these least commandments and teaches  others to break them, will be called the least in the Kingdom of the Heavens; but whoever practises them and teaches them, he will be acknowledged as great in the Kingdom of the Heavens.
23255	40	5	20	 For I assure you that unless  your righteousness  greatly surpasses that of the Scribes and the Pharisees, you will certainly not find entrance into the Kingdom of the Heavens.
23256	40	5	21	  "You have heard that it was said to the ancients, <`Thou shalt not commit murder',> and whoever commits murder will be answerable to  the magistrate.
23257	40	5	22	 But I say to you that every one who becomes  angry with his brother shall be answerable to the magistrate; that whoever says to his brother  `Raca,' shall be answerable to the  Sanhedrin; and that whoever says, `You  fool!' shall be liable to the  Gehenna of Fire.
23258	40	5	23	 If therefore when you are offering your gift upon the altar, you remember that your brother has a grievance against you,
23259	40	5	24	 leave your gift there before the altar, and go and make friends with your brother first, and then return and proceed to offer your gift.
23260	40	5	25	  Come to terms without delay with your opponent while you are yet with him on the way to the court; for fear he should obtain judgement from the magistrate against you, and the magistrate should give you in custody to the officer and you be thrown into prison.
23261	40	5	26	 I solemnly tell you that you will certainly not be released till you have paid the very last farthing.
23262	40	5	27	 "You have heard that it was said, <`Thou shalt not commit adultery.'>
23263	40	5	28	 But I tell you that whoever looks at a woman and cherishes lustful thoughts has already in his heart become guilty with regard to her.
23264	40	5	29	 If therefore your eye, even the right eye,  is a snare to you, tear it out and away with it; it is better for you that one member should be destroyed rather than that your whole body should be thrown into Gehenna.
23265	40	5	30	 And if your right hand  is a snare to you, cut it off and away with it; it is better for you that one member should be destroyed rather than that your whole body should go into Gehenna.
23266	40	5	31	 "It was also said, <`If any man puts away his wife, let him give her a written notice of divorce.'>
23267	40	5	32	  But I tell you that every man who puts away his wife except on the ground of  unfaithfulness causes her to commit adultery, and whoever marries  her when so divorced commits adultery.
23268	40	5	33	 "Again, you have heard that it was said to the ancients, <`Thou shalt not swear falsely, but shalt perform thy vows to the Lord.'>
23269	40	5	34	 But I tell you not to  swear at all; neither by Heaven, for it is God's throne;
23270	40	5	35	 nor by the earth, for it is the footstool under His feet; nor  by Jerusalem, for it is the City of the Great King.
23271	40	5	36	 And do not swear by your head, for you cannot make one hair white or black.
23272	40	5	37	 But  let your language be, `Yes, yes,' or `No, no.' Anything in excess of this comes from the Evil one.
23273	40	5	38	 "You have heard that it was said, <`Eye for eye, tooth for tooth.'>
23274	40	5	39	  But I tell you not to resist a wicked man, but if any one  strikes you on the right  cheek, turn the other to him as well.
23275	40	5	40	 If any one wishes to go to law with you and to deprive you of your  under garment, let him take your outer one also.
23276	40	5	41	 And whoever shall compel you to  convey his goods one mile, go with him two.
23277	40	5	42	 To him who asks, give: from him who would borrow, turn not away.
23278	40	5	43	 "You have heard that it was said, <`Thou shalt love thy neighbour> and hate thine enemy.'
23279	40	5	44	  But I command you all, love your enemies, and pray for your persecutors;
23280	40	5	45	 that so you may become true sons of your Father in Heaven; for He causes His sun to rise on the wicked as well as the good, and sends rain upon those who do right and those who do wrong.
23281	40	5	46	 For if you love only those who love you, what reward have you earned? Do not even the tax-gatherers do that?
23282	40	5	47	 And if you salute only your near relatives, what praise is due to you? Do not even the Gentiles do the same?
23283	40	5	48	 You however are to be complete in goodness, as your Heavenly Father is complete.
23284	40	6	1	 "But beware of doing your  good actions in the sight of men, in order to attract their gaze; if you do, there is no reward for you with your Father who is in Heaven.
23285	40	6	2	 `When you give in charity, never blow a  trumpet before you as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and streets in order that their praises may be sung by men. I solemnly tell you that  they already have their reward.
23286	40	6	3	 But when you are giving in  charity, let not your left hand perceive what your right hand is doing,
23287	40	6	4	 that your charities may be in secret; and then your Father--He who sees in secret--will recompense you.
23288	40	6	5	 "And when praying, you must not be like the hypocrites. They are fond of standing and praying in the synagogues or at the corners of the wider streets, in order that men may see them. I solemnly tell you that  they already have their reward.
23289	40	6	6	 But you, whenever you pray, go into your own room and shut the door: then pray to your Father who is in secret, and your Father--He who sees in secret--will recompense you.
23290	40	6	7	 "And when praying, do not use needless repetitions as the Gentiles do, for they expect to be listened to because of their multitude of words.
23291	40	6	8	 Do not,  however, imitate them; for  your Father knows what things you need before ever you ask Him.
23292	40	6	9	  "In this manner therefore pray: `Our Father who art in Heaven, may Thy name be kept holy;
23293	40	6	10	 let Thy kingdom come; let Thy  will be done, as in Heaven so on earth;
23294	40	6	11	  give us to-day our bread  for the day;
23295	40	6	12	 and forgive us our shortcomings, as we also have forgiven those who have  failed in their duty towards us;
23296	40	6	13	 and bring us not into temptation, but rescue us  from the Evil one.'
23297	40	6	14	 "For if you forgive others their offences, your Heavenly Father will forgive you also;
23298	40	6	15	 but if you do not forgive others their offences, neither will your Father forgive yours.
23299	40	6	16	 "When any of you fast, never assume gloomy looks as the hypocrites do; for they disfigure their faces in order that it may be evident to men that they are fasting. I solemnly tell you that they already have their reward.
23300	40	6	17	 But, whenever you fast, pour  perfume on your hair and wash your face,
23301	40	6	18	 that it may not be apparent to men that you are fasting, but to your Father who is in secret; and your Father--He who sees in secret--will recompense you.
23302	40	6	19	  "Do not lay up stores of wealth for yourselves on earth, where the moth and  wear-and-tear destroy, and where thieves  break in and steal.
23303	40	6	20	 But amass wealth for yourselves in Heaven, where neither the moth nor  wear-and-tear destroys, and where thieves do not  break in and steal.
23304	40	6	21	 For where your wealth is, there also will your heart be.
23305	40	6	22	  "The eye is the lamp of the body. If then your  eyesight is good, your whole body will be well lighted;
23306	40	6	23	 but if your  eyesight is bad, your whole body will be dark. If however the very light within you is darkness, how dense must the darkness be!
23307	40	6	24	  "No man can be the bondservant of two masters; for either he will dislike one and like the other, or he will attach himself to one and think slightingly of the other. You cannot be the bondservants both of God and of gold.
23308	40	6	25	  For this reason I charge you not to be over-anxious about your lives, inquiring what you are to eat or what you are to drink, nor yet about your bodies, inquiring what clothes you are to put on. Is not the life more precious than its food, and the body than its clothing?
23309	40	6	26	  Look at the birds which fly in the air: they do not sow or reap or store up in barns, but your Heavenly Father feeds them: are not you of much greater value than they?
23310	40	6	27	 Which of you by being over-anxious can add  a single foot to his height?
23311	40	6	28	 And why be anxious about clothing? Learn a lesson from the wild  lilies. Watch their growth. They neither  toil nor  spin,
23312	40	6	29	 and yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his magnificence could array himself like one of these.
23313	40	6	30	 And if God so clothes the wild herbage which to-day flourishes and to-morrow is thrown into the  oven, is it not much more certain that He will clothe you, you men of little faith?
23314	40	6	31	 Do not be  over-anxious, therefore, asking `What shall we eat?' or `What shall we drink?' or `What shall we wear?'
23315	40	6	32	 For all these are questions that Gentiles are always asking;  but your Heavenly Father knows that you need these things--all of them.
23316	40	6	33	 But make His Kingdom and righteousness your chief aim, and then these things shall all be given you in addition.
23317	40	6	34	 Do not be  over-anxious, therefore, about to-morrow, for to-morrow will bring its own cares. Enough for each day are its own troubles.
23318	40	7	1	  "Judge not, that you may not be judged;
23319	40	7	2	 for your own judgement will be dealt--and your own measure meted--to yourselves.
23320	40	7	3	  And why do you look at the splinter in your brother's eye, and not notice the beam which is in your own eye?
23321	40	7	4	 Or how say to your brother, `Allow me to take the splinter out of your eye,' while the beam is in your own eye?
23322	40	7	5	 Hypocrite, first take the beam out of your own eye, and then you will see clearly how to remove the splinter from your brother's eye.
23323	40	7	6	 "Give not that which is holy to the dogs, nor throw your pearls to the swine; otherwise they will trample them under their feet and then turn and  attack you.
23324	40	7	7	  "Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and the door will be opened to you.
23325	40	7	8	 For it is always he who asks that receives, he who seeks that finds, and he who knocks that has the door opened to him.
23326	40	7	9	 What man is there among you, who if his son shall ask him for bread will offer him a stone?
23327	40	7	10	 Or if the son shall ask him for a fish will offer him a snake?
23328	40	7	11	 If you then, imperfect as you are, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will your Father in Heaven give good things to those who ask Him!
23329	40	7	12	  Everything, therefore, be it what it may, that you would have men do to you, do you also the same to them; for in this the Law and the Prophets are summed up.
23330	40	7	13	  "Enter by the narrow gate; for wide is the  gate and broad the road which leads to ruin, and many there are who enter by it;
23331	40	7	14	  because narrow is the gate and contracted the road which leads  to Life, and few are those who find it.
23332	40	7	15	 "Beware of the false  teachers--men who come to you in sheep's fleeces, but beneath that disguise they are ravenous wolves.
23333	40	7	16	  By their fruits you will easily recognize them. Are grapes gathered from  thorns or figs from  brambles?
23334	40	7	17	 Just so every good tree produces good fruit, but a poisonous tree produces bad fruit.
23335	40	7	18	 A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, nor a poisonous tree good fruit.
23336	40	7	19	 Every tree which does not yield good fruit is cut down and thrown aside for burning.
23337	40	7	20	 So by their fruits at any rate, you will easily recognize them.
23338	40	7	21	 "Not every one who says to me, `Master, Master,'  will enter the Kingdom of the Heavens, but only those who are obedient to my Father who is in Heaven.
23339	40	7	22	  Many will say to me on that day, "`Master, Master, have we not prophesied in Thy name, and in Thy name expelled demons, and in Thy name performed many mighty works?'
23340	40	7	23	 "And then I will tell them plainly, "`I never knew you: begone from me, you doers of  wickedness.'
23341	40	7	24	  "Every one who hears  these my teachings and acts upon them  will be found to resemble a wise man who builds his house upon rock;
23342	40	7	25	 and the heavy rain falls, the swollen torrents come, and the winds blow and beat against the house; yet it does not fall, for its foundation is on rock.
23343	40	7	26	 And every one who hears these my teachings and does not act upon them will be found to resemble a fool who builds his house upon sand.
23344	40	7	27	 The heavy rain descends, the swollen torrents come, and the winds blow and burst upon the house, and it falls; and disastrous is the fall."
23345	40	7	28	 When Jesus had concluded this discourse, the crowds were  filled with amazement at His teaching,
23346	40	7	29	 for He had been teaching them as one who had authority, and not as their Scribes taught.
23347	40	8	1	  Upon descending from the hill country He was followed by immense crowds.
23348	40	8	2	 And a leper came to Him, and throwing himself at His feet, said,  "Sir, if only you are willing you are able to cleanse me."
23349	40	8	3	 So Jesus put out His hand and touched him, and said, "I am willing: be cleansed." Instantly he was cleansed from his leprosy;
23350	40	8	4	 and Jesus said to him, "Be careful to tell no one, but go and show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift which Moses appointed as evidence for them."
23351	40	8	5	  After His entry into Capernaum a  Captain came to Him, and entreated Him.
23352	40	8	6	 "Sir," he said, "my  servant at home is lying ill with paralysis, and is suffering great  pain."
23353	40	8	7	 "I will come and cure him," said Jesus.
23354	40	8	8	 "Sir," replied the Captain, "I am not  a fit person to receive you under my roof: merely say  the word, and my servant will be cured.
23355	40	8	9	 For I myself am also  under authority, and have soldiers under me. To one I say `Go,' and he goes, to another `Come,' and he comes, and to my slave `Do this or that,' and he does it."
23356	40	8	10	 Jesus listened to this reply, and was astonished, and said to the people following Him, "I solemnly tell you that  in no Israelite have I found faith as great as this.
23357	40	8	11	 And I tell you that many will come from the east and from the west and will  recline at table with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob in the Kingdom of the Heavens,
23358	40	8	12	 while the natural heirs of the Kingdom will be driven out into the darkness outside: there will be  the weeping aloud and the gnashing of teeth."
23359	40	8	13	 And Jesus said to the Captain, "Go, and just as you have believed, so be it for you." And the servant recovered precisely at that time.
23360	40	8	14	  After this Jesus went to the house of Peter, whose mother-in-law he  found ill in bed with fever.
23361	40	8	15	 He touched her hand and the fever left her: and then she  rose and  waited upon Him.
23362	40	8	16	  In the evening many demoniacs were brought to Him, and with a word He expelled the demons; and He cured all the sick,
23363	40	8	17	 in order that this prediction of the Prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled, <"He took on Him our weaknesses, and bore the burden of our diseases.">
23364	40	8	18	  Seeing  great crowds about Him Jesus had given directions to cross to the other side of the Lake,
23365	40	8	19	  when  a Scribe came and said to Him, "Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go."
23366	40	8	20	 "Foxes have holes," replied Jesus, "and birds have  nests; but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head."
23367	40	8	21	 Another of the disciples said to Him, "Sir, allow me first to go and bury my father."
23368	40	8	22	 "Follow me," said Jesus, "and leave the  dead to bury their own dead."
23369	40	8	23	  Then He went on board a fishing-boat, and His disciples followed Him.
23370	40	8	24	 But  suddenly there arose a great storm on the Lake, so that the waves threatened to engulf the boat; but He was asleep.
23371	40	8	25	 So they came and woke Him, crying, "Master, save us, we are drowning!"
23372	40	8	26	 "Why are you so easily frightened," He replied, "you men of little faith?" Then He rose and reproved the winds and the waves, and there was a perfect calm;
23373	40	8	27	 and the men, filled with amazement, exclaimed, "What kind of man is this? for the very winds and waves obey him!"
23374	40	8	28	  On His arrival at the other side, in the country of the Gadarenes, there met Him two men possessed by demons, coming  from among the tombs: they were so dangerously fierce that no one was able to pass that way.
23375	40	8	29	 They cried aloud, "What hast Thou to do with us, Thou Son of God? Hast Thou come here to torment us before the time?"
23376	40	8	30	 Now at some distance from them a vast herd of swine were feeding.
23377	40	8	31	 So the demons entreated Him. "If Thou drivest us out," they said, "send us into the herd of swine."
23378	40	8	32	 "Go," He replied. Then they came out from the men and went into the swine, whereupon the entire herd  instantly rushed down the cliff into the Lake and perished in the water.
23379	40	8	33	 The  swineherds fled, and went and told the whole story in the town, including what had happened to the demoniacs.
23380	40	8	34	 So at once the whole population came out to meet Jesus; and when they saw Him, they besought Him to leave their country.
23381	40	9	1	  Accordingly He went on board, and crossing over came to  His own town.
23382	40	9	2	 Here they brought to Him a paralytic lying on a  bed. Seeing their faith Jesus said to the paralytic, "Take courage, my child; your sins are pardoned."
23383	40	9	3	 "Such language is impious," said some of the Scribes  among themselves.
23384	40	9	4	  Knowing their thoughts Jesus said, "Why are you cherishing evil thoughts in your hearts?
23385	40	9	5	 Why, which is easier? --to say, `Your sins are pardoned,' or to say `Rise up and walk'?
23386	40	9	6	 But, to prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to pardon sins" --He then says to the paralytic, "Rise, and take up your bed and go home."
23387	40	9	7	 And he got up, and went off home.
23388	40	9	8	 And the crowds were awe-struck when they saw it, and ascribed the glory to God who had  entrusted such power  to a man.
23389	40	9	9	  Passing on thence Jesus saw a man called Matthew  sitting at the Toll Office, and said to him,  "Follow me." And he arose, and followed Him.
23390	40	9	10	 And while He was reclining  at table, a large number of  tax-gathers and notorious sinners were of the party with Jesus and His disciples.
23391	40	9	11	 The Pharisees noticed this, and they inquired of His disciples, "Why does your Teacher eat with the tax-gatherers and notorious sinners?"
23392	40	9	12	 He heard the question and replied, "It is not men in good health who require a doctor, but the sick.
23393	40	9	13	 But  go and learn what this means, <`It is mercy that I desire, not sacrifice';> for I did not come to appeal to the righteous, but to sinners."
23394	40	9	14	  At that time John's disciples came and asked Jesus, "Why do we and the Pharisees  fast, but your disciples do not?"
23395	40	9	15	 "Can the bridegroom's party mourn," He replied, "as long as the bridegroom is with them? But other days will come (when the Bridegroom has been taken from them) and then they will fast.
23396	40	9	16	 No one ever mends an old cloak with a patch of newly woven cloth. Otherwise, the patch put on would tear away some of the old, and a worse hole would be made.
23397	40	9	17	 Nor do people pour new wine into old  wineskins. Otherwise, the skins would split, the wine  would escape, and the skins be destroyed. But they put new wine into fresh skins, and both are saved."
23398	40	9	18	  While He was thus speaking, a  Ruler came up and  profoundly bowing said, "My daughter is just dead; but come and put your hand upon her and she will return to life."
23399	40	9	19	 And Jesus rose and followed him, as did also His disciples.
23400	40	9	20	 But a woman who for twelve years had been afflicted with haemorrhage came behind Him and  touched the  tassel of His cloak;
23401	40	9	21	 for she said to herself, "If I but touch His cloak, I shall be cured."
23402	40	9	22	 And Jesus turned and saw her, and said, "Take courage, daughter; your faith has  cured you." And the woman was restored to health from that moment.
23403	40	9	23	 Entering the Ruler's house, Jesus saw the flute-players and the  crowd loudly wailing,
23404	40	9	24	 and He said, "Go out of the room; the little girl is not dead, but asleep." And they laughed at Him.
23405	40	9	25	 When however the place was cleared of the crowd, Jesus went in, and on His taking the little girl by the hand, she  rose up.
23406	40	9	26	 And the report of this spread throughout all that district.
23407	40	9	27	 As Jesus passed on, two blind men followed Him, shouting and saying, "Pity us, Son of David."
23408	40	9	28	 And when He had gone indoors, they came to Him. "Do you believe that I can do this?" He asked them. "Yes,  Sir," they replied.
23409	40	9	29	 So He touched their eyes and said, "According to your faith let it be to you."
23410	40	9	30	 Then their eyes were opened. And assuming a stern tone Jesus said to them, "Be careful to let no one know."
23411	40	9	31	 But they went out and published His fame in all that district.
23412	40	9	32	  And as they were leaving His presence a  dumb demoniac was brought to Him.
23413	40	9	33	 When the demon was expelled, the dumb man could speak. And the crowds exclaimed in astonishment, "Never was such a thing seen in Israel."
23414	40	9	34	 But the Pharisees maintained, "It is  by the power of the Prince of the demons that he drives out the demons."
23415	40	9	35	  And Jesus continued His circuits through all the towns and the villages, teaching in their synagogues and proclaiming the Good News of the Kingdom, and curing every kind of disease and infirmity.
23416	40	9	36	 And when He saw the crowds He was touched with pity for them, because they were distressed and were fainting on the ground like sheep which have no shepherd.
23417	40	9	37	 Then He said to His disciples, "The harvest is abundant, but the reapers are few;
23418	40	9	38	 therefore entreat the Owner of the Harvest to send out reapers into His  fields."
23419	40	10	1	  Then He called to Him His twelve disciples and gave them authority over foul spirits, to drive them out; and to cure every kind of disease and infirmity.
23420	40	10	2	 Now the names of the twelve  Apostles were these: first, Simon called Peter, and his brother Andrew; James the son of Zabdi, and his brother John;
23421	40	10	3	 Philip and Bartholomew, Thomas and Matthew the tax-gatherer, James the son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus;
23422	40	10	4	 Simon the  Cananaean, and Judas the  Iscariot, who also betrayed Him.
23423	40	10	5	  These twelve Jesus  sent on a mission, after giving them their instructions: "Go not," He said, "among the Gentiles, and enter no Samaritan town;
23424	40	10	6	 but, instead of that, go to the  lost sheep of Israel's race.
23425	40	10	7	 And as you go, preach and say, `The Kingdom of the Heavens is close at hand.'
23426	40	10	8	 Cure the sick,  raise the dead to life, cleanse lepers, drive out demons: you have received without payment, give without payment.
23427	40	10	9	 "Provide no gold, nor even silver nor copper to carry in your pockets;
23428	40	10	10	 no bag for your journey, nor change of linen, nor shoes, nor stick; for the labourer deserves his food.
23429	40	10	11	 "Whatever town or village you enter, inquire for some good man; and make his house your home till you leave the place.
23430	40	10	12	 When you enter the house,  salute it;
23431	40	10	13	 and if the house deserves it, the peace you invoke shall come upon it. If not, your peace shall return to you.
23432	40	10	14	 And whoever refuses to receive you or even to listen to your Message, as you leave that house or town,  shake off the very dust  from your feet.
23433	40	10	15	 I solemnly tell you that it will be more endurable for the land of Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of Judgement than for that town.
23434	40	10	16	  "Remember it is I who am sending you out, as sheep into the midst of wolves; prove yourselves as sagacious as serpents, and as innocent as  doves.
23435	40	10	17	  But beware of men; for they will deliver you up to appear before  Sanhedrins, and will flog you in their synagogues;
23436	40	10	18	 and you will even be put on trial before governors and kings for my sake, to bear witness to them and to the Gentiles.
23437	40	10	19	 But when they have delivered you up, have  no anxiety as to how you shall speak or what you shall say; for at that very time it shall be given you what to say;
23438	40	10	20	 for it is not you who will speak: it will be the Spirit of your Father speaking  through you.
23439	40	10	21	 Brother will betray brother to death, and father, child; and children will rise against their own parents and will put them to death.
23440	40	10	22	 And you will be objects of universal hatred because you are called by my name; but he who holds out to  the End--he will be saved.
23441	40	10	23	  Whenever they persecute you in one town,  escape to the next; for I solemnly tell you that you will not have gone the round of all the towns of Israel  before the Son of Man comes.
23442	40	10	24	 "The  learner is never superior to his teacher, and the  servant is never superior to his  master.
23443	40	10	25	 Enough for the learner to be on a level with his teacher, and for the servant to be on a level with his master. If they have called the master of the house  Baal-zebul, how much more will they slander his servants?
23444	40	10	26	  Fear them not, however; there is nothing veiled which will not be uncovered, nor secret which will not become known.
23445	40	10	27	 What I tell you in the dark, speak in the light; and what is whispered into your ear, proclaim upon the roofs of the houses.
23446	40	10	28	 "And do not fear those who kill the body, but cannot kill the  soul; but rather  fear him who is able to destroy both  soul and body in Gehenna.
23447	40	10	29	 Do not two sparrows sell for a  halfpenny? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground without your Father's leave.
23448	40	10	30	 But as for you, the very hairs on your heads are all numbered.
23449	40	10	31	 Away then with fear; you are more  precious than a multitude of sparrows.
23450	40	10	32	 "Every man who  acknowledges me before men I also  will acknowledge before my Father who is in Heaven.
23451	40	10	33	 But whoever disowns me before men I also will disown before my Father who is in Heaven.
23452	40	10	34	  "Do not suppose that I came to  bring peace to the earth: I did not come to bring peace but a sword.
23453	40	10	35	 For I came to set a man against his father, <a daughter against her mother, and a daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law;
23454	40	10	36	 and a man's own family will be his foes.>
23455	40	10	37	  Any one who loves father or mother more than me  is not worthy of me, and any one who loves son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me;
23456	40	10	38	 and any one who does not take up his  cross and follow where I lead is not worthy of me.
23457	40	10	39	 To save your  life is to lose it, and to lose your life for my sake is to save it.
23458	40	10	40	  "Whoever receives you receives me, and whoever receives me receives Him who sent me.
23459	40	10	41	 Every one who receives a  prophet, because he is a prophet, will receive a prophet's reward, and every one who receives a righteous man, because he is a righteous man, will receive a righteous man's reward.
23460	40	10	42	  And whoever gives one of these  little ones  even a cup of cold water to drink because he is a disciple, I solemnly tell you that he will not lose his reward."
23461	40	11	1	 When Jesus had concluded His instructions to His twelve disciples, He left in order to teach and to  proclaim His Message in the neighbouring towns.
23462	40	11	2	  Now John had heard in prison about the Christ's doings, and he sent  some of his disciples to inquire:
23463	40	11	3	 "Are you the Coming One, or is it a different person that we are to expect?"
23464	40	11	4	 "Go and report to John what you see and hear," replied Jesus;
23465	40	11	5	 "blind eyes  receive sight, and cripples walk; lepers are cleansed, and deaf ears hear; the dead  are raised to life, and the poor have the Good News proclaimed to them;
23466	40	11	6	 and blessed is every one who does not stumble and fall because of my claims."
23467	40	11	7	  When the messengers had taken their leave, Jesus proceeded to say to the multitude concerning John, "What did you go out into the Desert to gaze at? A reed waving in the wind?
23468	40	11	8	 But what did you go out to see? A man luxuriously dressed? Those who wear luxurious clothes are to be found in kings' palaces.
23469	40	11	9	 But why did you go out? To see a prophet? Yes, I tell you, and far more than a prophet.
23470	40	11	10	 This is he of whom it is written, <"`See I am sending My  messenger before Thy face, and he will make Thy road ready before Thee.'>
23471	40	11	11	 "I solemnly tell you that among all of woman born no greater has ever been raised up than John the Baptist; yet one who is of lower rank in the Kingdom of the Heavens is greater than he.
23472	40	11	12	  But from  the time of John the Baptist till now, the Kingdom of the Heavens  has been suffering violent assault, and the violent have been seizing it by force.
23473	40	11	13	 For all the Prophets and the Law  taught until John.
23474	40	11	14	 And (if you are willing to receive it) he is the Elijah who  was to come.
23475	40	11	15	 Listen, every one who has  ears!
23476	40	11	16	 "But to what shall I compare the present generation? It is like children sitting in the open places, who call  to their playmates.
23477	40	11	17	 "`We have played the flute to you,' they say, `and you have not danced: we have sung dirges, and you have not beaten your breasts.'
23478	40	11	18	 "For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, `He has a demon.'
23479	40	11	19	 The Son of Man came  eating and drinking, and they exclaim, `See this man! --given to gluttony and tippling, and a friend of tax-gatherers and notorious sinners!' And yet Wisdom  is vindicated by her  actions."
23480	40	11	20	  Then began He to upbraid the towns where most of His mighty works had been done--because they had not repented.
23481	40	11	21	  "Alas for  thee, Chorazin!" He cried. "Alas for thee,  Bethsaida! For had the mighty works been done in Tyre and Sidon which have been done in  both of you, they would long ere now have repented, covered with sackcloth and ashes.
23482	40	11	22	 Only I tell you that it will be more endurable for Tyre and Sidon on the day of Judgement than for you.
23483	40	11	23	 And thou, Capernaum, shalt thou be exalted even to Heaven? Even to  Hades shalt thou  descend. For had the mighty works been done in Sodom which have been done in thee, it would have remained until now.
23484	40	11	24	 Only I tell  you all, that it will be more endurable for the land of Sodom on the day of Judgement than for thee."
23485	40	11	25	  About that time  Jesus exclaimed, "I heartily praise Thee, Father,  Lord of Heaven and of earth, that Thou hast hidden these things from sages and men of discernment, and hast unveiled them to babes.
23486	40	11	26	 Yes, Father, for such has been Thy gracious will.
23487	40	11	27	 "All things have been handed over to me by my Father, and no one fully knows the Son except the Father, nor does any one fully know the Father except the Son and all to whom the Son chooses to reveal Him.
23488	40	11	28	 "Come to me, all you toiling and burdened ones, and *I* will give you rest.
23489	40	11	29	 Take my yoke upon you and learn from me; for I am  gentle and lowly in heart, and you will find rest for your souls.
23490	40	11	30	 For  it is good to bear my yoke, and my burden is light."
23491	40	12	1	  About that time Jesus passed on the Sabbath through the wheatfields; and His disciples  became hungry, and began to gather ears of wheat and eat them.
23492	40	12	2	 But the Pharisees saw it and said to Him, "Look! your disciples are doing what the Law forbids them to do on the Sabbath."
23493	40	12	3	 "Have you never read," He replied, "what David did when he and his men were hungry?
23494	40	12	4	 how he entered the House of God  and ate the Presented Loaves, which it was not lawful for him or his men to eat,  nor for any except the priests?
23495	40	12	5	 And have you not read in the Law how on the Sabbath the priests in the Temple  break the Sabbath without incurring guilt?
23496	40	12	6	 But I tell you that there is here  that which is greater than the Temple.
23497	40	12	7	 And if you knew what this means, <`It is mercy I desire, not sacrifice'>, you would not have condemned those who are without guilt.
23498	40	12	8	  For the Son of Man is the Lord of the Sabbath."
23499	40	12	9	  Departing thence  He went to their synagogue,
23500	40	12	10	 where there was a man with a shrivelled  arm. And they questioned Him,  "Is it right to cure people on the Sabbath?" Their intention was to bring a charge against Him.
23501	40	12	11	 "Which of you is there," He replied, "who, if he has but a single sheep and it falls into a hole on the Sabbath, will not lay hold of it and lift it out?
23502	40	12	12	 Is not a man, however, far superior to a sheep? Therefore it is right to do good on the Sabbath."
23503	40	12	13	 Then He said to the man, "Stretch out your arm." And he stretched it out, and it was restored quite sound like the other.
23504	40	12	14	 But the Pharisees after leaving the synagogue consulted together against Him, how they might destroy Him.
23505	40	12	15	 Aware of this, Jesus departed elsewhere; and a great number of people followed Him, all of whom He cured.
23506	40	12	16	 But He gave them strict injunctions not to blaze abroad His doings,
23507	40	12	17	 that those words of the Prophet Isaiah might be fulfilled,
23508	40	12	18	  <"This is My servant whom I have chosen, My dearly loved One in whom My soul  takes pleasure. I will put My spirit upon Him, and He will announce justice to the nations.
23509	40	12	19	 He will not wrangle or raise His voice, nor will His voice be heard in the broadways.
23510	40	12	20	  A crushed reed He will not utterly break, nor will He quench the still smouldering wick, until He has led on Justice to victory.
23511	40	12	21	 And on His name shall the nations  rest their hopes.">
23512	40	12	22	  At that time a demoniac was brought to Him, blind and  dumb; and He cured him, so that the dumb man could speak and see.
23513	40	12	23	 And the crowds of people were all filled with amazement and said, "Can this be  the Son of David?"
23514	40	12	24	 The Pharisees heard it and said, "This man only expels demons by the power of Baal-zebul, the Prince of demons."
23515	40	12	25	 Knowing their thoughts He said to them, "Every kingdom in which civil war has raged suffers desolation; and every city or house in which there is internal strife will be brought low.
23516	40	12	26	 And if Satan is expelling Satan, he has  begun to make war on himself: how therefore shall his kingdom last?
23517	40	12	27	 And if it is by Baal-zebul's power that I expel the demons, by whose power do your  disciples expel them? They therefore shall be your judges.
23518	40	12	28	 But if it is by the power of the Spirit of God that I expel the demons, it is evident that the  Kingdom of God  has come upon you.
23519	40	12	29	 Again, how can any one enter the house of  a strong man and carry off his goods, unless first of all he masters and secures the strong man: then he will ransack his house.
23520	40	12	30	 "The man who is not with me is against me, and he who is not gathering with me is scattering abroad.
23521	40	12	31	 This is why I tell you that  men may find forgiveness for every other sin and impious word, but that for impious speaking against the Holy Spirit they shall find no forgiveness.
23522	40	12	32	 And whoever  shall speak against the Son of Man may obtain forgiveness; but whoever speaks against the Holy Spirit, neither in this nor in the coming age shall he obtain forgiveness."
23523	40	12	33	 "Either grant the tree to be wholesome and its fruit wholesome, or the tree poisonous and its fruit poisonous; for the tree is known by its fruit.
23524	40	12	34	 O vipers'  brood, how can you speak what is good when you are evil? For it is from the overflow of the heart that the mouth speaks.
23525	40	12	35	 A good man from his good store produces good things, and a bad man from his bad store produces bad things.
23526	40	12	36	 But I tell you that for every careless word that men shall speak they will be held accountable on the day of Judgement.
23527	40	12	37	 For each of you by his words shall be justified, or by his words shall be condemned."
23528	40	12	38	  Then He was accosted by some of the Scribes and of the Pharisees who said, "Teacher, we wish to see a sign  given by you."
23529	40	12	39	 "Wicked and faithless generation!" He replied, "they clamour for a sign, but none shall be given to them except the sign of the Prophet Jonah.
23530	40	12	40	 For just as <Jonah was  three days in the sea-monster's belly,> so will the Son of Man be three days in the heart of the earth.
23531	40	12	41	 There will stand up men of Nineveh at the Judgement together with the present generation, and will condemn it; because they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and mark! there is  One greater than Jonah here.
23532	40	12	42	 The Queen of the south will awake at the Judgement together with the present generation, and will condemn it; because she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and mark! there is One greater than Solomon here.
23533	40	12	43	  "No sooner however has  the foul spirit gone out of the man, then he  roams about in places where there is no water, seeking rest but finding none.
23534	40	12	44	 Then he says, `I will return to my house that I left;' and he comes and finds it unoccupied, swept clean, and  in good order.
23535	40	12	45	 Then he goes and brings back with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they come in and dwell there; and in the end that man's condition becomes worse than it was at first. So will it be also with  the present wicked generation."
23536	40	12	46	  While He was still addressing the people His mother and His brothers were standing on the edge of the crowd desiring to speak to Him.
23537	40	12	47	  So some one told Him, "Your mother and your brothers are standing outside, and desire to speak to you."
23538	40	12	48	 "Who is my mother?" He said to the man; "and who are my brothers?"
23539	40	12	49	 And pointing to His disciples He added, "See here are my mother and my brothers.
23540	40	12	50	 To obey my Father who is in Heaven--that is to be my brother and my sister and my mother."
23541	40	13	1	  That same day Jesus had left the house and was sitting on the shore of the Lake,
23542	40	13	2	 when a vast multitude of people crowded round Him. He therefore went on board a boat and sat there, while all the people stood on the shore.
23543	40	13	3	  He then spoke many things to them in  figurative language. "The sower  goes out," He said, "to sow.
23544	40	13	4	 As he sows, some of the seed falls by the way-side, and the birds come and peck it up.
23545	40	13	5	 Some falls on rocky ground, where it has but scanty soil. It quickly shows itself above ground, because it has no depth of earth;
23546	40	13	6	 but when the sun is risen, it is scorched by the heat, and through having no root it withers up.
23547	40	13	7	 Some falls  among the thorns; but the thorns spring up and stifle it.
23548	40	13	8	 But a portion falls upon good ground, and  gives a return, some a hundred for one, some sixty, some thirty.
23549	40	13	9	 Listen, every one who has ears!"
23550	40	13	10	  (And His disciples  came and asked Him, "Why do you speak to them in figurative language?"
23551	40	13	11	 "Because," He replied, "while to you it is granted to know the secrets of the Kingdom of the Heavens, to them it is not.
23552	40	13	12	 For whoever has, to him more shall be given, and he shall have abundance; but whoever has not, from him even what he has shall be taken away.
23553	40	13	13	 I speak to them in figurative language for this reason, that while looking they do not see, and while hearing they neither hear nor understand.
23554	40	13	14	 And in regard to them the prophecy of Isaiah is receiving signal fulfilment: <"`You will hear and hear and by no means understand, and you will look and look and by no means see.
23555	40	13	15	 For this people's  mind  is stupefied, their hearing has become dull, and their eyes they have closed; to prevent their ever seeing with their eyes, or hearing with their ears, or understanding with their minds, and turning back,  so that I might heal them.'>
23556	40	13	16	 "But as for you, blessed are your eyes, for they see, and your ears, for they hear.
23557	40	13	17	 For I solemnly tell you that many Prophets and holy men have longed to see the sights you see, and have not seen them, and to hear the words you hear, and have not heard them.
23558	40	13	18	  "To you then I will explain the parable of the Sower.
23559	40	13	19	 When a man hears the Message concerning the Kingdom and does not understand it, the Evil one comes and catches away what has been sown in his heart. This is he who  has received the seed by the road-side.
23560	40	13	20	 He who  has received the seed on the rocky ground is the man who hears the Message and immediately receives it with joy.
23561	40	13	21	 It has struck no root, however, within him. He continues for a time, but when suffering comes, or persecution, because of the Message, he at once stumbles and falls.
23562	40	13	22	 He who  has received the seed among the thorns is the man who hears the Message, but the cares of the present age and the delusions of riches quite stifle the Message, and it becomes unfruitful.
23563	40	13	23	 But he who  has received the seed on good ground is he who hears and understands. Such hearers give a return, and yield one a hundred for one, another sixty, another thirty.")
23564	40	13	24	  Another parable He put before them. "The Kingdom of the Heavens," He said,  "may be compared to a man who has sown good seed in his field,
23565	40	13	25	 but  during the night his enemy comes, and over the first seed he sows darnel among the wheat, and goes away.
23566	40	13	26	 But when the blade shoots up and the grain is formed, then appears the darnel also.
23567	40	13	27	 "So the farmer's  men come and ask him, "`Sir, was it not good seed that you sowed on your land? Where then does the darnel come from?'
23568	40	13	28	 "`Some enemy has done this,' he said. "`Shall we go, and collect it?' the  men inquire.
23569	40	13	29	 "`No,' he replied, `for fear that while collecting the darnel you should at the same time root up the wheat with it.
23570	40	13	30	 Leave both to grow together until the harvest, and at harvest-time I will direct the reapers, Collect the darnel  first, and make it up into bundles to burn it, but  bring  all the wheat into my barn.'"
23571	40	13	31	  Another parable He put before them. "The Kingdom of the Heavens," He said, "is like a mustard-seed, which a man takes and sows in his ground.
23572	40	13	32	 It is  the smallest of all seeds, and yet when full-grown it is larger than any  herb and forms a tree, so that the birds come and build in its branches."
23573	40	13	33	 Another parable He spoke to them. "The Kingdom of the Heavens," He said, "is like  yeast which a woman takes and buries in a bushel of flour, for it to work there till the whole mass has risen."
23574	40	13	34	  All this Jesus spoke to the people in figurative language, and except in figurative language He spoke nothing to them,
23575	40	13	35	 in fulfilment of the saying of  the Prophet, <"I will open my mouth in figurative language, I will utter things kept hidden since the creation of all things.">
23576	40	13	36	 When He had dismissed the people and had returned to the house, His disciples came to Him with the request, "Explain to us the parable of the darnel sown in the field."
23577	40	13	37	 "The sower of the good seed," He replied, "is the Son of Man;
23578	40	13	38	 the field is the world; the good seed--these are the  sons of the Kingdom; the darnel, the sons of the Evil one.
23579	40	13	39	 The enemy who sows the darnel is *the Devil*; the harvest is the  Close of the Age; the reapers are the angels.
23580	40	13	40	 As then the darnel is collected together and burnt up with fire, so will it be at the Close of the Age.
23581	40	13	41	 The Son of Man will commission His angels, and they will gather out of His Kingdom all  causes of sin and all who violate His laws;
23582	40	13	42	 and these they will throw into the fiery furnace. There will be  the weeping aloud and the gnashing of teeth.
23583	40	13	43	 Then will the righteous shine out  like the sun in  their Father's Kingdom. Listen, every one who has ears!
23584	40	13	44	 "The Kingdom of the Heavens is like treasure buried in the open country, which a man finds, but buries again, and, in his joy about it, goes and sells all he has and buys that piece of ground.
23585	40	13	45	 "Again the Kingdom of the Heavens is like  a jewel merchant who is in quest of choice pearls.
23586	40	13	46	 He finds one most costly pearl; he goes away; and though it costs all he has, he buys it.
23587	40	13	47	 "Again the Kingdom of the Heavens is like a draw-net let down into the sea, which encloses fish of all sorts.
23588	40	13	48	 When full, they haul it up on the beach, and sit down and collect the good fish in baskets, while  the worthless they throw away.
23589	40	13	49	 So will it be at the  Close of the Age. The angels will go forth and separate the wicked from among the righteous,
23590	40	13	50	 and will throw them into the fiery furnace. There will be the weeping aloud and the gnashing of teeth."
23591	40	13	51	 "Have you understood all this?" He asked. "Yes," they said.
23592	40	13	52	  "Therefore," He said, "remember that every Scribe well trained for the Kingdom of the Heavens is like a householder who brings out of his storehouse new things and old."
23593	40	13	53	 Jesus concluded this series of parables and then departed.
23594	40	13	54	  And He came into His own  country and proceeded to teach in their synagogue, so that they were filled with astonishment and exclaimed, "Where did he obtain such wisdom, and these wondrous powers?
23595	40	13	55	 Is not  this the carpenter's son? Is not his mother called Mary? And are not his brothers, James, Joseph, Simon and Judah?
23596	40	13	56	 And his sisters--are they not all living here among us? Where then did he get all this?"
23597	40	13	57	 So they  turned angrily away from Him. But Jesus said to them, "There is no prophet left without honour except in his own country and among his own  family."
23598	40	13	58	 And He performed but few mighty deeds there because of their want of faith.
23599	40	14	1	  About that time Herod the Tetrarch heard of the fame of Jesus,
23600	40	14	2	 and he said to his courtiers, "This is John the Baptist: he has come back to life--and that is why these miraculous Powers are working in him."
23601	40	14	3	  For Herod had arrested John, and had put him in chains, and imprisoned him, for the sake of Herodias his brother Philip's wife,
23602	40	14	4	 because John had persistently said to him, "It is not lawful for you to have her."
23603	40	14	5	 And he would have liked to put him to death, but was afraid of the people, because they regarded John as a Prophet.
23604	40	14	6	  But when Herod's birthday came, the daughter of Herodias danced before all the company, and so pleased Herod
23605	40	14	7	 that with an oath he promised to give her whatever she asked.
23606	40	14	8	 So she, instigated by her mother, said, "Give me here on a dish the head of John the Baptist."
23607	40	14	9	 The king was deeply vexed, yet because of his repeated oath and of the guests at his table he ordered it to be given her,
23608	40	14	10	 and he sent and beheaded John in the prison.
23609	40	14	11	 The head was brought on a dish and given to the young girl, and she took it to her mother.
23610	40	14	12	 Then John's disciples went and removed the body and buried  it, and came and informed Jesus.
23611	40	14	13	  Upon receiving these tidings, Jesus went away by boat to an uninhabited and secluded district; but the people heard of it and followed Him in crowds from the towns by land.
23612	40	14	14	 So Jesus  went out and saw an immense multitude, and felt compassion for them, and cured those of them who were out of health.
23613	40	14	15	 But when  evening was come, the disciples came to Him and said, "This is an uninhabited place, and the best of the day is now gone; send the people away to go into the villages and buy something to eat."
23614	40	14	16	 "They need not go away," replied Jesus; "you yourselves must give them something to eat."
23615	40	14	17	 "We have nothing here," they said, "but five loaves and a couple of fish."
23616	40	14	18	 "Bring them here to me," He said,
23617	40	14	19	 and He told all the people to sit down on the grass. Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and after looking up to heaven and blessing them, He broke up the loaves and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples distributed them to the people.
23618	40	14	20	 So all ate, and were fully satisfied. The  broken portions that remained over they gathered up, filling twelve baskets.
23619	40	14	21	 Those who had eaten were about 5,000 adult men, without reckoning women and children.
23620	40	14	22	  Immediately afterwards He made the disciples go on board the boat and cross to the opposite shore, leaving Him to dismiss the people.
23621	40	14	23	 When He had done this, He climbed the hill to pray in solitude.  Night came on, and he was there alone.
23622	40	14	24	 Meanwhile the boat was  far out on the Lake, buffeted and tossed by the waves, the wind being adverse.
23623	40	14	25	 But  towards daybreak He went to them, walking over the waves.
23624	40	14	26	 When the disciples saw Him walking on the waves, they were greatly alarmed. "It is a spirit," they exclaimed, and they cried out with terror.
23625	40	14	27	 But instantly Jesus spoke to them, and said, "There is no danger;  it is I; do not be afraid."
23626	40	14	28	 "Master," answered Peter, "if it is you, bid me come to you upon the water."
23627	40	14	29	 "Come," said Jesus. Then Peter climbed down from the boat and walked upon the water  to go to Him.
23628	40	14	30	 But when he  felt  the wind he  grew frightened, and beginning to sink he cried out, "Master, save me."
23629	40	14	31	 Instantly Jesus stretched out His hand and caught hold of him, saying to him, "O little faith, why did you doubt?"
23630	40	14	32	 So they climbed into the boat, and the wind lulled;
23631	40	14	33	 and the men on board fell down before him and said, "You are indeed God's Son."
23632	40	14	34	  When they had quite crossed over, they put ashore at Gennesaret;
23633	40	14	35	 and the men of the place, recognizing Him, sent word into all the country round. So they brought all the sick to Him,
23634	40	14	36	 and they entreated Him that they might but touch the tassel of His outer garment; and all who did so were restored to perfect health.
23635	40	15	1	  Then there came to Jesus a party of Pharisees and Scribes from Jerusalem, who inquired,
23636	40	15	2	 "Why do your disciples transgress the tradition of the Elders by not washing their hands  before meals?"
23637	40	15	3	 "Why do you, too," He retorted, "transgress God's commands  for the sake of  your tradition?
23638	40	15	4	 For God said, <`Honour thy father and thy mother';> and <`Let him who  reviles father or mother  be certainly put to death';>
23639	40	15	5	 but you--this is what you say: `If a man says to his father or mother, That is  consecrated, whatever it is, which otherwise you should have received from me--
23640	40	15	6	  he shall be absolved from honouring his father';  and so you have abrogated God's  Word for the sake of your tradition.
23641	40	15	7	 Hypocrites! well did Isaiah prophesy of you,
23642	40	15	8	 <"`This is a People who honour Me with their lips, while their heart is far away from Me;
23643	40	15	9	 but it is in vain they worship Me, while they lay down precepts which are mere human rules.'">
23644	40	15	10	 Then, when He had called the people to Him, Jesus said, "Hear and understand.
23645	40	15	11	 It is not what goes into a man's mouth that  defiles him; but it is what comes out of his mouth--*that* defiles a man."
23646	40	15	12	 Then His disciples came and said to Him, "Do you know that the Pharisees were greatly  shocked when they heard those words?"
23647	40	15	13	 "Every plant," He replied, "which my Heavenly Father has not planted will be rooted up.
23648	40	15	14	 Leave them alone. They are blind guides  of the blind; and if a blind man leads a blind man, both will fall into some  pit."
23649	40	15	15	 "Explain to us this figurative language," said Peter.
23650	40	15	16	 "Are even you," He answered, "still without intellingence?
23651	40	15	17	 Do you not understand that whatever enters the mouth passes into the stomach and is afterwards ejected from the body?
23652	40	15	18	 But the things that come out of the mouth proceed from the heart, and it is these that defile the man.
23653	40	15	19	 For out of the heart proceed wicked  thoughts, murder, adultery, fornication, theft, perjury, impiety of speech.
23654	40	15	20	 These are the things which defile the man; but eating with unwashed hands does not defile."
23655	40	15	21	  Leaving that place, Jesus withdrew into the vicinity of Tyre and Sidon.
23656	40	15	22	 Here a Canaanitish woman of the district came out and  persistently cried out, "Sir, Son of David, pity me; my daughter is cruelly harassed by a demon."
23657	40	15	23	 But He answered her not a word. Then the disciples interposed, and begged Him, saying, "Send her away because she keeps crying behind us."
23658	40	15	24	 "I have only been sent to the  lost sheep of the house of Israel," He replied.
23659	40	15	25	 Then she  came and  threw herself at His feet and entreated Him. "O Sir, help me," she said.
23660	40	15	26	 "It is not right," He said, "to take the children's bread and throw it to the  dogs."
23661	40	15	27	  "Be it so, Sir," she said,  "for even the dogs eat the scraps which fall from their  masters' tables."
23662	40	15	28	 "O woman," replied Jesus, "great is your faith: be it done to you as you desire." And from that moment her daughter was restored to health.
23663	40	15	29	 Again, moving thence, Jesus went along by the Lake of Galilee; and ascending  the hill, He  sat down there.
23664	40	15	30	 Soon great crowds came to Him, bringing with them those who were crippled in feet or hands, blind or  dumb, and many besides, and they hastened to lay them at His feet. And He cured them,
23665	40	15	31	 so that the people were amazed to see the dumb speaking,  the maimed with their hands perfect, the lame walking, and the blind seeing; and they gave the glory to the God of Israel.
23666	40	15	32	  But Jesus called His disciples to Him and said, "My heart yearns over this mass of people, for it is now  the third day that they have been with me and they have nothing to eat. I am unwilling to send them away hungry, lest they should faint on the road."
23667	40	15	33	 "Where can we," asked the disciples, "get bread enough in this remote place to satisfy so vast a multitude?"
23668	40	15	34	 "How many loaves have you?" Jesus asked. "Seven," they said, "and a few small fish."
23669	40	15	35	 So He bade all the people sit down on the ground,
23670	40	15	36	 and He took the seven loaves and the fish, and after giving thanks He broke them up and then distributed them to the disciples, and they to the people.
23671	40	15	37	 And they all ate and were satisfied. The broken portions that remained over they took up--seven full  hampers.
23672	40	15	38	 Those who ate were 4,000 adult men, without reckoning women and children.
23673	40	15	39	  He then dismissed the people, went on board the boat, and came into the district of Magadan.
23674	40	16	1	 Here the Pharisees and Sadducees came to Him; and, to make trial of Him, they asked Him to show them a sign  in the sky.
23675	40	16	2	  He replied,  "In the evening you say, `It will be fine weather, for the sky is red;'
23676	40	16	3	 and in the morning, `It will be rough weather to-day, for the sky is red and murky.' You learn how to distinguish the aspect of the heavens, but the signs of the times you cannot.
23677	40	16	4	  A wicked and faithless generation are eager for a sign; but none shall be given to them except the sign of Jonah." and He left them and went away.
23678	40	16	5	 When the disciples arrived at the other side  of the Lake, they found that they  had forgotten to bring any bread;
23679	40	16	6	 and when Jesus said to them, "See to it: beware of the  yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees,"
23680	40	16	7	 they reasoned among themselves, saying,  "It is because we have not brought any bread."
23681	40	16	8	 Jesus perceived this and said, "Why are you reasoning among yourselves, you men of little faith, because  you have no bread?
23682	40	16	9	 Do you not yet understand? nor even remember the 5,000 and the five loaves, and how many basketfuls you carried away,
23683	40	16	10	 nor the 4,000 and the seven loaves, and how many hampers you carried away?
23684	40	16	11	 How is it you do not understand that it was not about bread that I spoke to you? But beware of the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."
23685	40	16	12	 Then they perceived that He had not warned them against bread-yeast, but against the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.
23686	40	16	13	  When He arrived in the neighbourhood of Caesarea Philippi, Jesus  questioned His disciples. "Who do people  say that the Son of Man is?" He asked.
23687	40	16	14	 "Some say John the Baptist," they replied; "others Elijah; others Jeremiah or one of the Prophets."
23688	40	16	15	 "But you, who do you say that I am?" He asked again.
23689	40	16	16	 "You," replied  Simon Peter, "are the Christ, the Son of the  ever-living God."
23690	40	16	17	 "Blessed are you, Simon Bar-jonah," said Jesus; "for  mere human nature has not revealed this to you, but my Father in Heaven.
23691	40	16	18	 And I declare to you that you are  Peter, and that upon this  Rock I will build my Church, and the  might of Hades shall not triumph over it.
23692	40	16	19	 I will give  you the keys of the Kingdom of the Heavens; and whatever you bind on earth shall  remain bound in Heaven, and whatever you loose on earth shall remain loosed in Heaven."
23693	40	16	20	 Then He urged His disciples to tell no one that He was the Christ.
23694	40	16	21	 From this time  Jesus began to explain to His disciples that He  must go to Jerusalem, and suffer much cruelty from the Elders and the High Priests and the Scribes, and be put to death, and on the third day  be raised to life again.
23695	40	16	22	 Then Peter  took Him aside and began taking Him to task. "Master," he said,  "God forbid; this  will not be your lot."
23696	40	16	23	 But He turned and said to Peter, "Get behind me,  Adversary; you are a  hindrance to me, because your thoughts are not God's thoughts, but men's."
23697	40	16	24	 Then Jesus said to His disciples, "If any one desires to follow me, let him renounce self and take up his cross, and so be my follower.
23698	40	16	25	 For whoever desires to save his  life shall lose it, and whoever loses his life for my sake  shall find it.
23699	40	16	26	 Why, what benefit will it be to a man if he gains the whole world but  forfeits his life? Or what shall a man give  to buy back his life?
23700	40	16	27	 For the Son of Man is soon to come in the glory of the Father with  His angels, and then will He requite every man according to his actions.
23701	40	16	28	 I solemnly tell you that some of those who are standing here will certainly not taste death till they have  seen the Son of Man coming in His Kingdom."
23702	40	17	1	  Six day later, Jesus took with Him Peter and the brothers James and John, and brought them up  a high mountain to a solitary place.
23703	40	17	2	 There in their presence His form underwent a change; His face shone like the sun, and His raiment became as white as the light.
23704	40	17	3	 And suddenly Moses and Elijah appeared to them conversing with Him.
23705	40	17	4	 Then Peter said to Jesus, "Master,  we are thankful to you that we are here. If you approve, I will put up three tents here, one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
23706	40	17	5	 He was still speaking when a luminous cloud  spread over them; and a voice was heard from within the cloud, which said, "This is My Son dearly beloved, in whom is My delight. Listen to Him."
23707	40	17	6	 On hearing this voice, the disciples fell on their faces and were filled with terror.
23708	40	17	7	 But Jesus came and touched them, and said, "Rouse yourselves and have no fear."
23709	40	17	8	 So they looked up, and saw no one but Jesus.
23710	40	17	9	 As they were descending the mountain, Jesus laid a command upon them. "Tell no one," He said, "of the sight you have seen till the Son of Man has risen from among the dead."
23711	40	17	10	 "Why then," asked the disciples, "do the Scribes say that Elijah must first come?"
23712	40	17	11	 "Elijah was indeed to come," He replied, "and would reform everything.
23713	40	17	12	 But I tell you that he has already come, and they did not recognize him, but dealt with him as they chose. And before long the Son of Man will be treated by them in a similar way."
23714	40	17	13	 Then it dawned upon the disciples that it was John the Baptist about whom He had spoken to them.
23715	40	17	14	  When they had returned to the people, there came to Him a man who fell on his knees before Him and besought Him.
23716	40	17	15	 "Sir," he said, "have pity on my son, for he is an epileptic and is very ill. Often he falls into the fire and often into the water.
23717	40	17	16	 I have brought him to your disciples, and they have not been able to cure him."
23718	40	17	17	  "O unbelieving and  perverse generation!" replied Jesus; "how long shall I be with you? how long shall I endure you? Bring him  to me."
23719	40	17	18	 Then Jesus reprimanded the demon, and it came out and left him; and the boy was cured from that moment.
23720	40	17	19	 Then the disciples came to Jesus privately and asked Him, "Why could not we expel the demon?"
23721	40	17	20	 "Because your faith is so small," He replied; "for I solemnly declare to you that if you have faith  like a mustard-seed, you shall say to this mountain, `Remove from this place to that,' and it will remove; and nothing shall be impossible to you.
23722	40	17	21	  But an evil spirit of this kind is only driven out by prayer and fasting."
23723	40	17	22	  As they were  travelling about in Galilee, Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man is about to be betrayed into the hands of men;
23724	40	17	23	 they will put Him to death, but on the third day He will be raised to life again." And they were exceedingly distressed.
23725	40	17	24	  After their arrival at Capernaum the collectors of the half-shekel came and asked Peter, "Does not your Teacher pay  the half-shekel?"
23726	40	17	25	 "Yes," he replied, and then went into the house. But before he spoke a word Jesus said, "What think you, Simon? From whom do this world's kings receive customs or capitation tax? from their own children, or from others?"
23727	40	17	26	 "From others," he replied. "Then  the children go free," said Jesus.
23728	40	17	27	 "However, lest we  cause them to sin, go and throw a hook into the Lake, and take the first fish that comes up. When you open its mouth, you will find a shekel in it: bring that coin and give it to them  for yourself and me."
23729	40	18	1	  Just  then the disciples came to Jesus and asked, "Who  ranks higher than others in the Kingdom of the Heavens?"
23730	40	18	2	 So He called a young child to Him, and, bidding him stand in the midst of them,
23731	40	18	3	 said, "In solemn truth I tell you that unless you  turn and become like little children, you will in no case be admitted into the Kingdom of the Heavens.
23732	40	18	4	 Whoever therefore shall humble himself as this young child, he it is who  is superior to others in the Kingdom of the Heavens.
23733	40	18	5	 And whoever for my sake receives one young child such as this, receives me.
23734	40	18	6	  But whoever shall  occasion the fall of one of these little ones who believe in me, it would be better for him to have a  millstone hung round his neck and to be drowned in the depths of the sea.
23735	40	18	7	 "Alas for the world because of causes of falling! They cannot but come, but alas for each man through whom they come!
