23736	40	18	8	 If your hand or your foot is causing you to fall into sin, cut it off and away with it. It is better for you to enter  into Life crippled in hand or foot than to remain in possession of two sound hands or feet but be thrown into the fire  of the Ages.
23737	40	18	9	 And if your eye is causing you to fall into sin, tear it out and away with it; it is better for you to enter into Life with only one eye, than to remain in possession of two eyes but be thrown into the  Gehenna of fire.
23738	40	18	10	  "Beware of ever despising one of these little ones, for I tell you that in Heaven  their angels  have continual access to my Father who is in Heaven.
23739	40	18	11	  []
23740	40	18	12	 What do you yourselves think? Suppose a man gets a hundred sheep and one of them strays away, will he not leave the ninety-nine on the hills and go and look for the one that is straying?
23741	40	18	13	 And if he succeeds in finding it, in solemn truth I tell you that he rejoices over it more than he does over the ninety-nine that have not gone astray.
23742	40	18	14	 Just so it is not the will  of your Father in Heaven that one of these little ones should be lost.
23743	40	18	15	 "If your brother  acts wrongly  towards you, go and point out his fault to him when only you and he are there. If he listens to you, you have gained your brother.
23744	40	18	16	 But if he will not listen to you, go again, and ask one or two to go with you, that every word spoken may be attested by two or three witnesses.
23745	40	18	17	 If he refuses to hear them, appeal to  the Church; and if he refuses to hear even  the Church,  regard him just as you regard a Gentile or a tax-gatherer.
23746	40	18	18	 I solemnly tell you that whatever you  as a Church bind on earth will in Heaven be held as bound, and whatever you loose on earth will in Heaven be held to be loosed.
23747	40	18	19	 I also solemnly tell you that if two of you here on earth agree together concerning anything whatever that they shall ask, the boon will come to them from my Father who is in Heaven.
23748	40	18	20	 For where there are two or three assembled in my name, there am I  in the midst of them."
23749	40	18	21	  At this point Peter came to Him with the question, "Master, how often shall my brother act wrongly towards me and I forgive him? seven times?"
23750	40	18	22	 "I do not say seven times," answered Jesus, "but  seventy times seven times.
23751	40	18	23	 "For this reason the Kingdom of the Heavens  may be compared to  a king who determined to have a settlement of accounts with his  servants.
23752	40	18	24	 But as soon as he began the settlement, one was brought before him who owed  10,000 talents,
23753	40	18	25	 and was unable to pay. So his  master ordered that he and his wife and children and everything that he had should be sold, and payment be made.
23754	40	18	26	 The servant therefore falling down, prostrated himself at his feet and entreated him. "`Only give me time,' he said, `and I will pay you the whole.'
23755	40	18	27	 "Whereupon his master, touched with compassion, set him free and forgave him the  debt.
23756	40	18	28	 But no sooner had that servant gone out, than he met with one of his fellow servants who owed him 100  shillings; and seizing him by the throat and nearly strangling him he exclaimed, "`Pay me all you owe.'
23757	40	18	29	 "His fellow servant therefore fell at his feet and entreated him, "`Only give me time,' he said, `and I will pay you.'
23758	40	18	30	 "He would not, however, but went and threw him into prison until he should pay what was due.
23759	40	18	31	 His fellow servants, therefore, seeing what had happened, were exceedingly angry; and they came and told their master without reserve all that had happened.
23760	40	18	32	 At once his master called him and said, "`Wicked servant, I forgave you all that debt, because you entreated me:
23761	40	18	33	 ought not you also to have had pity on your fellow servant, just as I had pity on you?'
23762	40	18	34	 "So his master, greatly incensed, handed him over to the  jailers until he should pay all he owed him.
23763	40	18	35	 "In the same way  my Heavenly Father will deal with you, if you do not all of you forgive one another from your hearts."
23764	40	19	1	  When Jesus had finished these discourses, He removed from Galilee and came into that  part of Judaea which lay beyond the Jordan.
23765	40	19	2	 And a vast multitude followed him, and He cured them there.
23766	40	19	3	  Then came  some of the Pharisees to Him to put Him to the proof by the question, "Has a man a right to divorce his wife  whenever he chooses?"
23767	40	19	4	 "Have you not read," He replied, "that He who made them <`made them'> from the beginning <`male and female,
23768	40	19	5	 and said, For this reason a man shall leave his father and mother and  be united to his wife, and the two shall be  one'?>
23769	40	19	6	 Thus they are no longer two, but  `one'! What therefore God has joined together, let not man separate."
23770	40	19	7	 "Why then," said they, "did Moses command the husband to give her `a written notice of divorce,' and so put her away?"
23771	40	19	8	 "Moses," He replied,  "in consideration of the  hardness of your nature permitted you to put away your wives, but it has not been so from the beginning.
23772	40	19	9	 And I tell you that whoever divorces his wife for any reason except her unfaithfulness, and marries another woman,  commits adultery."
23773	40	19	10	 "If this is the case with a man in relation to his wife," said the disciples to Him, "it is better not to marry."
23774	40	19	11	 "It is not every man," He replied, "who can receive this teaching, but  only those on whom the grace has been bestowed.
23775	40	19	12	 There are men who from their birth have been disabled from marriage, others who have been so disabled by men, and others who have disabled themselves for the sake of the Kingdom of the Heavens. He who is able to receive this, let him receive it."
23776	40	19	13	  Then young children were brought to Him for Him to put His hands on them and pray; but the disciples interfered.
23777	40	19	14	 Jesus however said, "Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them; for it is to those who are childlike that the Kingdom of the Heavens belongs."
23778	40	19	15	 So He laid His hands upon them and went away.
23779	40	19	16	  "Teacher," said one man, coming up to Him, "what that is good shall I do in order to win the Life  of the Ages?"
23780	40	19	17	  "Why do you ask me," He replied, "about what is good? There is only One who is truly good. But if you desire to enter into Life, keep the Commandments."
23781	40	19	18	  "Which Commandments?" he asked. Jesus answered, <"`Thou shalt not kill;' `Thou shalt not commit adultery;' `Thou shalt not steal;' `Thou shalt not lie in giving evidence;'
23782	40	19	19	 `Honour thy father and thy mother'; and `Thou shalt love thy fellow man as much as thyself.'">
23783	40	19	20	 "All of these," said the young man, "I have  carefully kept. What do I still lack?"
23784	40	19	21	 "If you desire to be perfect," replied Jesus, "go and sell all that you have, and give to the poor, and you shall have wealth in Heaven; and come, follow me."
23785	40	19	22	 On hearing those words the young man went away much cast down; for he had much property.
23786	40	19	23	 So Jesus said to His disciples, "I solemnly tell you that it is with difficulty that a rich man will enter the Kingdom of the Heavens.
23787	40	19	24	 Yes, I tell you, it is easier for a  camel to go through the eye of a needle than for a rich man to enter the Kingdom of God."
23788	40	19	25	 These words utterly amazed the disciples, and they asked, "Who then can be saved?"
23789	40	19	26	 Jesus looked at them and said, "With men this is impossible, but with God everything is possible."
23790	40	19	27	 Then Peter said to Jesus, "See, *we* have forsaken everything and followed you; what then will be *our* reward?"
23791	40	19	28	 "I solemnly tell you," replied Jesus, "that  in the New Creation, when the Son of Man has taken His seat on  His glorious throne, all of you who have followed me shall also sit on twelve thrones and judge the twelve tribes of Israel.
23792	40	19	29	 And whoever has forsaken houses, or brothers or sisters, or father  or mother, or children or lands, for my sake, shall receive  many times as much and shall have as his inheritance the Life  of the Ages.
23793	40	19	30	 "But many who are now first will be last, and many who are now last will be first.
23794	40	20	1	 "For the Kingdom of the Heavens is like  an employer who went out early in the morning to hire men to work in his vineyard,
23795	40	20	2	 and having made an agreement with them for a shilling a day, sent them into his vineyard.
23796	40	20	3	 About nine o'clock he went out and saw others loitering in the market-place.
23797	40	20	4	 To these also he said, "`You also, go into the vineyard, and whatever is right I will give you.'
23798	40	20	5	 "So they went. Again about twelve, and about three o'clock, he went out and did the same.
23799	40	20	6	 And going out about five o'clock he found others loitering, and he asked them, "`Why  have you been standing here all day long, doing nothing?'
23800	40	20	7	 "`Because  no one has hired us,' they replied. "`You also, go into the vineyard,' he said.
23801	40	20	8	 "When evening came, the master said to his steward, "`Call the men and pay them their wages. Begin with the last set and finish with the first.'
23802	40	20	9	 "When those came who had begun at five o'clock, they received a shilling apiece;
23803	40	20	10	 and when the first came, they expected to get more, but they also each got  the shilling.
23804	40	20	11	 So when they had received it, they grumbled against the employer, saying,
23805	40	20	12	 "`These who came last  have done  only one hour's work, and  you have put them on a level with us who have worked the whole day and have borne the scorching heat.'
23806	40	20	13	 "`My friend,' he answered to one of them, `I am doing you no injustice.  Did you not agree with me for a shilling?
23807	40	20	14	 Take your money and go. I choose to give this last comer just as much as I give you.
23808	40	20	15	 Have I not a right to do what I choose with my own property? Or are you envious because I am  generous?'
23809	40	20	16	 "So the last shall be first, and the first last."
23810	40	20	17	  Jesus was now going up to Jerusalem, and He took the twelve disciples aside by themselves, and on the way He said to them,
23811	40	20	18	 "We are going up to Jerusalem, and there the Son of Man will be betrayed to the High Priests and Scribes. They will condemn Him to death,
23812	40	20	19	 and hand Him over to the Gentiles to be made sport of and scourged and crucified; and on the third day He  will be raised to life."
23813	40	20	20	  Then the mother of the sons of Zabdi came to Him with her sons, and knelt before Him to make a request of Him.
23814	40	20	21	 "What is it you desire?" He asked. "Command," she replied, "that these my two sons may sit one at your right hand and one at your left in  your Kingdom."
23815	40	20	22	 "None of you know what you are asking for," said Jesus; "can you drink  out of the cup  from which I am about to drink?" "We can," they replied.
23816	40	20	23	 "You shall drink out of my cup," He said, "but a seat at my right hand or at my left it is not for me to allot, but it belongs to those for whom it has been  prepared by my Father."
23817	40	20	24	 The  other ten heard of this, and their indignation was aroused  against the two brothers.
23818	40	20	25	 But Jesus called them to Him, and said, "You know that the rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their great men exercise authority over them.
23819	40	20	26	 Not so  shall it be among you; but whoever desires to be great among you shall be your servant,
23820	40	20	27	 and whoever desires to be first among you shall be your bondservant;
23821	40	20	28	 just as the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give His life as the  redemption-price  for many."
23822	40	20	29	  As they were leaving Jericho, an immense crowd following Him,
23823	40	20	30	 two blind men sitting by the roadside heard that it was Jesus who was passing by, and cried aloud, "Sir, Son of David, pity us."
23824	40	20	31	 The people angrily tried to silence them, but they cried all the louder. "O Sir, Son of David, pity us," they said.
23825	40	20	32	 So Jesus stood still and called to them. "What shall I do for you?" He asked.
23826	40	20	33	 "Sir, let our eyes be opened," they replied.
23827	40	20	34	 Moved with compassion, Jesus touched their eyes, and immediately they regained their sight and followed Him.
23828	40	21	1	  When they were come near Jerusalem and had arrived at Bethphage and the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of the disciples on in front,
23829	40	21	2	 saying to them, "Go to the village you see facing you, and as you enter it you will find a she-ass tied up and a foal with her. Untie her and  bring them to me.
23830	40	21	3	 And if any one says anything to you, say,  `The Master needs them,' and he will at once send them."
23831	40	21	4	 This  took place in order that the Prophet's prediction might be fulfilled:
23832	40	21	5	 <"Tell the  Daughter of Zion, `See, thy King is coming  to thee, gentle,  and yet mounted on an ass, even on a colt the  foal of a beast of burden.'">
23833	40	21	6	 So the disciples went and did as Jesus had instructed them:
23834	40	21	7	 they brought the she-ass and the foal, and threw their outer garments on them. So He sat on them;
23835	40	21	8	 and most of the crowd kept spreading their garments along the road, while others  cut branches from the trees and  carpeted the road with them,
23836	40	21	9	 and the multitudes--some of the people preceding Him and some following--sang aloud,  <"God save the Son of David! Blessings on Him who comes in the Lord's name! God in the highest Heavens save Him!">
23837	40	21	10	 When He thus entered Jerusalem, the whole city was thrown into commotion, every one inquiring, "Who is this?"
23838	40	21	11	 "This is Jesus, the Prophet, from Nazareth in Galilee," replied the crowds.
23839	40	21	12	  Entering  the Temple, Jesus drove out all who were buying and selling there, and overturned the money-changers' tables and the seats of the pigeon-dealers.
23840	40	21	13	 "It is written," He said, <"`My House shall be called  the House of Prayer',> but you are making it <a robbers' cave.">
23841	40	21	14	 And  the blind and the lame came to Him in the Temple, and He cured them.
23842	40	21	15	 But when the High Priests and the Scribes saw the wonderful things that He had done and the children who were crying aloud in the Temple, <"God save the Son of David,"> they were filled with indignation.
23843	40	21	16	 "Do you hear," they asked Him, "what these children are saying?" "Yes," He replied; "have you never read, <`Out of the mouths of infants and of babes at the breast Thou hast brought forth the praise which is due'?">
23844	40	21	17	 So He left them and went out of the city to Bethany and passed the night there.
23845	40	21	18	  Early in the morning  as He was on His way to return to the city He was hungry,
23846	40	21	19	 and seeing  a fig-tree on the road-side He went up to it, but found nothing on it but leaves. "On you," He said, "no fruit shall ever again grow." And immediately the fig-tree withered away.
23847	40	21	20	  When the disciples saw it they exclaimed in astonishment, "How instantaneously the fig-tree has withered away!"
23848	40	21	21	 "I solemnly tell you," said Jesus, "that if you have an unwavering faith, you shall not only perform such a miracle as this of the fig-tree, but that even if you say to this mountain, `Be thou lifted up and hurled into the sea,' it shall be done;
23849	40	21	22	 and everything, whatever it be, that you ask for in your prayers, if you have faith, you shall obtain."
23850	40	21	23	  He entered the Temple; and while He was teaching, the High Priests and the Elders of the people came to Him and asked Him, "By  what authority are you doing  these things? and who gave you this authority?"
23851	40	21	24	 "And I also have a question to ask *you*," replied Jesus, "and if you answer me, I in turn will tell you by what authority I do these things.
23852	40	21	25	 John's Baptism, whence was it? --had it a heavenly or a human origin?" So they debated the matter among themselves. "If we say `a heavenly origin,'" they argued, "he will say, `Why then did you not believe him?'
23853	40	21	26	 and if we say `a human origin' we have the people to fear, for they all hold John to have been a Prophet."
23854	40	21	27	 So they answered Jesus, "We do not know."  "Nor do I tell you," He replied, "by what authority I do these things."
23855	40	21	28	 "But give me your judgement. There was a man who had two  sons. He came to the elder of them, and said, "`My  son, go and work in the vineyard to-day.'
23856	40	21	29	 "`I will not,' he replied. "But afterwards he was sorry, and went.
23857	40	21	30	 He came to the second and spoke in the same manner. His answer was, "`I will go, Sir.' "But he did not go.
23858	40	21	31	 Which of the two did as his father desired?"  "The first," they said. "I solemnly tell you,' replied Jesus, "that the tax-gatherers and the notorious sinners are entering the Kingdom of God  in front of you.
23859	40	21	32	 For John came to you observing all sorts of ritual, and you put no faith in him: the tax-gatherers and the notorious sinners did put faith in him, and you, though you saw this example set you, were not even afterwards sorry so as to believe him.
23860	40	21	33	  "Listen to another parable. There was a householder who planted a vineyard, made a fence round it, dug a wine-tank in it, and built a strong lodge; then let the place to vine-dressers, and went abroad.
23861	40	21	34	 When vintage-time approached, he sent his  servants to the vine-dressers to receive his share of the  grapes;
23862	40	21	35	 but the vine-dressers seized the servants, and one they cruelly beat, one they killed, one they pelted with stones.
23863	40	21	36	 Again he sent another party of servants more numerous than the first; and these they treated in the same manner.
23864	40	21	37	 Later still he sent to them  his son,  saying, "`They will respect my son.'
23865	40	21	38	 "But the vine-dressers, when they saw the son, said to one another, "`Here is the heir: come, let us kill him and get his inheritance.'
23866	40	21	39	 "So they seized him, dragged him out of the vineyard, and killed him.
23867	40	21	40	 When then the owner of the vineyard comes, what will he do to those vine-dressers?"
23868	40	21	41	 "He will put the wretches to a wretched death," was the reply, "and will entrust the vineyard to other vine-dressers who will render the produce to him at the vintage season."
23869	40	21	42	 "Have you never read in the Scriptures," said Jesus, <"`The Stone which the builders rejected has been made the Cornerstone: this Cornerstone  came from the Lord, and is wonderful in our eyes'?>
23870	40	21	43	 "That, I tell you, is the reason why the Kingdom of God will be taken away from you, and given to a nation  that will exhibit the power  of it.
23871	40	21	44	 He who  falls on this stone will be severely hurt; but he on whom it falls will be utterly crushed."
23872	40	21	45	 After listening to His parables the High Priests and the Pharisees perceived that He was speaking about them;
23873	40	21	46	 but though they were eager to lay hands upon Him, they were afraid of the people, for by them He was regarded as a Prophet.
23874	40	22	1	  Again Jesus spoke to them in figurative language.
23875	40	22	2	 "The Kingdom of the Heavens," He said,  "may be compared to  a king who celebrated the marriage of his son,
23876	40	22	3	 and sent his  servants to call the invited guests to the wedding, but they were unwilling to come.
23877	40	22	4	 "Again he sent other servants with a message to those who were invited. "`My  breakfast is now ready," he said, `my bullocks and fat cattle are killed, and every preparation is made: come to the wedding.'
23878	40	22	5	 "They however gave no heed, but went, one to his home in the country, another to his business;
23879	40	22	6	 and the rest seized the king's servants, maltreated them, and murdered them.
23880	40	22	7	 So the king's anger was stirred, and he sent his troops and destroyed those murderers and burnt their city.
23881	40	22	8	 Then he said to his servants, "`The wedding banquet is ready, but those who were invited were unworthy of it.
23882	40	22	9	 Go out therefore to the crossroads, and everybody you meet invite to the wedding.'
23883	40	22	10	 "So they went out into the roads and gathered together all they  could find, both bad and good, and the  banqueting hall was filled with guests.
23884	40	22	11	 "Now the king came in to see the guests; and among them he discovered one who was not wearing a wedding-robe.
23885	40	22	12	 "`My friend,' he said, `how is it that you came in here without a wedding robe?'
23886	40	22	13	 "The man  stood speechless. Then the king said to the servants, "`Bind him hand and foot and fling him into the darkness outside: there will be the weeping aloud and the gnashing of teeth.'
23887	40	22	14	 "For there are many called, but few chosen."
23888	40	22	15	  Then the Pharisees went and consulted together how they might entrap Him in His conversation.
23889	40	22	16	 So they sent to Him their disciples together with the Herodians;  who said, "Teacher, we know that you are truthful and that you faithfully teach God's truth; and that no fear of man misleads you, for you  are not biased by men's wealth or rank.
23890	40	22	17	 Give us your judgement therefore: is it allowable for us to pay a poll-tax to Caesar, or not?"
23891	40	22	18	 Perceiving their wickedness, Jesus replied, "Why are you hypocrites trying to ensnare me?
23892	40	22	19	 Show me the tribute coin." And they brought Him a shilling.
23893	40	22	20	 "Whose likeness and inscription," He asked, "is this?"
23894	40	22	21	 "Caesar's," they replied. "Pay therefore," He rejoined, "what is Caesar's to Caesar; and what is God's to God."
23895	40	22	22	 They heard this, and were astonished; then left Him, and went their way.
23896	40	22	23	  On the same day a party of Sadducees came to Him, contending that there is no resurrection. And they put this case to Him.
23897	40	22	24	 "Teacher," they said, "Moses enjoined, <`If a man die childless, his brother shall marry his widow, and raise up a family for him.'>
23898	40	22	25	 Now we had among us seven brothers. The eldest of them married, but died childless, leaving his wife to his brother.
23899	40	22	26	 So also did the second and the third, down to the seventh,
23900	40	22	27	 till the woman also died, after surviving them all.
23901	40	22	28	 At the Resurrection, therefore, whose wife of the seven will she be? for they all married her."
23902	40	22	29	 The reply of Jesus was, "You are in error, through ignorance of the Scriptures and of the power of God.
23903	40	22	30	 For in the Resurrection, men neither marry nor are women given in marriage, but they are like  angels in Heaven.
23904	40	22	31	 But as to the Resurrection of the dead, have you never read what God says to you,
23905	40	22	32	 <`I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob'?> He is not the God of dead, but of living men."
23906	40	22	33	 All the crowd heard this, and were filled with amazement at His teaching.
23907	40	22	34	  Now the Pharisees came up when they heard that He  had silenced the Sadducees,
23908	40	22	35	 and one of them, an expounder of the Law, asked Him as a test question,
23909	40	22	36	 "Teacher,  which is the  greatest Commandment in the Law?"
23910	40	22	37	 <"`Thou shalt love the Lord thy God,'"> He answered,  <"`with thy whole heart, thy whole soul, thy whole mind.'>
23911	40	22	38	 This is the greatest and foremost Commandment.
23912	40	22	39	 And the second is similar to it: <`Thou shalt love thy fellow man  as much as thyself.'
23913	40	22	40	 The whole of the Law and the Prophets is summed up in these two Commandments."
23914	40	22	41	  While the Pharisees were still assembled there, Jesus put a question to them.
23915	40	22	42	 "What think you about the Christ," He said, "whose son is He?" "David's," they replied.
23916	40	22	43	 "How then," He asked, "does David,  taught by the Spirit, call Him Lord, when he says,
23917	40	22	44	 <"`The Lord said to my Lord, sit at My right hand until I have put thy foes beneath thy feet'?>
23918	40	22	45	 "If therefore David calls Him Lord, how can He be his son?"
23919	40	22	46	 No one could say a word in reply, nor from that day did any one venture again to put a question to Him.
23920	40	23	1	  Then Jesus addressed the crowds and His disciples.
23921	40	23	2	 "The Scribes," He said, "and the Pharisees  sit in the chair of Moses.
23922	40	23	3	 Therefore do and observe everything that they command you; but do not imitate their lives, for though they tell others what to do, they do not do it themselves.
23923	40	23	4	  Heavy  and cumbrous burdens they bind together and load men's shoulders with them, while as for themselves, not with one finger do they choose to lift them.
23924	40	23	5	 And everything they do they do with a view to being observed by men; for they widen their  phylacteries and make the tassels large,
23925	40	23	6	 and love the best seats at a dinner party or in the synagogues,
23926	40	23	7	 and like to be bowed to in places of public resort, and to be addressed by men as `Rabbi.'
23927	40	23	8	 "As for you, do not accept the title of `Rabbi,' for one alone is your Teacher, and you are all brothers.
23928	40	23	9	 And call no one on earth your Father, for One alone is your Father--the Heavenly Father.
23929	40	23	10	 And do not accept the name of `leader,' for your Leader is one alone--the Christ.
23930	40	23	11	 He who is the greatest among you shall be your servant;
23931	40	23	12	 and one who exalts himself shall be abased, while one who abases himself shall be exalted.
23932	40	23	13	 "But alas for you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you lock the door of the Kingdom of the Heavens against men; you yourselves do not enter, nor do you allow those to enter who are seeking to do so.
23933	40	23	14	  []
23934	40	23	15	 "Alas for you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you scour sea and land in order to win one convert--and when he is gained, you make him twice as much a son of Gehenna as yourselves.
23935	40	23	16	 "Alas for you, you blind guides, who say, "`Whoever swears by  the Sanctuary it is nothing; but whoever swears by the gold of the Sanctuary, is bound by the oath.'
23936	40	23	17	 "Blind fools!  Why, which is greater? --the gold, or the Sanctuary which has made the gold holy?
23937	40	23	18	 And you say, "`Whoever swears by the altar, it is nothing; but whoever swears by the offering lying on it is bound by the oath.'
23938	40	23	19	 "You are blind! Why, which is greater? --the offering, or the altar which makes the offering holy?
23939	40	23	20	 He who swears by the altar swears both by it and by everything on it;
23940	40	23	21	 he who swears by the Sanctuary swears both by it and by Him who  dwells in it;
23941	40	23	22	 and he who swears by Heaven swears both by the throne of God and by Him who sits upon it.
23942	40	23	23	  "Alas for you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you pay the tithe on mint, dill, and cumin, while you have neglected the weightier requirements of the Law--just judgement, mercy, and faithful dealing. These things you ought to have done, and yet you ought not to have left the others undone.
23943	40	23	24	 You blind guides, straining out the gnat while you gulp down the camel!
23944	40	23	25	  "Alas for you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you wash clean the outside of the cup or dish, while within they are full of greed and  self-indulgence.
23945	40	23	26	 Blind Pharisee, first wash clean the inside of the cup  or dish, and then the outside will be clean also.
23946	40	23	27	 "Alas for you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you are just like whitewashed sepulchres, the outside of which pleases the eye, though inside they are full of dead men's bones and of all that is unclean.
23947	40	23	28	 The same is true of you: outwardly you seem to the human eye to be good and honest men, but, within, you are full of insincerity and  disregard of God's Law.
23948	40	23	29	  "Alas for you, Scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites, for you repair the sepulchres of the Prophets and  keep in order the tombs of the righteous,
23949	40	23	30	 and your boast is, "`If we had lived in the time of our forefathers, we should not have been implicated with them in the murder of the Prophets.'
23950	40	23	31	 "So that you bear witness against yourselves that you are descendants of those who murdered the Prophets.
23951	40	23	32	 Fill up the measure of your forefathers' guilt.
23952	40	23	33	 O serpents, O vipers' brood, how are you  to escape  condemnation to  Gehenna?
23953	40	23	34	  "For this reason I am sending to you Prophets and wise men and Scribes. Some of them you will put to death--nay, crucify; some of them you will flog in your synagogues and chase from town to town;
23954	40	23	35	 that all the innocent blood  shed upon earth may come on you, from the blood of righteous Abel to the blood of Zechariah the son of Berechiah whom you murdered between the Sanctuary and the altar.
23955	40	23	36	 I tell you in solemn truth that all these things will come upon the present generation.
23956	40	23	37	 "O Jerusalem, Jerusalem! thou who murderest the Prophets and stonest those who have been sent to thee! how often have I desired to gather thy children to me, just as a hen gathers her chickens under her wings, and you would not come!
23957	40	23	38	 See, your house  will now be left to you  desolate!
23958	40	23	39	 For I tell you that you will never see me again until you say,  <`Blessed be He who comes in the name of the Lord.'">
23959	40	24	1	 Jesus had left  the Temple and was going on His way, when His disciples came and called His attention to the Temple  buildings.
23960	40	24	2	 "You see all these?" He replied; "in solemn truth I tell you that there will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be pulled down."
23961	40	24	3	 Afterwards He was on the Mount of Olives and was seated there when the disciples came to Him, apart from the others, and said, "Tell us when this will be; and what will be the sign of your  Coming and of the Close of the  Age?"
23962	40	24	4	 "Take care that no one misleads you," answered Jesus;
23963	40	24	5	 "for many will come  assuming my name and saying `I am the Christ;' and they will mislead many.
23964	40	24	6	 And before long you will hear of wars and rumours of wars. Do not be alarmed, for such things must be; but the  End is not yet.
23965	40	24	7	 <For nation will rise in arms against nation, kingdom against kingdom,> and there will be famines and earthquakes in various places;
23966	40	24	8	 but all these miseries are but like the early pains of childbirth.
23967	40	24	9	 "At that time they will deliver you up to punishment and will put you to death; and you will be objects of hatred to all the nations because you are called by my name.
23968	40	24	10	 Then <will many  stumble and fall,> and they will betray one another and hate one another.
23969	40	24	11	 Many false prophets will rise up and lead multitudes astray;
23970	40	24	12	 and because of the prevalent  disregard of God's law the love of  the great majority will grow cold;
23971	40	24	13	 but those who stand firm to  the End shall be saved.
23972	40	24	14	 And  this Good News of the Kingdom shall be proclaimed throughout  the whole world to set the evidence before all the  Gentiles; and then  the End will come.
23973	40	24	15	  "When you have seen (to use the language of the Prophet Daniel) the <`Abomination of Desolation',> standing in the Holy Place" --let the reader observe those words--
23974	40	24	16	 "then let those who are in Judaea escape to the hills;
23975	40	24	17	 let him who is on the roof not go down to fetch what is in his house;
23976	40	24	18	 nor let him who is outside the city stay to pick up his outer garment.
23977	40	24	19	 And  alas for the women who at that time are with child or have infants!
23978	40	24	20	 "But pray that your flight may not be  in winter, nor on  the Sabbath;
23979	40	24	21	 for it <will be> a time of great <suffering, such as never has been from the beginning of the world till now,> and assuredly  never will be again.
23980	40	24	22	 And if those days had not  been cut short, no one would escape; but for the sake of  God's own People those days  will be cut short.
23981	40	24	23	  "If at that time any one should say to you, `See, here is the Christ!' or `Here!' give no credence to it.
23982	40	24	24	 For there will rise up false Christs and false prophets, displaying wonderful signs and prodigies, so as to deceive, were it possible, even God's own People.
23983	40	24	25	 Remember, I have forewarned you.
23984	40	24	26	 If therefore they should say to you, `See, He is in the Desert!' do not go out there: or `See, He is indoors in the room!' do not believe it.
23985	40	24	27	 For just as the lightning flashes in the east and is seen to the very west, so will be the Coming of the Son of Man.
23986	40	24	28	 Wherever the dead body is, there will the  vultures flock together.
23987	40	24	29	 "But immediately after those times of distress <the sun will  be darkened, the moon will not shed her light, the stars will fall from the firmament, and the  forces which control the heavens will be disordered and disturbed.>
23988	40	24	30	 Then will appear the Sign of the Son of Man in the sky; and <then will all the  nations of the earth lament,> when they  see the Son of Man <coming on the clouds of the sky>  with great power and glory.
23989	40	24	31	 And He will send out His angels  <with a loud trumpet-blast,> and <they will  bring together His own People to Him from north, south, east and west--from one extremity of the world to the other.>
23990	40	24	32	 "Now learn from the fig-tree the lesson it teaches. As soon as its branches have now become soft and it is bursting into leaf, you all know that summer is near.
23991	40	24	33	 So you also, when you see all these signs, may be sure that  He is near--at your very door.
23992	40	24	34	 I tell you in solemn truth that  the present generation will certainly not pass away without all these things having first taken place.
23993	40	24	35	  Earth and sky will pass away, but it is certain that my words will not pass away.
23994	40	24	36	 "But as to that day and the exact time no one knows--not even the angels of heaven,  nor the Son, but the Father alone.
23995	40	24	37	  `For as it was in the time of Noah, so it will be at the Coming of the Son of Man.
23996	40	24	38	 At that time, before the Deluge, men were busy eating and drinking, taking wives or giving them, up to the very day when Noah entered the Ark,
23997	40	24	39	 nor did they realise any danger till the Deluge came and swept them all away; so will it be at the Coming of the Son of Man.
23998	40	24	40	 Then will two men be in the open country: one  will be  taken away, and one left behind.
23999	40	24	41	 Two women will be grinding at the mill: one  will be  taken away, and one left behind.
24000	40	24	42	 Be  on the alert therefore, for you do not know the day on which your Lord is coming.
24001	40	24	43	  But of this be assured, that if the master of the house had known the hour at which the robber was coming, he would have kept awake, and not have allowed his house to be broken into.
24002	40	24	44	 Therefore you also must be ready; for it is at a time when you do not expect Him that the Son of Man will come.
24003	40	24	45	 "Who therefore is the loyal and intelligent  servant to whom his  master has entrusted the control of his household to give them their rations at the appointed time?
24004	40	24	46	 Blessed is that servant whom his master when he comes shall find so doing!
24005	40	24	47	 In solemn truth I tell you that he will give him the management of all his wealth.
24006	40	24	48	 But if the man, being a bad servant, should say in his heart, `My master is a long time in coming,'
24007	40	24	49	 and should begin to beat his fellow servants, while he eats and drinks with drunkards;
24008	40	24	50	 the master of that servant will arrive on a day when he is not expecting him and at an hour of which he has not been informed;
24009	40	24	51	 he will  treat him with the utmost severity and assign him a place among the  hypocrites: there will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.
24010	40	25	1	 "Then will the Kingdom of the Heavens  be found to be like ten bridesmaids who took their torches and went out to meet the bridegroom.
24011	40	25	2	 Five of them were foolish and five were wise.
24012	40	25	3	 For the foolish, when they took their torches, did not provide themselves with oil;
24013	40	25	4	 but the wise, besides their  torches, took oil in their  flasks.
24014	40	25	5	 The bridegroom was a long time in coming, so that meanwhile they all became drowsy and fell asleep.
24015	40	25	6	 But at midnight there is a loud cry, "`The bridegroom! Go out and meet him!'
24016	40	25	7	 "Then all those bridesmaids roused themselves and trimmed their torches.
24017	40	25	8	 "`Give us some of your oil,' said the foolish ones to the wise, `for our torches are going out.'
24018	40	25	9	 "`But perhaps,' replied the wise, `there will not be enough for all of us. Go to the shops rather, and buy some for yourselves.'
24019	40	25	10	 "So they went to buy. But meanwhile the bridegroom came; those bridesmaids who were ready went in with him to the wedding banquet; and the door was shut.
24020	40	25	11	 "Afterwards the other bridesmaids came and cried, "`Sir, Sir, open the door to us.'
24021	40	25	12	 "`In solemn truth I tell you,' he replied, `I do not know you.'
24022	40	25	13	 "Keep awake therefore; for you know neither the day nor the hour.
24023	40	25	14	  "Why, it is like a man who, when going on his travels, called his  bondservants and entrusted his property to their care.
24024	40	25	15	 To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one--to each according to his individual capacity; and then started from home.
24025	40	25	16	 Without delay the one who had received the five talents went and employed them in business, and gained five more.
24026	40	25	17	 In the same way he who had the two gained two more.
24027	40	25	18	 But the man who had received the one went and dug a hole and buried his  master's money.
24028	40	25	19	  "After a long lapse of time the master of those servants returned, and had a reckoning with them.
24029	40	25	20	 The one who had received the five talents came and brought five more, and said, "`Sir, it was five talents that you entrusted to me: see, I have gained five more.'
24030	40	25	21	 "`You have done well,  good and  trustworthy servant,' replied his master; `you have been trustworthy in the management of a little, I will put you in charge of much: share your master's joy.'
24031	40	25	22	 "The second, who had received the two talents, came and said, "`Sir, it was two talents you entrusted to me: see, I have gained two more.'
24032	40	25	23	 "`Good and trustworthy servant, you have done well,' his master replied; `you have been trustworthy in the management of a little, I will put you in charge of much:  share your master's joy.'
24033	40	25	24	 "But, next, the man who had the one talent in his keeping came and said, "`Sir,  I knew you to be a severe man, reaping where you had not sown and garnering  what you had not winnowed.
24034	40	25	25	 So being afraid I went and buried your talent in the ground: there you have what belongs to you.'
24035	40	25	26	 "`You wicked and slothful servant,' replied his master, `did you know that I reap where I have not sown, and garner what I have not winnowed?
24036	40	25	27	 Your duty then was to deposit my money in some bank, and so when I came I should have got back my property with interest.
24037	40	25	28	 So take away the talent from him, and give it to the man who has the ten.'
24038	40	25	29	 (For to every one who has, more shall be given, and he shall have abundance; but from him  who has nothing, even what he has shall be taken away.)
24039	40	25	30	 `But as for this worthless servant, put him out into the darkness outside: *there* will be the weeping and the gnashing of teeth.'
24040	40	25	31	  "When the Son of Man comes in His glory, and all the angels with Him, then will He sit upon His glorious throne,
24041	40	25	32	 and  all the nations will be gathered into His presence. And He will separate  them from one another, just as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats;
24042	40	25	33	 and will make the sheep stand at His right hand, and the goats at His left.
24043	40	25	34	 "Then the King will say to those at His right, "`Come, my Father's blessed ones, receive your inheritance of the Kingdom which has been  divinely intended for you ever since the creation of the world.
24044	40	25	35	 For when I was hungry, you gave me food; when I was thirsty, you gave me drink; when I was homeless, you gave me a welcome;
24045	40	25	36	 when I was ill-clad, you clothed me; when I was sick, you visited me; when I was in prison, you came to see me.'
24046	40	25	37	 "`When, Lord,' the righteous will reply, `did we see  Thee hungry, and feed Thee; or thirsty, and give Thee drink?
24047	40	25	38	 When did we see Thee homeless, and give Thee a welcome? or ill-clad, and clothe Thee?
24048	40	25	39	 When did we see Thee sick or in prison, and come to see Thee?'
24049	40	25	40	 "But the King will answer them, "`In solemn truth I tell you that in so far as you rendered such services to one of the humblest of these my brethren, you rendered them to myself.'
24050	40	25	41	 "Then will He say to those at His left, "`Begone from me, with the curse resting upon you, into the Fire  of the Ages, which has been  prepared for the Devil and his angels.
24051	40	25	42	 For when I was hungry, you gave me nothing to eat; when thirsty, you gave me nothing to drink;
24052	40	25	43	 when homeless, you gave me no welcome; ill-clad, you clothed me not; sick or in prison, you visited me not.'
24053	40	25	44	 "Then will they also answer, "`Lord, when did we see Thee hungry or thirsty or homeless or ill-clad or sick or in prison, and not come to serve Thee?'
24054	40	25	45	 "But he will reply, "`In solemn truth I tell you that in so far as you withheld such services from one of the humblest of these, you withheld them from me.'
24055	40	25	46	 "And these shall go away into the  Punishment  of the Ages, but the righteous into the Life  of the Ages."
24056	40	26	1	  When Jesus had ended all these discourses, He said to His disciples,
24057	40	26	2	 "You know that in  two days' time the Passover comes. And the Son of Man will be delivered up to be crucified."
24058	40	26	3	 Then the High Priests and Elders of the People assembled in the court of the palace of the High Priest Caiaphas,
24059	40	26	4	 and consulted how to get Jesus into their power by stratagem and put Him to death.
24060	40	26	5	 But they said, "Not during the Festival, lest there be a riot among the people."
24061	40	26	6	  Now when Jesus was come to Bethany and was at the house of Simon the Leper,
24062	40	26	7	  a woman came to Him with a jar of very costly, sweet-scented ointment, which she poured over His head as He reclined at table.
24063	40	26	8	 "Why such waste?" indignantly exclaimed the disciples;
24064	40	26	9	 "for this might have been sold for a considerable sum, and the money given to the poor."
24065	40	26	10	 But Jesus heard it, and said to them, "Why are you vexing her? For she has done a most gracious act towards me.
24066	40	26	11	 The poor you always have with you, but me you have not always.
24067	40	26	12	 In pouring this ointment over me, her object was to prepare me for burial.
24068	40	26	13	 In solemn truth I tell you that wherever in the whole world this Good News shall be proclaimed, this deed of hers shall be spoken of in memory of her."
24069	40	26	14	  At that time one of the Twelve, the one called Judas Iscariot, went to the High Priests
24070	40	26	15	 and said, "What are you willing to give me if I betray him to you?" So they weighed out to him thirty shekels,
24071	40	26	16	 and from that moment he was on the look out for an opportunity to betray Him.
24072	40	26	17	  On the first day of the Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus with the question, "Where shall we make preparations for you to eat the Passover?"
24073	40	26	18	 "Go into the city," He replied, "to a certain man, and tell him, `The Teacher says, My time is close at hand. It is at your house that I shall keep the Passover with my disciples.'"
24074	40	26	19	 The disciples did as Jesus directed them, and got the Passover ready.
24075	40	26	20	  When evening came, He  was at table with the twelve  disciples,
24076	40	26	21	  and the meal was proceeding, when Jesus said, "In solemn truth I tell you that one of you will betray me."
24077	40	26	22	 Intensely grieved they began one after another to ask Him, "Can it be I, Master?"
24078	40	26	23	 "The one who has dipped his fingers in the bowl with me," He answered, "is the man who will betray me.
24079	40	26	24	 The Son of Man is indeed going as is written concerning Him; but alas for that man by whom the Son of Man is betrayed! It had been a happy thing for that man if he had  never been born."
24080	40	26	25	 Then Judas, the disciple who was betraying Him, asked, "Can it be I, Rabbi?"  "It is you," He replied.
24081	40	26	26	  During the meal Jesus took  a Passover biscuit, blessed it and broke it. He then gave it to the disciples, saying, "Take this and eat it: it  is my body."
24082	40	26	27	 And He  took the cup and gave thanks, and gave it to them saying, "Drink from it, all of you;
24083	40	26	28	 for this is my blood which is to be poured out for many for the remission of sins--the blood which ratifies  the Covenant.
24084	40	26	29	  I tell you that I will never again take the produce of the vine till that day when I shall drink  the new wine with you in my Father's Kingdom."
24085	40	26	30	  So they sang  the hymn and went out to the Mount of Olives.
24086	40	26	31	  Then said Jesus, "This night all of you will stumble and fail in your fidelity to me; for it is written, <`I will strike the Shepherd, and the sheep of the flock will be scattered in all directions.'>
24087	40	26	32	 But after I have risen to life again I will go before you into Galilee."
24088	40	26	33	 "All may stumble and fail," said Peter, "but I never will."
24089	40	26	34	 "In solemn truth I tell you," replied Jesus, "that this very night,  before the cock crows, you will three times disown me."
24090	40	26	35	 "Even if I must die with you," declared Peter, "I will never disown you." In like manner protested all the disciples.
24091	40	26	36	  Then Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane. And He said to the disciples, "Sit down here, whilst I go yonder and there pray."
24092	40	26	37	 And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zabdi. Then He began to be full of anguish and distress,
24093	40	26	38	 and He said to them, "My soul is  crushed with anguish to the very point of death; wait here, and keep awake with me."
24094	40	26	39	 Going forward a short distance He fell on His face and prayed. "My Father," He said, "if it is possible, let this  cup pass away from me; nevertheless, not as I will, but as Thou willest."
24095	40	26	40	 Then He came to the disciples and found them asleep, and He said to Peter, "Alas, none of you could keep awake with me for even a single hour!
24096	40	26	41	 Keep awake, and pray that you may not enter into temptation:  the spirit is  right willing, but the  body is frail."
24097	40	26	42	 Again a second time He went away and prayed, saying, "My Father, if it is impossible for this cup to pass without my drinking it, Thy will be done."
24098	40	26	43	 He came and again found them asleep, for  they were very tired.
24099	40	26	44	 So He left them, and went away once more and prayed a third time, again using the same words.
24100	40	26	45	 Then He came to the disciples and said, "Sleep on and rest. See, the moment is close at hand when the Son of Man is to be betrayed into the hands of sinful men.
24101	40	26	46	 Rouse yourselves. Let us be going. My betrayer is close at hand."
24102	40	26	47	  He had scarcely finished speaking when Judas came--one of the Twelve--accompanied by a great crowd of men armed with swords and bludgeons, sent by the High Priests and Elders of the People.
24103	40	26	48	 Now the betrayer had agreed upon a sign with them, to direct them. He had said, "The one whom I kiss is the man: lay hold of him."
24104	40	26	49	 So he went straight to Jesus and said,  "Peace to you, Rabbi!" And he kissed Him  eagerly.
24105	40	26	50	 "Friend," said Jesus,  "carry out your intention." Then they came and laid their hands on Jesus and seized Him firmly.
24106	40	26	51	 But one of those with Jesus drew his sword and struck the High Priest's  servant, cutting off his ear.
24107	40	26	52	 "Put back your sword again," said Jesus, "for all who  draw the sword shall perish by the sword.
24108	40	26	53	 Or do you suppose I cannot entreat my Father and He would instantly  send to my help more than twelve legions of angels?
24109	40	26	54	 In that case how are the Scriptures to be fulfilled which declare that thus it must be?"
24110	40	26	55	 Then said Jesus to the crowds, "Have you come out as if to fight with a robber, with swords and bludgeons to apprehend me? Day after day I  have been sitting teaching in the Temple, and you did not arrest me.
24111	40	26	56	  But all this has taken place in order that the writings of the Prophets may be fulfilled." At this point the disciples all left Him and fled.
24112	40	26	57	  But the officers who had laid hold of Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas the High Priest, at whose house the Scribes and the Elders had assembled.
24113	40	26	58	 And Peter kept following Him at a distance, till he came even to the court of the High Priest's palace, where he entered and sat down among the  officers to see the issue.
24114	40	26	59	 Meanwhile the High Priests and the whole Sanhedrin were seeking false testimony against Jesus in order to put Him to death;
24115	40	26	60	 but they could find none, although many false witnesses came forward. At length there came two
24116	40	26	61	 who testified, "This man said, `I am able to pull down the Sanctuary of God and three days afterwards to build a new one.'"
24117	40	26	62	 Then the High Priest stood up and asked Him, "Have you no answer to make? What is it these men are saying in evidence against you?"
24118	40	26	63	 Jesus however remained silent. Again the High Priest addressed Him. "In the name of the  ever-living God," he said,  "I now put you on your oath. Tell us whether you are the Christ, the Son of God."
24119	40	26	64	  "I am He," replied Jesus. "But I tell you that,  later on, you will see <the Son of Man sitting at the right hand> of Omnipotence, <and coming on the clouds of the sky.">
24120	40	26	65	 Then the High Priest tore his robes and exclaimed, "Impious language! What further need have we of witnesses! See, you have now heard the impiety.
24121	40	26	66	 What is your verdict?" "He deserves to die," they replied.
24122	40	26	67	 Then they spat in His face, and struck Him--some with the fist, some  with the open hand--
24123	40	26	68	 while they taunted Him, saying, "Christ,  prove yourself a Prophet by telling us who it was that struck you."
24124	40	26	69	 Peter meanwhile was sitting outside in the court of the palace, when  one of the maidservants came over to him and said, "You too were with Jesus the Galilaean."
24125	40	26	70	 He denied it before them all, saying, "I do not know what you mean."
24126	40	26	71	 Soon afterwards he went out and stood in the gateway, when another girl saw him, and said, addressing the people there,  "This man was with Jesus the Nazarene."
24127	40	26	72	 Again he denied it with an oath. "I do not know the man," he said.
24128	40	26	73	 A short time afterwards the people  standing there came and said to Peter, "Certainly you too are one of them, for your brogue shows it."
24129	40	26	74	 Then with curses and oaths he declared, "I do not know the man." Immediately a cock crowed,
24130	40	26	75	 and Peter recollected the words of Jesus, how He had said, "Before the cock crows you will three times disown me." And he went out and wept  aloud, bitterly.
24131	40	27	1	  When morning came all the High Priests and the Elders of the people consulted together against Jesus to put Him to death;
24132	40	27	2	 and binding Him they led Him away and handed Him over to Pilate the Governor.
24133	40	27	3	  Then when Judas,  who had betrayed Him, saw that He was condemned, smitten with remorse he brought back the thirty shekels to the High Priests and Elders
24134	40	27	4	 and said, "I have sinned, in betraying to death one who is innocent." "What does that matter to us?" they replied; it is your business."
24135	40	27	5	 Flinging the shekels into the Sanctuary he left the place, and went and hanged himself.
24136	40	27	6	 When the High Priests had gathered up the money they said, "It is illegal to put it into the Treasury, because it is the price of blood."
24137	40	27	7	 So after consulting together they spent the money in the purchase of the Potter's Field as a burial place for people not belonging to the city;
24138	40	27	8	 for which reason that piece of ground received the name, which it still bears, of `the Field of Blood.'
24139	40	27	9	 Then were fulfilled the words spoken by the Prophet Jeremiah, <"And I took the thirty shekels, the price of the prized one on whom Israelites had set a price,
24140	40	27	10	 and  gave them for the potter's field, as the Lord directed me.">
24141	40	27	11	  Meanwhile Jesus was brought before the Governor, and the latter put the question, "Are you the King of the Jews?"  "I am their King," He answered.
24142	40	27	12	 When however the High Priests and the Elders kept bringing their charges against Him, He said not a word in reply.
24143	40	27	13	 "Do you not hear," asked Pilate, "what a mass of  evidence they are bringing against you?"
24144	40	27	14	 But He made no reply to a single accusation, so that the Governor was greatly astonished.
24145	40	27	15	  "Now it was the Governor's custom at the Festival to release some one prisoner, whomsoever the populace desired;
24146	40	27	16	 and at this time they had a notorious prisoner called  Barabbas.
24147	40	27	17	 So when they were now assembled Pilate appealed to them. "Whom shall I release to you," he said,  "Barabbas, or Jesus the so-called Christ?"
24148	40	27	18	 For he knew that it was from envious hatred that Jesus had been brought before him.
24149	40	27	19	 While he was sitting on the tribunal a message came to him from his wife. "Have nothing to do with that innocent man," she said, "for during the night I have suffered terribly in a dream through him."
24150	40	27	20	 The High Priests, however, and the Elders  urged the crowd to ask for Barabbas and to demand the death of Jesus.
24151	40	27	21	 So when the Governor  a second time asked them, "Which of the two shall I release to you?" --they cried, "Barabbas!"
24152	40	27	22	 "What then," said Pilate, "shall I do with Jesus, the so-called Christ?" With one voice they shouted, "Let him be crucified!"
24153	40	27	23	 "Why, what crime has he committed?" asked Pilate. But they kept on furiously shouting, "Let him be crucified!"
24154	40	27	24	  So when he saw that he could gain nothing, but that on the contrary there was a riot threatening, he called for water and washed his hands in sight of them all, saying, "I am  not responsible for this murder: you must answer for it."
24155	40	27	25	 "His blood," replied all the people, "be on us and on our children!"
24156	40	27	26	 Then he released Barabbas to them, but Jesus he ordered to be  scourged, and gave Him up to be crucified.
24157	40	27	27	 Then the Governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and called together the whole  battalion  to make sport of Him.
24158	40	27	28	 Stripping off His garments, they put on Him a general's short  crimson cloak.
24159	40	27	29	 They twisted a wreath of thorny twigs and put it on His head, and they put a sceptre of cane in His right hand, and kneeling to Him they shouted in mockery,  "Long live the King of the Jews!"
24160	40	27	30	 Then they spat upon Him, and taking the cane they repeatedly struck Him on the head with it.
24161	40	27	31	  At last, having finished their sport, they took off the cloak, clothed Him again in His own garments, and led Him away for crucifixion.
24162	40	27	32	 Going out they met a Cyrenaean named Simon; whom they compelled to carry His cross,
24163	40	27	33	 and so they came to a place called Golgotha, which means `Skull-ground.'
24164	40	27	34	 Here they gave Him a mixture of  wine and gall to drink, but having tasted it He refused to drink it.
24165	40	27	35	  After crucifying Him, they divided His garments among them by lot,
24166	40	27	36	 and sat down there on guard.
24167	40	27	37	 Over His head they placed a written statement of the charge against Him: THIS IS JESUS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
24168	40	27	38	 At the same time two robbers were crucified with Him, one at His right hand and the other at His left.
24169	40	27	39	  And the passers-by reviled Him. They shook their heads at Him
24170	40	27	40	 and said, "You who would pull down the Sanctuary and build a new one within three days, save yourself. If you are God's Son, come down from the cross."
24171	40	27	41	 In like manner the High Priests also, together with the Scribes and the Elders, taunted Him.
24172	40	27	42	 "He saved others," they said,  "himself he cannot save! He is the King of Israel! Let him now come down from the cross, and we will believe in him.
24173	40	27	43	 His trust is in God: let God deliver him now, if He will have him; for he said, `I am God's Son.'"
24174	40	27	44	 Insults of the same kind were heaped on Him even by the  robbers who were being crucified with Him.
24175	40	27	45	  Now from noon until three o'clock in the afternoon there was darkness over the whole  land;
24176	40	27	46	 but about three o'clock Jesus cried out in a loud voice, <"Eli, Eli, lama sabachthani?"> that is to say, <"My God, My God, why hast Thou forsaken me?">
24177	40	27	47	  "The man is calling for Elijah," said some of the bystanders.
24178	40	27	48	 One of them ran forthwith, and filling a sponge with  sour wine put it on the end of a cane and offered it Him to drink;
24179	40	27	49	 while the rest said, "Let us see whether Elijah is coming to deliver him."
24180	40	27	50	 But Jesus uttered another loud cry and then yielded up His spirit.
24181	40	27	51	  Immediately the curtain of the Sanctuary  was torn in two  from top to bottom: the earth quaked; the rocks split;
24182	40	27	52	 the tombs opened; and many of God's people who were asleep in death  awoke.
24183	40	27	53	 And coming out of their tombs after Christ's resurrection they entered the holy city and showed themselves to many.
24184	40	27	54	 As for the Captain and the soldiers who were with Him keeping guard over Jesus, when they witnessed the earthquake and the other occurrences they were filled with terror, and exclaimed, "Assuredly he was God's Son."
24185	40	27	55	 And there were a number of women there looking on from a distance, who had followed Jesus from Galilee ministering to His necessities;
24186	40	27	56	 among them being Mary of Magdala, Mary the mother of James and  Joses, and the mother of the sons of Zabdi.
24187	40	27	57	  Towards sunset there came a wealthy inhabitant of Arimathaea, named Joseph, who himself also had become a disciple of Jesus.
24188	40	27	58	 He went to Pilate and begged to have the body of Jesus, and Pilate ordered it to be given to him.
24189	40	27	59	 So Joseph took the body and wrapped it in a clean sheet of fine linen.
24190	40	27	60	 He then laid it in his own  new tomb which he had hewn in the solid rock, and after rolling a great stone against the door of the tomb he went home.
24191	40	27	61	 Mary of Magdala and the other Mary were both present there, sitting opposite to the sepulchre.
24192	40	27	62	 On the next day, the day after the Preparation, the High Priests and the Pharisees came in a body to Pilate.
24193	40	27	63	 "Sir," they said, "we recollect that during his lifetime that impostor pretended that after two days he was to rise to life again.
24194	40	27	64	 So give orders for the sepulchre to be securely guarded till the third day, for fear his disciples should come by night and steal  the body, and then tell the people that he has come back to life; and so the last imposture will be more serious than the first."
24195	40	27	65	  "You can have a guard," said Pilate: "go and make all safe, as best you can."
24196	40	27	66	 So they went and made the sepulchre secure, sealing the stone besides setting the guard.
24197	40	28	1	  After the Sabbath, in the early dawn of the first day of the week, Mary of Magdala and the other Mary came to see the sepulchre.
24198	40	28	2	 But to their amazement there  had been a great earthquake; for an angel of the Lord had descended from Heaven, and had come and rolled back the stone, and was sitting upon it.
24199	40	28	3	 His appearance was like lightning, and his raiment white as snow.
24200	40	28	4	 For fear of him the guards trembled violently, and became like dead men.
24201	40	28	5	  But the angel said to the women, "As for you,  dismiss your fears. I know that it is Jesus that you are looking for--the crucified One.
24202	40	28	6	 He is not here: He has  come back to life, as He foretold. Come and see the place  where He lay.
24203	40	28	7	 And go quickly and tell His disciples that He has risen from the dead and is going before you into Galilee: there you shall see Him. Remember, I have told you."
24204	40	28	8	  They quickly left the tomb and ran, still terrified but full of unspeakable joy, to carry the news to His disciples.
24205	40	28	9	  And then suddenly they saw Jesus coming to meet them. "Peace be to you," He said. And they came and clasped His feet,  bowing to the ground before Him.
24206	40	28	10	 Then He said, "Dismiss all fear! Go and take word to my brethren to go into Galilee, and there they shall see me."
24207	40	28	11	 While they went on this errand, some of the guards came into the city and reported to the High Priests every detail of what had happened.
24208	40	28	12	 So the latter held a conference with the Elders, and after consultation with them they heavily bribed the soldiers,
24209	40	28	13	 telling them to say, "His disciples came during the night and stole  his body while we were asleep."
24210	40	28	14	 "And if this," they added,  "is reported to the Governor, we will satisfy him and screen you from punishment."
24211	40	28	15	 So they took the money and did as they were instructed; and this story was noised about among the Jews, and is current to this day.
24212	40	28	16	  As for the eleven disciples, they proceeded into Galilee, to the hill where Jesus had arranged to meet them.
24213	40	28	17	 There they saw Him and  prostrated themselves before Him. Yet some doubted.
24214	40	28	18	 Jesus however came near and said to them, "All  power in Heaven and  over the earth has been given to me.
24215	40	28	19	 Go  therefore and make disciples of all the nations; baptize them  into the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Spirit;
24216	40	28	20	 and teach them to obey every command which I have given you. And remember, I am with you always, day by day, until the  Close of the  Age."
24217	41	1	1	  The beginning of the Good News of Jesus Christ  the Son of God.
24218	41	1	2	 As  it is written in Isaiah the Prophet, <"See, I am sending My messenger before Thee, Who will prepare Thy way";
24219	41	1	3	 "The voice of one  crying aloud: `In the Desert prepare a road for the Lord: Make His highways straight.'">
24220	41	1	4	 So John  the Baptizer came, and was in the Desert proclaiming a baptism of  the penitent for forgiveness of sins.
24221	41	1	5	 There went out to him people  of all classes from Judaea, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem of all ranks, and  were baptized by him  in the river Jordan, making open confession of their sins.
24222	41	1	6	 As for John, his garment was of camel's hair, and he wore a loincloth of leather; and his food was locusts and wild honey.
24223	41	1	7	  His announcement was, "There is One coming after me mightier than I--One whose sandal-strap I am unworthy to stoop down and unfasten.
24224	41	1	8	 I have baptized you with water, but He will baptize you  with the Holy Spirit."
24225	41	1	9	  At that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan;
24226	41	1	10	 and  immediately on His coming up out of the water He saw an opening in the sky, and the Spirit like a  dove coming down  to Him;
24227	41	1	11	 and a voice came from the sky, saying, "Thou art My Son dearly loved: in Thee is My delight."
24228	41	1	12	  At once the Spirit impelled Him to go out into the Desert,
24229	41	1	13	 where He remained for forty days, tempted by Satan; and He was among the wild beasts, but the angels waited upon Him.
24230	41	1	14	  Then, after John had been  thrown into prison, Jesus came into Galilee proclaiming God's Good News.
24231	41	1	15	 "The time has fully come," He said, "and the Kingdom of God is close at hand: repent, and believe this Good News.
24232	41	1	16	 One day, passing along the shore of the Lake of Galilee, He saw Simon and Andrew, Simon's brother, throwing their nets in the Lake; for they were fisherman.
24233	41	1	17	 "Come and follow me," said Jesus, "and I will make you fishers for men."
24234	41	1	18	 At once they left their nets and followed Him.
24235	41	1	19	 Going on a little further He saw James the son of Zabdi and his brother John: they also were in the boat mending the nets, and He immediately called them.
24236	41	1	20	 They  therefore left their father Zabdi in the boat with the hired men, and went and followed Him.
24237	41	1	21	  So they came to Capernaum, and on the next Sabbath He went to the synagogue and began to teach.
24238	41	1	22	 The people listened with amazement to His teaching--for there was authority about it: it was very different from that of the Scribes--
24239	41	1	23	 when all at once, there in their synagogue, a man  under the power of a foul spirit screamed out:
24240	41	1	24	 "What have you to do with us, Jesus the Nazarene? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are--God's Holy One."
24241	41	1	25	 But Jesus reprimanded him, saying, "Silence! come out of him."
24242	41	1	26	 So the foul spirit, after throwing the man into convulsions, came out of him with a loud cry.
24243	41	1	27	 And all were  amazed and awe-struck, so they began to ask one another, "What does this mean? Here is a new sort of teaching--and a tone of authority! And even to foul spirits he issues orders and they obey him!"
24244	41	1	28	 And His fame spread at once everywhere in all that part of Galilee.
24245	41	1	29	  Then on leaving the synagogue  they came at once, with James and John, to the house of Simon and Andrew.
24246	41	1	30	 Now Simon's mother-in-law was ill in bed with a fever, and without delay they informed Him about her.
24247	41	1	31	 So He went to her, and taking her  hand He raised her to her feet: the fever left her, and she began to wait upon them.
24248	41	1	32	 When it was evening, after sunset people came bringing Him all who were sick and the demoniacs;
24249	41	1	33	 and the whole town was assembled at the door.
24250	41	1	34	 Then He cured numbers of people who were ill with various diseases, and He drove out many demons; not allowing the demons to speak, because they knew  who He was.
24251	41	1	35	 In the morning He rose early, while it was still quite dark, and leaving the house He went away to a solitary place and there prayed.
24252	41	1	36	 And Simon and the others searched everywhere for Him.
24253	41	1	37	 When they found Him they said, "Every one is looking for you."
24254	41	1	38	 "Let us go elsewhere, to the neighbouring country towns," He replied, "that I may proclaim my Message there also; because for that purpose I came from God."
24255	41	1	39	 And He went through all Galilee, preaching in the synagogues and expelling the demons.
24256	41	1	40	 One day there came a leper to Jesus entreating Him, and pleading on his knees. "If you are willing," he said, "you are able to cleanse me."
24257	41	1	41	  Moved with pity Jesus reached out His hand and touched him. "I am willing," He said; "be cleansed."
24258	41	1	42	 The leprosy at once  left him, and he was cleansed.
24259	41	1	43	 Jesus at once sent him away, strictly charging him,
24260	41	1	44	 and saying, "Be careful not to tell any one, but go and show yourself to the Priest, and for your purification present the offerings that Moses appointed as evidence for them."
24261	41	1	45	 But the man, when he went out, began to tell every one and to publish the matter abroad, so that it was no longer possible for Jesus to go openly into  any town; but He had to remain outside in unfrequented places, where people came to Him from all parts.
24262	41	2	1	  After some days He entered Capernaum again, and it soon became known that He was at home;
24263	41	2	2	 and such numbers of people came together that there was no longer room for them even round the door. He was speaking His Message to them,
24264	41	2	3	 when there came a party of people bringing a paralytic--four men carrying him.
24265	41	2	4	 Finding themselves unable, however, to bring him to Jesus because of the crowd, they untiled the roof just over His head, and after clearing an opening they lowered the mat on which the paralytic was lying.
24266	41	2	5	 Seeing their faith, Jesus said to the paralytic, "My son, your sins are pardoned."
24267	41	2	6	 Now there were some of the Scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts.
24268	41	2	7	 "Why does this man use such words?" they said; "he is blaspheming. Who can pardon sins but One--that is, God?"
24269	41	2	8	 At once perceiving by His spirit that they were reasoning within themselves, Jesus asked them, "Why do you thus argue in your  minds?
24270	41	2	9	 Which is easier?--to say to this paralytic, `Your sins are pardoned,' or to say, `Rise, take up your mat, and walk?'
24271	41	2	10	 But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to pardon sins" --He turned to the paralytic, and said,
24272	41	2	11	 "To you I say, `Rise, take up your mat and go home.'"
24273	41	2	12	 The man rose, and immediately under the eyes of all took up his mat and went out, so that they were all filled with astonishment, gave the glory to God, and said, "We never saw anything like this."
24274	41	2	13	  Again He went out to the shore of the Lake, and the whole multitude kept coming to Him, and He taught them.
24275	41	2	14	 And as He passed by, He saw Levi the son of Alphaeus sitting  at the Toll Office, and said to him, "Follow me." So he rose and followed Him.
24276	41	2	15	 When He was  sitting at table in Levi's house, a large number of tax-gatherers and notorious sinners were at table with Jesus and His disciples; for there were many such who habitually followed Him.
24277	41	2	16	 But when the Scribes of the Pharisee sect saw Him eating with the sinners and the tax-gatherers, they said to His disciples, "He is eating  and drinking with the tax-gatherers and sinners!"
24278	41	2	17	 Jesus heard the words, and He said, "It is not the healthy who require a doctor, but the sick: I did not come to appeal to the righteous, but to sinners."
24279	41	2	18	  (Now John's disciples and those of the Pharisees were  keeping a fast.) And they came and asked Him, "How is it that John's disciples and those of the Pharisees are fasting, and yours are not?"
24280	41	2	19	 "Can a wedding party fast while the bridegroom is among them?" replied Jesus. "So long as they have the bridegroom with them, fasting is impossible.
24281	41	2	20	 But a time will come when the Bridegroom will be taken away from them; then they will fast.
24282	41	2	21	 No one mends an old garment with a piece of unshrunk cloth. Otherwise, the patch put on would tear away from it--the new from the old--and a worse hole would be made.
24283	41	2	22	 And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise the wine would burst the skins, and both wine and skins would be lost. New wine needs fresh skins!"
24284	41	2	23	  One Sabbath He was walking through the wheatfields when His disciples began to pluck the ears of wheat as they went.
24285	41	2	24	 So the Pharisees said to Him, "Look! why are they doing what on the Sabbath is unlawful?"
24286	41	2	25	 "Have you never read," Jesus replied, "what David did when the necessity arose and he and his men were hungry:
24287	41	2	26	 how he entered the house of God  in the High-priesthood of Abiathar, and ate the Presented Loaves--which none but the priests are allowed to eat--and gave some to his men also?"
24288	41	2	27	 And Jesus said to them: "The Sabbath was made for  man, not man for the Sabbath;
24289	41	2	28	 so that the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath."
24290	41	3	1	  At another time, when He went to the synagogue, there was a man there with one arm shrivelled up.
24291	41	3	2	 They closely watched Him to see whether He would cure him on the Sabbath--so as to have a charge to bring against Him.
24292	41	3	3	 "Come forward," said He to the man with the shrivelled arm.
24293	41	3	4	 Then He asked them, "Are we allowed to do good on the Sabbath, or to do evil? to save a  life, or to destroy one?" They remained silent.
24294	41	3	5	  Grieved and indignant at the hardening of their hearts, He looked round on them with anger, and said to the man, "Stretch out your arm." He stretched it out, and the arm was completely restored.
24295	41	3	6	 But no sooner had the Pharisees left the synagogue than they held a consultation with the Herodians against Jesus, to devise some means of destroying Him.
24296	41	3	7	  Accordingly Jesus withdrew with His disciples to the Lake, and a vast crowd of people from Galilee followed Him;
24297	41	3	8	 and from Judaea and Jerusalem and Idumaea and from beyond the Jordan and from the district of Tyre and Sidon there came to Him a vast crowd, hearing of all that He was doing.
24298	41	3	9	  So He gave directions to His disciples to keep a small boat in constant attendance on Him because of the throng--to prevent their crushing Him.
24299	41	3	10	 For He had cured many of the people, so that all who had any ailments pressed upon Him, to touch Him.
24300	41	3	11	 And the foul spirits, whenever they saw Him, threw themselves down at His feet, screaming out: "You are the Son of God."
24301	41	3	12	 But He many a time checked them, forbidding them to say who He was.
24302	41	3	13	  Then He went up the hill; and those whom He Himself chose He called, and they came to Him.
24303	41	3	14	 He appointed  twelve of them, that they might be with Him, and that He might also send them to proclaim His Message,
24304	41	3	15	 with authority to expel the demons.
24305	41	3	16	  These twelve were Simon (to whom He gave the surname of Peter),
24306	41	3	17	 James the son of Zabdi and John the brother of James (these two He surnamed Boanerges, that is `Sons of Thunder'),
24307	41	3	18	 Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the  Cananaean,
24308	41	3	19	 and Judas Iscariot, the man who also betrayed Him.
24309	41	3	20	  And He  went into a house. But again the crowd assembled, so that there was no opportunity for them even  to snatch a meal.
24310	41	3	21	 Hearing of this,  His relatives came to seize Him by force, for they said, "He is out of his mind."
24311	41	3	22	 The Scribes, too, who had come down from Jerusalem said, "He has  Baal-zebul in him; and it is by the power of the Prince of the demons that he expels the demons."
24312	41	3	23	 So He called them to Him, and using figurative language He appealed to them, saying, "How is it possible for Satan to expel Satan?
24313	41	3	24	  For if civil war breaks out in a kingdom, nothing can make that kingdom last;
24314	41	3	25	 and if a family splits into parties, that family cannot continue.
24315	41	3	26	 So if Satan has risen in arms and has made war upon himself, stand he cannot, but meets his end.
24316	41	3	27	 Nay, no one can go into a strong man's house and carry off his property, unless he first binds the strong man, and then he will plunder his house.
24317	41	3	28	  In solemn truth I tell you that all their sins may be pardoned to the sons of men, and all their blasphemies, however they may have blasphemed;
24318	41	3	29	 but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit, he remains  for ever unabsolved: he is guilty of  a sin  of the Ages."
24319	41	3	30	 This was because they said, "He is possessed by a foul spirit."
24320	41	3	31	  By this time His mother and His brothers arrive, and standing  outside they send a message to Him to call Him.
24321	41	3	32	 Now a crowd was  sitting round Him; so they tell Him, "Your mother and your brothers and sisters are outside, inquiring for you."
24322	41	3	33	 "Who are my mother and my brothers?" He replied.
24323	41	3	34	 And, fixing His eyes on the people who were sitting round Him in a circle, He said,
24324	41	3	35	 "Here are my mother and my brothers. For wherever there is one who has been obedient to God, there is my brother--my sister--and my mother."
24325	41	4	1	  Once more He began to teach by the side of the Lake, and a vast multitude of people came together to listen to Him. He therefore went  on board the boat and sat there, a little way from the land; and all the people were on the shore close to the water.
24326	41	4	2	 Then He proceeded to teach them many lessons in figurative language; and in His teaching He said,
24327	41	4	3	 "Listen: the sower  goes out to sow.
24328	41	4	4	 As he sows, some of the seed falls by the way-side, and the birds come and peck it up.
24329	41	4	5	 Some falls on the rocky ground where it finds but little earth, and it shoots up quickly because it has no depth of soil;
24330	41	4	6	 but when the sun is risen, it is scorched, and through having no root it withers away.
24331	41	4	7	 Some, again, falls among the thorns; and the thorns spring up and stifle it, so that it yields no crop.
24332	41	4	8	 But some of the seed falls into good ground, and gives a return: it comes up and increases, and yields thirty, sixty, or a hundred-fold."
24333	41	4	9	 "Listen," He added, "every one who has ears to listen with!"
24334	41	4	10	 When He was alone, the Twelve and the others who were about Him requested Him to explain His figurative language.
24335	41	4	11	 "To you," He replied, "has been entrusted  the secret truth concerning the Kingdom of God; but to those others outside your number all this is spoken in figurative language;
24336	41	4	12	 that <"`They may look and look but not see, and listen and listen but not understand, lest perchance they should return and be pardoned.'">
24337	41	4	13	 "Do you all miss the meaning of this parable?" He added; "how then will you understand the rest of my parables?"
