24929	42	1	35	 The angel answered, "The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; and for this reason your holy  offspring will be called `the Son of God.'
24930	42	1	36	 And see, your relative Elizabeth--she also has conceived a son in her old age; and this is the sixth month with her who was called barren.
24931	42	1	37	 For no promise from God will be  impossible of fulfilment."
24932	42	1	38	 "I am the Lord's  maidservant," Mary replied; "may it be with me in accordance with your words!" And then the angel left her.
24933	42	1	39	  Not long after this, Mary rose up and went  in haste into the hill country to a town in Judah.
24934	42	1	40	 Here she came to the house of Zechariah and greeted Elizabeth;
24935	42	1	41	 and as soon as Elizabeth heard Mary's greeting, the babe leapt within her. And Elizabeth was filled with the Holy Spirit,
24936	42	1	42	 and uttered a loud  cry of joy.  "Blest among women are you," she said, "and the offspring of your body is blest!
24937	42	1	43	 But why is this honour done me, that the mother of my Lord should come to me?
24938	42	1	44	 For, the moment your greeting reached my ears, the babe within me leapt for joy.
24939	42	1	45	 And blessed is she  who has believed,  for the word spoken to her from the Lord shall be fulfilled."
24940	42	1	46	 Then Mary said: "My soul extols the Lord,
24941	42	1	47	 And my spirit  triumphs in God my  Saviour;
24942	42	1	48	 Because He has not turned from His maidservant in her lowly position; For from this time forward all generations will account me happy,
24943	42	1	49	 Because the mighty One has done great things for me--Holy is His name!--
24944	42	1	50	 And His compassion is, generation after generation, Upon those who fear Him.
24945	42	1	51	 He  has manifested His supreme strength. He has scattered those who were haughty in the thoughts of their hearts.
24946	42	1	52	 He has cast monarchs down from their thrones, And exalted men of low estate.
24947	42	1	53	 The hungry He has satisfied with choice gifts, But the rich He has sent empty-handed away.
24948	42	1	54	 His servant Israel He has helped,  Remembering His compassion--
24949	42	1	55	 In fulfillment of His promises to our forefathers--For Abraham and his posterity for ever."
24950	42	1	56	 So Mary stayed with Elizabeth about three months, and then returned home.
24951	42	1	57	 Now when Elizabeth's full time was come, she gave birth to a son;
24952	42	1	58	 and her neighbours and relatives heard how the Lord  had had great compassion on her; and they rejoiced with her.
24953	42	1	59	 And on the eighth day they came to circumcise the child, and were going to call him Zechariah, after his father.
24954	42	1	60	 His mother, however, said, "No, he is to be called John."
24955	42	1	61	 "There is not one of your family," they said, "who has that name."
24956	42	1	62	 They asked his father by signs what he wished him to be called.
24957	42	1	63	 So he asked for a writing-tablet, and wrote, "His name is John." And they all wondered.
24958	42	1	64	 Instantly his mouth and his tongue were set free, and he began to speak and bless God.
24959	42	1	65	 And all who lived round about them were filled with awe, and throughout the hill country of Judaea reports of all these things were spread abroad.
24960	42	1	66	 All who heard the story treasured it in their memories. "What then will this child be?" they said. For the lord's hand was indeed with him.
24961	42	1	67	 And Zechariah his father was filled with the Holy Spirit, and spoke in a rapture of praise.
24962	42	1	68	 "Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel," he said, "Because He  has not forgotten His people but has effected redemption for them,
24963	42	1	69	 And has raised up  a mighty Deliverer for us In the house of David His servant--
24964	42	1	70	 As He has spoken  from all time by the lips of His holy Prophets--
24965	42	1	71	  To deliver us from our foes and from the power of all who hate us.
24966	42	1	72	 He dealt pitifully with our forefathers, And remembered His holy covenant,
24967	42	1	73	 The oath which He swore to Abraham our forefather,
24968	42	1	74	 To grant us to be rescued from the power of our foes And so render worship to Him free from fear,
24969	42	1	75	 In  piety and uprightness before Him all our days.
24970	42	1	76	 And you moreover, O child, shall be called Prophet of the Most High; For you shall go on in front before the Lord to prepare the way for Him,
24971	42	1	77	 To give to His People a knowledge of  salvation In the forgiveness of their sins,
24972	42	1	78	 Through the tender compassion of our God, Through which the daybreak from on high  will come to us,
24973	42	1	79	  Dawning on those who now  dwell in the darkness and shadow of death--To direct our feet into the path of peace."
24974	42	1	80	 And the child grew and became strong in character, and lived in the  Desert till the time came for him to appear publicly to Israel.
24975	42	2	1	 Just at this time an edict was issued by Caesar Augustus for the  registration of  the whole Empire.
24976	42	2	2	 It was the first registration made during the governorship of Quirinius in Syria;
24977	42	2	3	 and all went to be registered--every one to the town to which he belonged.
24978	42	2	4	 So Joseph went up from Galilee, from the town of Nazareth, to Judaea, to David's town of Bethlehem, because he was of the house and lineage of David,
24979	42	2	5	 to have himself registered together with Mary, who was betrothed to him and was with child.
24980	42	2	6	 But while they were there, her full time came,
24981	42	2	7	 and she gave birth to her first-born son, and wrapped Him round, and laid Him in a manger, because there was no room for them in the  inn.
24982	42	2	8	 Now there were shepherds in the same part of the country, keeping watch over their sheep by night  in the open fields,
24983	42	2	9	 when suddenly an angel of the Lord stood by them, and the glory of the Lord shone round them; and they were filled with terror.
24984	42	2	10	 But the angel said to them, "Put away all fear; for I am bringing you good news of great joy--joy for all the People.
24985	42	2	11	 For a  Saviour who is the Anointed Lord is born to you to-day, in the town of David.
24986	42	2	12	 And this is the token for you: you will find a babe wrapped in swaddling clothes and lying in a manger."
24987	42	2	13	 And immediately there was with the angel a multitude of the army of Heaven praising God and saying,
24988	42	2	14	 "Glory be to God in the highest Heavens, And on earth peace among  men who please Him!"
24989	42	2	15	 Then, as soon as the angels had left them and returned to Heaven, the shepherds said to one another, "Let us now go over as far as Bethlehem and see this that has happened, which the Lord has made known to us."
24990	42	2	16	 So they made haste and came and found Mary and Joseph, with the babe lying in the manger.
24991	42	2	17	 And when they saw the child, they told what had been said to them about Him;
24992	42	2	18	 and all who listened were astonished at what the shepherds told them.
24993	42	2	19	 But Mary treasured up all these things, often dwelling on them in her mind.
24994	42	2	20	 And the shepherds returned, glorifying and praising God for all that they had heard and seen in accordance with the announcement made to them.
24995	42	2	21	 When eight days had passed and the time for circumcising Him had come, He was called JESUS, the name given Him by the angel before His conception in the womb.
24996	42	2	22	 And when the days for their purification appointed by the Law of Moses had passed, they took Him up to Jerusalem to present Him to the Lord--
24997	42	2	23	 as it is written in the Law of the Lord: <"Every first-born male shall be called holy to the Lord.">
24998	42	2	23	 During the passage He fell asleep, and there came down a squall of wind on the Lake, so that  the boat began to fill and they were in deadly peril.
24999	42	2	24	 And they also offered a sacrifice as commanded in the Law of the Lord, <"a pair of  turtle doves or two young pigeons.">
25000	42	2	25	 Now there was a man in Jerusalem of the name of Symeon, an upright and God-fearing man, who was waiting for the consolation of Israel, and the Holy Spirit was upon him.
25001	42	2	26	 To him it had been revealed by the Holy Spirit that he should  not see death until he had seen the Lord's Anointed One.
25002	42	2	27	  Led by the Spirit he came to the Temple; and when the parents brought in the child Jesus to do with regard to Him according to the custom of the Law,
25003	42	2	28	 he took Him up in his arms and blessed God and said,
25004	42	2	29	 "Now, O Sovereign Lord, Thou dost send Thy servant away in peace, in fulfilment of Thy word,
25005	42	2	30	 Because mine eyes have seen Thy salvation,
25006	42	2	31	 Which Thou hast made ready in the sight of all nations--
25007	42	2	32	 A light  to shine upon the Gentiles, And the glory of Thy people Israel."
25008	42	2	33	 And while the child's father and mother were wondering at the words of Symeon concerning Him,
25009	42	2	34	 Symeon blessed them and said to Mary the mother, "This child  is appointed for the falling and the  uprising of many in Israel and for a token to be spoken against;
25010	42	2	35	 and a sword will pierce through your own soul also; that the reasonings  in many hearts may be  revealed."
25011	42	2	36	 There was also  Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanuel, belonging to the tribe of Asher. She was of a very great age, having had after her maidenhood seven years of married life,
25012	42	2	37	 and then being a widow  of eighty-four years. She was never absent from the Temple, but worshipped, by day and by night, with fasting and prayer.
25013	42	2	38	 And coming up just at that moment, she gave thanks to God, and spoke about the child to all who were expecting the  deliverance of Jerusalem.
25014	42	2	39	 Then, as soon as they had accomplished all that the Law required, they returned to Galilee to their own town of Nazareth.
25015	42	2	40	 And the child grew and became strong and full of wisdom, and the favour of God rested upon Him.
25016	42	2	41	 Now His parents used to go up year by year to Jerusalem at the Feast of the Passover.
25017	42	2	42	 And when He was twelve years old they went up as was customary at the time of the Feast, and,
25018	42	2	43	 after staying the full number of days, when they started back home the boy Jesus remained behind in Jerusalem. His parents did not discover this,
25019	42	2	44	 but supposing Him to be in the travelling company, they proceeded a day's journey. Then they searched up and down for Him among their relatives and acquaintances;
25020	42	2	45	 but being unable to find Him they returned to Jerusalem, making anxious inquiry for Him.
25021	42	2	46	  On the third day they found Him in  the Temple sitting among the  Rabbis, both listening to them and asking them  questions,
25022	42	2	47	 while all who heard Him were astonished at His intelligence and at  the answers He gave.
25023	42	2	48	 When they saw Him, they were smitten with amazement, and His mother said to Him, "My child, why have you behaved thus to us? Your father and I have been searching for you in anguish."
25024	42	2	49	 "Why is it that you have been searching for me?" He replied; "did you not know that it is my duty  to be engaged upon my Father's business?"
25025	42	2	50	 But they did not understand the significance of these words.
25026	42	2	51	 Then He went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was always obedient to them; but His mother carefully treasured up all these  incidents in her memory.
25027	42	2	52	 And as Jesus grew older He gained in both wisdom and stature, and in favour with God and man.
25028	42	3	1	  Now in the fifteenth year of the  reign of Tiberius Caesar, Pontius Pilate being Governor of Judaea, Herod Tetrarch of Galilee, his brother Philip Tetrarch of Ituraea and Trachonitis, and Lysanias Tetrarch of Abilene,
25029	42	3	2	 during the High-priesthood of  Annas and Caiaphas, a message from God came  to John, the son of Zechariah, in the Desert.
25030	42	3	3	 John went into all the district about the Jordan proclaiming a baptism  of the penitent for the forgiveness of sins;
25031	42	3	4	 as it is written in the book of the prophet Isaiah, <"The voice of one crying aloud! `In the Desert prepare ye a road for the Lord: make His highway straight.
25032	42	3	5	 Every ravine shall be filled up, and every mountain and hill levelled down, the crooked places shall be turned into straight roads, and the rugged ways into smooth;
25033	42	3	6	 and then shall all mankind see God's salvation.'">
25034	42	3	7	 Accordingly John used to say to the crowds who came out to be baptized by him, "O vipers'  brood, who has  warned you to flee from the coming wrath?
25035	42	3	8	 Live lives which shall prove your change of heart; and do not begin to say to yourselves, `We have Abraham as our forefather,' for I tell you that God can  raise up descendants for Abraham from these stones.
25036	42	3	9	 And even now the axe is lying at the root of the trees, so that every tree  which fails to yield good fruit will quickly be hewn down and thrown into the fire."
25037	42	3	10	 The crowds repeatedly asked him, "What then are we to do?"
25038	42	3	11	 "Let the man who has two  coats," he answered, "give one to the man who has none; and let the man who has food share it with others."
25039	42	3	12	 There came also a party of tax-gatherers to be baptized, and they asked him,  "Rabbi, what are we to do?"
25040	42	3	13	 "Do not exact more than the legal amount," he replied.
25041	42	3	14	 The soldiers also once and again inquired of him, "And we, what are we to do?" His answer was, "Neither intimidate any one nor lay false charges; and be content with your pay."
25042	42	3	15	  And while the people were in suspense and all were debating in their minds whether John might possibly be the Anointed One,
25043	42	3	16	 he answered the question by saying to them all, "As for me, I am baptizing you with water, but One mightier than I is coming, whose very sandal-strap I am not worthy to unfasten: He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and with fire.
25044	42	3	17	 His winnowing-shovel is in His hand to clear out His threshing-floor, and to gather the wheat into His storehouse; but the chaff He will burn up in fire unquenchable."
25045	42	3	18	 With many exhortations besides these he declared the Good News to the people.
25046	42	3	19	  But Herod the Tetrarch, being repeatedly rebuked by him about Herodias his brother's wife, and about all the wicked deeds that he had done,
25047	42	3	20	 now added this to crown all the rest, that he threw John into prison.
25048	42	3	21	  Now when  all the people  had been baptized, and Jesus also had been baptized and was praying, the sky opened,
25049	42	3	22	 and the Holy Spirit came down in bodily shape, like a dove, upon Him, and a voice came from Heaven, which said, "Thou art My Son, dearly loved: in Thee  is My delight."
25050	42	3	23	 And  He--Jesus--when He began His ministry, was about thirty years old. He was  the son (it was supposed) of Joseph, son of Heli,
25051	42	3	24	 son of Matthat, son of Levi, son of Melchi, son of Jannai, son of Joseph,
25052	42	3	25	 son of Mattathias, son of Amos, son of Nahum, son of Esli, son of Naggai,
25053	42	3	26	 son of Mahath, son of Mattathias, son of Semein, son of Josech, son of Joda,
25054	42	3	27	 son of Johanan, son of Resa, son of Zerubbabel, son of Shealtiel, son of Neri,
25055	42	3	28	 son of Melchi, son of Addi, son of Cosam, son of Elmadam, son of Er,
25056	42	3	29	 son of Joshua, son of Eliezar, son of Jorim, son of Maththat, son of Levi,
25057	42	3	30	 son of Symeon, son of Judah, son of Joseph, son of Jonam, son of Eliakim, son of
25058	42	3	31	 Melea, son of Menna, son of Mattatha, son of Nathan, son of David,
25059	42	3	32	 son of Jesse, son of Obed, son of Boaz, son of Salmon, son of Nahshon,
25060	42	3	33	 son of Amminadab,  son of Admin, son of Arni, son of Hezron, son of Perez, son of Judah,
25061	42	3	34	 son of Jacob, son of Isaac, son of Abraham, son of Terah, son of Nahor,
25062	42	3	35	 son of Serug, son of Reu, son of Peleg, son of Eber, son of Shelah,
25063	42	3	36	 son of Cainan, son of Arpachshad, son of Shem, son of Noah, son of Lamech,
25064	42	3	37	 son of Methuselah, son of Enoch, son of Jared, son of Mahalalel, son of Kenan,
25065	42	3	38	 son of Enosh, son of Seth, son of Adam, son of God.
25066	42	4	1	  Then Jesus, full of the Holy Spirit, returned from the Jordan, and was led about  by the Spirit in the Desert for forty days,
25067	42	4	2	 tempted all the while by the Devil. During those days He ate nothing, and at the close of them He suffered from hunger.
25068	42	4	3	 Then the Devil said to Him,  "If you are God's Son, tell this stone to become bread."
25069	42	4	4	 "It is written," replied Jesus, <"`It is not on bread alone that a man shall live.'">
25070	42	4	5	 The Devil next led Him up and caused Him to see  at a glance all the kingdoms of the world.
25071	42	4	6	 And the Devil said to Him, "To you will I give all this authority and  this splendour; for it has been handed over to me, and on whomsoever I will I bestow it.
25072	42	4	7	 If therefore you do homage to me, it shall all be yours.'
25073	42	4	8	 Jesus answered him, "It is written, <`To the Lord thy God thou shalt do homage, and to Him alone shalt thou render worship.'">
25074	42	4	9	 Then he brought Him to Jerusalem and caused Him to stand on the roof of the Temple, and said to Him, "If you are God's Son, throw yourself down from here; for it is written,
25075	42	4	10	 <`He will give orders to His angels concerning thee, to guard thee safely;'>
25076	42	4	11	 and <`On their hands they shall bear thee up, Lest at any moment thou shouldst strike thy foot against a stone.'">
25077	42	4	12	 The reply of Jesus was, "It is said, <`Thou shalt not put the Lord they God to the proof.'">
25078	42	4	13	 So the Devil, having  fully tried  every kind of temptation on Him, left Him  for a time.
25079	42	4	14	  Then Jesus returned in the Spirit's power to Galilee; and His fame spread through all the adjacent districts.
25080	42	4	15	 And  He proceeded to teach in their synagogues, winning praise from all.
25081	42	4	16	 He came to Nazareth also, where He had been brought up; and, as was His custom, He went to the synagogue on the Sabbath, and stood up to read.
25082	42	4	17	 And there was handed to Him the  book of the Prophet Isaiah, and, opening the book, He found the place where it was written,
25083	42	4	18	 <"The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because He has anointed me to proclaim Good News to the poor; He has sent me to announce release to the prisoners of war and recovery of sight to the blind: to send away free those whom tyranny has crushed,
25084	42	4	19	 to proclaim the year of acceptance with the Lord.">
25085	42	4	20	 And rolling up the book, He returned it to the attendant, and  sat down--to speak. And the eyes of all in the synagogue were fixed on Him.
25086	42	4	21	 Then He proceeded to say to them, "To-day is this Scripture fulfilled in your hearing."
25087	42	4	22	 And they all  spoke well of Him, wondering at the  sweet words of kindness which fell from His lips, while they asked one another, "Is not this Joseph's son?"
25088	42	4	23	 "Doubtless," said He, "you will quote to me the proverb, `Physician, cure yourself: all that we hear that you have done  at Capernaum, do here also in your native place.'"
25089	42	4	24	 "I tell you  in solemn truth," He added, "that no Prophet is welcomed among his own people.
25090	42	4	25	 But I tell you in truth that there was many a widow in Israel in the time of Elijah, when  there was no rain for three years and six months and there came a severe famine over all the land;
25091	42	4	26	 and yet to not one of them was Elijah sent:  he was only sent to a widow at Zarephath in the Sidonian country.
25092	42	4	27	 And there was also many a leper in Israel in the time of the Prophet Elisha, and yet not one of them was cleansed, but Naaman the Syrian was."
25093	42	4	28	 Then all in the synagogue, while listening to these words, were filled with fury.
25094	42	4	29	 They rose, hurried Him outside the town, and brought Him to the brow of the hill on which their town was built, to throw Him down the cliff;
25095	42	4	30	 but He passed through the midst of them and went His way.
25096	42	4	31	  So He came down to Capernaum, a town in Galilee, where He frequently taught the people on the Sabbath days.
25097	42	4	32	 And they were greatly impressed by His teaching, because He spoke with the language of authority.
25098	42	4	33	 But in the synagogue there was a man  possessed by the spirit of a foul demon. In a loud voice he cried out,
25099	42	4	34	 "Ha! Jesus the Nazarene, what have you to do with us? I know who you are--God's Holy One!"
25100	42	4	35	 But Jesus rebuked the demon. "Silence!" He exclaimed; "come out of him." Upon this, the demon hurled the man into the midst of them, and came out of him without doing him any harm.
25101	42	4	36	 All were astonished and awe-struck; and they asked one another, "What sort of language is this? For with authority and real power He gives orders to the foul spirits and they come out."
25102	42	4	37	 And the talk about Him spread into every part of the neighbouring country.
25103	42	4	38	  Now when He rose and left the synagogue He went to Simon's house. Simon's mother-in-law was  suffering from an acute attack of fever; and they consulted Him about her.
25104	42	4	39	 Then standing over her He  rebuked the fever, and it left her; and she at once rose and waited on them.
25105	42	4	40	 At sunset all who had friends suffering from any illness brought them to Him, and He laid His hands on them all, one by one, and cured them.
25106	42	4	41	 Demons also came out of many, loudly calling out, "You are the Son of God." But He rebuked them and forbad them to speak, because they knew Him to be  the Christ.
25107	42	4	42	  Next morning, at daybreak, He left the town and went away to a solitary place; but the people flocked out to find Him, and, coming to the place where He was, they endeavoured to detain Him that He might not leave them.
25108	42	4	43	 But He said to them, "I have to tell the Good News of the Kingdom of God to the other towns also, because for this purpose I was sent."
25109	42	4	44	 And  for some time He preached in the synagogues in  Galilee.
25110	42	5	1	 On one occasion the crowd was pressing on Him and listening to God's Message, while He was standing by the Lake of Gennesaret.
25111	42	5	2	 He, however, saw two fishing-boats drawn up on the beach (for the men had gone away from them and were washing the nets),
25112	42	5	3	 and going on board one of them, which was Simon's He asked him to push out a little from land. Then He sat down and taught the crowd of people from the boat.
25113	42	5	4	 When He had finished speaking, He said to Simon,  "Push out into deep water, and  let down your nets for a haul."
25114	42	5	5	  "Rabbi," replied Peter, "all night long we have worked hard and caught nothing; but at your command I will let down the nets."
25115	42	5	6	 This they did, and enclosed a vast number of fish; and their nets began to break.
25116	42	5	7	 So they signalled to their partners in the other boat to come and help them; they came, and they filled both the boats so that they almost sank.
25117	42	5	8	 When Simon Peter saw this, he fell down at the knees of Jesus, and exclaimed, "Master,  leave my boat, for I am a sinful man."
25118	42	5	9	 (For he was  astonished and terrified--he and all his companions--at the haul of fish which they had taken;
25119	42	5	10	 and so were Simon's partners James and John, the sons of Zabdi.) But Jesus replied to Simon, "Fear not: from this time you shall be a catcher of men."
25120	42	5	11	 Then, after bringing their boats to land, they left everything and followed Him.
25121	42	5	12	  On another occasion, when He was in one of the towns, there was a man there covered with leprosy, who, seeing Jesus, threw himself at His feet and implored Him, saying, "Sir, if only you are willing, you are able to make me clean."
25122	42	5	13	 Reaching out His hand and touching him, Jesus said, "I am willing; be cleansed!" And instantly the leprosy left him.
25123	42	5	14	 He ordered him to tell no one. "But go," He said, "show yourself to the Priest, and make the offering for your purification which Moses appointed, as evidence for them."
25124	42	5	15	 But all the more the report about Him spread abroad, and great multitudes crowded to hear Him and to be cured of their diseases;
25125	42	5	16	 but Jesus Himself constantly withdrew into the Desert and there prayed.
25126	42	5	17	  One day He was teaching, and there were Pharisees and teachers of the Law  sitting there who had come from every village in Galilee and Judaea and from Jerusalem. And the power of the Lord was present  for Him to cure people.
25127	42	5	18	 And a party of men came carrying a palsied man on a bed, and they endeavoured to bring him in and lay him before Jesus.
25128	42	5	19	 But when they could find no way of doing so because of the crowd, they went up on the roof and let him down through the tiling--bed and all--into the midst, in front of Jesus.
25129	42	5	20	 He saw their faith and said to him,  "Friend, your sins are  forgiven."
25130	42	5	21	 Then the Scribes and Pharisees began to cavil, asking, "Who is  this, uttering blasphemies? Who but God alone can forgive sins?"
25131	42	5	22	 Well aware of their reasonings, Jesus answered their questions by asking in turn,  "What is this that you are debating in your hearts?
25132	42	5	23	 Which is easier? --to say, `Your sins are forgiven,' or to say, `Rise and walk'?
25133	42	5	24	 But to prove to you that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins" --Turning to the paralytic He said, "I bid you, Rise, take up your bed, and go home."
25134	42	5	25	 Instantly he stood up in their presence, took up the mattress on which he had been lying, and went away to his home, giving glory to God.
25135	42	5	26	  Amazement seized them all. "Glory to God!" was the abiding feeling. Yet fear flashed through their minds and they said, "We have seen strange things to-day."
25136	42	5	27	  After this He went out and noticed a tax-gatherer, Levi by name, sitting at the Toll office; and He said to him, "Follow me."
25137	42	5	28	 He rose, left everything, and followed Him.
25138	42	5	29	 Levi also gave a great entertainment at his house in honour of Jesus, and there was a large party of tax-gatherers and others at table with them.
25139	42	5	30	 This led the Pharisees and Scribes of their party to expostulate with His disciples and ask, "Why are you eating and drinking with these tax-gatherers and notorious sinners?"
25140	42	5	31	 But Jesus replied to them, "It is not men in good health who require a physician, but the sick.
25141	42	5	32	 I have not come to call the righteous to repentance, but sinners."
25142	42	5	33	  Again they said to Him, "John's disciples fast often and pray, as do also those of the pharisees; but yours eat and drink."
25143	42	5	34	 "Can you compel the bridal party to fast," replied Jesus, "so long as they have the bridegroom among them?
25144	42	5	35	 But a time for this will come, when the Bridegroom has been taken away from them: then, at that time, they will fast."
25145	42	5	36	 He also spoke in figurative language to them. "No one," He said, "tears a piece from a new garment to mend an old one. Otherwise he would not only spoil the new, but the patch from the new would not match the old.
25146	42	5	37	 Nor does any one pour new wine into old wine-skins. Otherwise the new wine would burst the skins, the wine itself would be spilt, and the skins be destroyed.
25147	42	5	38	 But new wine must be put into fresh wineskins.
25148	42	5	39	 Nor does any one after drinking old wine wish for new; for he says, `The old is  better.'"
25149	42	6	1	  Now on the  second-first Sabbath while He was passing through the wheatfields, His disciples were plucking the ears and rubbing them with their hands to eat the grain.
25150	42	6	2	 And some of the Pharisees asked, "Why are you doing what the Law forbids on the Sabbath?"
25151	42	6	3	 "Have you  never read so much as this," answered Jesus--"what David did when he and his followers were hungry;
25152	42	6	4	 how he entered the house of God and took and ate the Presented Loaves and gave some to his followers--loaves which none but the Priests are allowed to eat?"
25153	42	6	5	 "The Son of Man," He added, "is Lord of the Sabbath  also."
25154	42	6	6	  On another Sabbath He had gone to the synagogue and was teaching there; and in the congregation was a man whose right arm was withered.
25155	42	6	7	 The Scribes and the Pharisees were on the watch to see whether He would cure him on the Sabbath that they might be able to bring an accusation against Him.
25156	42	6	8	 He knew their thoughts, and said to the man with the withered arm, "Rise, and  stand there in the middle." And he rose and stood there.
25157	42	6	9	 Then Jesus said to them, "I put it to you all whether we are allowed to do good on the Sabbath, or to do evil; to save a life, or to destroy it."
25158	42	6	10	 And looking round upon them all He said to the man, "Stretch out your arm." He did so, and the arm was restored.
25159	42	6	11	 But they were filled with madness, and began to discuss with one another what they should do to Jesus.
25160	42	6	12	  About that time He went out on one occasion into the  hill country to pray; and He remained all night in  prayer to God.
25161	42	6	13	 When it was day, He called His disciples; and He selected from among them twelve, whom He also named Apostles.
25162	42	6	14	  These were Simon, to whom also He  had given the name of Peter, and Andrew his brother; James and John; Philip and Bartholomew;
25163	42	6	15	 Matthew and Thomas; James the son of Alphaeus and Simon called the Zealot;
25164	42	6	16	  James's relative Judas, and Judas Iscariot who proved to be a traitor.
25165	42	6	17	 With these He came down  till He reached a level place, where there was a great crowd of His disciples, and a multitude of people from every part of Judaea, from Jerusalem, and from the sea-side district of Tyre and Sidon, who came to hear Him and to be cured of their diseases;
25166	42	6	18	 and those who were tormented by foul spirits were cured.
25167	42	6	19	 The whole crowd were eager to touch Him, because power went forth from him and cured every one.
25168	42	6	20	  Then fixing His eyes upon His disciples, Jesus said to them, "Blessed are you poor, because the Kingdom of God is yours.
25169	42	6	21	 "Blessed are you who hunger now, because your hunger shall be satisfied. "Blessed are you who now weep aloud, because you shall laugh.
25170	42	6	22	  "Blessed are you when men shall hate you and exclude you from their society and insult you, and spurn your very names as evil things, for the Son of Man's sake.
25171	42	6	23	 "Be glad at such a time, and dance for joy; for your reward is great in Heaven; for that is just the way their forefathers behaved to the Prophets!
25172	42	6	24	 "But  alas for you rich men, because you already have your consolation!
25173	42	6	25	 "Alas for you who now have plenty to eat, because you will be hungry! "Alas for you who laugh now, because you will mourn and weep aloud!
25174	42	6	26	 "Alas for you when men shall all have spoken well of you; for that is just the way their forefathers behaved to the false Prophets!
25175	42	6	27	  "But to you who are listening to me I say, Love your enemies; seek the welfare of those who hate you;
25176	42	6	28	 bless those who curse you; pray for those who revile you.
25177	42	6	29	 To him who gives you a blow on one side of the face offer the other side also; and to him who is robbing you of your outer garment refuse not the under one also.
25178	42	6	30	 To every one who asks, give; and from him who takes away your property, do not demand it back.
25179	42	6	31	  And behave to your fellow men just as you would have them behave to you.
25180	42	6	32	  "If you love those who love you, what credit is it to you? Why, even bad men love those who love them.
25181	42	6	33	 And if you are  kind to those who are kind to you, what credit is it to you?  Even bad men act thus.
25182	42	6	34	 And if you lend to those from whom you hope to receive, what credit is it to you? Even bad men lend to their fellows so as to receive back an equal amount.
25183	42	6	35	 Nevertheless love your enemies, be beneficent; and lend without hoping for any repayment. Then your recompense shall be great, and you will be sons of the Most High; for He is kind to the ungrateful and wicked.
25184	42	6	36	 Be compassionate just as your Father is compassionate.
25185	42	6	37	  "Judge not, and you shall not be judged; condemn not, and you shall not be condemned;  pardon, and you shall be  pardoned;
25186	42	6	38	 give, and gifts shall be bestowed on you. Full measure, pressed, shaken down, and running over, shall they pour into your laps; for with the same measure that you use they shall measure to you in return."
25187	42	6	39	  He also spoke to them in figurative language. "Can a blind man lead a blind man?" He asked; "would not both fall into the ditch?
25188	42	6	40	 There is no disciple who is superior to his teacher; but every one whose instruction is complete will be like his teacher.
25189	42	6	41	 "And why look at the splinter in your brother's eye instead of giving careful attention to the beam in your own?
25190	42	6	42	 How can you say to your brother, `Brother, let me take that splinter out of your eye,' when all the while you yourself do not see the beam in your own eye? Vain pretender! take the beam out of your own eye first, and then you will see clearly to take the splinter out of your brother's eye.
25191	42	6	43	  "There is no good tree that yields unsound fruit, nor again any unsound tree that yields good fruit.
25192	42	6	44	 Every tree is known by its own fruit. It is not from thorns that men gather figs, nor from the bramble that they can get a bunch of grapes.
25193	42	6	45	 A good man from the good stored up in his heart brings out what is good; and an evil man from the evil stored up brings out what is evil; for from the overflow of his heart his mouth speaks.
25194	42	6	46	 "And why do you all call me `Master, Master' and yet not do what I tell you?
25195	42	6	47	 Every one who comes to me and listens to my words and puts them in practice, I will show you whom he is like.
25196	42	6	48	 He is like a man building a house, who  digs and goes deep, and lays the foundation on the rock; and when a flood comes, the torrent bursts upon that house, but is unable to shake it, because it is securely built.
25197	42	6	49	 But he who has heard and not practised is like a man who has built a house upon the soft soil without a foundation, against which the torrent bursts, and immediately it collapses, and terrible is the wreck and ruin of that house."
25198	42	7	1	  After He had finished teaching all these things  in the hearing of the people, He went into Capernaum.
25199	42	7	2	 Here the  servant of a certain Captain, a man dear to his master, was ill and at the point of death;
25200	42	7	3	 and the Captain, hearing about Jesus, sent to Him some of the Jewish Elders, begging Him to come and  restore his servant to health.
25201	42	7	4	 And they, when they came to Jesus, earnestly entreated Him, pleading, "He deserves to have this favour granted him,
25202	42	7	5	 for he loves our nation, and at his own expense he built our synagogue for us."
25203	42	7	6	 Then Jesus went with them. But when He was not far from the house, the Captain sent friends to Him with the message: "Sir, do not trouble to come.  I am not worthy of having you come under my roof;
25204	42	7	7	 and therefore I did not deem myself worthy to come to you. Only speak the word, and  let my  young man be cured.
25205	42	7	8	 For I too am a man obedient to authority, and have soldiers under me; and I say to one, `Go,' and he goes; to another, `Come,' and he comes; and to my slave, `Do this or that,' and he does it."
25206	42	7	9	 Jesus listened to the Captain's message and was astonished at him, and He turned and said to the crowd that followed Him, "I tell you that not even in Israel have I found faith like that."
25207	42	7	10	 And the friends who had been sent, on returning to the house, found the servant in perfect health.
25208	42	7	11	  Shortly afterwards He went to a town called Nain, attended by  His disciples and a great crowd of people.
25209	42	7	12	 And just as He reached the gate of the town, they happened to be bringing out for burial a dead man who was his mother's only son; and she was a widow; and a great number of the townspeople were with her.
25210	42	7	13	 The Lord saw her, was moved with pity for her, and said to her, "Do not weep."
25211	42	7	14	 Then He went close and touched the bier, and the bearers halted. "Young man," He said, "I command you, wake!"
25212	42	7	15	 The dead man sat up and began to speak; and He restored him to his mother.
25213	42	7	16	 All were awe-struck, and they gave glory to God--some saying, "A Prophet, a great Prophet, has  risen up among us." Others said, "God has not forgotten His People."
25214	42	7	17	 And the report of what Jesus had done spread through the whole of Judaea and in all the surrounding districts.
25215	42	7	18	  John's disciples brought him an account of all these things;
25216	42	7	19	 so John called two of his disciples and sent them to the Lord. "Are you the Coming One?" he asked, "or is there  another that we are to expect?"
25217	42	7	20	 The men came to Jesus and said, "John the Baptist has sent us to you with this question: `Are you the Coming One, or is there another that we are to expect?'"
25218	42	7	21	  He immediately cured many of diseases, severe pain, and evil spirits, and to many who were blind He gave the gift of sight.
25219	42	7	22	 Then He answered the messengers, "Go and report to John what you have seen and heard. Blind men  receive sight, the lame walk, lepers are purified, deaf persons hear, the dead are  raised to life, the poor have the Good News proclaimed to them.
25220	42	7	23	 And blessed is every one who does not stumble and fall because of my claims."
25221	42	7	24	  When John's messengers were gone, He proceeded to say to the multitude concerning John, "What did you go out into the Desert to gaze at? A reed waving in the wind?
25222	42	7	25	 But what did you go out to see? A man wearing luxurious clothes? People who are gorgeously dressed and live in luxury are found in palaces.
25223	42	7	26	 But what did you go out to see? A Prophet? Aye, I tell you, and far more than a Prophet.
25224	42	7	27	 John is the man about whom it is written, <`See, I am sending My messenger before thy face, and he shall make ready thy way before thee.'>
25225	42	7	28	 "I tell you that among all of women born there is not one greater than John. Yet one who is of lower rank in the Kingdom of God is greater than he.
25226	42	7	29	 And all the people, including the tax-gatherers, when they listened to him upheld the righteousness of God, by being baptized with John's baptism.
25227	42	7	30	 But the Pharisees and expounders of the Law have frustrated  God's purpose as to their own lives, by refusing to be  baptized.
25228	42	7	31	 "To what then shall I compare the men of the present generation, and what do they resemble?
25229	42	7	32	 They are like children sitting in the public square and calling out to one another, `We have played the flute to you, and you have not danced: we have sung dirges, and you have not shown sorrow.'
25230	42	7	33	 For John the Baptist has come eating no bread and drinking no wine, and you say, `He has a demon!'
25231	42	7	34	 The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, `Look, there is a man who is overfond of eating and drinking--he is a friend of tax-gatherers and notorious sinners!'
25232	42	7	35	 But wisdom  is justified by all  who are truly wise."
25233	42	7	36	  Now one of the Pharisees  repeatedly invited Him to a meal at his house; so He entered the house and reclined at the table.
25234	42	7	37	 And there was a woman in the town who was a notorious sinner. Having learnt that Jesus  was at table in the Pharisee's house she brought a flask of perfume,
25235	42	7	38	 and, standing  behind close to His feet, weeping, began to wet His feet with her tears; and with her hair she wiped the tears away again, while she lovingly kissed His feet and poured the perfume over them.
25236	42	7	39	 Noticing this, the Pharisee, His host, said to himself,  "This man, if he were really a Prophet, would know who and what sort of person this woman is who is touching him--and would know that she is an immoral woman."
25237	42	7	40	 In answer to  his thoughts Jesus said to him, "Simon, I have a word to say to you."  "Rabbi, say on," he replied.
25238	42	7	41	 "There were once two men in debt to one money-lender," said Jesus; "one owed him five hundred shillings and the other fifty.
25239	42	7	42	 But neither of them could pay anything; so he freely forgave them both. Tell me, then, which of them will love him most?"
25240	42	7	43	 "I suppose," replied Simon, "the one to whom he forgave most." "You have judged rightly," Jesus rejoined.
25241	42	7	44	 Then turning towards the woman He said to Simon, "Do you see this woman? I came into your house: you gave me no water for my feet; but she has made my feet wet with her tears, and then wiped the tears away with her hair.
25242	42	7	45	 No kiss did you give me; but she from the moment I came in has not left off tenderly kissing my feet.
25243	42	7	46	 No oil did you pour even on my head; but she has poured perfume upon my feet.
25244	42	7	47	 This is the reason why I tell you that her sins, her many sins,  are forgiven--because she has loved much; but he who is forgiven little, loves little."
25245	42	7	48	 And He said to her, "Your sins  are forgiven."
25246	42	7	49	 Then the other guests began to say to themselves, "Who can this man be who even forgives sins?"
25247	42	7	50	 But He said to the woman, "Your faith has  cured you:  go, and be at peace."
25248	42	8	1	 Shortly after this He visited town after town, and village after village, proclaiming His Message and telling  the Good News of the Kingdom of God. The Twelve were with Him,
25249	42	8	2	 and certain women whom He had  delivered from evil spirits and various diseases--Mary of Magdala, out of whom seven demons had come,
25250	42	8	3	 and  Joanna the wife of Chuza, Herod's steward, and Susanna, and many other women, all of whom contributed to  the support of Jesus and His Apostles.
25251	42	8	4	  And when a great crowd was assembling, and was receiving additions from one town after another, He spoke a parable to them.
25252	42	8	5	 "The sower," He said,  "goes out to sow his seed; and as he sows, some of the seed falls by the way-side, and is trodden upon, or the birds of the air come and peck it up.
25253	42	8	6	 Another part drops upon the rock, and after growing up it withers away for want of moisture.
25254	42	8	7	 Another part falls among the thorns, and the thorns grow up with it and stifle it.
25255	42	8	8	 But some of the seed falls into good ground, and grows up and yields a return of a hundred for one." While thus speaking, He cried aloud and said, "Listen, every one who has ears to listen with!"
25256	42	8	9	 The disciples  proceeded to ask Him what this parable meant.
25257	42	8	10	 "To you," He replied, "it is granted to know the secrets of the Kingdom of God; but all others are taught by parables, in order that they may see and yet not see, and may hear and yet not understand.
25258	42	8	11	 The meaning of the parable is as follows. The seed is God's Message.
25259	42	8	12	 Those by the way-side are those who have heard, and then the Devil comes and carries away the Message from their hearts, lest they should believe and be saved.
25260	42	8	13	 Those on the rock are the people who on hearing the Message receive it joyfully; but they have no root: for a time they believe, but when trial comes they fall away.
25261	42	8	14	 That which fell among the thorns means those who have heard, but as they go on their way, the Message is stifled by the anxieties, wealth and gaieties of time, and they yield nothing in perfection.
25262	42	8	15	 But as for that in the good ground, it means those who, having listened to the Message with open  minds and in a right spirit, hold it fast, and patiently yield a return.
25263	42	8	16	 "When any one lights a lamp, he does not cover it with a vessel or hide it under  a couch; he puts it on  a lampstand, that people who enter the room may see the light.
25264	42	8	17	 There is nothing hidden, which shall not be openly seen; nor anything secret, which shall not be known and come into the light of day.
25265	42	8	18	 Be careful, therefore, how you hear; for whoever has anything, to him more shall be given, and whoever has nothing, even that which he thinks he has shall be taken away from him."
25266	42	8	19	  Then came to Him His mother and His brothers, but could not get near Him for the crowd.
25267	42	8	20	 But He was told, "Your mother and brothers are standing on the edge of the crowd, and want to see you."
25268	42	8	21	 "My mother and my brothers," He replied, "are  these who hear God's Message and obey it."
25269	42	8	22	  One day He went on board a boat--both He and his disciples; and He said to them, "Let us cross over to the other side of the Lake." So they set sail.
25270	42	8	24	 So they came and woke Him, crying,  "Rabbi, Rabbi, we are drowning." Then He roused Himself and rebuked the wind and the surging of the water, and they ceased and there was a calm.
25271	42	8	25	 "Where is your faith?" He asked them. But they were filled with terror and amazement, and said to one another, "Who then is this? for He gives orders both to wind and waves, and they obey Him."
25272	42	8	26	  Then they put in to shore in the country of the  Gerasenes, which lies opposite to Galilee.
25273	42	8	27	 Here, on landing, He was met by one of the townsmen who was possessed by demons--for a long time he had not put on any garment, nor did he live in a house, but in the tombs.
25274	42	8	28	 When he saw Jesus, he cried out and fell down before Him, and said in a loud voice, "What have you to do with me, Jesus, Son of God Most High? Do not torture me, I beseech you."
25275	42	8	29	 For already He  had been commanding the foul spirit to come out of the man. For  many a time it had seized and held him, and they had repeatedly put him in chains and fetters and kept guard over him, but he used to break the chains to pieces, and, impelled by the demon, to escape into the Desert.
25276	42	8	30	 "What is your name?" Jesus asked him. "Legion," he replied--because a great number of demons had entered into him;
25277	42	8	31	 and they besought Him not to command them to be gone into the  Bottomless Pit.
25278	42	8	32	 Now there was  a great herd of swine there feeding on the hill-side; and the demons begged Him to give them leave to go into them, and He gave them leave.
25279	42	8	33	 The demons  came out of the man and left him, and entered into the swine; and the herd rushed violently over the cliff into the Lake and were drowned.
25280	42	8	34	 The swineherds, seeing what had happened, fled and reported it both in town and country;
25281	42	8	35	 whereupon the people came out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and they found the man from whom the demons had gone out sitting at the feet of Jesus, clothed and in his right mind; and they were terrified.
25282	42	8	36	  And those who had seen it told them how the demoniac was cured.
25283	42	8	37	 Then the whole population of the Gerasenes and of the adjacent districts begged Him to depart from them; for  their terror was great. So He went on board and returned.
25284	42	8	38	 But the man from whom the demons had gone out earnestly asked permission to go with Him; but He sent him away.
25285	42	8	39	 "Return home," He said, "and tell there all that God has done for you." So he went and published through the whole town all that Jesus had done for him.
25286	42	8	40	  Now when Jesus  was returning, the people gave Him a warm welcome; for they had all been looking out for Him.
25287	42	8	41	 Just then there came a man named Jair, a Warden of the Synagogue, who threw himself at the feet of Jesus, and entreated Him to come to his house;
25288	42	8	42	 for he had an only daughter, about twelve years old, and she was dying. And as He went, the dense throng crowded on Him.
25289	42	8	43	 And a woman who for twelve years had been afflicted with haemorrhage--and had spent on doctors all she had, but  none of them had been able to cure her--
25290	42	8	44	 came close behind Him and touched the tassel of His robe; and instantly her flow of blood stopped.
25291	42	8	45	 "Who is it touched me?" Jesus asked. And when all denied having done so, Peter and the rest said, "Rabbi, the crowds are hemming you in and pressing on you."
25292	42	8	46	 "Some one has touched me," Jesus replied, "for  I feel that power has gone out from me."
25293	42	8	47	 Then the woman, perceiving that she had not escaped notice, came trembling, and throwing herself down at His feet she stated before all the people the reason why she had touched Him and how she was instantly cured.
25294	42	8	48	 "Daughter," said He, "your faith has cured you; go, and be at peace."
25295	42	8	49	 While He was still speaking, some one came to the Warden of the Synagogue from his house and said, "Your daughter is dead; trouble the  Rabbi no further."
25296	42	8	50	 Jesus heard the words and said to him, "Have no fear. Only believe, and she shall be restored to life."
25297	42	8	51	 So He came to the house, but allowed no one to go in with Him but Peter and John and James and the girl's father and mother.
25298	42	8	52	 The people were all weeping aloud and beating their breasts for her; but He said, "Leave off wailing; for she is not dead, but asleep."
25299	42	8	53	 And they jeered at Him, knowing that she was dead.
25300	42	8	54	 He, however, took her by the hand and called aloud, "Child, awake!"
25301	42	8	55	 And her spirit returned, and instantly she stood up; and He directed them to give her some food.
25302	42	8	56	 Her parents were  astounded; but He forbad them to mention the matter to any one.
25303	42	9	1	  Then calling the Twelve together He conferred on them power and authority over all the demons and to cure diseases;
25304	42	9	2	 and sent them out to proclaim the Kingdom of God and to cure  the sick.
25305	42	9	3	 And He commanded them, "Take nothing for your journey; neither stick nor bag nor bread nor money; and do not have an extra under garment.
25306	42	9	4	 Whatever house you enter, make that your home, and from it start afresh.
25307	42	9	5	 Wherever they refuse to receive you, as you leave that town shake off the very dust from your feet as a protest against them."
25308	42	9	6	 So they departed and visited village after village, spreading the Good News and performing cures everywhere.
25309	42	9	7	  Now Herod the Tetrarch heard of all that was going on; and he was bewildered because of its being said by some that John had come back to life,
25310	42	9	8	 by others that Elijah had appeared, and by others that some one of the ancient Prophets had come back to life.
25311	42	9	9	 And Herod said, "John I have beheaded; but who is this, of whom I hear such reports?" And he sought for an opportunity of seeing Jesus.
25312	42	9	10	  The Apostles, on their return, related to Jesus all they had done. Then He took them and withdrew to a quiet retreat,  to a town called Bethsaida.
25313	42	9	11	 But the immense crowd, aware of this, followed Him; and receiving them kindly He proceeded to speak to them of the Kingdom of God, and those who needed to be restored to health, He cured.
25314	42	9	12	 Now when the day began to decline, the Twelve came to Him and said, "Send the people away, that they may go to the villages and farms round about and find lodging and a supply of food; because here we are in an uninhabited district."
25315	42	9	13	 "You yourselves," He said, "must give them food." "We have nothing," they replied, "but five loaves and a couple of fish, unless indeed we were to go and buy provisions for all this host of people."
25316	42	9	14	 (For there were about 5,000 adult men.) But He said to His disciples, "Make them sit down in parties of about fifty each."
25317	42	9	15	 They did so, making them all, without exception, sit down.
25318	42	9	16	 Then He took the five loaves and the two fish, and looking up to Heaven He blessed them and broke them into portions which He gave to the disciples  to distribute to the people.
25319	42	9	17	 So they ate and were fully satisfied, all of them; and what they had remaining over was gathered up, twelve baskets of fragments.
25320	42	9	18	  One day when He was praying by Himself the disciples were present; and He asked them, "Who do the people say that I am?"
25321	42	9	19	 "John the Baptist," they replied; "but others say Elijah; and others that some one of the ancient Prophets has come back to life."
25322	42	9	20	 "But you," He asked, "who do you say that I am?" "God's  Anointed One," replied Peter.
25323	42	9	21	 And Jesus strictly forbad them to tell this to any one;
25324	42	9	22	 and He said, "The Son of Man must suffer much cruelty, be rejected by the Elders and High Priests and Scribes, and be put to death, and on the third day  be raised to life again."
25325	42	9	23	 And He said to all, "If any one is desirous of following me, let him  ignore self and take up his cross day by day, and so be my follower.
25326	42	9	24	 For whoever desires to save his life shall lose it, and whoever loses his life for my sake shall save it.
25327	42	9	25	 Why, what benefit is it to a man to have gained the whole world, but to have lost or  forfeited his own self.
25328	42	9	26	 For whoever shall have been ashamed of me and my teachings, of him the Son of Man will be ashamed when He comes in His own and the Father's glory and in that of the holy angels.
25329	42	9	27	 I tell you truly that there are some of those who stand here who will certainly not taste death  till they have seen the Kingdom of God."
25330	42	9	28	  It was about eight days after this that Jesus, taking with Him Peter, John, and James, went  up the mountain to pray.
25331	42	9	29	 And while He was praying the appearance of His face underwent a change, and His clothing became white and  radiant.
25332	42	9	30	 And suddenly there were two men conversing with Him, who were Moses and Elijah.
25333	42	9	31	 They  came in glory, and kept speaking about His death, which He was so soon to undergo in Jerusalem.
25334	42	9	32	 Now Peter and the others were weighed down with sleep; but, keeping themselves awake all through, they saw His glory, and the two men standing with Him.
25335	42	9	33	 And when they were preparing to depart from Him, Peter said to Jesus,  "Rabbi, we are thankful to you that we are here. Let us put up three tents--one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah." He did not know what he was saying.
25336	42	9	34	 But while he was thus speaking, there came a cloud which  spread over them; and they were awe-struck when  they had entered into the cloud.
25337	42	9	35	 Then there came a voice from within the cloud: "This is My Son, My Chosen One: listen to Him."
25338	42	9	36	 After this voice had spoken, Jesus was found alone. They kept it to themselves, and said not a word to any one at that time about what they had seen.
25339	42	9	37	  On the following day, when they were come down from the mountain, a great crowd came to meet Him;
25340	42	9	38	 and a man from the crowd called out,  "Rabbi,  I beg you to pity my son, for he is my only child.
25341	42	9	39	 At times a spirit seizes him and he suddenly cries out. It convulses him, and makes him foam at the mouth, and  does not leave him till it has well-nigh covered him with bruises.
25342	42	9	40	 I entreated your disciples to expel the spirit, but they could not."
25343	42	9	41	 "O unbelieving and perverse generation!" replied Jesus; "how long shall I be with you and bear with you? Bring your son here to me."
25344	42	9	42	 Now while the youth was coming, the spirit  dashed him to the ground and cruelly convulsed him. But Jesus  rebuked the foul spirit, and cured the youth and gave him back to his father.
25345	42	9	43	  And all were awe-struck at the  mighty power of God. And while every one was expressing wonder at all that He was doing, He said to his disciples,
25346	42	9	44	 "As for you, store these my sayings in your  memory; for, before long, the Son of Man will be betrayed into the hands of men."
25347	42	9	45	 But they did not understand His meaning: it was  veiled from them that they might not perceive it, and they were afraid to ask Him about it.
25348	42	9	46	  Now there arose a dispute among them, which of them was to be the greatest.
25349	42	9	47	 And Jesus,  knowing the reasoning that was in their hearts, took a young child and made him stand by His side
25350	42	9	48	 and said to them,  "Whoever  for my sake receives this little child, receives me; and whoever receives me, receives Him who sent me. For the lowliest among you all--he is the  greatest."
25351	42	9	49	 "Rabbi," replied John, "we have seen a man making use of your name to expel demons; and we forbad him, because he does not come with us."
25352	42	9	50	 "Do not forbid him," said Jesus, "for he who is not against you is on your side."
25353	42	9	51	 Now when the time drew near for Him to be received up again into Heaven, He proceeded with fixed purpose towards Jerusalem, and sent messengers before Him.
25354	42	9	52	 They went and entered a village of the Samaritans to make ready for Him.
25355	42	9	53	 But the people there would not receive Him, because He was evidently going to Jerusalem.
25356	42	9	54	 When the disciples James and John saw this, they said, "Master, do you wish us to order fire to come down from Heaven and  consume them?"
25357	42	9	55	 But He turned and rebuked them.
25358	42	9	56	 And they went to another village.
25359	42	9	57	  And, as they proceeded on their way, a man came to Him and said, "I will follow you wherever you go."
25360	42	9	58	 "The foxes have holes," said Jesus, "and the birds of the air have  nests; but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay His head."
25361	42	9	59	 "Follow me," He said to another. "Master," the man replied, "allow me first to go and bury my  father."
25362	42	9	60	 "Leave the dead," Jesus rejoined, "to bury their own dead; but you must go and announce far and wide  the coming of the Kingdom of God."
25363	42	9	61	 "Master," said yet another, "I will follow you; but allow me first to go and say good-bye to my friends at home."
25364	42	9	62	 Jesus answered him, "No one who has put his hand to the plough, and then looks behind him, is  fit for the Kingdom of God.
25365	42	10	1	  After this the Lord appointed  seventy  others, and sent them before Him, by twos, to go to every town or place which He Himself intended to visit.
25366	42	10	2	 And He addressed them thus:  "The harvest is abundant, but the reapers are few: therefore entreat the Owner of the harvest to send out more reapers into His  fields. And now go.
25367	42	10	3	 Remember that I am sending you out as lambs into the midst of wolves.
25368	42	10	4	 Carry no purse, bag, nor change of shoes; and  salute no one on your way."
25369	42	10	5	 "Whatever house you enter, first say, `Peace be to this house!'
25370	42	10	6	 And if there is a  lover of peace there, your peace shall rest  upon it; otherwise come back upon you.
25371	42	10	7	 And  in that same house stay, eating and drinking at their table; for the labourer deserves his wages. Do not move from one house to another.
25372	42	10	8	 "And whatever town you come to and they receive you, eat what they put before you.
25373	42	10	9	 Cure the sick in that town, and tell them, "`The Kingdom of God is now at your door.'
25374	42	10	10	 "But whatever town you come to and they will not receive you, go out into the broader streets and say,
25375	42	10	11	 "`The very dust of your town that hangs about us we wipe off as a protest. Only be sure of this, that the Kingdom of God is close at hand.'
25376	42	10	12	 "I tell you that it will be more endurable for Sodom on the great day than for that town.
25377	42	10	13	  "Alas for thee, Chorazin! Alas for thee, Bethsaida! For had the miracles been performed in Tyre and Sidon which have been performed in you, long ere now they would have repented, sitting in sackcloth and ashes.
25378	42	10	14	 However, for Tyre and Sidon it will be more endurable at the Judgement than for you.
25379	42	10	15	 And thou, Capernaum, shalt thou be lifted high as Heaven? Thou shalt be driven down as low as Hades.
25380	42	10	16	 "He who listens to you listens to me; and he who  disregards you disregards me, and he who disregards me disregards Him who sent me."
25381	42	10	17	  When the Seventy returned, they exclaimed joyfully, "Master, even the demons submit to us  when we utter your name."
25382	42	10	18	 "I saw Satan  fall like a lightning-flash out of Heaven," He replied.
25383	42	10	19	 "I have given you  power to tread serpents and scorpions underfoot, and to trample on all the power of the Enemy; and in no case shall anything do you harm.
25384	42	10	20	 Nevertheless rejoice not at this, that the spirits submit to you; but rejoice that your names are registered in Heaven."
25385	42	10	21	 On that  same occasion Jesus was filled by the Holy Spirit with  rapturous joy. "I give Thee fervent thanks," He exclaimed, "O Father, Lord of Heaven and earth, that Thou hast hidden these things from sages and men of understanding, and hast revealed them to babes. Yes, Father, for such has been Thy gracious will.
25386	42	10	22	 All things are delivered to me by my Father; and no one knows who the Son is but the Father, nor who the Father is but the Son, and he to whom the Son may choose to reveal  Him."
25387	42	10	23	 And He turned towards His disciples and said to them apart, "Blessed are the eyes which see what you see!
25388	42	10	24	 For I tell you that many Prophets and kings have desired to see the things you see, and have not seen them, and to hear the things you hear, and have not heard them."
25389	42	10	25	 Then an expounder of the Law stood up to test Him with a question.  "Rabbi," he asked, "what shall I do to inherit the Life of the Ages?"
25390	42	10	26	 "Go to the Law," said Jesus; "what is written there? how does it read?"
25391	42	10	27	 <"`Thou shalt love the Lord thy God,'"> he replied,  <"`with thy whole heart, thy whole soul, thy whole strength, and thy whole mind; and thy fellow man as much as thyself.'">
25392	42	10	28	 "A right answer," said Jesus; "do that, and you shall live."
25393	42	10	29	 But he, desiring to justify himself, said, "But what is meant by my `fellow man'?"
25394	42	10	30	 Jesus replied, "A man was once on his way down from Jerusalem to Jericho when he fell among robbers, who after both stripping and beating him went away, leaving him half dead.
25395	42	10	31	 Now a priest happened to be going down that way, and on seeing him passed by on the other side.
25396	42	10	32	 In like manner a Levite also came to the place, and seeing him passed by on the other side.
25397	42	10	33	 But a certain Samaritan, being on a journey, came where he lay, and seeing him was moved with pity.
25398	42	10	34	 He went to him, and dressed his wounds with oil and wine and bound them up. Then placing him on his own  mule he brought him to an  inn, where he bestowed every care on him.
25399	42	10	35	 The next day he took out two shillings and gave them to the innkeeper. "`Take care of him,' he said, `and whatever further expense you are put to, I will repay it you at my next visit.'
25400	42	10	36	 "Which of those three seems to you to have acted  like a fellow man to him who fell among the robbers?"
25401	42	10	37	  "The one who showed him pity," he replied. "Go," said Jesus, "and act in the same way."
25402	42	10	38	 As they pursued their journey He came to a certain village, where a woman named Martha welcomed Him to her house.
25403	42	10	39	 She had a sister called Mary, who seated herself  at the Lord's feet and listened to His teaching.
25404	42	10	40	 Martha meanwhile was  busy and distracted in waiting at table, and she  came and said, "Master, do you not care that my sister  is leaving me to do all the waiting? Tell her to assist me."
25405	42	10	41	 "Martha, Martha," replied Jesus, "you are anxious and worried about a multitude of things;
25406	42	10	42	 and yet  only one thing is really necessary. Mary has chosen the good portion and she shall not be deprived of it."
25407	42	11	1	  At one place where He was praying, when He  rose from His knees one of His disciples said to Him, "Master, teach us to pray, just as John taught his disciples."
25408	42	11	2	 So He said to them, "When you pray, say, `Father may Thy name be kept holy; let Thy Kingdom come;
25409	42	11	3	  give us day after day our bread for the day;
25410	42	11	4	 and forgive us our sins, for we ourselves also forgive every one who  fails in his duty to us; and bring us not into temptation.'"
25411	42	11	5	 And He said to them, "Which of you shall have a friend and shall go to him in the middle of the night and say, "`Friend, lend me three loaves of bread;
25412	42	11	6	 for a friend of mine has just come to my house from a distance, and I have nothing for him to eat'?
25413	42	11	7	 "And  he from indoors shall answer, "`Do not pester me. The door is now barred, and I am here in bed with my children. I cannot get up and give you bread.'
25414	42	11	8	 "I tell you that even if he will not rise and give him the loaves because he is his friend, at any rate because of his  persistency he will rouse himself and give him as many as he requires.
25415	42	11	9	 "So I say to you, `Ask, and what you ask for shall be given to you; seek, and you shall find; knock, and the door shall be opened to you.'
25416	42	11	10	 For every one who asks, receives; and he who seeks, finds; and to him who knocks, the door shall be opened.
25417	42	11	11	 And what father is there among you, who, if his son asks for  a slice of bread, will offer him a stone? or if he asks for a fish, will instead of a fish offer him a snake?
25418	42	11	12	 or if he asks for an egg, will offer him a scorpion?
25419	42	11	13	 If you then,  with all your human frailty, know how to give your children gifts that are good for them, how much more certainly will your Father  who is in Heaven give the Holy Spirit to those who ask Him!"
25420	42	11	14	  On once occasion He was expelling a dumb demon; and when the demon was gone out the dumb man could speak, and the  people were astonished.
25421	42	11	15	 But some among them said, "It is  by the power of Baal-zebul, the Prince of the demons, that he expels the demons."
25422	42	11	16	 Others, to put Him to the test, asked Him for a  sign in the sky.
25423	42	11	17	  And, knowing their thoughts, He said to them, "Every kingdom  in which civil war rages goes to ruin:  family attacks family and is overthrown.
25424	42	11	18	 And if Satan  really has engaged in fierce conflict with himself, how shall his kingdom stand?--because you say that I expel demons by the power of Baal-zebul.
25425	42	11	19	 And if it is by the power of Baal-zebul that I expel the demons, by whom do  your disciples expel them? They therefore shall be your judges.
25426	42	11	20	 But if it is by the  power of God that I drive out the demons, it is evident that  the Kingdom of God  has come upon you.
25427	42	11	21	 "Whenever a strong man, fully armed and equipped, is guarding his own castle, he enjoys peaceful possession of his property;
25428	42	11	22	 but as soon as another stronger than he attacks him and overcomes him, he takes away that complete armour of his in which he trusted, and distributes the plunder he has collected.
25429	42	11	23	 Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever is not gathering with me is scattering abroad.
25430	42	11	24	 "When a foul spirit has left a man, it roams about in the Desert, seeking a resting-place; but, unable to find any, it says, `I will return to the house I have left;"
25431	42	11	25	 and when it comes, it finds the house swept clean and  in good order.
25432	42	11	26	 Then it goes and brings with it seven other spirits more malignant than itself, and they enter and dwell there; and in the end that man's condition becomes worse than it was at first.
25433	42	11	27	 As He thus spoke a woman in the crowd called out in a loud voice, "Blessed is the mother who carried you, and the breasts that you have sucked."
25434	42	11	28	  "Nay rather," He replied, "they are blessed who hear God's Message and  carefully keep it."
25435	42	11	29	  Now when the crowds came thronging upon Him, He proceeded to say, "The present generation is a wicked generation: it requires some sign, but no sign shall be given to it except that of Jonah.
25436	42	11	30	 For just as Jonah became a sign to the men of Nineveh, so the Son of Man will be a token to the present generation.
25437	42	11	31	 The Queen of the South will awake at the Judgement together with the men of the present generation, and will condemn them; because she came from the extremity of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon; but mark!  One greater than Solomon is here.
25438	42	11	32	 There will stand up men of Nineveh at the Judgement together with the present generation, and will condemn it; because they repented at the preaching of Jonah; and mark!  One greater than Jonah is here.
25439	42	11	33	 "When any one lights a lamp, he never puts it  in the cellar or under the bushel, but on the lampstand, that people who come in may see the light.
25440	42	11	34	 The lamp of the body is the eye. When your eyesight is good, your whole body also is lighted up; but when it is defective, your body is darkened.
25441	42	11	35	 Consider therefore whether the light that is in you is anything but mere darkness.
25442	42	11	36	 If, however, your whole body is penetrated with light, and has no part dark, it will be so lighted, all of it, as when the lamp with its bright shining gives you light."
25443	42	11	37	 When He had thus spoken, a Pharisee invited Him to breakfast at his house; so He entered and took His place at table.
25444	42	11	38	 Now the Pharisee saw to his surprise that He did not wash His hands before breakfasting.
25445	42	11	39	 The Master however said to him, "Here we see how you Pharisees clean the outside of the cup or plate, while your secret hearts are full of greed and  selfishness.
25446	42	11	40	 Foolish men! Did not He who made the outside make the inside also?
25447	42	11	41	 But as to what is within,  give alms, and  instantly all is clean  in you.
25448	42	11	42	 "But  alas for you Pharisees! for you pay tithes on your mint and rue and every kind of garden vegetable, and are indifferent to justice and the love of God. These are the things you ought to have  attended to, while not neglecting the others.
25449	42	11	43	 Alas for you Pharisees! for you love the best seats in the synagogues, and you like to be bowed to in places of public resort.
25450	42	11	44	 Alas for you! for you are like the tombs which lie hidden, and the people who walk over them are not aware of their existence."
25451	42	11	45	 Hereupon one of the expounders of the Law exclaimed,  "Rabbi, in saying such things you reproach us also."
25452	42	11	46	 "Alas too for you expounders of the Law!" replied Jesus, "for you load men with cumbrous burdens which you yourselves will not touch with one of your fingers.
25453	42	11	47	 Alas for you! for you repair the tombs of the Prophets, whom your forefathers killed.
25454	42	11	48	  It follows that you  bear testimony to the actions of your forefathers and that you fully approve thereof. They slew, you build.
25455	42	11	49	 "For this reason also the Wisdom of God has said, `I will send Prophets and Apostles to them, of whom they will kill some and persecute others,'
25456	42	11	50	 so that the blood of all the Prophets,  that is being shed from the creation of the world onwards, may be  required from the present generation.
25457	42	11	51	 Yes, I tell you that,  from the blood of Abel down to the blood of Zechariah who perished between the altar and the House, it shall all be required from the present generation.
25458	42	11	52	 "Alas for you expounders of the Law! for you have taken away the key of knowledge: you yourselves have not entered, and those who wanted to enter you have hindered."
25459	42	11	53	 After He had left the house, the Scribes and Pharisees commenced a vehement attempt to entangle Him and make Him give off-hand answers on numerous points,
25460	42	11	54	 lying in wait to catch some unguarded expression from His lips.
25461	42	12	1	 Meanwhile the people had come streaming towards Him by tens of thousands, so that they were trampling one another under foot. And now He proceeded to say  to His disciples first, "Beware of the yeast of the Pharisees, that is to say, beware of hypocrisy.
25462	42	12	2	 There is nothing that is covered up which will not be uncovered, nor hidden which will not become known.
25463	42	12	3	 Whatever therefore you have said in the dark, will be heard in the light; and what you have whispered within closed doors will be proclaimed from the house-tops.
25464	42	12	4	 "But to you who are my friends I say, "`Be not afraid of those who kill the body and after that can do nothing further.
25465	42	12	5	 I will warn you whom to fear: fear him who after killing has power to throw into Gehenna: yes, I say to you, fear him.
25466	42	12	6	 Are not five sparrows sold for  a penny? and yet not one of them is a thing forgotten in God's sight.
25467	42	12	7	 But the very hairs on your heads are all counted. Away with fear: you are more precious than a multitude of sparrows.'
25468	42	12	8	 "And I tell you that  every man who shall have  acknowledged me before men, the Son of Man will also acknowledge before the angels of God.
25469	42	12	9	 But he who disowns me before men will be disowned before the angels of God.
25470	42	12	10	 "Moreover every one who  shall speak against the Son of Man,  may obtain forgiveness; but he who  blasphemes the Holy Spirit will never obtain forgiveness.
25471	42	12	11	 And when they are bringing you before synagogues and magistrates and governors, do not anxiously ponder the manner or matter of your defence, nor what you are to say;
25472	42	12	12	 for the Holy Spirit shall teach you at that very moment what you must say."
25473	42	12	13	 Just then a man in the crowd appealed to Him.  "Rabbi," he said, "tell my brother to give me a share of the inheritance."
25474	42	12	14	 "Man," He replied, "who has constituted me a judge or arbitrator over you?"
25475	42	12	15	 And to the people He said, "Take care, be on your guard against all covetousness, for no one's life consists in the superabundance of his possessions."
25476	42	12	16	 And He spoke a parable to them. "A certain rich man's lands," He said, "yielded abundant crops,
25477	42	12	17	 and he debated within himself, saying, "`What am I to do? for I have no place in which to store my crops.'
25478	42	12	18	 "And he said to himself, "`This is what I will do: I will pull down my barns and build larger ones, and in them I will store up all my harvest and my wealth;
25479	42	12	19	 and I will say to my  life, "`Life, you have ample possessions laid up for many years to come: take your ease, eat, drink, enjoy yourself.'
25480	42	12	20	 "But God said to him, "`Foolish man, this night your life is demanded from you; and these preparations--for whom shall they be?'
25481	42	12	21	 "So is it with him who amasses treasure for himself, but has no riches  in God."
25482	42	12	22	 Then turning to His disciples He said,  "For this reason I say to you, `Dismiss all anxious care for your  lives, inquiring what you are to eat, and for your  bodies, what you are to put on.'
25483	42	12	23	 For life is a greater gift than  food, and the body is a greater gift than clothing.
25484	42	12	24	  Observe the ravens. They neither sow nor reap, and have neither store-chamber nor barn. And yet God feeds them. How far more precious are you than the birds!
25485	42	12	25	 And which of you is able by anxious thought to add  a  moment to his life?
25486	42	12	26	 If then you are unable to do even a very little thing, why be over-anxious about other matters?
25487	42	12	27	 Observe the lilies, how they grow. They neither labour nor spin. And yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his splendour was  as beautifully dressed as one of these.
25488	42	12	28	 But if God so clothes the vegetation in the fields, that  blooms to-day and to-morrow will be thrown into the oven, how much more certainly will He clothe you, you men of feeble faith!
25489	42	12	29	 "Therefore, do not be asking what you are to eat nor what you are to drink; and do not waver between hope and fear.
25490	42	12	30	 For though the nations of the world pursue these things, as for you, your Father knows that you need them.
25491	42	12	31	 But make His Kingdom the object of your pursuit, and these things shall be given you in addition.
25492	42	12	32	 "Dismiss your fears, little flock: your Father finds a pleasure in giving you the Kingdom.
25493	42	12	33	 Sell your possessions and give alms. Provide yourselves with purses that will never wear out, a treasure inexhaustible in Heaven, where no thief can come nor moth consume.
25494	42	12	34	 For where your wealth is stored, there also will your heart be.
25495	42	12	35	 "Have your girdles on, and let your lamps be alight;
25496	42	12	36	 and be yourselves like men waiting for their master--on the look-out till he shall  return from the wedding feast--that, when he comes and knocks, they may open the door instantly.
25497	42	12	37	 Blessed are those servants, whom their Master when He comes shall find on the watch. I tell you in solemn truth, that He will tie an apron round Him, and will bid them recline at table while He comes and waits on them.
25498	42	12	38	 And whether it be in the second watch or in the third that He comes and finds them so, blessed are they.
25499	42	12	39	 Of this be sure, that if the master of the house had known what time the robber was coming, he would have kept awake and not have allowed his house to be broken into.
25500	42	12	40	 Be you also ready, for at an hour when you are not expecting Him the Son of Man will come."
25501	42	12	41	 "Master," said Peter, "are you addressing this parable to us, or to all alike?"
25502	42	12	42	 "Who, then," replied the Lord, "is the faithful and intelligent steward whom his Master will put in charge of His household to serve out their rations at the proper times?
25503	42	12	43	 Blessed is that servant whom his Master when He comes shall find so doing.
25504	42	12	44	 I tell you truly that He will put him in authority over all His possessions.
25505	42	12	45	 But if that servant  should say in his heart, `My Master is a long time in coming,' and should begin to beat the  menservants and the maids, and to eat and drink, drinking even to excess;
