25506	42	12	46	 that servant's Master will come on a day when he is not expecting Him and at an hour that he knows not of, and will  punish him severely, and make him share the lot of the unfaithful.
25507	42	12	47	 And that servant who has been told his Master's will and yet made no preparation and did not obey His will, will receive many lashes.
25508	42	12	48	 But he who had not been told it and yet did what deserved the scourge, will receive but few lashes. To whomsoever much has been given, from him much will be required; and to whom much has been  entrusted, of him a larger amount will be demanded.
25509	42	12	49	  "I came to throw fire upon the earth, and what is my desire? Oh that it were even now kindled!
25510	42	12	50	  But I have a baptism to undergo; and how am I pent up till it is accomplished!
25511	42	12	51	  Do you suppose that I came to give peace on earth? No, I tell you that I came to bring dissension.
25512	42	12	52	 For from this time there will be in one house five persons split into parties. Three will form a party against two and two will form a party against three;
25513	42	12	53	 father against son and son against father; mother attacking daughter and daughter her mother, mother-in-law her daughter-in-law, and daughter-in-law her mother-in-law."
25514	42	12	54	 Then He said to the  people also, "When you see a cloud  rising in the west, you immediately say, `There is to be  a shower;' and it comes to pass.
25515	42	12	55	 And when you see a south wind blowing, you say, `It will be burning hot;' and it comes to pass.
25516	42	12	56	 Vain pretenders! You know how to read the aspect of earth and sky. How is it you cannot read this present time?
25517	42	12	57	 "Why, too, do you not of yourselves arrive at just conclusions?
25518	42	12	58	  For when, with  your opponent,  you are  going before the magistrate, on the way take pains to get out of his power; for fear that, if he  should drag you before the judge, the judge  may hand you over to the officer of the court, and the officer lodge you in prison.
25519	42	12	59	 Never, I tell you, will you get free till you have paid the last farthing."
25520	42	13	1	 Just at that time people came to tell Him about the Galilaeans whose blood Pilate had mingled with their sacrifices.
25521	42	13	2	 "Do you suppose," He asked in reply, "that  those Galilaeans were worse sinners than the mass of the Galilaeans, because this happened to them?
25522	42	13	3	 I tell you, certainly not. On the contrary, if you  are not penitent you will all perish  as they did.
25523	42	13	4	 Or those eighteen on whom the tower at Siloam fell, do you suppose they had  failed in their duty more than all the rest of the people who live in Jerusalem?
25524	42	13	5	 I tell you, certainly not. On the contrary, if you  do not repent you will all perish  just as they did."
25525	42	13	6	 And He gave them the following parable. "A man," He said, "who had a fig-tree growing in his garden came to look for fruit on it and could find none.
25526	42	13	7	 So he said to the gardener, "`See, this is the third year I have come to look for fruit on this fig-tree and cannot find any. Cut it down. Why should so much ground be actually wasted?'
25527	42	13	8	 "But the gardener pleaded, "`Leave it, Sir, this year also, till I have dug round it and manured it.
25528	42	13	9	 If after that it bears fruit,  well and good; if it does not, then you shall cut it down.'"
25529	42	13	10	 Once He was teaching on the Sabbath in one of the synagogues
25530	42	13	11	 where a woman was present who for eighteen years  had been a confirmed invalid: she was bent double, and was unable to lift herself to her full height.
25531	42	13	12	 But Jesus saw her, and calling to her, He said to her, "Woman,  you are free from your weakness."
25532	42	13	13	 And He put His hands on her, and she immediately stood upright and began to give glory to God.
25533	42	13	14	 Then the Warden of the Synagogue, indignant that Jesus had cured her on a Sabbath, said to the crowd, "There are six days in the week on which people ought to work. On those days therefore come and get yourselves cured, and not on the Sabbath day."
25534	42	13	15	 But the Lord's reply to him was, "Hypocrites, does not each of you on the Sabbath untie his bullock or his ass from the stall and lead him to water?
25535	42	13	16	 And this woman, daughter of Abraham as she is, whom Satan had bound for no less than eighteen years, was she not to be loosed from this chain because it is the Sabbath day?"
25536	42	13	17	 When He had said this, all His opponents were ashamed, while the whole multitude was delighted at the many glorious things continually done by Him.
25537	42	13	18	  This prompted Him to say, "What is the Kingdom of God like? and to what shall I compare it?
25538	42	13	19	 It is like a mustard seed which a man drops into the soil in his garden, and it grows and becomes a tree in whose branches the birds roost."
25539	42	13	20	 And again He said, "To what shall I compare the Kingdom of God?
25540	42	13	21	 It is like yeast which a woman takes and buries in a bushel of flour, to work there till the whole is leavened."
25541	42	13	22	 He was passing through town after town and village after village, steadily proceeding towards Jerusalem,
25542	42	13	23	 when some one asked Him, "Sir, are there but few who are to be saved?"
25543	42	13	24	  "Strain every nerve to force your way in through the narrow gate," He answered; "for multitudes, I tell you, will  endeavour to find a way in and will not succeed.
25544	42	13	25	  As soon as the Master of the house shall have risen and shut the door, and you have begun to stand outside and knock at the door and say, "`Sir, open the door for us' --"`I do not know you,' He answers;  `you are no friends of mine.'
25545	42	13	26	 "Then you will plead, "`We have eaten and drunk in your company and you have taught in our streets.'
25546	42	13	27	 "But He will reply, "`I tell you that you are no friends of mine. Begone from me, all of you, wrongdoers that you are.'
25547	42	13	28	 "There will be  the weeping and gnashing of teeth, when you see Abraham and Isaac and Jacob and all the Prophets in the Kingdom of God, and yourselves being driven far away.
25548	42	13	29	 They will come from east and west, from north and south, and will sit down at the banquet in the Kingdom of God.
25549	42	13	30	 And  I tell you that some now last  will then be first, and some now first will then be last."
25550	42	13	31	 Just at that time there came some Pharisees who warned Him, saying, "Leave this place and continue your journey; Herod means to kill you."
25551	42	13	32	 "Go," He replied, "and take this message to that fox: "`See, to-day and to-morrow I am driving out demons and effecting cures, and on the third day I finish my course.'
25552	42	13	33	  "Yet I must continue my journey to-day and to-morrow and the day following; for it is not conceivable that a Prophet should perish outside of Jerusalem.
25553	42	13	34	  O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, thou who murderest the Prophets and stonest those who have been sent to thee, how often have I desired to gather thy children just as a hen gathers her brood under her wings, and you would not come!
25554	42	13	35	 See, your house  is left to you. But I tell you that you will never see me again  until you say, <`Blessed is He who comes in the name of the Lord!'">
25555	42	14	1	 One day--it was a Sabbath--He was  taking a meal at the house of one of the Rulers of the Pharisee party, while they were closely watching Him.
25556	42	14	2	 In front of Him was a man suffering from dropsy.
25557	42	14	3	 This led Jesus to ask the lawyers and Pharisees, "Is it allowable to cure people on the Sabbath?"
25558	42	14	4	 They gave Him no answer; so He took hold of the man, cured him, and sent him away.
25559	42	14	5	 Then He turned to them and said, "Which of you shall have a  child or an ox fall into a well on the Sabbath day, and will not immediately lift him out?"
25560	42	14	6	 To this they could make no reply.
25561	42	14	7	 Then, when He noticed that the invited guests chose the best  seats, He used this as an illustration and said to them,
25562	42	14	8	 "When any one invites you to a wedding banquet, do not take the best seat, lest perhaps some more honoured guest than you may have been asked,
25563	42	14	9	 and the man who invited you both will come and will say to you, `Make room for this guest,' and then you, ashamed, will move to the lowest place.
25564	42	14	10	 On the contrary, when you are invited go and take the lowest place, that when your host comes round he may say to you, `My friend, come up higher.' This will be  doing you honour in the presence of all the other guests.
25565	42	14	11	 For whoever uplifts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be uplifted.
25566	42	14	12	 Also to His host, who had invited Him, He said, "When you give a breakfast or a dinner, do not invite your friends or brothers or relatives or rich neighbours, lest perhaps they should invite you in return and a requital be made you.
25567	42	14	13	  But when you entertain, invite the poor, the crippled, the lame, and the blind;
25568	42	14	14	 and you will be blessed, because they have no means of requiting you, but there will be requital for you at the  Resurrection of the righteous."
25569	42	14	15	 After listening to this teaching, one of His fellow guests said to Him, "Blessed is he who shall feast in God's Kingdom."
25570	42	14	16	 "A man once gave  a great dinner," replied Jesus, "to which he invited a large number of guests.
25571	42	14	17	 At dinner-time he sent his  servant to announce to those who had been invited, "`Come, for things are now ready.'
25572	42	14	18	 "But they all without exception began to excuse themselves. The first told him, "`I have purchased a piece of land, and must of necessity go and look at it. Pray hold me excused.'
25573	42	14	19	 "A second pleaded, "`I have bought five yoke of oxen, and am  on my way to try them. Pray hold me excused.'
25574	42	14	20	 "Another said, "`I am just married. It is impossible for me to come.'
25575	42	14	21	 "So the servant came and brought these answers to his master, and they stirred his anger. "`Go out quickly,' he said, `into the streets of the city--the wide ones and the narrow. You will see poor men, and crippled, blind, lame: fetch them all in here.'
25576	42	14	22	 "Soon the servant reported the result, saying, "`Sir, what you ordered is done, and there is room still.'
25577	42	14	23	 "`Go out,' replied the master, `to the high roads and hedge-rows, and compel the people to come in, so that my house may be filled.
25578	42	14	24	 For I tell you that not one of those who were invited shall taste my dinner.'"
25579	42	14	25	 On His journey vast crowds attended Him, towards whom He turned and said,
25580	42	14	26	  "If any one is coming to me who does not hate his father and mother, wife and children, brothers and sisters, yes and his own  life also, he cannot be a disciple of mine.
25581	42	14	27	 No one who does not carry his own cross and come after me can be a disciple of mine.
25582	42	14	28	 "Which of you, desiring to build a tower, does not sit down first and calculate the cost, asking if he has the means to finish it? --
25583	42	14	29	 lest perhaps, when he has laid the foundation and is unable to finish, all who see it shall begin to jeer at him,
25584	42	14	30	 saying, `This man began to build, but could not finish.'
25585	42	14	31	 Or what king,  marching to encounter another king in war, does not first sit down and deliberate whether he is able with ten thousand men to meet the one who is advancing against him with twenty thousand?
25586	42	14	32	 If not, while the other is still a long way off, he sends  messengers and  sues for peace.
25587	42	14	33	  Just as no one of you who does not  detach himself from all that belongs to him can be a disciple of mine.
25588	42	14	34	  "Salt is good: but if even the salt has become tasteless, what will you use to season it?
25589	42	14	35	 Neither for land nor dunghill is it of any use; they throw it away. Listen, every one who has ears to listen with!"
25590	42	15	1	 Now the tax-gatherers and the notorious sinners were everywhere in the habit of coming close to Him to listen to Him;
25591	42	15	2	 and this led the Pharisees and the Scribes indignantly to complain, saying, "He gives a welcome to notorious sinners, and joins them at their meals!"
25592	42	15	3	  So in figurative language He asked them,
25593	42	15	4	 "Which of you men, if he has a hundred sheep and has lost one of them, does not leave the ninety-nine in their pasture and go in search of the lost one till he finds it?
25594	42	15	5	 And when he has found it, he lifts it on his shoulder, glad at heart.
25595	42	15	6	 Then coming home he calls his friends and neighbours together, and says,  `Congratulate me, for I have found my sheep--the one I had lost.'
25596	42	15	7	 I tell you that in the same way there will be rejoicing in Heaven over one repentant sinner--more rejoicing than over ninety-nine blameless persons who have no need of repentance.
25597	42	15	8	 "Or what woman who has ten silver coins, if she loses one of them, does not light a lamp and sweep the house and search carefully till she finds it?
25598	42	15	9	 And when she has found it, she calls together her  friends and neighbours, and says, "`Congratulate me, for I have found the coin which I had lost.'
25599	42	15	10	 "I tell you that in the same way there is rejoicing in the presence of the angels of God over one repentant sinner."
25600	42	15	11	 He went on to say, "There was a man who had two sons.
25601	42	15	12	 The younger of them said to his father, "`Father, give me the share of the property that comes to me.' "So he divided his wealth between them.
25602	42	15	13	 No long time afterwards the younger son got all together and travelled to a distant country, where he wasted his money in debauchery and excess.
25603	42	15	14	 At last, when he had spent everything, there came a terrible famine throughout that country, and  he began  to feel the pinch of want.
25604	42	15	15	 So he went and  hired himself to one of the inhabitants of that country, who sent him on to his farm to tend swine;
25605	42	15	16	 and he longed to make a hearty meal of the pods the swine were eating, but no one gave him any.
25606	42	15	17	 "But on coming to himself he said, "`How many of my father's hired men have more bread than they want, while I here am dying of hunger!
25607	42	15	18	 I will rise and go to my father, and will say to him, Father, I have sinned against Heaven and before you:
25608	42	15	19	 I no longer deserve to be called a son of yours: treat me as one of your hired men.'
25609	42	15	20	 "So he rose and came to his father. But while he was still a long way off, his father saw him and pitied him, and ran and threw his arms round his neck and kissed him tenderly.
25610	42	15	21	 "`Father,' cried the son, `I have sinned against Heaven and before you: no longer do I deserve to be called a son of yours.'
25611	42	15	22	  "But the father said to his servants, "`Fetch a good coat quickly--the best one--and put it on him; and bring a ring for his finger and shoes for his feet.
25612	42	15	23	 Fetch the fat calf and kill it, and let us feast and enjoy ourselves;
25613	42	15	24	 for my son here was dead and has come to life again: he was lost and has been found.' "And they began to be merry.
25614	42	15	25	 "Now his elder son was out on the farm; and when he returned and came near home, he heard music and  dancing.
25615	42	15	26	 Then he called one of the lads to him and asked what all this meant.
25616	42	15	27	 "`Your brother has come,' he replied; `and your father has had the fat calf killed, because he has got him home safe and sound.'
25617	42	15	28	 "Then he was angry and would not go in. But his father came out and entreated him.
25618	42	15	29	 "`All these years,' replied the son, `I have been slaving for you, and I have never at any time  disobeyed any of your orders, and yet you have never given me so much as a kid, for me to enjoy myself with my friends;
25619	42	15	30	 but now that this son of yours is come who has eaten up your property among his bad women, you have killed the fat calf for him.'
25620	42	15	31	 "`You  my dear son,' said the father, `are always with me, and all that is mine is also yours.
25621	42	15	32	 We are bound to make merry and rejoice, for this brother of yours was dead and has come back to life, he was lost and has been found.'"
25622	42	16	1	 He said also to His disciples: "There was a rich man who had a steward, about whom a report was brought to him, that he was wasting his property.
25623	42	16	2	 He called him and said, "`What is this I hear about you? Render an account of your stewardship, for I cannot let you hold it any longer.'
25624	42	16	3	 "Then the steward said within himself, "`What am I to do? For my master is taking away the stewardship from me. I am not strong enough for field labour: to beg, I should be ashamed.
25625	42	16	4	 I see what to do, in order that when I am discharged from the stewardship they may give me a home in their own houses.'
25626	42	16	5	 "So he called all his master's debtors, one by one, and asked the first, `How much are you in debt to my master?'
25627	42	16	6	 "`A hundred  firkins of oil,' he replied. "`Here is your account,' said the steward: `sit down quickly and  change it into fifty firkins.'
25628	42	16	7	 "To a second he said, "`And how much do you owe?' "`A hundred  quarters of wheat,' was the answer. "`Here is your account,' said he:  `change it into eighty quarters.'
25629	42	16	8	 "And the master praised the dishonest steward for his shrewdness; for, in relation to their own contemporaries, the men of this age are shrewder than the sons of Light.
25630	42	16	9	 "But I charge you, so to use  the wealth which is ever tempting to dishonesty as to win friends who, when it fails, shall welcome you to the tents that never perish.
25631	42	16	10	 The man who is honest in a very small matter is honest in a great one also; and he who is dishonest in a very small matter is dishonest in a great one also.
25632	42	16	11	 If therefore you have not proved yourselves faithful in dealing with the  wealth that is  tainted with fraud, who will entrust to you the true good?
25633	42	16	12	 And if you have not been faithful in dealing with that which is not your own, who will give you that which is your own?
25634	42	16	13	 "No  servant can be in bondage to two masters. For either he will hate one and love the other, or else he will cling fast to one and scorn the other. You cannot be bondservants both of God and of  gold."
25635	42	16	14	 To all this the Pharisees listened,  bitterly jeering at Him; for they were lovers of money.
25636	42	16	15	 "You are they," He said to them, "who boast of their own goodness before men, but God sees your hearts; for that which holds a proud position among men is detestable in God's sight.
25637	42	16	16	 The Law and the Prophets continued until John came: from that time the Good News of the Kingdom of God  has been spreading, and all classes  have been forcing their way into it.
25638	42	16	17	  But it is easier for earth and sky to pass away than for one smallest detail of the Law to fall to the ground.
25639	42	16	18	 Every man who divorces his wife and marries another commits adultery; and he who marries  her when so divorced from her husband commits adultery.
25640	42	16	19	 "There was once a rich man who habitually arrayed himself in purple and  fine linen, and enjoyed a splendid banquet every day,
25641	42	16	20	 while at his outer door there  lay a beggar, Lazarus by name,
25642	42	16	21	 covered with sores and longing to make a full meal off the  scraps flung on the floor from the rich man's table. Nay, the dogs, too, used to come and lick his sores.
25643	42	16	22	 "But in course of time the beggar died; and he was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom. The rich man also died, and  had a funeral.
25644	42	16	23	 And in Hades, being in torment, he looked and saw Abraham in the far distance, and Lazarus resting in his  arms.
25645	42	16	24	 So he cried aloud, and said, "`Father Abraham, take pity on me and send Lazarus to dip the tip of his finger in water and cool my tongue, for I am in agony in this flame.'
25646	42	16	25	 "`Remember, my child,' said Abraham, `that you had all your good things during your lifetime, and that Lazarus in like manner had his bad things. But, now and here, he is receiving consolation and you are in agony.
25647	42	16	26	 And, besides all this, a vast chasm is immovably fixed between us and you, put there in order that those who desire to cross from this side to you may not be able, nor any be able to cross over from your side to us.'
25648	42	16	27	 "`I entreat you then, father,' said he, `to send him to my father's house.
25649	42	16	28	 For I have five brothers. Let him earnestly warn them, lest they also come to this place of torment.'
25650	42	16	29	 "`They have Moses and the Prophets,' replied Abraham; `let them hear them.'
25651	42	16	30	 "`No, father Abraham,' he pleaded; `but if some one  goes to them from the dead, they will repent.'
25652	42	16	31	 "`If they are deaf to Moses and the Prophets,' replied Abraham, `they would not be led to believe even if some one should rise from the dead.'"
25653	42	17	1	  Jesus said to His disciples, "It is inevitable that causes of stumbling should come; but alas for him through whom they come!
25654	42	17	2	 It would be well for him if, with a  millstone round his neck, he were lying at the bottom of the sea, rather than that he should cause even one of these little ones to fall.
25655	42	17	3	  Be on your guard. "If your brother acts wrongly, reprove him; and if he is sorry, forgive him;
25656	42	17	4	 and if seven times in a day he acts wrongly towards you, and seven times turns again to you and says, `I am sorry,' you must forgive him."
25657	42	17	5	 And the Apostles said to the Lord, "Give us faith."
25658	42	17	6	 "If your faith," replied the Lord, "is like a mustard seed, you might command this black-mulberry-tree, `Tear up your roots and plant yourself in the sea,' and instantly it would obey you.
25659	42	17	7	 But which of you who has a  servant ploughing, or tending sheep, will say to him when he comes in from the farm, `Come at once and take your place at table,'
25660	42	17	8	 and will not rather say to him, `Get my dinner ready, make yourself tidy, and wait upon me till I have finished my dinner, and then you shall have yours'?
25661	42	17	9	 Does he thank the  servant for obeying his orders?
25662	42	17	10	 So you also, when you have obeyed all the orders given you, must say, "`There is no merit in our service: what we have done is  only what we were in duty bound to do.'"
25663	42	17	11	 As  they pursued their journey to Jerusalem, He passed through Samaria and Galilee.
25664	42	17	12	 And as He entered a certain village, ten men met Him who were lepers and stood at a distance.
25665	42	17	13	 In loud voices they cried out, "Jesus, Rabbi, take pity on us."
25666	42	17	14	 Perceiving this, He said to them, "Go and show yourselves to the Priests." And while on their way to do this they were made clean.
25667	42	17	15	 One of them, seeing that he was cured, came back, adoring and praising God in a loud voice,
25668	42	17	16	 and he threw himself at the feet of Jesus, thanking Him. He was a Samaritan.
25669	42	17	17	 "Were not all ten made clean?" Jesus asked; "but where are the nine?
25670	42	17	18	 Have none been found to come back and give glory to God except this foreigner?"
25671	42	17	19	 And He said to him, "Rise and go: your faith has cured you."
25672	42	17	20	  Being asked by the Pharisees when the Kingdom of God was coming, He answered, "The Kingdom of God does not so come that you can  stealthily watch for it.
25673	42	17	21	 Nor will they say, `See here!' or `See there!' --for the Kingdom of God is  within you."
25674	42	17	22	 Then, turning to His disciples, He said, "There will come a time when you will wish you could see a single one of the days of the Son of Man, but will not see one.
25675	42	17	23	  And they will say to you, `See there!' `See here!' Do not start off and go in pursuit.
25676	42	17	24	 For just as the lightning, when it flashes, shines from one part of the horizon to the opposite part, so will the Son of Man be on His day.
25677	42	17	25	 But  first He must endure much suffering, and be rejected by the present generation.
25678	42	17	26	 "And as it was in the time of Noah, so will it also be in the time of the Son of Man.
25679	42	17	27	 Men were eating and drinking, taking wives and giving wives, up to the very day on which Noah entered the Ark, and the Deluge came and destroyed them all.
25680	42	17	28	 The same was true in the time of Lot: they were eating and drinking, buying and selling, planting and building;
25681	42	17	29	 but on the day that Lot left Sodom, God rained fire and brimstone from the sky and destroyed them all.
25682	42	17	30	 Exactly so will it be on the day that the veil is lifted from the Son of Man.
25683	42	17	31	 "On that day, if a man is on the roof and his  property indoors, let him not go down to fetch it; and, in the same way, he who is in the field, let him not turn back.
25684	42	17	32	 Remember Lot's wife.
25685	42	17	33	 Any man who makes it his object to keep his own  life safe, will lose it; but whoever loses his  life will  preserve it.
25686	42	17	34	  On that night, I tell you, there will be two men in one bed: one will be  taken away and the other left behind.
25687	42	17	35	 There will be two women turning the mill together: one will be  taken away and the other left behind."
25688	42	17	36	  []
25689	42	17	37	 "Where, Master?" they inquired. "Where the dead body is," He replied, "there also will the vultures flock together."
25690	42	18	1	  He also taught them by a parable that they must always pray and never lose heart.
25691	42	18	2	 "In a certain town," He said, "there was a judge who had no fear of God and no respect for man.
25692	42	18	3	 And in the same town was a widow who repeatedly came and entreated him, saying, "`Give me justice and stop my oppressor.'
25693	42	18	4	 "For a time he would not, but afterwards he said to himself, "`Though I have neither reverence for God nor respect for man,
25694	42	18	5	 yet because she annoys me I will give her justice, to prevent her from  constantly coming to pester me.'"
25695	42	18	6	 And the Lord said, "Hear those words of the unjust judge.
25696	42	18	7	  And will not God avenge the wrongs of His own People who cry aloud to Him day and night, although He seems slow in taking action on their behalf?
25697	42	18	8	 Yes, He will soon avenge their wrongs. Yet, when the Son of Man  comes, will He find  faith on earth?"
25698	42	18	9	 And to some who relied on themselves as being righteous men, and looked down upon all others, He addressed this parable.
25699	42	18	10	 "Two men went up to the Temple to pray," He said; "one being a Pharisee and the other a tax-gatherer.
25700	42	18	11	 The Pharisee, standing erect, prayed as follows  by himself: "`O God, I thank Thee that I am not like other people--I am not a thief nor a cheat nor an adulterer, nor do I even resemble this tax-gatherer.
25701	42	18	12	 I fast twice a week. I pay the tithe on all my gains.'
25702	42	18	13	 "But the tax-gatherer, standing far back, would not so much as lift his eyes to Heaven, but kept beating his breast and saying, "`O God,  be reconciled to me, sinner that I am.'
25703	42	18	14	 "I tell you that this man went home more thoroughly absolved from guilt than the other; for every one who uplifts himself will be humbled, but he who humbles himself will be uplifted."
25704	42	18	15	  On one occasion  people also brought with them their infants, for Him to touch them; but the disciples, noticing this, proceeded to find fault with them.
25705	42	18	16	 Jesus however called the infants to Him. "Let the little children come to me," He said; "do not hinder them; for it is to those who are childlike that the Kingdom of God belongs.
25706	42	18	17	 I tell you in solemn truth that, whoever does not receive the Kingdom of God like a little child will certainly not enter it."
25707	42	18	18	  The question was put to Him by a Ruler: "Good Rabbi, what shall I do to inherit the Life of the Ages?"
25708	42	18	19	 "Why do you call me good?" replied Jesus; "there is no one good but One, namely God.
25709	42	18	20	 You know the Commandments: <`Do not commit adultery;' `Do not murder;' `Do not steal;' `Do not lie in giving evidence;' `Honour thy father and thy mother.'">
25710	42	18	21	 "All of those," he replied, "I have kept from my youth."
25711	42	18	22	 On receiving this answer Jesus said to him, "There is still one thing wanting in you. Sell everything you possess and give the money to the poor, and you shall have wealth in Heaven; and then come, follow me."
25712	42	18	23	 But on hearing these words he was deeply sorrowful, for he was exceedingly rich.
25713	42	18	24	 Jesus saw his sorrow, and said, "With how hard a struggle do the possessors of riches ever enter the Kingdom of God!
25714	42	18	25	 Why, it is easier for a camel to go through a  needle's eye than for a rich man to enter the Kingdom of God."
25715	42	18	26	 "Who then can be saved?" exclaimed the hearers.
25716	42	18	27	 "Things impossible with man," He replied, "are possible with God."
25717	42	18	28	 Then Peter said, "See, we have given up our  homes and have followed you."
25718	42	18	29	 "I solemnly tell you," replied Jesus, "that there is no one who has left house or wife, or brothers or parents or children, for the sake of God's Kingdom,
25719	42	18	30	 who shall not certainly receive many times as much  in this life, and in the age that is coming the Life of the Ages."
25720	42	18	31	  Then He drew the Twelve to Him and said, "See, we are going up to Jerusalem, and everything written in the Prophets which refers to the Son of Man will be fulfilled.
25721	42	18	32	 For He will be given up to the Gentiles, and be mocked, outraged and spit upon.
25722	42	18	33	 They will scourge Him and put Him to death, and on the third day He will rise to life again."
25723	42	18	34	 Nothing of this did they understand. The words were a mystery to them, nor could they see what He meant.
25724	42	18	35	  As Jesus came near to Jericho, there was a blind man sitting by the way-side begging.
25725	42	18	36	 He heard a crowd of people going past, and inquired what it all meant.
25726	42	18	37	 "Jesus the Nazarene is passing by," they told him.
25727	42	18	38	 Then, at the top of his voice, he cried out, "Jesus, son of David, take pity on me."
25728	42	18	39	 Those in front reproved him and tried to silence him; but he continued shouting, louder than ever, "Son of David, take pity on me."
25729	42	18	40	 At length Jesus stopped and desired them to bring the man to Him; and when he had come close to Him He asked him,
25730	42	18	41	 "What shall I do for you?" "Sir," he replied, "let me recover my sight."
25731	42	18	42	 "Recover your sight," said Jesus: "your faith has cured you."
25732	42	18	43	 No sooner were the words spoken than the man regained his sight and followed Jesus, giving glory to God; and all the people, seeing it, gave praise to God.
25733	42	19	1	 So He entered Jericho and was passing through the town.
25734	42	19	2	 There was a man there called Zacchaeus, who was the local surveyor of taxes, and was wealthy.
25735	42	19	3	 He was anxious to see what sort of man Jesus was; but he could not because of the crowd, for he was short in stature.
25736	42	19	4	 So he ran on in front and climbed up a mulberry tree to see Him; for He was about to pass that way.
25737	42	19	5	 As soon as Jesus came to the place, He looked up and said to him, "Zacchaeus, come down quickly, for I must stay at your house to-day."
25738	42	19	6	 So he came down in haste, and welcomed Him joyfully.
25739	42	19	7	 When they all saw this, they began to complain with indignation. "He has gone in to be the guest of a notorious sinner!" they said.
25740	42	19	8	 Zacchaeus however stood up, and addressing the Lord said,  "Here and now, Master, I give half my  property to the poor, and if I have unjustly exacted money from any man, I pledge myself to repay to him four times the amount."
25741	42	19	9	 Turning towards him, Jesus replied, "To-day salvation has come to this house, seeing that he too is a son of Abraham.
25742	42	19	10	 For the Son of Man has come to seek and to save that which was lost."
25743	42	19	11	  As they were listening to His words, He went on to teach them by a parable, because He was near to Jerusalem and they supposed that the Kingdom of God was going to appear immediately.
25744	42	19	12	 So He said to them, "A man of noble family travelled to a distant country to obtain the rank of king, and to return.
25745	42	19	13	 And he called ten of his  servants and gave each of them  a pound, instructing them to trade with the money  during his absence.
25746	42	19	14	 "Now his countrymen hated him, and sent a deputation after him to say, `We are not willing that he should become our king.'
25747	42	19	15	 And upon his return, after he had obtained the sovereignty, he ordered those servants to whom he had given the money to be summoned before him, that he might learn their success in trading.
25748	42	19	16	 "So the first came and said, "`Sir, your pound has produced ten pounds more.'
25749	42	19	17	 "`Well done, good servant,' he replied; `because you have been faithful in a very small matter, be in authority over ten towns.'
25750	42	19	18	 "The second came, and said, "`Your pound, Sir, has produced five pounds.'
25751	42	19	19	 "So he said to this one also, "`And you, be the governor of five towns.'
25752	42	19	20	 "The next came. "`Sir,' he said, `here is your pound, which I have kept wrapt up in a cloth.
25753	42	19	21	 For I was afraid of you, because you are a severe man: you take up what you did not lay down, and you reap what you did not sow.'
25754	42	19	22	 "`By your own words,' he replied, `I will judge you, you bad servant. You knew me to be a severe man, taking up what I did not lay down, and reaping what I did not sow:
25755	42	19	23	 why then did you not put my money into a bank, that when I came I might have received it back with interest?
25756	42	19	24	 "And he said to those who stood by, "`Take the pound from him and give it to him who has the ten pounds.'
25757	42	19	25	 ("They said to him, "`Sir, he already has ten pounds.')
25758	42	19	26	 "`I tell you that to every one who has anything, more shall be given; and from him who has not anything, even what he has shall be taken away.
25759	42	19	27	 But as for those enemies of mine who were unwilling that I should become their king, bring them here, and cut them to pieces in my presence.'"
25760	42	19	28	 After thus speaking, He journeyed onward, proceeding up to Jerusalem.
25761	42	19	29	  And when he was come near Bethphage and Bethany, at the Mount called  the Oliveyard, He sent two of the disciples on in front,
25762	42	19	30	 saying to them, "Go into the village facing you. On entering it you will find an ass's foal tied up which no one has ever yet ridden: untie it, and bring it here.
25763	42	19	31	 And if any one asks you, `Why are you untying the colt?' simply say,  `The Master needs it.'"
25764	42	19	32	 So those who were sent went and found things as He had told them.
25765	42	19	33	 And while they were untying the colt the owners called out, "Why are you untying the colt?"
25766	42	19	34	 and they replied,  "The Master needs it."
25767	42	19	35	 Then they brought it to Jesus, and after throwing their outer garments on the colt they placed Jesus on it.
25768	42	19	36	 So He rode on, while they carpeted the road with their garments.
25769	42	19	37	 And when He was now getting near Jerusalem, and descending the Mount of Olives, the whole multitude of the disciples began in their joy to praise God in loud voices for all the mighty deeds they had witnessed.
25770	42	19	38	 <"Blessed is> the King," they cried, <"who comes in the name of the Lord:> in Heaven peace, and glory in the highest realms."
25771	42	19	39	 Thereupon some of the Pharisees in the crowd appealed to Him, saying,  "Rabbi, reprove your disciples."
25772	42	19	40	 "I tell you," He replied, "that if *they* became silent, the very stones would cry out."
25773	42	19	41	 When He came into full view of the city, He wept aloud over it, and exclaimed,
25774	42	19	42	 "O that at this time thou hadst known--yes even thou--what makes peace possible! But now it is hid from thine eyes.
25775	42	19	43	 For the time is coming upon thee when thy foes will throw up around thee  earthworks and a wall, investing thee and hemming thee in on every side.
25776	42	19	44	 And they will dash thee to the ground and thy children within thee, and will not leave one stone upon another within thee; because thou hast not recognized the time of thy visitation."
25777	42	19	45	  Then Jesus entered the Temple and proceeded to drive out the dealers.
25778	42	19	46	 "It is written," He said, <"`And My house shall be the House of Prayer,'> but you have made it <a robbers' cave.">
25779	42	19	47	 And day after day He taught in the Temple, while the High Priests and the Scribes were devising some means of destroying Him, as were also the leading men of the people.
25780	42	19	48	 But they could not find any way of doing it, for the people all hung upon His lips.
25781	42	20	1	  On one of those days while He was teaching the people in the Temple and proclaiming the Good News, the High Priests came upon Him, and the Scribes,
25782	42	20	2	 together with the Elders, and they asked Him, "Tell us, By what authority are you doing these things? And who is it that gave you this authority?"
25783	42	20	3	 "I also will put a question to you, "He said;
25784	42	20	4	 "was John's baptism of Heavenly or of human origin?"
25785	42	20	5	 So they debated the matter with one another. "If we say `Heavenly,'" they argued, "he will say, `Why did you not believe him?'
25786	42	20	6	 And if we say, `human,' the people will all stone us; for they are thoroughly convinced that John was a Prophet."
25787	42	20	7	 And they answered that they did not know the origin of it.
25788	42	20	8	 "Nor will I tell you," said Jesus, "by what authority I do these things."
25789	42	20	9	  Then He proceeded to speak a parable to the people. "There was a man," He said, "who planted a vineyard, let it out to vine-dressers, and went abroad for a considerable time.
25790	42	20	10	 At vintage-time he sent a  servant to the vine-dressers, for them to give him a share of the crop; but the vine-dressers beat him cruelly and sent him away empty-handed.
25791	42	20	11	 Then he sent a second  servant; and him too they beat and ill treated and sent away empty-handed.
25792	42	20	12	 Then again he sent a third; and this one also they wounded and drove away.
25793	42	20	13	 Then the owner of the vineyard said, "`What am I to do? I will send my son--my dearly-loved son: they will probably respect him.'
25794	42	20	14	 "But when the vine-dressers saw him, they discussed the matter with one another, and said, "`This is the heir: let us kill him, that the inheritance may be ours.'
25795	42	20	15	 "So they turned him out of the vineyard and murdered him. What then will the owner of the vineyard do to them?
25796	42	20	16	 He will come and put these vine-dressers to death, and give the vineyard to others."  "God forbid!" exclaimed the hearers.
25797	42	20	17	 He looked at them and said, "What then does that mean which is written, <"`The Stone which the builders rejected has been made the cornerstone'?>
25798	42	20	18	 Every one who falls on that stone will be severely hurt, but on whomsoever it falls, he will be utterly crushed."
25799	42	20	19	 At this the Scribes and the High Priests wanted to lay hands on Him,  then and there; only they were afraid of the people. For they saw that in this parable He had referred to them.
25800	42	20	20	  So, after impatiently watching their opportunity, they sent spies who were to act the part of good and honest men, that they might fasten on some expression of His, so as to hand Him over to the ruling power and the Governor's authority.
25801	42	20	21	 So they put a question to Him.  "Rabbi," they said, "we know that you say and teach what is right and that  you make no distinctions between one man and another, but teach God's way truly.
25802	42	20	22	 Is it allowable to pay a tax to Caesar, or not?"
25803	42	20	23	 But He saw through their knavery and replied,
25804	42	20	24	 "Show me a shilling; whose likeness and inscription does it bear?" "Caesar's," they said.
25805	42	20	25	 "Pay therefore," He replied, "what is Caesar's to Caesar--and what is God's to God."
25806	42	20	26	 There was nothing here that they could lay hold of before the people, and marvelling at His answer they said no more.
25807	42	20	27	  Next some of the Sadducees came forward (who deny that there is a Resurrection), and they asked Him,
25808	42	20	28	  "Rabbi, Moses made it a law for us that if a man's brother should die, leaving a wife but no children, the man shall marry the widow and raise up a family for his brother.
25809	42	20	29	 Now there were seven brothers. The first of them took a wife and died childless.
25810	42	20	30	 The second and the third also took her;
25811	42	20	31	 and all seven, having done the same, left no children when they died.
25812	42	20	32	 Finally the woman also died.
25813	42	20	33	 The woman, then--at the Resurrection--whose wife shall she be? for they all seven married her."
25814	42	20	34	 "The  men of this age," replied Jesus, "marry, and the women are given in marriage.
25815	42	20	35	 But as for those who  shall have been deemed worthy to find a place in that other age and in the Resurrection from among the dead, the men do not marry and the women are not given in marriage.
25816	42	20	36	 For indeed they cannot die again; they are like angels, and are sons of God through being sons of the Resurrection.
25817	42	20	37	 But that the dead  rise to life even Moses clearly  implies in the passage about the Bush, where he calls the Lord <`The God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob.'>
25818	42	20	38	 He is not a God of dead, but of living men, for to Him are all living."
25819	42	20	39	 Then some of the Scribes replied, "Rabbi, you have spoken well."
25820	42	20	40	 From that time,  however, no one ventured to challenge Him with a single question.
25821	42	20	41	  But He asked them, "How is it they say that the Christ is a son of David?
25822	42	20	42	 Why, David himself says in the Book of Psalms, <"`The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at My right hand
25823	42	20	43	 Until I have made thy foes a footstool under they feet.'>
25824	42	20	44	 "David himself therefore calls Him Lord, and how can He be his son?"
25825	42	20	45	  Then, in the hearing of all the people, He said to the disciples,
25826	42	20	46	 "Beware of the Scribes, who like to walk about in long robes, and love to be bowed to in places of public resort and to occupy the best seats in the synagogues or at a dinner party;
25827	42	20	47	 who swallow up the property of widows and mask their wickedness by making long prayers. They will be punished far more severely than others."
25828	42	21	1	  Looking up He saw the people throwing their gifts into the Treasury--the rich people.
25829	42	21	2	 He also saw a poor widow dropping in two farthings,
25830	42	21	3	 and He said, "In truth I tell you that this widow, so poor, has thrown in more than any of them.
25831	42	21	4	 For from what they could well spare they have all of them contributed to the offerings, but she in her need has thrown in all she had to live on."
25832	42	21	5	  When some were remarking about the Temple, how it was embellished with beautiful stones and dedicated gifts, He said,
25833	42	21	6	 "As to these things which you now admire, the time is coming when there will not be one stone left here upon another which will not be pulled down."
25834	42	21	7	  "Rabbi, when will this be?" they asked Him, "and what will be the token given when these things are about to take place?"
25835	42	21	8	 "See to it," He replied, "that you are not misled; for many will come  assuming my name and professing, `I am He,' or saying, `The time is close at hand.' Do not go and follow them.
25836	42	21	9	 But when you hear of wars and turmoils, be not afraid; for these things must happen first, but the end does not come immediately."
25837	42	21	10	 Then He said to them, <"Nation will rise in arms against nation, and kingdom against kingdom.>
25838	42	21	11	 And there will be great earthquakes, and in places famines and pestilence; and there will be terrible sights and wonderful tokens from Heaven.
25839	42	21	12	 "But before all these things happen they will lay hands on you and persecute you. They will deliver you up to synagogues and to prison, and you will be brought before kings and governors for my sake.
25840	42	21	13	 In the end all this will be evidence of your fidelity.
25841	42	21	14	 "Make up your minds, however, not to prepare a defence beforehand,
25842	42	21	15	 for I will give you utterance and wisdom which none of your opponents will be able to withstand or reply to.
25843	42	21	16	 You will be betrayed even by parents, brothers, relatives, friends; and some of you they will put to death.
25844	42	21	17	 You will be the objects of universal hatred because you are called by my name;
25845	42	21	18	 and yet not a hair of your heads shall perish.
25846	42	21	19	 By your patient endurance you will purchase your  lives.
25847	42	21	20	  "But when you see Jerusalem with armies encamping round her on every side, then be certain that her  overthrow is close at hand.
25848	42	21	21	 Then let those who shall be in Judaea escape to the hills; let those who are in the city leave it, and those who are in the country not enter in.
25849	42	21	22	 For those are the <days of vengeance> and  of fulfilling all that is written.
25850	42	21	23	 "Alas for the women who at that time are with child or who have infants; for there will be great distress  in the land, and anger towards this People.
25851	42	21	24	 They will fall  by the sword, or be carried off into slavery among all the Gentiles.  And Jerusalem will be trampled under foot by the  Gentiles, till the appointed times of the  Gentiles have expired.
25852	42	21	25	 "There will be  signs in sun, moon, and stars; and on earth anguish among the nations in their bewilderment at the roaring of the sea and its billows;
25853	42	21	26	 while men's hearts are fainting for fear, and for anxious expectation of what is coming on the world. For <the  forces which control the heavens will be disordered and disturbed.>
25854	42	21	27	 And then will they  see the <Son of Man coming in a cloud>  with great power and glory.
25855	42	21	28	 But when all this is beginning to take place, grieve no longer. Lift up your heads, because your  deliverance is drawing near."
25856	42	21	29	 And He spoke a parable to them. "See," He said, "the fig-tree and all the trees.
25857	42	21	30	 As soon as they have shot out their leaves, you know at a glance that summer is now near.
25858	42	21	31	 So also, when you see these things happening, you may be sure that the Kingdom of God is near.
25859	42	21	32	 I tell you in solemn truth that the present generation will certainly not pass away without all these things having first taken place.
25860	42	21	33	 Earth and sky will pass away, but it is certain that my words will not pass away.
25861	42	21	34	 "But take heed to yourselves, lest your  souls be weighed down with  self-indulgence and drunkenness or the anxieties of this life, and that day come upon you, suddenly, like a falling trap;
25862	42	21	35	 for it will come on all dwellers on the face of the whole  earth.
25863	42	21	36	 But beware of slumbering; and every moment pray that you may be fully strengthened to escape from all these coming evils, and to take your stand in the presence of the Son of Man."
25864	42	21	37	  His habit at this time was to teach in the Temple by day, but to go out and spend the night on the Mount called  the Oliveyard.
25865	42	21	38	 And all the people came to Him in the Temple, early in the morning, to listen to Him.
25866	42	22	1	  Meanwhile the Festival of the Unleavened Bread, called the Passover, was approaching,
25867	42	22	2	 and the High Priests and the Scribes were contriving how to destroy Him.  But they feared the people.
25868	42	22	3	  Satan, however, entered into Judas (the man called Iscariot) who was one of the Twelve.
25869	42	22	4	 He went and conferred with the High Priests and  Commanders as to how he should deliver Him up to them.
25870	42	22	5	 This gave them great pleasure, and they agreed to pay him.
25871	42	22	6	 He accepted their offer, and then looked out for an opportunity to betray Him when the people were not there.
25872	42	22	7	  When the day of the Unleavened Bread came--the day for the Passover lamb to be sacrificed--
25873	42	22	8	 Jesus sent Peter and John with instructions. "Go," He said, "and prepare the Passover for us, that we may eat it."
25874	42	22	9	 "Where shall we prepare it?" they asked.
25875	42	22	10	 "You will no sooner have entered the city," He replied, "than you will meet a man carrying a pitcher of water. Follow him into the house to which he goes,
25876	42	22	11	 and say to the master of the house, "`The  Rabbi asks you, Where is the room where I can eat the Passover with my disciples?'
25877	42	22	12	 "And he will show you a large furnished room upstairs. There make your preparations."
25878	42	22	13	 So they went and found all as He had told them; and they got the Passover ready.
25879	42	22	14	  When the time was come, and He had taken His place at table, and the Apostles with Him,
25880	42	22	15	 He said to them, "Earnestly have I longed to eat this Passover with you before I suffer;
25881	42	22	16	  for I tell you that I certainly shall not eat one again till its full meaning has been brought out in the Kingdom of God."
25882	42	22	17	 Then, having  received the cup and given thanks, He said, "Take this and share it among yourselves;
25883	42	22	18	 for I tell you that from this time I will never drink the  produce of the vine till the Kingdom of God has come."
25884	42	22	19	  Then, taking a Passover biscuit, He gave thanks and broke it, and gave it to them, saying, "This is my body which  is being given on your behalf: this do in remembrance of me."
25885	42	22	20	 He gave them the cup in like manner, when  the meal was over. "This cup," He said, "is the new Covenant ratified  by my blood which  is to be poured out on your behalf.
25886	42	22	21	  Yet the hand of him who is betraying me is at the table with me.
25887	42	22	22	 For indeed the Son of Man goes on His way--His pre-destined way; yet alas for that man who is betraying Him!"
25888	42	22	23	 Thereupon they began to discuss with one another which of them it could possibly be who was about to do this.
25889	42	22	24	  There arose also a dispute among them which of them should be  regarded as greatest.
25890	42	22	25	 But He said to them, "The kings of the Gentiles are their masters, and those who exercise authority over them are called Benefactors.
25891	42	22	26	 With you it is not so; but let the greatest among you be as the younger, and the leader be like him who serves.
25892	42	22	27	 For which is the greater--he who sits at table, or he who waits on him? Is it not he who sits at table? But my position among you is that of one who waits on others.
25893	42	22	28	 You however have remained with me amid my trials;
25894	42	22	29	 and I covenant to give you, as my Father has covenanted to give me, a Kingdom--
25895	42	22	30	 so that you shall eat and drink at my table in my Kingdom, and sit on thrones as judges over the twelve tribes of Israel.
25896	42	22	31	  "Simon, Simon, I tell you that Satan has  obtained permission to have all of you to sift as wheat is sifted.
25897	42	22	32	 But *I* have prayed  for *you* that your faith may not fail, and  you, when at last you have come back to your true self, must strengthen your brethren."
25898	42	22	33	 "Master," replied Peter, "with you I am ready to go both to prison and to death."
25899	42	22	34	 "I tell you, Peter," said Jesus, "that the cock will not crow to-day till you have three times denied that you know me."
25900	42	22	35	 Then He asked them, "When I sent you out without purse or bag or shoes, was there anything you needed?" "No, nothing," they replied.
25901	42	22	36	 "But now," said He, "let the one who has a purse take it, and he who has a bag must do the same. And let him who has no sword sell his outer garment and  buy one.
25902	42	22	37	 For I tell you that those words of Scripture must yet find their fulfilment in me: <`And He was reckoned among the lawless';> for indeed that saying about me has its accomplishment."
25903	42	22	38	 "Master, here are two swords," they exclaimed. "That is enough," He replied.
25904	42	22	39	  On going out, He proceeded as usual to the Mount of Olives, and His disciples followed Him.
25905	42	22	40	  But when He arrived at the place, He said to them,  "Pray that you may not come into temptation."
25906	42	22	41	 But He Himself withdrew from them about a stone's throw, and knelt down and prayed repeatedly, saying,
25907	42	22	42	 "Father, if it be Thy will,  take this  cup away from me; yet not my will but Thine be done!"
25908	42	22	43	 And there appeared to Him an angel from Heaven, strengthening Him;
25909	42	22	44	 while He--an agony of distress having come upon Him--prayed all the more with intense earnestness, and His sweat became like clots of blood dropping on the ground.
25910	42	22	45	 When He rose from his prayer and came to His disciples, He found them sleeping for sorrow.
25911	42	22	46	 "Why are you sleeping?" He said;  "stand up; and pray that you may not come into temptation."
25912	42	22	47	  While He was still speaking there came a crowd with Judas, already mentioned as one of the Twelve, at their head. He went up to Jesus to kiss Him.
25913	42	22	48	 "Judas," said Jesus, "are you betraying the Son of Man with a kiss?"
25914	42	22	49	 Those who were about Him, seeing what was likely to happen, asked Him, "Master, shall we strike with the sword?"
25915	42	22	50	 And one of them struck a blow at the High Priest's  servant and cut off his right ear.
25916	42	22	51	 "Permit me thus far," said Jesus. And He touched the ear and healed it.
25917	42	22	52	 Then Jesus said to the High Priests and Commanders of the Temple and Elders, who had come to arrest Him, "Have you come out as if to fight with a robber, with swords and cudgels?
25918	42	22	53	 While day after day I was with you in the Temple, you did not lay hands upon me; but to you belongs this hour--and the power of darkness."
25919	42	22	54	  And they arrested Him and led Him away, and brought Him to the High Priest's house, while Peter followed a good way behind.
25920	42	22	55	 And when they had lighted a fire in the middle of the court and had seated themselves in a group round it, Peter was sitting among them,
25921	42	22	56	 when a maidservant saw him sitting  by the fire, and, looking fixedly at him, she said, "This man also was with him."
25922	42	22	57	 But he denied it, and declared, "Woman, I do not know him."
25923	42	22	58	 Shortly afterwards a man saw him and said, "You, too, are one of them." "No, man, I am not," said Peter.
25924	42	22	59	 After an interval of about an hour some one else stoutly maintained: "Certainly this fellow also was with him, for in fact he is a Galilaean."
25925	42	22	60	 "Man, I don't know what you mean," replied Peter. No sooner had he spoken than a cock crowed.
25926	42	22	61	 The Master turned and looked on Peter; and Peter recollected the Master's words, how He had said to him, "This very day, before the cock crows, you will disown me three times."
25927	42	22	62	 And he went out and wept aloud bitterly.
25928	42	22	63	  Meanwhile the men who held Jesus in custody repeatedly beat Him in cruel sport,
25929	42	22	64	 or blindfolded Him, and then challenged Him. "Prove to us," they said, "that you are a prophet, by telling us who it was that struck you."
25930	42	22	65	 And they said many other insulting things to Him.
25931	42	22	66	 As soon as it was day, the whole body of the Elders, both High Priests and Scribes, assembled. Then He was brought into their Sanhedrin, and they asked Him,
25932	42	22	67	 "Are you the Christ? Tell us." "If I tell you," He replied, "you will certainly not believe;
25933	42	22	68	 and if I ask you questions, you will certainly not answer.
25934	42	22	69	 But from this time forward the Son of Man will be seated at the right hand of God's omnipotence."
25935	42	22	70	 Thereupon they cried out with one voice, "You, then, are the Son of God?" "It is as you say," He answered;  "I am He."
25936	42	22	71	 "What need have we of further evidence?" they said; "for we ourselves have heard it from his own lips."
25937	42	23	1	  Then the whole assembly rose and brought Him to Pilate, and began to accuse Him.
25938	42	23	2	 "We have found this man," they said, "an agitator among our nation, forbidding the payment of tribute to Caesar, and claiming to be himself  an anointed king."
25939	42	23	3	  Then Pilate asked Him, "You, then, are the King of the Jews?" "It is as you say," He replied.
25940	42	23	4	 Pilate said to the High Priests and to the crowd, "I can find no crime in this man."
25941	42	23	5	 But they violently insisted. "He stirs up the people," they said, "throughout all Judaea with His teaching--even from Galilee (where He first started) to this city."
25942	42	23	6	 On hearing this, Pilate inquired, "Is this man a Galilaean?"
25943	42	23	7	 And learning that He belonged to Herod's jurisdiction he  sent Him to Herod, for he too was in Jerusalem at that time.
25944	42	23	8	 To Herod the sight of Jesus was a great gratification, for, for a long time, he had been wanting to see Him, because he had heard so much about Him. He hoped also to see some  miracle performed by Him.
25945	42	23	9	 So he put a number of questions to Him, but Jesus gave him no reply.
25946	42	23	10	 Meanwhile the High Priests and the Scribes were standing there and vehemently accusing Him.
25947	42	23	11	 Then, laughing to scorn the claims of Jesus, Herod (and his soldiers with him) made sport of Him, dressed Him in a gorgeous costume, and sent Him back to Pilate.
25948	42	23	12	 And on that very day Herod and Pilate became friends again, for they had been for some time at enmity.
25949	42	23	13	 Then calling together the High Priests and the Rulers and the people, Pilate said,
25950	42	23	14	 "You have brought this man to me on a charge of corrupting the loyalty of the people. But, you see, I have examined him in your presence and have discovered in the man no ground for the accusations which you bring against him.
25951	42	23	15	 No, nor does Herod; for  he has sent him back to us; and, you see, there is nothing he has done that deserves death.
25952	42	23	16	 I will therefore give him a light punishment and release him."
25953	42	23	17	  []
25954	42	23	18	  Then the whole multitude burst out into a shout. "Away with this man," they said, "and release Barabbas to us"
25955	42	23	19	 --Barabbas! who had been lodged in jail for some time in connexion with a riot which had occurred in the city, and for murder.
25956	42	23	20	 But Pilate once more addressed them, wishing to set Jesus free.
25957	42	23	21	 They, however, persistently shouted, "Crucify, crucify him!"
25958	42	23	22	 A third time he appealed to them:  "Why, what crime has the man committed? I have discovered in him nothing that deserves death. I will therefore give him a light punishment and release him."
25959	42	23	23	 But they urgently insisted, demanding with frantic outcries that He should be crucified; and their clamour prevailed.
25960	42	23	24	  So Pilate gave judgement, yielding to their demand.
25961	42	23	25	 The man who was lying in prison charged with riot and murder and for whom they clamoured he set free, but Jesus he gave up to be dealt with as they desired.
25962	42	23	26	  As soon as they led Him away, they laid hold on one Simon, a Cyrenaean, who was coming in from the country, and on his shoulders they put the cross, for him to carry it behind Jesus.
25963	42	23	27	 A vast crowd of the people also followed Him, and of women who were beating their breasts and wailing for Him.
25964	42	23	28	 But Jesus turned towards them and said, "Daughters of Jerusalem, weep not for me, but weep for yourselves and for your children.
25965	42	23	29	 For a time is coming when they will say, `Blessed are the women who never bore children, and the breasts which have never given nourishment.'
25966	42	23	30	  Then will they begin to say to the mountains, `Fall on us;' and to the hills, `Cover us.'
25967	42	23	31	 For if they are doing these things in the case of the green tree, what will be done in that of the dry?"
25968	42	23	32	 They brought also two others, criminals, to put them to death with Him.
25969	42	23	33	  When they reached the place called `The Skull,' there they nailed Him to the cross, and the criminals also, one at His right hand and one at His left.
25970	42	23	34	 Jesus prayed, "Father, forgive them, for they know not what they are doing." And they divided His garments among them, drawing lots for them;
25971	42	23	35	  and the people stood looking on. The Rulers, too, repeatedly uttered their bitter taunts. "This fellow," they said, "saved others: let him save himself, if he is God's Anointed, the Chosen One."
25972	42	23	36	 And the soldiers also made sport of Him, coming and offering Him  sour wine and saying,
25973	42	23	37	 "Are *you* the King of the Jews? Save yourself, then!"
25974	42	23	38	 There was moreover a writing over His head: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.
25975	42	23	39	 Now one of the criminals who had been crucified insulted Him, saying, "Are not you the Christ? Save yourself and us."
25976	42	23	40	 But the other, answering, reproved him.  "Do you also not fear God," he said, "when you are actually suffering the same punishment?
25977	42	23	41	 And we indeed are suffering justly, for we are receiving due requital for what we have done. But He has done nothing amiss."
25978	42	23	42	 And he said, "Jesus, remember me when you come  in your Kingdom."
25979	42	23	43	 "I tell you in solemn truth," replied Jesus, "that  this very day you shall be with me in Paradise."
25980	42	23	44	  It was now about noon, and a darkness came over the whole country till three o'clock in the  afternoon.
25981	42	23	45	  The sun was darkened, and the curtain of the Sanctuary was torn down the middle,
25982	42	23	46	 and Jesus cried out in a loud voice, and said, "Father, to Thy hands I entrust my spirit." And after uttering these words He yielded up His spirit.
25983	42	23	47	 The Captain, seeing what had happened, gave glory to God, saying, "Beyond question this man was innocent."
25984	42	23	48	 And all the crowds that had come together to this sight, after seeing all that had occurred, returned to the city beating their breasts.
25985	42	23	49	 But all His acquaintances, and the women who had been His followers after leaving Galilee, continued standing at a distance and looking on.
25986	42	23	50	  There was a member of the Council of the name of Joseph, a kind-hearted and upright man,
25987	42	23	51	 who came from the Jewish town of Arimathaea and was awaiting the coming of the Kingdom of God. He had not concurred in the design or action of the Council,
25988	42	23	52	 and now he went to Pilate and asked for the body of Jesus.
25989	42	23	53	 Then, taking it down, he wrapped it in a  linen sheet and laid it in a tomb in the rock, where no one else had yet been put.
25990	42	23	54	 It was the Preparation Day, and the Sabbath was near at hand.
25991	42	23	55	 The women--those who had come with Jesus from Galilee--followed close behind, and saw the tomb and how His body was placed.
25992	42	23	56	 Then they returned, and prepared spices and perfumes. On the Sabbath they rested in obedience to the Commandment.
25993	42	24	1	  And, on the first day of the week, at early dawn, they came to the tomb bringing the spices they had prepared.
25994	42	24	2	 But they found the stone rolled back from the tomb,
25995	42	24	3	 and on entering they found that the body  of the Lord Jesus was not there.
25996	42	24	4	  At this they were in great perplexity, when  suddenly there stood by them two men whose raiment  flashed like lightning.
25997	42	24	5	 The women were terrified; but, as they stood with their faces bowed to the ground, the men said to them, "Why do you search among the dead for Him who is living?
25998	42	24	6	 He is not here. He has come back to life. Remember how He spoke to you while He was still in Galilee,
25999	42	24	7	 when He told you that the Son of Man must be betrayed into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and on the third day rise again."
26000	42	24	8	 Then they remembered His words,
26001	42	24	9	  and returning from the tomb they reported all this to the Eleven and to all the rest.
26002	42	24	10	 The women were Mary of  Magdala, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James; and they and the rest of the women related all this to the Apostles.
26003	42	24	11	 But the whole story seemed to them an idle tale; they could not believe the women.
26004	42	24	12	  Peter, however, rose and ran to the tomb. Stooping and looking in, he saw nothing but the  linen cloths: so he went away to his own home, wondering at what had happened.
26005	42	24	13	  On that same day two of the disciples were walking to Emmaus, a village seven or eight miles from Jerusalem,
26006	42	24	14	 and were conversing about all these recent events;
26007	42	24	15	 and, in the midst of their conversation and discussion, Jesus Himself came and joined them,
26008	42	24	16	 though they were prevented from recognizing Him.
26009	42	24	17	 "What is the subject," He asked them, "on which you are talking so earnestly, as you  walk?" And they stood still, looking full of sorrow.
26010	42	24	18	 Then one of them, named Cleopas, answered,  "Are you a stranger lodging alone in Jerusalem, that you have known nothing of the things that have lately happened in the city?"
26011	42	24	19	 "What things?" He asked. "The things about Jesus the Nazarene," they said, "who was a Prophet powerful in work and word before God and all the people;
26012	42	24	20	 and how our High Priests and Rulers delivered Him up to be sentenced to death, and crucified Him.
26013	42	24	21	 But we were hoping that it was He who was about to ransom Israel. Yes, and moreover it was  the day before yesterday that these things happened.
26014	42	24	22	 And, besides, some of the women of our company have amazed us. They went to the tomb at daybreak,
26015	42	24	23	 and, finding that His body was not there, they came and declared to us that they had also seen a vision of angels who said that He was alive.
26016	42	24	24	 Thereupon some of our party went to the tomb and found things just as the women had said; but Jesus Himself they did not see."
26017	42	24	25	 "O dull-witted men," He replied, "with  minds so slow to believe all that the Prophets have spoken!
26018	42	24	26	 Was there not a necessity for the Christ thus to suffer, and then enter into His glory?"
26019	42	24	27	 And,  beginning with Moses and all the Prophets, He  explained to them the passages in Scripture which refer to Himself.
26020	42	24	28	 When they had come near the village to which they were going, He appeared to be going further.
26021	42	24	29	 But they pressed Him to remain with them. "Because," said they, "it is getting towards evening, and the day is nearly over." So He went in to stay with them.
26022	42	24	30	 But as soon as He had sat down with them, and had taken the  bread and had blessed and broken it, and was handing it to them,
26023	42	24	31	 their eyes were opened and they recognized Him. But He vanished from them.
26024	42	24	32	 "Were not our hearts," they said to one another, "burning within us while He talked to us on the way and explained the Scriptures to us?"
26025	42	24	33	 So they rose and without an hour's delay returned to Jerusalem, and found the Eleven and the rest met together, who said  to them,
26026	42	24	34	 "Yes, it is true: the Master has come back to life. He has been seen by Simon."
26027	42	24	35	 Then they related what had happened on the way, and how He had been recognized by them in the breaking of the  bread.
26028	42	24	36	  While they were thus talking, He Himself stood in their midst  and said, "Peace be to you!"
26029	42	24	37	 Startled, and in the utmost alarm, they thought they were looking at a spirit;
26030	42	24	38	 but He said to them, "Why such alarm? And why are there such questionings in your minds?
26031	42	24	39	 See my hands and my feet--it is my very self. Feel me and see, for a spirit has not flesh and bones as you see I have."
26032	42	24	40	  And then He showed them His hands and His feet.
26033	42	24	41	 But, while they still could not believe it for joy and were full of astonishment, He asked them, "Have you any food here?"
26034	42	24	42	 And they gave Him a piece of roasted  fish,
26035	42	24	43	 and He took it and ate it in their presence.
26036	42	24	44	  And He said to them, "This is what I told you while I was still with you--that everything must be fulfilled that is written in the Law of Moses and in the Prophets and the Psalms concerning me."
26037	42	24	45	 Then He opened their minds to understand the Scriptures,
26038	42	24	46	 and He said, "Thus it is written that the Christ would suffer and on the third day rise again from among the dead;
26039	42	24	47	 and that proclamation would be made, in His name, of repentance and forgiveness of sins to all the nations, beginning in Jerusalem.
26040	42	24	48	 You are witnesses as to these things.
26041	42	24	49	 And remember that I am about to send out my Father's promised gift to rest upon you. But, as for you,  wait patiently in the city until you are clothed with power from on high."
26042	42	24	50	 And He brought them out  to within view of Bethany, and then lifted up His hands and blessed them.
26043	42	24	51	 And while He was blessing them, He parted from them and was carried up into Heaven.
26044	42	24	52	 They worshipped Him, and returned to Jerusalem with great joy.
26045	42	24	53	 Afterwards they were continually  in attendance at the Temple,  blessing God.
26046	43	1	1	  In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
26047	43	1	2	 He was in the beginning with God.
26048	43	1	3	 All things came into being  through Him, and apart from Him nothing  that exists came into being.
26049	43	1	4	 In Him was Life, and that Life was the Light of men.
26050	43	1	5	 The Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness has not  overpowered it.
26051	43	1	6	 There was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
26052	43	1	7	 He came as a witness, in order that he might give testimony concerning the Light--so that all might believe through him.
26053	43	1	8	 He was not the Light, but he  existed that he might give testimony concerning the Light.
26054	43	1	9	 The true Light was that which illumines  every man by its coming into the world.
26055	43	1	10	  He was in the world, and the world came into existence through Him, and the world did not recognize Him.
26056	43	1	11	 He came to the things that were His own, and His own people gave Him no welcome.
26057	43	1	12	 But all who have received Him, to them--that is, to those who trust in His name--He has given the privilege of becoming children of God;
26058	43	1	13	 who were begotten as such not  by  human descent, nor through an impulse  of their own nature, nor through the will of  a human father, but from God.
26059	43	1	14	 And the Word came in the flesh, and  lived for a time in our midst, so that we saw His glory--the glory as of the Father's  only Son, sent from His presence. He was full of grace and truth.
26060	43	1	15	 John gave testimony concerning Him and cried aloud, saying, "This is He of whom I said, `He who is coming after me has been put before me,' for He was before me."
26061	43	1	16	 For He it is from whose fulness we have all received, and grace upon grace.
26062	43	1	17	 For the Law was given through Moses; grace and truth came through Jesus Christ.
26063	43	1	18	 No human eye has ever seen God:  the only Son, who is  in the Father's bosom--He has made Him known.
26064	43	1	19	 This also is John's testimony, when the Jews sent to him a deputation of Priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him who he was.
26065	43	1	20	 He avowed--he did not conceal the truth, but avowed, "I am not the Christ."
26066	43	1	21	 "What then?" they inquired; "are you Elijah?" "I am not," he said. "Are you the Prophet?" "No," he answered.
26067	43	1	22	 So they pressed the question. "Who are you?" they said--"that we may take an answer to those who sent us. What account do you give of yourself?"
26068	43	1	23	 "I am <the voice,"> he replied, <"of one crying aloud, `Make straight the Lord's way  in the Desert,'> fulfilling the words of the Prophet Isaiah."
26069	43	1	24	 They were Pharisees who had been sent.
26070	43	1	25	 Again they questioned him. "Why then do you baptize," they said, "if you are neither the Christ nor Elijah nor the Prophet?"
26071	43	1	26	 "I baptize in water only," John answered, "but in your midst stands One whom you do not know--
26072	43	1	27	 He who is to come after me, and whose sandal-strap I am not worthy to unfasten."
26073	43	1	28	 This conversation took place at Bethany beyond the Jordan, where John was baptizing.
26074	43	1	29	 The next day John saw Jesus coming towards him and exclaimed,  "Look, that is the Lamb of God who is to take away the sin of the world!
26075	43	1	30	 This is He about whom I said, `After me is to come One who has been put before me, because He was before me.'
26076	43	1	31	 I did not yet know Him; but that He may be openly shown to Israel is the reason why I have come baptizing in water."
26077	43	1	32	 John also gave testimony by stating:  "I have seen the Spirit coming down like a dove out of Heaven; and it remained upon Him.
26078	43	1	33	 I did not yet know Him, but He who sent me to baptize in water said to me, "`The One on whom you see the Spirit coming down, and remaining, He it is who baptizes in the Holy Spirit.'
26079	43	1	34	 "This  I have seen, and I have become a witness that He is the Son of God."
26080	43	1	35	 Again the next day John was standing with two of his disciples,
26081	43	1	36	 when he saw Jesus passing by, and said, "Look! that is the Lamb of God!"
26082	43	1	37	 The two disciples heard his exclamation, and they followed Jesus.
26083	43	1	38	 Then Jesus turned round, and seeing them following He asked them, "What is your wish?"  "Rabbi," they replied--`Rabbi' means `Teacher' --"where are you staying?"
26084	43	1	39	 "Come and you shall see," He said. So they went and saw where He was staying, and they remained and spent that day with Him. It was then about  ten o'clock in the morning.
26085	43	1	40	 Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, was one of the two who heard John's exclamation and followed Jesus.
26086	43	1	41	 He first found his own brother Simon, and said to him, "We have found the Messiah!" --that is to say,  the Anointed One.
26087	43	1	42	 He brought him to Jesus. Jesus looked at him and said, "You are Simon, son of John: you shall be called  Cephas" --that is to say, Peter (or `Rock').
26088	43	1	43	 The next day, having decided to leave Bethany and go into Galilee, Jesus found Philip, and invited him to follow Him.
26089	43	1	44	 (Now Philip came from Bethsaida,  the same town as Andrew and Peter.)
26090	43	1	45	 Then Philip found Nathanael, and said to him, "We have found him about whom Moses in the Law wrote, as well as the Prophets--Jesus, the son of Joseph, a man of Nazareth."
26091	43	1	46	 "Can anything good come out of Nazareth?" replied Nathanael. "Come and see," said Philip.
26092	43	1	47	 Jesus saw Nathanael approaching, and said of him, "Look! here is a true Israelite, in whom there is no  deceitfulness!"
26093	43	1	48	 "How do you know me?" Nathanael asked. "Before Philip called you," said Jesus, "when you were under the fig-tree I saw you."
26094	43	1	49	 "Rabbi," cried Nathanael, "you are the Son of God, you are Israel's King!"
26095	43	1	50	 "Because I said to you, `I saw you under the fig-tree,'" replied Jesus, "do you believe? You shall see greater things than that."
26096	43	1	51	 "I tell you all  in most solemn truth," He added,  "that you shall see Heaven opened wide, and God's angels going up, and coming down to the Son of Man."
26097	43	2	1	  Two days later there was a wedding at Cana in Galilee, and the mother of Jesus was there,
26098	43	2	2	 and Jesus also was invited and His disciples.
26099	43	2	3	 Now the wine ran short; whereupon the mother of Jesus said to Him, "They have no wine."
26100	43	2	4	  "Leave the matter in my hands," He replied;  "the time for me to act has not yet come."
26101	43	2	5	 His mother said to the attendants, "Whatever he tells you to do,  do it."
26102	43	2	6	 Now there were six stone jars standing there (in accordance with the Jewish regulations for purification), each large enough to hold twenty gallons or more.
26103	43	2	7	 Jesus said to the attendants, "Fill the jars with water." And they filled them to the brim.
26104	43	2	8	 Then He said, "Now, take some out, and carry it to the President of the feast."
26105	43	2	9	 So they carried some to him. And no sooner had the President tasted the water now turned into wine, than--not knowing where it came from, though the attendants who had drawn the water knew--he called to the bridegroom
26106	43	2	10	 and said to him, "It is usual to put on the good wine first, and when people have drunk freely, then that which is inferior. But you have kept the good wine till now."
26107	43	2	11	 This, the first of His  miracles, Jesus performed at Cana in Galilee, and thus displayed His glorious power; and His disciples believed in Him.
26108	43	2	12	 Afterwards He went down to Capernaum--He, and His mother, and His brothers, and His disciples; and they made a short stay there.
26109	43	2	13	 But the Jewish Passover was approaching, and for this Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
26110	43	2	14	 And He found in the Temple the dealers in cattle and sheep and in pigeons, and the money-changers sitting there.
26111	43	2	15	 So He plaited a whip of  rushes, and drove all--both sheep and bullocks--out of the Temple. The small coin of the brokers He upset on the ground and overturned their tables.
26112	43	2	16	 And to the pigeon-dealers He said, "Take these things away. Do not turn my Father's house into a market."
26113	43	2	17	 This recalled to His disciples the words of Scripture, <"My zeal for Thy House will consume me.">
26114	43	2	18	 So the Jews  asked Him, "What  proof of your authority do you exhibit to us, seeing that you do these things?"
26115	43	2	19	 "Demolish this Sanctuary," said Jesus, "and in three days I will rebuild it."
26116	43	2	20	 "It has taken forty-six years," replied the Jews, "to build this Sanctuary, and will you rebuild it in three days?"
26117	43	2	21	 But He was speaking of the Sanctuary of His body.
