26118	43	2	22	 When however He had risen from among the dead, His disciples recollected that He  had said this; and they believed the Scripture and the  teaching which Jesus had given them.
26119	43	2	23	 Now when He was in Jerusalem,  at the Festival of the Passover, many  became believers  in Him through watching the miracles He performed.
26120	43	2	24	 But for His part, Jesus did not trust Himself to them, because He knew them all,
26121	43	2	25	 and did not need any one's testimony concerning  a man, for He of Himself knew what was in the man.
26122	43	3	1	 Now there was one of the Pharisees whose name was Nicodemus--a ruler among the Jews.
26123	43	3	2	 He came to Jesus by night and said, "Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher from God; for no one can do these miracles which you are doing, unless God is with him.
26124	43	3	3	 "In most solemn truth I tell you," answered Jesus, "that unless a man is born  anew he cannot see the Kingdom of God."
26125	43	3	4	 "How is it possible," Nicodemus asked, "for a man to be born when he is old? Can he a second time enter his mother's womb and be born?"
26126	43	3	5	 "In most solemn truth I tell you," replied Jesus, "that unless a man is  born of water  and the Spirit, he cannot enter the Kingdom of God.
26127	43	3	6	  Whatever has been  born of the flesh is flesh, and whatever has been born of the Spirit is spirit.
26128	43	3	7	 Do not be astonished at my telling you, `You must all be born anew.'
26129	43	3	8	  The wind blows where it chooses, and you hear its  sound, but you do not know where it comes from or where it is going. So is it with every one who has been born of the Spirit."
26130	43	3	9	 "How is all this possible?" asked Nicodemus.
26131	43	3	10	 "Are you," replied Jesus, "`the  Teacher of Israel,' and yet do you not understand these things?
26132	43	3	11	 In most solemn truth I tell you that  we speak what we know, and give testimony of that of which we  were eye-witnesses, and yet you all reject our testimony.
26133	43	3	12	 If I have told you earthly things and none of you believe me, how will you believe me if I tell you of things in Heaven?
26134	43	3	13	  There is no one who has gone up to Heaven, but there is One who has come down from Heaven, namely the Son of Man whose home is in Heaven.
26135	43	3	14	 And just as Moses lifted high the serpent in the Desert, so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
26136	43	3	15	 in order that every one who trusts in Him may have the  Life of the Ages."
26137	43	3	16	  For so  greatly did God love the world that He gave His  only Son, that every one who trusts in Him may not perish but may have the Life of Ages.
26138	43	3	17	 For God  did not send His Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him.
26139	43	3	18	 He who trusts in Him does not come up for judgement. He who does not trust has already received sentence, because he  has not his trust resting on the name of God's only Son.
26140	43	3	19	 And this is the  test by which men  are judged--the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness more than they loved the Light, because their deeds were wicked.
26141	43	3	20	 For every wrongdoer hates the light, and does not come to the light, for fear his actions should be exposed and condemned.
26142	43	3	21	 But he who does  what is honest and right comes to the light, in order that his actions may be plainly shown to have been done  in God.
26143	43	3	22	 After this Jesus and His disciples went into Judaea; and there He made a stay in company with them and baptized.
26144	43	3	23	 And John too was baptizing at Aenon, near Salim, because there were many  pools of water there; and people came and received baptism.
26145	43	3	24	 (For John was not yet in prison.)
26146	43	3	25	 As the result, a discussion having arisen on the part of John's disciples with a Jew about purification,
26147	43	3	26	 they came to John and reported to him, "Rabbi, he who was with you on the other side of the Jordan and to whom you bore testimony is now baptizing, and  great numbers of people are resorting to him."
26148	43	3	27	 "A man cannot obtain anything," replied John, "unless it has been granted to him from Heaven.
26149	43	3	28	 You yourselves can bear witness to my having said, `I am not the Christ,' but  `I am His appointed forerunner.'
26150	43	3	29	 He who has the bride is the bridegroom; and the bridegroom's friend who stands by his side and listens to him, rejoices heartily on account of the bridegroom's happiness. Therefore this joy of mine is now complete.
26151	43	3	30	 He must grow greater, but I must grow less.
26152	43	3	31	 He who  comes from above is above all. He whose origin is from the earth is not only himself from the earth, his teaching also is from the earth. He who comes from Heaven  is above all.
26153	43	3	32	 What He  has seen and heard, to that He bears witness; but His testimony no one receives.
26154	43	3	33	 Any man who has received His testimony has  solemnly declared that God is true.
26155	43	3	34	  For He whom God has sent speaks God's words; for God does not give the Spirit  with limitations."
26156	43	3	35	  The Father loves the Son and has entrusted everything to His hands.
26157	43	3	36	 He who  believes in the Son has the Life of the Ages; he who  disobeys the Son will not  enter into Life, but God's anger remains upon him.
26158	43	4	1	 Now as soon as the Master was aware that the Pharisees had heard it said, "Jesus is gaining and baptizing more disciples than John"--
26159	43	4	2	 though Jesus Himself did not baptize them, but His disciples did--
26160	43	4	3	 He left Judaea and returned to Galilee.
26161	43	4	4	 His road lay through Samaria,
26162	43	4	5	 and so He came to Sychar, a town in Samaria near the piece of land that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
26163	43	4	6	 Jacob's  Well was there: and accordingly Jesus, tired out with His journey, sat down by the well to rest. It was about  six o'clock in the evening.
26164	43	4	7	 Presently there came a woman of Samaria to draw water. Jesus asked her to give Him some water;
26165	43	4	8	 for His disciples were gone to the town to buy provisions.
26166	43	4	9	 "How is it," replied the woman, "that a Jew like you asks me, who am a woman and a Samaritan, for water?"  (For Jews have no dealings with Samaritans.)
26167	43	4	10	  "If you had known God's free gift," replied Jesus, "and who it is that said to you, `Give me some water,' you would have asked Him, and He would have given you living water."
26168	43	4	11	 "Sir," she said, "you have nothing to draw with, and the  well is deep; so where can you get the living water from?
26169	43	4	12	 Are you greater than our forefather Jacob, who gave us the well, and himself drank from it, as did also his sons and his cattle?"
26170	43	4	13	 "Every one," replied Jesus, "who drinks any of this water will be thirsty again;
26171	43	4	14	 but whoever drinks any of the water that I shall give him will never, never thirst. But the water that I shall give him will become a fountain within him of water  springing up  for  the Life of the Ages."
26172	43	4	15	 "Sir," said the woman, "give me that water, that I may never be thirsty, nor continually come all the way here to draw from the well."
26173	43	4	16	 "Go and call your husband," said Jesus; "and come back."
26174	43	4	17	 "I have no husband," she replied. "You rightly  say that you have no husband," said Jesus;
26175	43	4	18	 "for you have had five husbands, and the man you have at present is not your husband. You have spoken the truth in saying that."
26176	43	4	19	 "Sir," replied the woman, "I see that you are a Prophet.
26177	43	4	20	 Our forefathers worshipped on this mountain, but you Jews say that the place where people must worship is in Jerusalem."
26178	43	4	21	  "Believe me," said Jesus, "the time is coming when you will worship the Father neither on this mountain nor in Jerusalem.
26179	43	4	22	 You worship  One of whom you know nothing. We worship One whom we know; for salvation comes from the Jews.
26180	43	4	23	 But a time is coming--nay, has already come--when the true worshippers will worship the Father  with true spiritual worship; for indeed the Father desires  such worshippers.
26181	43	4	24	 God is  Spirit; and those who worship Him must bring Him true spiritual worship."
26182	43	4	25	 "I know," replied the woman, "that Messiah is coming--`the  Christ,' as He is called. When He has come, He will tell us everything."
26183	43	4	26	 "I am He," said Jesus--"I who am now talking to you."
26184	43	4	27	 Just then His disciples came, and were surprised to find Him talking with a woman. Yet not one of them asked Him, "What is your wish?" or "Why are you talking with her?"
26185	43	4	28	 The woman however, leaving her  pitcher, went away to the town, and called the people.
26186	43	4	29	 "Come," she said, "and see a man who has told me everything I have ever done. Can this be the Christ, do you think?"
26187	43	4	30	 They left the town and  set out to go to Him.
26188	43	4	31	 Meanwhile the disciples were urging Jesus. "Rabbi," they said, "eat something."
26189	43	4	32	 "I have food to eat," He replied, "of which you do not know."
26190	43	4	33	 So the disciples began questioning one another. "Can it be," they said, "that some one has brought Him something to eat?"
26191	43	4	34	 "My food," said Jesus, "is to be obedient to Him who sent me, and fully to accomplish His work.
26192	43	4	35	 Do you not say, `It wants four months yet to the harvest'? But look round, I tell you, and observe these plains--  they are already ripe for the sickle.
26193	43	4	36	 The reaper gets pay and gathers in a crop in preparation  for the Life of the Ages, that so the sower and the reapers may rejoice together.
26194	43	4	37	 For it is  in this that you see the real meaning of the saying, `The sower is one person, and the reaper is another.'
26195	43	4	38	 I sent you to reap a harvest which is not the result of your own labours. Others have laboured, and you are getting benefit from their labours."
26196	43	4	39	 Of the Samaritan population of that town a good many believed in Him because of the woman's statement when she declared, "He has told me all that I have ever done."
26197	43	4	40	 When however the Samaritans came to Him, they  asked Him on all sides to stay with them; and He stayed there two days.
26198	43	4	41	 Then a far larger number of people believed because of His own words,
26199	43	4	42	 and they said to the woman, "We no longer believe in Him simply because of your statements; for we have now heard for ourselves, and we know that this man really is the Saviour of the world."
26200	43	4	43	 After the two days He departed, and went into Galilee;
26201	43	4	44	  though Jesus Himself declared that a Prophet has no honour in his own country.
26202	43	4	45	 When  however He reached Galilee, the Galilaeans welcomed Him eagerly, having been eye-witnesses of all that He had done in Jerusalem at the Festival; for they also had been to the Festival.
26203	43	4	46	 So He came once more to Cana in Galilee, where He had made the water into wine. Now there was a certain officer of the King's court whose son was ill at Capernaum.
26204	43	4	47	 Having heard that Jesus had come from Judaea to Galilee, he came to Him and begged Him to go down and cure his son; for he was at the point of death.
26205	43	4	48	 "Unless you and others see miracles and marvels," said Jesus, "nothing will induce you to believe."
26206	43	4	49	 "Sir," pleaded the officer, "come down before my child dies."
26207	43	4	50	  "You may return home," replied Jesus; "your son has recovered." He believed the words of Jesus, and started back home;
26208	43	4	51	 and he was already on his way down when his servants met him and told him that his son was alive and well.
26209	43	4	52	 So he inquired of them at what hour he had shown improvement. "Yesterday,  about seven o'clock," they replied, "the fever left him."
26210	43	4	53	 Then the father recollected that that was the time at which Jesus had said to him, "Your son has recovered," and he and his whole household became believers.
26211	43	4	54	 This is  the second miracle that Jesus performed, after coming from Judaea into Galilee.
26212	43	5	1	 After this there was a Festival of the Jews, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
26213	43	5	2	 Now there is in Jerusalem near the Sheep Gate a pool, called in Hebrew `Bethesda.' It has five arcades.
26214	43	5	3	 In these there used to lie a great number of sick persons, and of people who were blind or lame or paralyzed.
26215	43	5	4	  []
26216	43	5	5	 And there was one man there who had been an invalid for thirty-eight years.
26217	43	5	6	 Jesus saw him lying there, and knowing that he had been a long time in that condition, He asked him, "Do you wish to have health and strength?"
26218	43	5	7	 "Sir," replied the sufferer, "I have no one to put me into the pool when the water is moved; but while I am coming some one else steps down before me."
26219	43	5	8	 "Rise," said Jesus, "take up your mat and walk."
26220	43	5	9	 Instantly the man was restored to perfect health, and he took up his mat and began to walk.
26221	43	5	10	 That day was a Sabbath. So the Jews said to the man who had been cured, "It is the Sabbath: you must not carry your mat."
26222	43	5	11	 "He who cured me," he replied, "said to me, `Take up your mat and walk.'"
26223	43	5	12	  "Who is it," they asked, "that said to you, `Take up your mat and walk'?"
26224	43	5	13	 But the man who had been cured did not know who it was; for Jesus had passed out unnoticed, there being a crowd in the place.
26225	43	5	14	 Afterwards Jesus found him in the Temple and said to him, "You are now restored to health. Do not sin any more, or a worse thing may befall you."
26226	43	5	15	 The man went and told the Jews that it was Jesus who had restored him to health;
26227	43	5	16	 and on this account the Jews began to persecute Jesus--because He did these things on the Sabbath.
26228	43	5	17	 His reply to their accusation was, "My Father  works unceasingly, and so do I."
26229	43	5	18	 On this account then the Jews were all the more eager to put Him to death--because He not only broke the Sabbath, but also spoke of God as being in a special sense His Father, thus putting Himself on a level with God.
26230	43	5	19	 "In most solemn truth I tell you," replied Jesus, "that the Son can do nothing of Himself--He can only do what He sees the Father doing; for whatever He does, that the Son does in like manner.
26231	43	5	20	 For the Father  loves the Son and reveals to Him all that He Himself is doing. And greater deeds than these will He reveal to Him, in order that you may wonder.
26232	43	5	21	 For just as the Father awakens the dead and gives them life, so the Son also gives life to whom He wills.
26233	43	5	22	 The Father indeed does not judge any one, but He has entrusted all judgement to the Son,
26234	43	5	23	 that all may honour the Son even as they honour the Father. The man who withholds honour from the Son withholds honour from the Father who sent Him.
26235	43	5	24	 "In most solemn truth I tell you that he who listens to my teaching and believes Him who sent me, has  the Life of the Ages, and does not come  under judgement, but has passed over out of death into Life.
26236	43	5	25	 "In most solemn truth I tell you that  a time is coming--nay, has already come--when the dead will hear the voice of the Son of God, and those  who hear it will live.
26237	43	5	26	 For just as the Father has life in Himself, so He has also given to the Son to have life in Himself.
26238	43	5	27	 And He has conferred on Him authority to act as Judge, because He is the Son of Man.
26239	43	5	28	 Wonder not at this. For a time is coming when all who are in the graves will hear His voice and will come forth--
26240	43	5	29	 they who have done what is right to the resurrection of Life, and they whose actions have been evil to the resurrection of judgement.
26241	43	5	30	 "I can of my own self do nothing. As  I am bidden, so I judge; and mine is a just judgement, because it is not my own will that guides me, but the will of Him who sent me.
26242	43	5	31	 "If I give testimony concerning myself, my testimony  cannot be accepted.
26243	43	5	32	 There is  Another who gives testimony concerning me, and I know that the testimony is true which He offers concerning me.
26244	43	5	33	  "You sent to John, and he  both was and still is a witness to the truth.
26245	43	5	34	 But the testimony on my behalf which I accept is not from man; though I say all this in order that you may be saved.
26246	43	5	35	 He was the lamp that burned and shone, and for a time you were willing to be gladdened by his light.
26247	43	5	36	 "But the testimony which I have is weightier than that of John; for the  work the Father  has assigned to me for me to bring it to completion--the very work which I am doing--affords testimony concerning me that the Father has sent me.
26248	43	5	37	 And the Father who sent me, *He* has given testimony concerning me. None of you have ever either heard His voice or seen what He is like.
26249	43	5	38	 Nor have you His word dwelling within you, for you refuse to believe Him whom *He* has sent.
26250	43	5	39	  "You search the Scriptures, because you suppose that in them  you will find the Life  of the Ages; and it is those Scriptures that yield testimony concerning me;
26251	43	5	40	 and yet you are unwilling to come to me that you may have Life.
26252	43	5	41	 "I do not accept glory from man,
26253	43	5	42	 but I know you well, and I know that in your hearts you do not really love God.
26254	43	5	43	 I have come  as my Father's representative, and you do not receive me. If some one else comes representing only himself, him you will receive.
26255	43	5	44	 How is it possible for you to believe, while you receive glory from one another and have no desire for the glory that comes from the only God?
26256	43	5	45	  "Do not suppose that I will accuse you to the Father. There is one who accuses you, namely Moses, on whom your hope rests.
26257	43	5	46	 For if you believe Moses, you would believe me; for he wrote about me.
26258	43	5	47	 But if you disbelieve his writings, how are you to believe my words?"
26259	43	6	1	  After this Jesus went away across the Lake of Galilee (that is, the Lake of Tiberias).
26260	43	6	2	 A vast multitude followed Him, because they witnessed the miracles on the sick which He was constantly performing.
26261	43	6	3	 Then Jesus went up the hill, and sat there with His disciples.
26262	43	6	4	 The Jewish Festival, the Passover, was at hand.
26263	43	6	5	 And when He looked round and saw an immense crowd coming towards Him, He said to Philip, "Where shall we buy bread for all these people to eat?"
26264	43	6	6	 He said this to put Philip to the test, for He Himself knew what He was going to do.
26265	43	6	7	 "Seven pounds' worth of bread," replied Philip, "is not enough for them all to get even a scanty meal."
26266	43	6	8	 One of His disciples, Andrew, Simon Peter's brother, said to Him,
26267	43	6	9	 "There is a boy here with five barley  loaves and a couple of fish: but what is that among so many?"
26268	43	6	10	 "Make the people sit down," said Jesus. The ground was covered with thick grass; so they sat down, the adult men numbering about 5,000.
26269	43	6	11	 Then Jesus took the loaves, and after giving thanks He distributed them to those who were resting on the ground; and also the fish in like manner--as much as they desired.
26270	43	6	12	 When all were fully satisfied, He said to His disciples, "Gather up the broken portions that remain over, so that nothing be lost."
26271	43	6	13	 Accordingly they gathered them up; and with the fragments of the five barley loaves--the broken portions that remained over after they had done eating--they filled twelve baskets.
26272	43	6	14	 Thereupon the people, having seen the miracle He had performed, said, "This is indeed the Prophet who was to come into the world."
26273	43	6	15	  Perceiving,  however, that they were about to come and carry Him off by force to make Him a king, Jesus withdrew again up the hill alone by Himself.
26274	43	6	16	 When evening came on, His disciples went down to the Lake.
26275	43	6	17	 There they got on board a boat, and pushed off to cross the Lake to Capernaum. By this time it had become dark, and Jesus had not yet joined them.
26276	43	6	18	 The Lake also was getting rough, because a strong wind was blowing.
26277	43	6	19	 When, however, they had rowed three or four miles, they saw Jesus walking on the water and coming near the boat.
26278	43	6	20	 They were terrified; but He called to them. "It is I," He said, "do not be afraid."
26279	43	6	21	 Then they were willing to take Him on board; and in a moment the boat reached the shore at the point to which they were going.
26280	43	6	22	 Next morning the crowd who were still standing about on the other side of the Lake found that there had been but one small boat there, and they had seen that Jesus did not go on board with His disciples, but that His disciples went away without Him.
26281	43	6	23	 Yet a number of small boats came from Tiberias to the neighbourhood of the place where they had eaten the bread after the Lord had given thanks.
26282	43	6	24	 When however the crowd saw that neither Jesus nor His disciples were there, they themselves also took boats and came to Capernaum to look for Jesus.
26283	43	6	25	 So when they had crossed the Lake and had found Him, they asked Him, "Rabbi, when did you come here?"
26284	43	6	26	  "In most solemn truth I tell you," replied Jesus, "that you are searching for me not because you have seen miracles, but because you ate  the loaves and had a hearty meal.
26285	43	6	27	 Bestow your pains not on the food which perishes, but on the food that remains unto  the Life of the Ages--that food which will be the Son of Man's gift to you; for on Him the Father, God, has set His seal."
26286	43	6	28	 "What are we to do," they asked, "in order to carry out the things that God requires?"
26287	43	6	29	 "This," replied Jesus, "is above all the thing that God requires--that you should be believers in Him whom He has sent."
26288	43	6	30	  "What miracle then," they asked, "do you perform for us to see and become believers in you? What do you *do*?
26289	43	6	31	 Our forefathers ate the manna in the Desert, as it is written, <`He gave them bread out of Heaven to eat'.">
26290	43	6	32	 "In most solemn truth I tell you," replied Jesus, "that Moses did not give you the bread out of Heaven, but my Father is giving you the bread--the true bread--out of Heaven.
26291	43	6	33	 For God's bread is  that which comes down out of Heaven and gives Life to the world."
26292	43	6	34	 "Sir," they said, "always give us that bread."
26293	43	6	35	 "I am the bread of Life," replied Jesus; "he who comes to me shall never hunger, and he who believes in me shall never, never thirst.
26294	43	6	36	 But  it is as I have said to you: you have seen  me and yet you do not believe.
26295	43	6	37	  Every one whom the Father gives me will come to me, and him who comes to me I will never on any account drive away.
26296	43	6	38	 For I have left Heaven and have come down to earth not to seek my own  pleasure, but to do the will of Him who sent me.
26297	43	6	39	 And this is the will of Him who sent me, that of  all that He has given me I should lose nothing, but should raise  it to life on the last day.
26298	43	6	40	 For this is my Father's will, that every one who fixes his gaze on the Son of God and believes in Him should have the Life  of the Ages, and I will raise him to life on the last day."
26299	43	6	41	 Now the Jews began to find fault about Him because of His claiming to be the bread which came down out of Heaven.
26300	43	6	42	 They kept asking, "Is not  this man Joseph's son? Is he not Jesus, whose father and mother we know? What does he mean by now saying, `I have come down out of Heaven'?"
26301	43	6	43	 "Do not  thus find fault among yourselves," replied Jesus;
26302	43	6	44	 "no one can come to me unless the Father who sent me draws him; then I will raise him to life on the last day.
26303	43	6	45	 It stands written in the Prophets, <`And they shall all of them be taught by God'.> Every one who  listens to the Father and learns from Him comes to me.
26304	43	6	46	 No one has ever seen the Father--except Him who is from God. He has seen the Father.
26305	43	6	47	 "In most solemn truth I tell you that he who  believes has the Life of the Ages.
26306	43	6	48	 I am the bread of Life.
26307	43	6	49	 Your forefathers ate the manna in the Desert, and they died.
26308	43	6	50	 Here is the bread that comes down out of Heaven that a man may eat it and not die.
26309	43	6	51	 I am the living bread come down out of Heaven. If a man eats  this bread, he shall live for ever. Moreover the bread which I will give is my flesh  given for the life of the world."
26310	43	6	52	 This led to an angry debate among the Jews. "How can  this man," they argued, "give us his flesh to eat?"
26311	43	6	53	 "In most solemn truth I tell you," said Jesus, "that unless you eat the flesh of the Son of Man and drink His blood, you have no Life  in you.
26312	43	6	54	 He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has the Life of the Ages, and I will raise him up on the last day.
26313	43	6	55	 For my flesh is true food, and my blood is true drink.
26314	43	6	56	 He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood remains in union with me, and I remain in union with him.
26315	43	6	57	 As the ever-living Father has sent me, and I live  because of the Father, so also he who eats me will live because of me.
26316	43	6	58	 This is the bread which came down out of Heaven; it is unlike that which your forefathers ate--for they ate and yet died. He who eats this bread shall live for ever."
26317	43	6	59	 Jesus said all this  in the synagogue while teaching at Capernaum.
26318	43	6	60	 Many therefore of His disciples, when they heard it, said, "This is hard to accept. Who can listen  to such teaching?"
26319	43	6	61	 But, knowing in Himself that His disciples were dissatisfied about it, Jesus asked them,
26320	43	6	62	  "Does this seem incredible to you? What then if you were to see the Son of Man ascending  again where He was before?
26321	43	6	63	 It is the spirit which gives Life. The flesh confers no benefit whatever. The words I have spoken to you are spirit and are Life.
26322	43	6	64	 But there are some of you who do not believe." For Jesus knew from the beginning who those were that did not believe, and who it was that would betray Him.
26323	43	6	65	 So He added, "That is why I told you that no one can come to me unless it be granted him by the Father."
26324	43	6	66	 Thereupon many of His disciples left Him and went away, and no longer associated with Him.
26325	43	6	67	 Jesus therefore appealed to the Twelve. "Will you go also?" He asked.
26326	43	6	68	 "Master," replied Simon Peter, "to whom shall we go?  Your teachings tell us of the Life of the Ages.
26327	43	6	69	 And we have come to believe and know that *you* are indeed the Holy One of God."
26328	43	6	70	 "Did not I choose you--the Twelve?" said Jesus, "and even of you one is  a devil."
26329	43	6	71	 He alluded to Judas, the son of Simon the Iscariot. For he it was who, though one of the Twelve, was afterwards to betray Him.
26330	43	7	1	  After this Jesus moved from place to place in Galilee. He would not go about in Judaea, because the Jews were seeking an opportunity to kill Him.
26331	43	7	2	 But the Jewish Festival of the Tent-Pitching was approaching.
26332	43	7	3	 So His brothers said to Him, "Leave these parts and go into Judaea, that not only we but your disciples also may witness the miracles which you perform.
26333	43	7	4	 For no one acts in secret, desiring all the while to be himself known publicly. Since you are doing these things, show yourself openly to the world."
26334	43	7	5	 For even His brothers were not believers in Him.
26335	43	7	6	 "My time," replied Jesus, "has not yet come, but for you any time is suitable.
26336	43	7	7	 It is impossible for the world to hate you; but me it does hate, because I give testimony concerning it that its conduct is evil.
26337	43	7	8	 As for you, go up to the Festival.  I do  not now go up to this Festival, because my time is not yet fully come."
26338	43	7	9	 Such was His answer, and He remained in Galilee.
26339	43	7	10	 When however His brothers had gone up to the Festival, then He also went up, not openly, but as it were privately.
26340	43	7	11	 Meanwhile the Jews at the Festival were looking for Him and were inquiring, "Where is he?"
26341	43	7	12	 Among the mass of the people there was much muttered debate about Him. Some said, "He is a good man." Others said, "Not so: he is imposing on the people."
26342	43	7	13	 Yet  for fear of the Jews no one spoke out boldly about Him.
26343	43	7	14	 But when the Festival was already half over, Jesus went up to the Temple and commenced teaching.
26344	43	7	15	 The Jews were astonished. "How does  this man know anything of books," they said, "although he has never been at any of the schools?"
26345	43	7	16	 Jesus answered their question by saying, "My teaching does not belong to me, but comes from Him who sent me.
26346	43	7	17	 If any one is willing to do His will, he shall know about the teaching, whether it is from God or originates with me.
26347	43	7	18	 The man whose teaching originates with himself aims at his own glory. He who aims at the glory of Him who sent him teaches the truth, and there is no deception in him.
26348	43	7	19	 Did not Moses give you the Law? And yet not a man of you obeys the Law. Why do you want to kill me?"
26349	43	7	20	 "You are possessed by a demon," replied the crowd;  "no one wants to kill you."
26350	43	7	21	 "One deed I have done," replied Jesus, "and you are all full of wonder.
26351	43	7	22	 Consider therefore. Moses  gave you the rite of circumcision (not that it began with Moses, but with your earlier forefathers), and even on a Sabbath day you circumcise a child.
26352	43	7	23	 If a child is circumcised even on a Sabbath day, are you bitter against me because I have restored a man to perfect health on a Sabbath day?
26353	43	7	24	  Do not form  superficial judgements, but form the judgements that are just."
26354	43	7	25	 Some however of the people of Jerusalem said, "Is not this the man they are wanting to kill?
26355	43	7	26	 But  here he is, speaking openly and boldly, and they say nothing to him! Can the Rulers really have ascertained that this man is the Christ?
26356	43	7	27	 And yet we know this man, and we know where he is from; but as for the Christ, when He comes, no one can tell where He is from."
26357	43	7	28	 Jesus therefore, while teaching in the Temple, cried aloud, and said, "Yes, you know me, and you know where I am from. And yet I have not come of my own accord; but there is One who has sent me, an Authority indeed, of whom you have no knowledge.
26358	43	7	29	 I know Him, because I came from Him, and He sent me."
26359	43	7	30	 On hearing this they wanted to arrest Him; yet not a hand was laid on Him, because His time had not yet come.
26360	43	7	31	 But from among the crowd a large number believed in Him. "When the Christ comes," they said, "will He perform more miracles than this teacher has performed?"
26361	43	7	32	 The Pharisees heard the people thus expressing their various doubts about Him, and the High Priests and the Pharisees sent some officers to apprehend Him.
26362	43	7	33	 So Jesus said, "Still for a short time I am with you, and then I go my way to Him who sent me.
26363	43	7	34	 You will look for me and will not find me, and where I am you cannot come."
26364	43	7	35	 The Jews therefore said to one another, "Where is he about to betake himself,  so that we shall not find him? Will he betake himself to the Dispersion among the  Gentiles, and teach the  Gentiles?
26365	43	7	36	 What do those words of his mean, `You will look for me, but will not find me, and where I am you cannot come'?"
26366	43	7	37	 On the last day of the Festival--the great day--Jesus stood up and cried aloud. "Whoever is thirsty," He said, "let him come to me and drink.
26367	43	7	38	 He who believes in me, from within him--as the Scripture has said--rivers of living water shall flow."
26368	43	7	39	 He referred to the Spirit which those who  believed in Him  were to receive; for the Spirit was not  bestowed as yet, because Jesus had not yet been  glorified.
26369	43	7	40	 After listening to these  discourses,  some of the crowd began to say, "This is beyond doubt the Prophet."
26370	43	7	41	 Others said, "He is the Christ." But others again,  "Not so, for is the Christ to come from Galilee?
26371	43	7	42	 Has not the Scripture declared that the Christ is to come of the family of David and from Bethlehem, David's village?"
26372	43	7	43	 So there was a violent dissension among the people on His account.
26373	43	7	44	 Some of them wanted at once to arrest Him, but no one laid hands upon Him.
26374	43	7	45	 Meanwhile the officers returned to the High Priests and Pharisees, who asked them, "Why have you not brought him?"
26375	43	7	46	 "No mere man has ever spoken as this man speaks," said the officers.
26376	43	7	47	 "Are *you* deluded too?" replied the Pharisees;
26377	43	7	48	 "has any one of the Rulers or of the Pharisees believed in him?
26378	43	7	49	 But this rabble who understand nothing about the Law are accursed!"
26379	43	7	50	 Nicodemus interposed--he who had formerly gone to Jesus, being himself one of them.
26380	43	7	51	 "Does our Law," he asked, "judge a man without first hearing what he has to say and ascertaining what his conduct is?"
26381	43	7	52	 "Do you also come from Galilee?" they asked in reply. "Search and see for yourself that no Prophet is of Galilaean origin."
26382	43	7	53	  [So they went away to their several homes;
26383	43	8	1	 but Jesus went to the Mount of Olives.
26384	43	8	2	 At break of day however He returned to the Temple, and there the people came to Him in crowds. He seated Himself;
26385	43	8	3	 and was teaching them when the Scribes and the Pharisees brought to Him a woman who had been found committing adultery. They made her stand in the centre of the court, and they put the case to Him.
26386	43	8	4	  "Rabbi," they said, "this woman has been found in the very act of committing adultery.
26387	43	8	5	 Now, in the Law, Moses has ordered us to stone  such women to death. But what do you say?"
26388	43	8	6	 They asked this in order to put Him to the test, so that they might have some charge to bring against Him. But Jesus  leant forward and began to write with His finger on the ground.
26389	43	8	7	 When however they persisted with their question, He raised His head and said to them, "Let the sinless man among you be the first to throw a stone at her."
26390	43	8	8	 Then He leant forward again, and again began to write on the ground.
26391	43	8	9	 They listened to Him, and then, beginning with the eldest, took their departure, one by one, till all were gone. And Jesus was left behind alone--and the woman in the centre of the court.
26392	43	8	10	 Then, raising His head, Jesus said to her,  "Where are they? Has no one condemned you?"
26393	43	8	11	 "No one, Sir," she replied. "And *I* do not condemn you either," said Jesus; "go, and from this time do not sin any more."]
26394	43	8	12	 Once more Jesus addressed them. "I am the Light of the world," He said; "the man who follows me shall certainly not walk in the dark, but shall have the light of Life."
26395	43	8	13	 "You are giving testimony about yourself," said the Pharisees; "your testimony is not true."
26396	43	8	14	 "Even if I am giving testimony about myself," replied Jesus, "my testimony is true; for I know where I came from and where I am going, but you know neither of these two things.
26397	43	8	15	 You judge according to  appearances:  I am judging no one.
26398	43	8	16	 And even if I do judge, my judgement is  just; for I am not alone, but the Father who sent me is with me.
26399	43	8	17	 In your own Law, too, it is written that <the testimony of two men is true.>
26400	43	8	18	 I am one giving testimony about myself, and the Father who sent me gives testimony about me."
26401	43	8	19	 "Where is your Father?" they asked. "You know my Father as little as you know me." He replied; "if you knew me, you would know my Father also."
26402	43	8	20	 These sayings He uttered in the Treasury, while teaching in the  Temple; yet no one arrested Him, because His time had not yet come.
26403	43	8	21	 Again He said to them, "I am going away. Then you will try to find me, but you will die in your sins. Where I am going, it is impossible for you to come."
26404	43	8	22	 The Jews began to ask one another, "Is he going to kill himself, do you think, that he says, `Where I am going, it is impossible for you to come'?"
26405	43	8	23	 "You," He continued, "are from below, I am from above: you are of this present world, I am not of this present world.
26406	43	8	24	 That is why I told you that you will die in your sins; for, unless you believe that  I am He,  that is what will happen."
26407	43	8	25	 "You--who are you?" they  asked.  "How is it that I am speaking to you at all?" replied Jesus.
26408	43	8	26	 "Many things I have to speak and to judge concerning you. But He who sent me is true, and the things which I have heard from Him are those which  I have come into the world to speak."
26409	43	8	27	 They did not perceive that He was speaking to them of the Father.
26410	43	8	28	 So Jesus added, "When you have lifted up the Son of Man, then you will know that  I am He. Of myself I do nothing; but as the Father has taught me, so I speak.
26411	43	8	29	 And He who sent me is with me. He has not left me alone: for I do always what is pleasing to Him."
26412	43	8	30	 As He thus spoke, many became believers in Him.
26413	43	8	31	 Jesus therefore  said to those of the Jews who had now believed in Him, "As for you, if you  hold fast to my teaching, then you are truly my disciples;
26414	43	8	32	 and you shall know the Truth, and the Truth will make you free."
26415	43	8	33	 "We are descendants of Abraham," they answered, "and have never at any time been in slavery to any one. What do those words of yours mean, `You shall become free'?"
26416	43	8	34	 "In most solemn truth I tell you," replied Jesus, "that every one who commits sin is the slave of sin.
26417	43	8	35	 Now a slave does not remain permanently in his master's house, but a son does.
26418	43	8	36	 If then the Son shall make you free, you will be free indeed.
26419	43	8	37	 You are descendants of Abraham, I know; but you want to kill me, because my teaching gains no ground within you.
26420	43	8	38	 The words I speak are those I have  learnt in the presence of the Father. Therefore you also should do what you have heard from your father."
26421	43	8	39	 "Our father is Abraham," they said. "If you were Abraham's children," replied Jesus,  "it is Abraham's deeds that you would be doing.
26422	43	8	40	 But, in fact, you are longing to kill me, a man who has spoken to you the truth which I have heard from God. Abraham did not do that.
26423	43	8	41	 You are doing the deeds of your father." "We," they replied, "are not illegitimate children. We have one Father, namely God."
26424	43	8	42	 "If God were your Father," said Jesus, "you would love me; for it is from God that I came and I am now here. I have not come of myself, but *He* sent me.
26425	43	8	43	 How is it you do not understand me when I speak? It is because you cannot bear to listen to my words.
26426	43	8	44	 The father whose sons you are is the Devil; and you desire to do what gives him pleasure. *He* was a murderer from the beginning, and  does not stand firm  in the truth--for there is no truth in him. Whenever he utters his lie, he utters it  out of his own store; for he is a liar, and the father  of lies.
26427	43	8	45	 But because I  speak the truth, you do not believe me.
26428	43	8	46	  Which of *you* convicts me of sin? If I speak the truth, why do you not believe me?
26429	43	8	47	 He who is a child of God listens to God's words. You do not listen to them: and why? It is because you are not God's children."
26430	43	8	48	 "Are we not right," answered the Jews, "in saying that you are a Samaritan and are possessed by a demon?"
26431	43	8	49	 "I am not possessed by a demon," replied Jesus. "On the contrary I honour my Father, and you dishonour me.
26432	43	8	50	 I, however, am not aiming at glory for myself: there is One who aims at glory for me--and who judges.
26433	43	8	51	 In most solemn truth I tell you that if any one shall have obeyed my  teaching he shall in no case ever see death."
26434	43	8	52	 "Now," exclaimed the Jews, "we know that you are possessed by a demon. Abraham died, and so did the Prophets, and yet *you* say, `If any one shall have obeyed my teaching, he shall in no case ever  taste death.'
26435	43	8	53	 Are you really greater than our forefather Abraham? For he died. And the prophets died.  Who do you make yourself out to be?"
26436	43	8	54	 "Were I to glorify myself," answered Jesus, "I should have no real glory. There is One who glorifies me--namely my Father, who you say is your God.
26437	43	8	55	 You do not know Him, but I know Him perfectly; and were I to deny my knowledge of Him, I should resemble you, and be a liar. On the contrary I do know Him, and I obey His  commands.
26438	43	8	56	 Abraham your forefather exulted  in the hope of seeing  my day: and he saw it, and was glad."
26439	43	8	57	 "You are not yet fifty years old," cried the Jews, "and have you seen Abraham?"
26440	43	8	58	 "In most solemn truth," answered Jesus, "I tell you that before Abraham came into existence, I am."
26441	43	8	59	 Thereupon they took up stones with which to stone Him, but He hid Himself and went away out of the Temple.
26442	43	9	1	  As He passed by, He saw a man who had been blind from his birth.
26443	43	9	2	 So His disciples asked Him, "Rabbi, who sinned--this man or his parents--that he was born blind?"
26444	43	9	3	 "Neither he nor his parents sinned," answered Jesus, "but he was born blind in order that  God's mercy might be openly shown in him.
26445	43	9	4	  We must do the works of Him who sent me while there is daylight. Night is coming on, when no one can work.
26446	43	9	5	 When I am in the world, I am  the Light of the world."
26447	43	9	6	 After thus speaking, He spat on the ground, and then, kneading the dust and spittle into clay, He smeared the clay over the man's eyes and said to him,
26448	43	9	7	 "Go and wash in the pool of Siloam" --the name means `Sent.' So he went and washed his eyes, and  returned able to see.
26449	43	9	8	 His neighbours, therefore, and the other people to whom he had been a familiar object because he was a beggar, began asking, "Is not this the man who used to sit and beg?"
26450	43	9	9	 "Yes it is," replied some of them. "No it is not," said others, "but he is like him." His own statement was, "I am the man."
26451	43	9	10	 "How then were your eyes opened?" they  asked.
26452	43	9	11	 "He whose name is Jesus," he answered, "made clay and smeared my eyes with it, and then told me to go to Siloam and wash. So I went and washed and  obtained sight."
26453	43	9	12	 "Where is he?" they inquired, but the man did not know.
26454	43	9	13	 They brought him to the Pharisees--the man who had been blind.
26455	43	9	14	 Now the day on which Jesus made the clay and opened the man's eyes was the Sabbath.
26456	43	9	15	 So the Pharisees renewed their questioning as to how he had obtained his sight. "He put clay on my eyes," he replied, "and I washed, and now I can see."
26457	43	9	16	 This led some of the Pharisees to say,  "That man has not come from God, for he does not keep the Sabbath." "How is it possible for  a bad man to do such miracles?" argued others.
26458	43	9	17	 And there was a division among them. So again they asked the once blind man, "What is your account of him? --for he opened your eyes." "He is a Prophet," he replied.
26459	43	9	18	 The Jews,  however, did not believe the statement concerning him--that he had been blind and had obtained his sight--until they called his parents and asked them,
26460	43	9	19	 "Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How is it then that he can now see?"
26461	43	9	20	 "We know," replied the parents, "that this is our son and that he was born blind;
26462	43	9	21	 but how it is that he can now see or who has opened his eyes we do not know. Ask him himself; he is of full age; he himself will give his own account of it."
26463	43	9	22	 Such was their answer, because they were afraid of the Jews; for the Jews had already settled among themselves that if any one should acknowledge Jesus as the Christ, he should be excluded from the synagogue.
26464	43	9	23	 That was why his parents said, "He is of full age: ask him himself."
26465	43	9	24	 A second time therefore they called the man who had been blind, and said, "Give God the praise: we know that that man is a sinner."
26466	43	9	25	 "Whether he is a sinner or not, I do not know," he replied; "one thing I know--that I was once blind and that now I can see."
26467	43	9	26	 "What did he do to you?" they asked; "how did he open your eyes?"
26468	43	9	27	 "I have told you already," he replied, "and you did not listen to me. Why do you want to hear it again? Do you also mean to be disciples of his?"
26469	43	9	28	 Then they railed at him, and said, "You are that man's disciple, but we are disciples of Moses.
26470	43	9	29	 We know that God  spoke to Moses; but as for this fellow we do not know where he comes from."
26471	43	9	30	 "Why, this is marvellous!" the man replied; "you do not know where he comes from, and yet he has opened my eyes!
26472	43	9	31	 We know that God does not listen to bad people, but that if any one is a God-fearing man and obeys Him, to him He listens.
26473	43	9	32	  From the beginning of the world such a thing was never heard of as that any one should open the eyes of a man blind from his birth.
26474	43	9	33	 Had that man not come from God, he could have done nothing."
26475	43	9	34	 "You," they replied, "were wholly begotten and born in sin, and do *you* teach *us*?" And they put him out of the synagogue.
26476	43	9	35	 Jesus heard that they had done this. So having found him, He asked him, "Do you believe in the  Son of God?"
26477	43	9	36	 "Who is He, Sir?" replied the man. "Tell me, so that I may believe in Him."
26478	43	9	37	 "You have seen Him," said Jesus; "and not only so: He is now speaking to you."
26479	43	9	38	 "I believe, Sir," he said. And he threw himself at His feet.
26480	43	9	39	 "I came into this world," said Jesus, "to judge men, that those who do not see may see, and that those who do see may become blind."
26481	43	9	40	 These words were heard by those of the Pharisees who were present, and they asked Him, "Are *we* also blind?"
26482	43	9	41	  "If you were blind," answered Jesus, "you would have no sin; but as a matter of fact you boast that you see. So your sin remains!"
26483	43	10	1	 "In most solemn truth I tell you that the man who does not enter the sheepfold by the door, but climbs over some other way, is a thief and a robber.
26484	43	10	2	 But he who enters by the door is  the shepherd of the sheep.
26485	43	10	3	 To him the porter opens the door, and the sheep hear his voice; and he calls his own sheep by their names and leads them out.
26486	43	10	4	 When he has brought out his own sheep--all of them--he walks at the head of them; and the sheep follow him, because they know his voice.
26487	43	10	5	 But a stranger they will by no means follow, but will run away from him, because they do not know the voice of strangers."
26488	43	10	6	 Jesus spoke to them  in this figurative language, but they did not understand what He meant.
26489	43	10	7	 Again therefore Jesus said to them, "In most solemn truth I tell you that I am the Door  of the sheep.
26490	43	10	8	 All who  have come before me are thieves and robbers; but the sheep would not listen to them.
26491	43	10	9	 I am the Door. If any one enters by me, he will find safety, and will go in and out and find pasture.
26492	43	10	10	 The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy: I have come that they may have Life, and may have it in abundance.
26493	43	10	11	 "I am the Good Shepherd. A  good shepherd lays down his very  life for the sheep.
26494	43	10	12	 The hired servant--one who is not a shepherd and does not own the sheep--no sooner sees the wolf coming than he leaves the sheep and runs away; and the wolf worries and scatters them.
26495	43	10	13	 For he is only a hired servant and cares nothing for the sheep.
26496	43	10	14	 "I am the Good Shepherd. And I know my sheep and my sheep know me,
26497	43	10	15	 just as the Father knows me and I know the Father; and I am laying down my life for the sheep.
26498	43	10	16	 I have also other sheep--which do not belong to this fold. Those also I must bring, and they will listen to my voice; and they shall become one flock under one Shepherd.
26499	43	10	17	 For this reason my Father loves me, because I am laying down my life in order to receive it back again.
26500	43	10	18	  No one is taking it away from me, but I myself am laying it down. I am authorized to lay it down, and I am authorized to receive it back again. This is the command I received from my Father."
26501	43	10	19	 Again there arose a division among the Jews because of these words.
26502	43	10	20	 Many of them said, "He is possessed by a demon and is mad. Why do you listen to him?"
26503	43	10	21	 Others argued, "That is not the language of a demoniac: and can a demon open blind men's eyes?"
26504	43	10	22	 The Dedication Festival  came on in Jerusalem. It was winter,
26505	43	10	23	 and Jesus was walking in the Temple in Solomon's Portico,
26506	43	10	24	 when the Jews gathered round Him and  kept asking Him, "How long do you mean to keep us in suspense? If you are the Christ, tell us so plainly."
26507	43	10	25	 "I have told you," answered Jesus, "and you do not believe. The deeds that I do in my Father's name--they give testimony about me.
26508	43	10	26	 But you do not believe, because you are not my sheep.
26509	43	10	27	 My sheep listen to my voice, and I know them, and they follow me.
26510	43	10	28	 I give them the Life  of the Ages, and they shall never, never perish, nor shall any one wrest them from my hand.
26511	43	10	29	 What my Father has given me is  more precious than all besides; and no one is able to wrest anything from my Father's hand.
26512	43	10	30	 I and the Father  are one."
26513	43	10	31	 Again the Jews brought stones with which to stone Him.
26514	43	10	32	 Jesus remonstrated with them. "Many good deeds," He said, "have I shown you as coming from the Father; for  which of them are you going to stone me?"
26515	43	10	33	 "For no good deed," the Jews replied, "are we going to stone you, but for blasphemy, and because you, who are only a man, are making yourself out to be God."
26516	43	10	34	 "Does it not stand written in your Law," replied Jesus, <"`I said, you are gods'?>
26517	43	10	35	 If those to whom God's word was addressed  are called gods (and the Scripture cannot be annulled),
26518	43	10	36	 how is it that you say to one whom the Father consecrated and sent into the world, `You are blaspheming,' because I said, `I am God's Son'?
26519	43	10	37	 If the deeds I do are not my Father's deeds, do not believe me.
26520	43	10	38	 But if they are, then even if you do not believe me, at least believe the deeds, that you may know and see clearly that the Father is in me, and that I am in the Father."
26521	43	10	39	 This made them once more try to arrest Him, but He withdrew out of their  power.
26522	43	10	40	 Then He went away again to the other side of the Jordan, to the place where John had been baptizing at first; and there He stayed.
26523	43	10	41	 Large numbers of people also came to Him. Their report was, "John did not work any miracle, but all that John said about this Teacher was true."
26524	43	10	42	 And many  became believers in Him there.
26525	43	11	1	 Now a certain man, named Lazarus, of Bethany, was lying ill--  Bethany being the village of Mary and her sister Martha.
26526	43	11	2	 (It was the Mary who poured the perfume over the Lord and wiped His feet with her hair, whose brother Lazarus was ill.)
26527	43	11	3	 So the sisters sent to Him to say, "Master, he  whom you hold dear is ill."
26528	43	11	4	 Jesus received the message and said, "This illness is not to end in death, but is to promote the glory of God, in order that the Son of God may be glorified by it."
26529	43	11	5	 Now Jesus  loved Martha, and her sister, and Lazarus.
26530	43	11	6	 When, however, He heard that Lazarus was ill, He still remained two days in that same place.
26531	43	11	7	 Then, after that, He said to the disciples, "Let us return to Judaea."
26532	43	11	8	 "Rabbi," exclaimed the disciples, "the Jews have just been trying to stone you, and do you think of going back there again?"
26533	43	11	9	 "Are there not twelve hours in the day?" replied Jesus. "If any one walks in the daytime, he does not stumble--because he sees  the light of this world.
26534	43	11	10	 But if a man walks by night, he does stumble, because the light is not in him."
26535	43	11	11	 He said this, and afterwards He added, "Our  friend Lazarus  is sleeping, but I will go  and wake him."
26536	43	11	12	 "Master," said the disciples, "if he is asleep he will recover."
26537	43	11	13	 Now Jesus had spoken of his death, but they thought He referred to the rest taken in ordinary sleep.
26538	43	11	14	 So then He told them plainly,
26539	43	11	15	 "Lazarus  is dead; and for your sakes I am glad I was not there, in order that you may believe. But let us go to him."
26540	43	11	16	 "Let us go also," Thomas, the Twin, said to his fellow disciples, "that we may die with him."
26541	43	11	17	  On His arrival Jesus found that Lazarus had already been  three days in the tomb.
26542	43	11	18	 Bethany was near Jerusalem, the distance being a little less than two miles;
26543	43	11	19	 and a considerable number of the Jews were with Martha and Mary, having come to express sympathy with them on the death of their brother.
26544	43	11	20	 Martha,  however, as soon as she heard the tidings, "Jesus is coming," went to meet Him; but Mary remained sitting in the house.
26545	43	11	21	 So Martha came and spoke to Jesus. "Master, if you had been here," she said, "my brother would not have died.
26546	43	11	22	 And  even now I know that whatever you ask God for, God will give you."
26547	43	11	23	 "Your brother  shall rise again," replied Jesus.
26548	43	11	24	 "I know," said Martha, "that he will rise again at the resurrection, on the last day."
26549	43	11	25	 "I am the Resurrection and the Life," said Jesus; "he who believes in me, even if he  has died, he shall live;
26550	43	11	26	 and every one who is living and is a believer in me shall never, never die. Do you believe this?"
26551	43	11	27	 "Yes, Master," she replied; "I thoroughly believe that you are the Christ, the Son of God, who was to come into the world."
26552	43	11	28	 After saying this, she went and called her sister Mary privately, telling her, "The  Rabbi is here and is asking for you."
26553	43	11	29	 So she, on hearing that, rose up quickly to go to Him.
26554	43	11	30	 Now Jesus was not yet come into the village, but was still at the place where Martha had met Him.
26555	43	11	31	 So the Jews who were with Mary in the house sympathizing with her, when they saw that she had risen hastily and had gone out, followed her,  supposing that she was going to the tomb to weep aloud there.
26556	43	11	32	 Mary then, when she came to Jesus and saw Him, fell at His feet and exclaimed, "Master, if you had been here, my brother would not have died."
26557	43	11	33	 Seeing her weeping aloud, and the Jews in like manner weeping who had come with her, Jesus,  curbing the strong  emotion of His spirit,
26558	43	11	34	 though deeply troubled, asked them, "Where have you laid him?" "Master, come and see," was their reply.
26559	43	11	35	 Jesus  wept.
26560	43	11	36	 "See how dear he held him," said the Jews.
26561	43	11	37	 But others of them asked, "Was this man who opened the blind man's eyes unable to prevent this man from dying?"
26562	43	11	38	 Jesus, however, again  restraining His strong feeling, came to the tomb. It was a cave, and a stone had been laid against the mouth of it.
26563	43	11	39	 "Take away the stone," said Jesus. Martha, the sister of the dead man, exclaimed, "Master, by this time there is a foul smell; for  it is three days since he died."
26564	43	11	40	 "Did I not promise you," replied Jesus, "that if you believe, you shall see the glory of God?"
26565	43	11	41	 So they removed the stone. Then Jesus lifted up His eyes and said, "Father, I thank Thee that Thou hast heard me.
26566	43	11	42	 I know that Thou always hearest me; but for the sake of the crowd standing round I have said this--that they may believe that Thou didst send me."
26567	43	11	43	 After speaking thus, He called out in a loud voice, "Lazarus, come out."
26568	43	11	44	 The dead man came out, his hands and feet wrapped in  cloths, and his face wrapped round with a  towel. "Untie him," said Jesus, "and let him go free."
26569	43	11	45	 Thereupon a considerable number of the Jews--namely those who had come to Mary and had witnessed His deeds--became believers in Him;
26570	43	11	46	 though some of them went off to the Pharisees and told them what He had done.
26571	43	11	47	 Therefore the High Priests and the Pharisees held a meeting of the Sanhedrin. "What steps are we taking?" they asked one another; "for this man is performing a great number of miracles.
26572	43	11	48	 If we leave him alone in this way, everybody will believe in him, and the Romans will come and blot out both our  city and our nation."
26573	43	11	49	 But one of them, named Caiaphas, being High Priest that year, said, "You know nothing about it.
26574	43	11	50	 You do not reflect that it is to your interest that one man should die for the people rather than the whole nation perish."
26575	43	11	51	 It was not  as a mere man that he thus spoke. But being High Priest that year he was inspired to declare that Jesus was to die for the nation,
26576	43	11	52	 and not for the nation only, but in order to unite into one body all the far-scattered children of God.
26577	43	11	53	 So from that day forward they planned and schemed in order to put Him to death.
26578	43	11	54	 Therefore Jesus no longer went about openly among the Jews, but He left that neighbourhood and went into the district near the Desert, to a town called Ephraim, and remained there with the disciples.
26579	43	11	55	 The Jewish Passover was coming near, and many  from that district went up to Jerusalem before the Passover, to purify themselves.
26580	43	11	56	 They therefore looked out for Jesus, and asked one another as they stood in the Temple, "What do you think? --will he come to the Festival at all?"
26581	43	11	57	 Now the High Priests and the Pharisees had issued orders that if any one knew where He was, he should give information, so that they might arrest Him.
26582	43	12	1	  Jesus,  however, six days before the Passover, came to Bethany, where Lazarus was whom He had raised from the dead.
26583	43	12	2	 So they gave a dinner there in honour of Jesus, at which Martha waited at table, but Lazarus was one of the guests who were with Him.
26584	43	12	3	 Availing herself of the opportunity, Mary took a pound weight of  pure spikenard, very costly, and poured it over His feet, and wiped His feet with her hair, so that the house was filled with the fragrance of the perfume.
26585	43	12	4	 Then said Judas (the Iscariot, one of the Twelve--the one who afterwards betrayed Jesus),
26586	43	12	5	 "Why was not that perfume sold for 300 shillings and the money given to the poor?"
26587	43	12	6	 The reason he said this was not that he cared for the poor, but that he was a thief, and that being in charge of the  money-box, he used to steal what was put into it.
26588	43	12	7	 But Jesus interposed. "Do not blame her," He said,  "allow her to have kept it for the time of my preparation for burial.
26589	43	12	8	 For the poor you always have with you, but you have not me always."
26590	43	12	9	 Now it became widely known among the Jews that Jesus was there; but they came not only on His account, but also in order to see Lazarus whom He had brought back to life.
26591	43	12	10	 The High Priests, however, consulted together to put Lazarus also to death,
26592	43	12	11	 for because of him many of the Jews  left them and became believers in Jesus.
26593	43	12	12	  The next day a great crowd of those who had come to the Festival, hearing that Jesus was coming to Jerusalem,
26594	43	12	13	 took branches of  the palm trees and went out to meet Him, shouting as they went, "God save him! <Blessings on him who comes in the name of the Lord>--even on the King of Israel!"
26595	43	12	14	 And Jesus, having procured a young ass, sat upon it, just as the Scripture says,
26596	43	12	15	 <"Fear not,  Daughter of Zion! See, thy King is coming riding on an ass's colt.">
26597	43	12	16	 The meaning of this His disciples did not understand at the time; but after Jesus was glorified they recollected that this was written about Him, and that they had done this to Him.
26598	43	12	17	 The large number of people,  however, who had been present when He called Lazarus out of the tomb and brought him back to life, related what they had witnessed.
26599	43	12	18	 This was also why the crowd came to meet Him, because they had heard of His having performed that miracle.
26600	43	12	19	 The result was that the Pharisees said among themselves,  "Observe how idle all your efforts are! The world is gone after him!"
26601	43	12	20	 Now some of those who used  to come up to worship at the Festival were Greeks.
26602	43	12	21	  They came to Philip, of Bethsaida in Galilee, with the request, "Sir, we wish to see Jesus."
26603	43	12	22	 Philip came and told Andrew: Andrew and Philip told Jesus.
26604	43	12	23	 His answer was, "The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.
26605	43	12	24	 In most solemn truth I tell you that unless the grain of wheat falls into the ground and dies, it remains what it was--a single grain; but that if it dies, it yields a rich harvest.
26606	43	12	25	 He who holds  his life dear, is destroying it; and he who  makes his life of no account in this world  shall keep it to the Life  of the Ages.
26607	43	12	26	 If a man wishes to be my servant, let him follow me; and where I am, there too shall my servant be. If a man wishes to be my servant, the Father will honour him.
26608	43	12	27	 Now is my soul full of trouble; and what shall I say? Father,  save me from this hour. But  for this purpose I have come to this hour.
26609	43	12	28	 Father, glorify Thy name." Thereupon there came a voice from the sky, "I have glorified it and will also glorify it again."
26610	43	12	29	 The crowd that  stood by and heard it, said that there had been thunder. Others said, "An angel spoke to him."
26611	43	12	30	 "It is not for my sake," said Jesus, "that that voice came, but for your sakes.
26612	43	12	31	 Now  is a judgement of this world: now will the Prince of this world be driven out.
26613	43	12	32	 And I--  if I am lifted up  from the earth--will draw all men to me."
26614	43	12	33	 He said this to indicate the kind of death He would die.
26615	43	12	34	 The crowd answered Him, "We have heard out of the Law that the Christ remains for ever. In what sense do you say that the Son of Man must be lifted up? Who is that Son of Man?"
26616	43	12	35	 "Yet a little while," He replied, "the light is among you.  Be faithful to the light that you have, for fear darkness should  overtake you; for a man who walks in the dark does not know where he is going.
26617	43	12	36	  In the degree that you have light, believe in the Light, so that you may become sons of Light." Jesus said this, and went away and  hid Himself from them.
26618	43	12	37	 But though He had performed  such great miracles in their presence, they did not believe in Him--
26619	43	12	38	 in order that the words of Isaiah the Prophet might be fulfilled, <"Lord, who has believed our preaching? And the arm of the Lord--to whom has it been unveiled?">
26620	43	12	39	 For this reason they were unable to believe--because Isaiah said again,
26621	43	12	40	 <"He has blinded their eyes and made their minds callous, lest they should see with their eyes and perceive with their minds, and should turn, and I should heal them.">
26622	43	12	41	 Isaiah uttered these words because he saw His glory; and he spoke of Him.
26623	43	12	42	 Nevertheless even from among the Rulers many believed in Him. But because of the Pharisees they did not avow their belief, for fear they should be shut out from the synagogue.
26624	43	12	43	 For they loved the glory that comes from men rather than the glory that comes from God.
26625	43	12	44	 But Jesus  cried aloud, "He who believes in me, believes not so much in me, as in Him who sent me;
26626	43	12	45	 and he who sees me sees Him who sent me.
26627	43	12	46	 I have come like light into the world, in order that no one who believes in me may remain in the dark.
26628	43	12	47	 And if any one hears my teachings and  regards them not, I do  not judge him; for I did not come to judge the world, but to save the world.
26629	43	12	48	 He who sets me at naught and does not receive my teachings is not left without a judge: the Message which  I have spoken will judge him on the last day.
26630	43	12	49	 Because I have not spoken on my own authority; but the Father who sent me, Himself  gave me a command what to say and in what words to speak.
26631	43	12	50	 And I know that  His command is the Life of the Ages. What therefore I speak, I speak just as the Father has bidden me."
26632	43	13	1	  Now just before the Feast of the Passover this incident took place. Jesus knew that the time had come for Him to leave this world and go to the Father; and having loved His own who were in the world, He loved them  to the end.
26633	43	13	2	 While supper was proceeding, the Devil having by this time suggested to Judas Iscariot, the son of Simon, the thought of betraying Him, Jesus,
26634	43	13	3	 although He knew that the Father had put everything into His hands, and that He had come forth from God and was now going to God,
26635	43	13	4	 rose from the table, threw off His upper garments, and took a towel and tied it round Him.
26636	43	13	5	 Then He poured water into a basin, and proceeded to wash the feet of the disciples and to wipe them with the towel which He had put round Him.
26637	43	13	6	  When He came to Simon Peter, Peter objected. "Master," he said, "are *you* going to wash my feet?"
26638	43	13	7	 "What I am doing," answered Jesus, "for the present you do not know, but afterwards you shall know."
26639	43	13	8	 "Never, while the world lasts," said Peter, "shall you wash my feet." "If I do not wash you," replied Jesus, "you have no share with me."
26640	43	13	9	 "Master," said Peter, "wash not only my feet, but also my hands and my head."
26641	43	13	10	 "Any one who has lately bathed," said Jesus, "does not need to wash  more than his feet, but is clean all over. And you my disciples are clean, and yet this is not true of all of you."
26642	43	13	11	 For He knew who was betraying Him, and that was why He said, "You are not all of you clean."
26643	43	13	12	 So after He had washed their feet, put on His garments again, and returned to the table, He said to them, "Do you understand what I have done to you?
26644	43	13	13	 You call me `The  Rabbi' and `The  Master,' and rightly so, for such I am.
26645	43	13	14	 If I then, your Master and Rabbi, have washed your feet, it is also your duty to wash one another's feet.
26646	43	13	15	 For I have set you an example in order that you may do what I have done to you.
26647	43	13	16	 In most solemn truth I tell you that a servant is not superior to his master, nor is a messenger superior to him who sent him.
26648	43	13	17	 If you know all this, blessed are you if you act accordingly.
26649	43	13	18	 I am not speaking of all of you. I know whom I have chosen, but things are as they are in order that the Scripture may be fulfilled, which says, <`He who eats  my bread has lifted up his heel against me.'>
26650	43	13	19	 From this time forward I tell you things before they happen, in order that when they do happen you may believe that  I am He.
26651	43	13	20	 In most solemn truth I tell you that he who receives whoever I send receives me, and that he who receives me receives Him who sent me."
26652	43	13	21	  After speaking thus Jesus was troubled in spirit and said with deep earnestness, "In most solemn truth I tell you that one of you will betray me."
26653	43	13	22	 The disciples began looking at one another, at a loss to know to which of them He was referring.
26654	43	13	23	 There was at table one of His disciples--the one Jesus  loved--  reclining with his head on Jesus's bosom.
26655	43	13	24	 Making a sign therefore to him, Simon Peter said, "Tell us to whom he is referring."
26656	43	13	25	 So he, having his head on Jesus's bosom, leaned back and asked, "Master, who is it?"
26657	43	13	26	 "It is the one," answered Jesus, "for whom I shall  dip this piece of bread and to whom I shall give it." Accordingly He dipped the piece of bread, and took it and gave it to Judas, the son of the Iscariot Simon.
26658	43	13	27	 Then, after Judas had received the piece of bread, Satan entered into him. "Lose no time  about it," said Jesus to him.
26659	43	13	28	 But why He said this no one else at the table understood.
26660	43	13	29	 Some,  however, supposed that because Judas had the money-box Jesus meant, "Buy what we require for the Festival," or that he should give something to the poor.
26661	43	13	30	 So Judas took the piece of bread and immediately went out. And it was night.
26662	43	13	31	 So when he was gone out, Jesus said, "Now  is the Son of Man glorified, and God is glorified in Him.
26663	43	13	32	 Moreover God will glorify Him in Himself, and will glorify Him without delay.
26664	43	13	33	  Dear children, I am still with you a little longer. You will seek me, but, as I said to the Jews, `Where I am going you cannot come,' so for the present I say to you.
26665	43	13	34	 A new commandment I give you,  to love one another; that as I have loved you, you also may love one another.
26666	43	13	35	 It is by this that every one will know that you are my disciples--if you love one another."
26667	43	13	36	  "Master," inquired Simon Peter, "where are you going?" "Where I am going," replied Jesus, "you cannot be my follower now, but you shall be later."
26668	43	13	37	 "Master," asked Peter again, "why cannot I follow you now? I will lay down my  life on your behalf.
26669	43	13	38	 "You say you will lay down your life on my behalf!" said Jesus; "in most solemn truth I tell you that  the cock will not crow before you have three times disowned me."
26670	43	14	1	 "Let not your hearts be troubled.  Trust in God: trust in me also.
26671	43	14	2	 In my Father's house there are many resting-places. Were it otherwise, I would have told you; for I am going  to make ready a place for you.
26672	43	14	3	 And  if I go and make ready a place for you, I will return and  take you to be with me, that where I am you also may be.
26673	43	14	4	 And where I am going, you all know the way."
26674	43	14	5	 "Master," said Thomas, "we do not know where you are going.  In what sense do we know the way?"
26675	43	14	6	 "I am the Way," replied Jesus, "and the Truth and the Life. No one comes to the Father except through me.
26676	43	14	7	 If you--all of you--knew me, you would fully know my Father also. From this time forward you know Him and have seen Him."
26677	43	14	8	 "Master," said Philip, "cause us to see the Father: that is all we need."
26678	43	14	9	 "Have I been so long among you," Jesus answered, "and yet you, Philip, do not know me? He who has seen me has seen the Father. How can *you* ask me, `Cause us to see the Father'?
26679	43	14	10	 Do you not  believe that I am in the Father and that the Father is in me? The things that I tell you all I do not speak on my own authority: but the Father  dwelling within me carries on His own  work.
26680	43	14	11	 Believe me, all of you, that I am in the Father and that the Father is in me; or at any rate,  believe me because of what I do.
26681	43	14	12	 In most solemn truth I tell you that he who trusts in me--the things which I do he shall do also; and greater things than these he shall do, because I am going to the Father.
26682	43	14	13	 And whatever any of you ask  in my name, I will do, in order that the Father may be glorified in the Son.
26683	43	14	14	 If you make any request  of me in my name, I will do it.
26684	43	14	15	 "If you love me, you will obey my commandments.
26685	43	14	16	 And I will ask the Father, and He will give you another  Advocate to be for ever with you--the Spirit of truth.
26686	43	14	17	 That Spirit the world cannot receive, because it does not see Him or know Him. You know Him, because He remains by your side and is in you.
26687	43	14	18	 I will not leave you  bereaved: I am coming to you.
26688	43	14	19	 Yet a little while and the world  will see me no more, but you will see me: because I live, you also shall live.
26689	43	14	20	 At that time you will know that I am in my Father, and that you are in me, and that I am in you.
26690	43	14	21	 He who has my commandments and obeys them--he it is who loves me. And he who loves me will be loved by my Father, and I will love him and will clearly reveal myself to him."
26691	43	14	22	 Judas (not the Iscariot) asked, "Master,  how is it that you will reveal yourself clearly to us and not to the world?"
26692	43	14	23	 "If any one loves me," replied Jesus, "he will obey my  teaching; and my Father will love him, and we will come to him and make our home  with him.
26693	43	14	24	 He who has no love for me does not obey my teaching; and yet the teaching to which you are listening is not mine, but is the teaching of the Father who sent me.
26694	43	14	25	 "All this I have spoken to you while still with you.
26695	43	14	26	 But the Advocate, the Holy Spirit whom the Father will send  at my request, will teach you everything, and will bring to your memories  all that I have said to you.
26696	43	14	27	 Peace I leave with you: my own peace I give to you. It is not as the world gives its greetings that I give you peace. Let not your hearts be troubled or dismayed.
26697	43	14	28	 "You heard me say to you, `I am going away, and yet I am coming to you.' If you loved me, you would have rejoiced because I am going to the Father; for the Father is  greater than I am.
26698	43	14	29	 I have now told you before it comes to pass, that when it has come to pass you may believe.
26699	43	14	30	 In future I shall not talk much with you, for the  Prince  of this world is coming. And yet in me he has nothing;
26700	43	14	31	 but it is in order that the world may know that I love the Father, and that it is in obedience to the command which the Father gave me that I thus act. Rise, let us be going."
26701	43	15	1	 "I am the Vine--the True Vine, and my Father is the vine-dresser.
26702	43	15	2	 Every branch in me--if it bears no fruit, He takes away; and every branch that bears fruit He prunes, that it may bear more fruit.
26703	43	15	3	 Already you are cleansed--through the  teaching which I have given you.
26704	43	15	4	 Continue in me, and let me continue in you. Just as the branch cannot bear fruit of itself--that is, if it does not continue in the vine--so neither can you if you do not continue in me.
26705	43	15	5	 I am the Vine, you are the branches. He who continues in me and in whom I continue bears abundant fruit, for apart from me you can do nothing.
26706	43	15	6	 If any one does not continue in me, he is like the unfruitful branch  which is at once thrown away and then withers up. Such branches they gather up and throw into the fire and they are burned.
26707	43	15	7	 "If you continue in me and my  sayings continue in you, ask what you will and it shall be done for you.
26708	43	15	8	 By this  is God glorified--by your bearing abundant fruit and thus being true disciples of mine.
26709	43	15	9	 As the Father  has loved me,  I have also loved you: continue in my love.
26710	43	15	10	 If you obey my commands, you will continue in my love, as I have obeyed my Father's commands and continue in His love.
26711	43	15	11	 "These things  I have spoken to you in order that I may have joy in you, and that your joy may become perfect.
26712	43	15	12	 This is my commandment to you, to love one another as I have loved you.
26713	43	15	13	 No one has greater love than this--a man laying down his life for his friends.
26714	43	15	14	 You are my friends, if you do what I command you.
26715	43	15	15	 No longer do I call you  servants, because a servant does not know what his master is doing; but I have called you friends, because all that I have heard from the Father I have made known to you.
26716	43	15	16	 It is not you who chose me, but it is I who chose you and appointed you that you might go and be fruitful and that your fruit might remain; so that whatever petition you present to the Father in my name He may give you.
26717	43	15	17	 "Thus I command you to love one another.
26718	43	15	18	 If the world hates you, remember that it has first had me as the fixed object of its hatred.
26719	43	15	19	 If you belonged to the world, the world would love its own property. But because you do not belong to the world, and I have chosen you out of the world--for that reason the world hates you.
26720	43	15	20	 Bear in mind what I said to you, `A servant is not superior to his master.' If they have persecuted me, they will also persecute you: if they have obeyed my teaching, they will obey yours also.
26721	43	15	21	 But they will inflict all this suffering upon you on account of your bearing my name--because they do not know Him who sent me.
26722	43	15	22	 "If I had not come and spoken to them, they would have had no sin; but as the case stands they are without excuse for their sin.
26723	43	15	23	 He who hates me hates my Father also.
26724	43	15	24	 If I had not done among them,  as I have, such miracles as no one else ever did, they would have had no sin; but they  have in fact seen and also hated both me and my Father.
26725	43	15	25	 But this has been so, in order that the saying may be fulfilled which stands written in their Law, <`They have hated me without any reason.'>
26726	43	15	26	 "When the Advocate is come whom I will send to you from the Father's presence--the Spirit of Truth who comes forth from the Father's presence--He will be a witness concerning me.
26727	43	15	27	 And you also are witnesses, because you have been with me from the first.
26728	43	16	1	 "These things I have spoken to you in order to clear stumbling-blocks out of your path.
26729	43	16	2	 You will be excluded from the synagogues; nay more, the time is coming when any one who has murdered one of you will suppose he is offering service to God.
26730	43	16	3	 And they will do these things because they have failed to recognize  the Father and to discover who I am.
