26731	43	16	4	 But I have spoken these things to you in order that when the time for their accomplishment comes you may remember them, and may recollect that I told you. I did not, however, tell you all this at first, because I was still with you.
26732	43	16	5	 But now I an returning to Him who sent me; and not one of you  asks me where I am going.
26733	43	16	6	 But grief has filled your hearts because I have said all this to you.
26734	43	16	7	 "Yet it is the truth that  I am telling you--it is to your advantage that I go away. For unless I go away, the Advocate will not come to you; but if I go, I will send Him to you.
26735	43	16	8	 And He, when He comes, will  convict the world in respect of sin, of righteousness, and of judgement; --
26736	43	16	9	 of sin, because they do not believe in me;
26737	43	16	10	 of righteousness, because I am going to the Father, and  you will no longer see me;
26738	43	16	11	 of judgement, because the Prince of this world is under sentence.
26739	43	16	12	 "I have much more to say to you, but you are unable at present to bear the burden of it.
26740	43	16	13	 But when He has come--the Spirit of Truth--He will guide you into all the truth. For He will not speak as Himself originating what He says, but  all that He hears He will speak, and He will make known  the future to you.
26741	43	16	14	 He will glorify me, because He will take of what is mine and will make it known to you.
26742	43	16	15	 Everything that the Father has is mine; that is why I said that the Spirit of Truth takes of what is mine and will make it known to you.
26743	43	16	16	 "A little while and you see me no more, and again a little while and you shall see me."
26744	43	16	17	 Some of His disciples therefore said to one another, "What does this mean which He is telling us, `A little while and you do not see me, and again a little while and you shall see me,' and  `Because I am going to the Father'?"
26745	43	16	18	 So they asked one another repeatedly, "What can that `little while' mean which He speaks of? We do not understand His words."
26746	43	16	19	 Jesus perceived that they wanted to ask Him, and He said, "Is this what you are questioning one another about--my saying, `A little while and you do not see me, and again a little while and you shall see me'?
26747	43	16	20	 In most solemn truth I tell you that you will weep aloud and lament, but the world will be glad. You will mourn, but your grief will be turned into gladness.
26748	43	16	21	 A woman, when she is in labour, has sorrow, because her time has come. But when she has given birth to the babe, she no longer remembers the pain, because of her joy at a child being born into the world.
26749	43	16	22	 So you also now have sorrow; but  I shall see you again, and your hearts will be glad, and your gladness no one will take away from you.
26750	43	16	23	 You will put no questions to me  then. "In most solemn truth I tell you that whatever you ask the Father for in my name He will give you.
26751	43	16	24	 As yet you have not asked for anything  in my name: ask, and you shall receive, that your hearts may be filled with gladness.
26752	43	16	25	 "All this I have spoken to you in veiled language. The time is coming when I shall no longer speak to you in veiled language, but  will tell you about the Father in plain words.
26753	43	16	26	  At that time you will make your requests in my name; and I do not promise to ask the Father on your behalf,
26754	43	16	27	 for the Father Himself holds you dear, because you  have held me dear and have believed that I came from the Father's presence.
26755	43	16	28	 I came  from the Father and have come into the world. Again I am leaving the world and am going to the Father."
26756	43	16	29	 "Ah, now you are using plain language," said His disciples, "and are uttering no figure of speech!
26757	43	16	30	 Now we know that you have all knowledge, and do not need to be pressed with questions. Through this we believe that you came from God."
26758	43	16	31	 "Do you at last believe?" replied Jesus.
26759	43	16	32	 "Remember that the time is coming, nay, has already come, for you all to be dispersed each to his own home and to leave me alone. And yet I am not alone, for the Father is with me.
26760	43	16	33	 "I have spoken all this to you in order that in me you may have peace. In the world you have affliction. But keep up your courage: *I* have won the victory over the world."
26761	43	17	1	 When Jesus had thus spoken, He raised his eyes towards Heaven and said, "Father, the hour has come. Glorify Thy Son that the Son may glorify Thee;
26762	43	17	2	 even as Thou hast given Him authority over all mankind, so that on all whom Thou hast given Him He may bestow the Life of the Ages.
26763	43	17	3	 And in this consists the Life of the Ages--in  knowing Thee the only true God and Jesus Christ whom Thou hast sent.
26764	43	17	4	 I have glorified Thee on earth, having done perfectly the work which  by Thine appointment has been mine to do.
26765	43	17	5	 And now, Father, do Thou glorify me in Thine own presence, with the glory that I had in Thy presence before the world existed.
26766	43	17	6	 "I have revealed Thy  perfections to the men whom Thou gavest me out of the world. Thine they were, and Thou gavest them to me, and  they have obeyed Thy message.
26767	43	17	7	 Now they know that whatever Thou hast given me is  from Thee.
26768	43	17	8	 For the truths which Thou didst  teach me I have taught them. And they have received them, and have known for certain that I came out from Thy presence, and have believed that Thou didst send me.
26769	43	17	9	  "I am making request  for them: for the world  I do not make any request, but for those whom Thou hast given me. Because they are Thine,
26770	43	17	10	 and everything that is mine is Thine, and everything that is Thine is mine; and I  am crowned with glory in them.
26771	43	17	11	 I am now no longer in the world, but they are in the world and I am coming to Thee. "Holy Father, keep them  true to Thy name--the name which Thou hast given me  to bear--that they may be one, even as we are.
26772	43	17	12	 While I was with them, I kept them true to Thy name--the name Thou hast given me  to bear--and I kept watch over them, and not one of them is lost but only he who is  doomed to destruction--that the Scripture may be fulfilled.
26773	43	17	13	 "But now I am coming to Thee, and I speak these words while I am in the world, in order that they may have my gladness within them filling their hearts.
26774	43	17	14	 I have given them Thy  Message, and the world has hated them, because they do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.
26775	43	17	15	 I do not ask that Thou wilt remove them out of the world, but that Thou wilt protect them from  the Evil one.
26776	43	17	16	 They do not belong to the world, just as I do not belong to the world.
26777	43	17	17	 Make them holy  in the truth: Thy  Message is truth.
26778	43	17	18	 Just as Thou didst send me into the world, I also  have sent them;
26779	43	17	19	 and on their behalf I  consecrate myself, in order that they may become perfectly consecrated in truth.
26780	43	17	20	 "Nor is it for them alone that I make request. It is also for  those who trust in me through their teaching;
26781	43	17	21	 that they may all be one, even as Thou art in me, O Father, and I am in Thee; that they also may be in us; that the world  may believe that Thou didst send me.
26782	43	17	22	 And the glory which Thou hast given me  I have given them, that they may be one, just as we are one:
26783	43	17	23	 I in them and Thou in me; that they may stand perfected  in one; that the world may come to understand that Thou didst send me and hast loved them with the same love as that with which Thou hast loved me.
26784	43	17	24	 "Father,  those whom Thou hast given me--I desire that where I am they also may be with me, that they  may see the glory--my glory--my gift from Thee, which Thou hast given me because Thou didst love me before the creation of the world.
26785	43	17	25	  And, righteous Father, though the world has failed to recognize Thee, I have known Thee, and these have perceived that Thou didst send me.
26786	43	17	26	 And I have made known Thy  name to them and will make it known, that the love with which Thou hast loved me may be in them, and that I may be in them."
26787	43	18	1	  After offering this prayer Jesus went out with His disciples to a place on the further side of the Ravine of the Cedars, where there was a garden which He entered--Himself and His disciples.
26788	43	18	2	  Now Judas also, who at that very time was betraying Him, knew the place, for Jesus had often resorted there with His disciples.
26789	43	18	3	 So Judas,  followed by the battalion and by a detachment of the Temple police sent by the High Priests and Pharisees, came there with torches and lamps and weapons.
26790	43	18	4	 Jesus therefore, knowing all that was about to befall Him, went out to meet them.  "Who are you looking for?" He asked them.
26791	43	18	5	 "For Jesus the Nazarene," was the answer. "I am he," He replied. (Now Judas who was betraying Him was also standing with them.)
26792	43	18	6	 As soon then as He said to them, "I am he," they went backwards and  fell to the ground.
26793	43	18	7	 Again therefore He asked them,  "Who are you looking for?" "For Jesus the Nazarene," they said.
26794	43	18	8	 "I have told you," replied Jesus, "that I am he. If therefore you are looking for me, let these my disciples go their way."
26795	43	18	9	 He made this request in order that the words He had spoken might be fulfilled, "As for those whom Thou hast given me, I have not lost one."
26796	43	18	10	 Simon Peter, however, having a sword, drew it, and, aiming at the High Priest's  servant, cut off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus.
26797	43	18	11	 Jesus therefore said to Peter, "Put back your sword. Shall I refuse to drink the cup of sorrow which the Father has given me to drink?"
26798	43	18	12	  So the battalion and their  tribune and the Jewish police closed in, and took Jesus and bound Him.
26799	43	18	13	 They then brought Him to  Annas first; for Annas was the father-in-law of Caiaphas who was High Priest that year.
26800	43	18	14	 (It was this Caiaphas who had advised the Jews, saying, "It is to your interest that one man should die for the People.")
26801	43	18	15	 Meanwhile Simon Peter was following Jesus, and so also was another disciple. The latter was known to the High Priest, and went in with Jesus into the court of the High Priest's palace.
26802	43	18	16	 But Peter remained standing outside the door, till the disciple who was acquainted with the High Priest came out and induced the portress to let Peter in.
26803	43	18	17	 This led the girl, the portress, to ask Peter, "Are you also one of this man's disciples?" "No, I am not," he replied.
26804	43	18	18	 Now because it was cold the  servants and the police had lighted a  charcoal fire, and were standing and warming themselves; and Peter too remained with them, standing and warming himself.
26805	43	18	19	  So the High Priest questioned Jesus about His disciples and His teaching.
26806	43	18	20	 "As for me," replied Jesus,  "I have spoken  openly to the world. I  have continually taught in some synagogue or in the Temple where all the Jews are wont to assemble, and I have said nothing in secret.
26807	43	18	21	 Why do you question me? Question  those who heard what it was I said to them: these witnesses here know what I said."
26808	43	18	22	 Upon His saying this, one of the officers standing by struck Him  with his open hand, asking Him as he did so, "Is that the way you answer the High Priest?"
26809	43	18	23	 "If I have spoken wrongly," replied Jesus, "bear witness to it as wrong; but if rightly, why that blow?"
26810	43	18	24	  So Annas  sent Him bound to Caiaphas the High Priest.
26811	43	18	25	 But Simon Peter remained standing and  warming himself, and this led to their asking him, "Are you also one of his disciples?" He denied it, and said, "No, I am not."
26812	43	18	26	 One of the High Priest's servants, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, "Did I not see you in the garden with him?"
26813	43	18	27	 Once more Peter denied it, and immediately a cock crowed.
26814	43	18	28	  So they brought Jesus from Caiaphas's house to the  Praetorium. It was the early morning, and they would not enter the Praetorium themselves for fear of defilement, and in order that they might be able to eat the Passover.
26815	43	18	29	  Accordingly Pilate  came out to them and inquired, "What accusation have you to bring against this man?"
26816	43	18	30	 "If the man were not a criminal," they replied, "we would not have handed him over to you."
26817	43	18	31	 "Take him yourselves," said Pilate, "and judge him by your Law." "We have no power," replied the Jews, "to put any man to death."
26818	43	18	32	 They said this that the words might be fulfilled in which Jesus predicted the kind of death He was to die.
26819	43	18	33	  Re-entering the Praetorium, therefore, Pilate called Jesus and asked Him, "Are *you* the King of the Jews?"
26820	43	18	34	 "Do you say this of yourself, or have others told it you about me?" replied Jesus.
26821	43	18	35	 "Am I a Jew?" exclaimed Pilate; "it is your own nation and the High Priests who have handed you over to me. What have you done?"
26822	43	18	36	 "My kingdom," replied Jesus, "does not belong to this world. If my kingdom did belong to this world, my subjects  would have resolutely fought to save me from being delivered up to the Jews. But, as a matter of fact, my kingdom has not this origin."
26823	43	18	37	 "So then *you* are a king!" rejoined Pilate. "Yes," said Jesus, "you say truly that I am a king. For this purpose  I was born, and for this purpose I have come into the world--to give testimony for the truth. Every one who is  a friend of the truth listens to my voice."
26824	43	18	38	 "What is truth?" said Pilate. But no sooner had he spoken the words than he went out again to the Jews and told them, "I find no crime in him.
26825	43	18	39	  But you have a custom that I should release one prisoner to you at the Passover. So shall I release to you the King of the Jews?"
26826	43	18	40	 With a roar of voices they again cried out, saying, "Not this man, but Barabbas!" Now Barabbas was a robber.
26827	43	19	1	 Then Pilate took Jesus and scourged Him.
26828	43	19	2	 And the soldiers, twisting twigs of thorn into a wreath, put it on His head, and threw round Him a crimson cloak.
26829	43	19	3	 Then they began to march up to Him, saying in a mocking voice, "Hail King of the Jews!" And they struck Him with the palms of their hands.
26830	43	19	4	 Once more Pilate  came out and said to the Jews, "See, I am bringing him out to you to let you clearly understand that I find no crime in him."
26831	43	19	5	 So Jesus came out, wearing the wreath of thorns and the crimson cloak. And Pilate said to them, "See, there is the man."
26832	43	19	6	 As soon then as the High Priests and the officers saw Him, they shouted "To the cross! To the cross!" "Take him yourselves and crucify him," said Pilate; "for I, at any rate, find no crime in him."
26833	43	19	7	 "We," replied the Jews, "have a Law, and in accordance with that Law he ought to die, for having claimed to be the Son of God."
26834	43	19	8	 More alarmed than ever, Pilate no sooner heard these words than he re-entered the Praetorium and began to question Jesus.
26835	43	19	9	 "What is your origin?" he asked. But Jesus gave him no answer.
26836	43	19	10	 "Do you refuse to speak even to me?" asked Pilate; "do you not know that I have it in my power either to release you or to crucify you?"
26837	43	19	11	 "You would have had no power whatever over me," replied Jesus, "had it not been granted you from above. On that account he who has delivered me up to you is more guilty than you are."
26838	43	19	12	 Upon receiving this answer, Pilate was for releasing Him. But the Jews  kept shouting, "If you release this man, you are no friend of Caesar's. Every one who sets himself up as king declares himself a rebel against Caesar."
26839	43	19	13	 On hearing this, Pilate brought Jesus out, and  sat down on the judge's seat in a place called the Pavement--or in Hebrew, Gabbatha.
26840	43	19	14	 It was the day of Preparation for the Passover, about  six o'clock in the morning. Then he said to the Jews, "There is your king!"
26841	43	19	15	 This caused a storm of outcries, "Away with him! Away with him! Crucify him!" "Am I to crucify your king?" Pilate asked. "We have no king, except Caesar," answered the High Priests.
26842	43	19	16	  Then Pilate gave Him up to them to be crucified. Accordingly they took Jesus;
26843	43	19	17	  and He went out carrying His own cross, to the place called Skull-place--or, in Hebrew, Golgotha--
26844	43	19	18	  where they nailed Him to a cross, and two others at the same time, one on each side and Jesus in the middle.
26845	43	19	19	 And Pilate wrote a notice and had it fastened to the top of the cross. It ran thus: JESUS THE NAZARENE, THE KING OF THE JEWS.
26846	43	19	20	 Many of the Jews read this notice, for the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and the notice was in three languages--Hebrew, Latin, and Greek.
26847	43	19	21	 This led the Jewish High Priests to remonstrate with Pilate. "You should not write `The King of the Jews,'" they said, "but that he claimed to be King of the Jews."
26848	43	19	22	 "What I have written I have written," was Pilate's answer.
26849	43	19	23	 So the soldiers, as soon as they had crucified Jesus, took His garments, including His  tunic, and divided them into four parts--one part for each soldier. The tunic was without seam, woven from the top in one piece.
26850	43	19	24	 So they said to one another, "Do not let us tear it. Let us draw lots for it." This happened that the Scripture might be fulfilled which says, <"They shared my garments among them, and drew lots for my clothing."> That was just what the soldiers did.
26851	43	19	25	  Now standing close to the cross of Jesus were His mother and His mother's sister,  Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary of Magdala.
26852	43	19	26	 So Jesus, seeing His mother, and seeing the disciple whom He loved standing near, said to His mother,  "Behold, your son!"
26853	43	19	27	 Then He said to the disciple, "Behold, your mother!" And from that time the disciple received her into his own home.
26854	43	19	28	  After this, Jesus, knowing that everything was now brought to an end, said--that the Scripture might be fulfilled, "I am thirsty."
26855	43	19	29	 There was a jar of  wine standing there. With this wine they filled a sponge, put it on the end of a stalk of hyssop, and lifted it to His mouth.
26856	43	19	30	 As soon as Jesus had taken the wine, He said, "It is finished." And then, bowing His head, He yielded up His spirit.
26857	43	19	31	  Meanwhile the Jews, because it was the day of Preparation for the Passover, and in order that the bodies might not remain on the crosses during  the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was one of special solemnity), requested Pilate to have the legs of the dying men broken, and the bodies removed.
26858	43	19	32	 Accordingly the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and also of the other who had been crucified with Jesus.
26859	43	19	33	 Then they came to Jesus Himself: but when they saw that He was already dead, they refrained from breaking His legs.
26860	43	19	34	 One of the soldiers, however, made a thrust at His side with a lance, and immediately  blood and water flowed out.
26861	43	19	35	 This statement is the testimony of an eye-witness, and it is true. He knows that he is telling the truth--in order that you also may believe.
26862	43	19	36	 For all this took place that the Scripture might be fulfilled which declares, <"Not one of His bones shall be broken.">
26863	43	19	37	 And again another Scripture says, <"They shall look on Him whom they have pierced.">
26864	43	19	38	  After this, Joseph of Arimathaea, who was a disciple of Jesus, but for fear of the Jews a secret disciple, asked Pilate's permission to carry away the body of Jesus; and Pilate gave him leave. So he came and removed the body.
26865	43	19	39	 Nicodemus too--he who at first had visited Jesus by night--came bringing a  mixture of myrrh and aloes, in weight about  seventy or eighty pounds.
26866	43	19	40	 Taking down the body they wrapped it in linen cloths along with the spices, in accordance with the Jewish mode of preparing for burial.
26867	43	19	41	 There was a garden at the place where Jesus had been crucified, and in the garden a new tomb, in which no one had yet been buried.
26868	43	19	42	 Therefore, because it was the day of Preparation for the Jewish Passover, and the tomb was close at hand, they put Jesus there.
26869	43	20	1	  On the first day of the week, very early, while it was still dark, Mary of Magdala came to the tomb and saw that the stone had been  removed from it.
26870	43	20	2	  So she ran, as fast as she could, to find Simon Peter and the other disciple--the one who was dear to Jesus--and to tell them, "They have taken the Master out of the tomb, and we do not know where they have put Him."
26871	43	20	3	  Peter and the other disciple started at once to go to the tomb, both of them running,
26872	43	20	4	 but the other disciple ran faster than Peter and reached it before he did.
26873	43	20	5	  Stooping and looking in, he saw the linen cloths lying there on the ground, but he did not go in.
26874	43	20	6	 Simon Peter, however, also came, following him, and entered the tomb. There on the ground he saw the cloths;
26875	43	20	7	 and the  towel, which had been placed  over the face of Jesus, not lying with the cloths, but folded up and put by itself.
26876	43	20	8	 Then the other disciple, who had been the first to come to the tomb, also went in and saw and was convinced.
26877	43	20	9	 For until now they had not understood the inspired teaching, that He must rise again from among the dead.
26878	43	20	10	 Then they went away and returned home.
26879	43	20	11	  Meanwhile Mary remained standing near the tomb, weeping aloud. She did not enter the tomb, but as she wept she stooped and looked in,
26880	43	20	12	 and  saw two angels clothed in white raiment, sitting one at the head and one at the feet where the body of Jesus had been.
26881	43	20	13	 They spoke to her.  "Why are you weeping?" they asked. "Because," she replied, "they have taken away my Lord, and I do not know where they have put him."
26882	43	20	14	 While she was speaking, she turned round and saw Jesus standing there, but did not recognize Him.
26883	43	20	15	  "Why are you weeping?" He asked;  "who are you looking for?" She, supposing that He was the gardener, replied, "Sir, if you have carried him away, tell me where you have put him and I will remove him."
26884	43	20	16	 "Mary!" said Jesus. She turned to Him.  "Rabboni!" she cried in Hebrew: the word means `Teacher!'
26885	43	20	17	  "Do not cling to me," said Jesus, "for I have not yet ascended to the Father.  But take this message to my brethren: `I am ascending to my Father and your Father, to my God and your God.'"
26886	43	20	18	 Mary of Magdala came and brought word to the disciples. "I have seen the Master," she said. And she told them that He had said these things to her.
26887	43	20	19	  On that same first day of the week, when it was evening and, for fear of the Jews, the doors of the house where the disciples were, were locked, Jesus came and stood in their midst, and said to them, "Peace be to you!"
26888	43	20	20	 Having said this He showed them His hands and also His side; and the disciples were filled with joy at seeing the Master.
26889	43	20	21	 A second time, therefore,  He said to them, "Peace be to you! As the Father sent me, I also now send you."
26890	43	20	22	 Having said this He breathed upon them and said, "Receive  the Holy Spirit.
26891	43	20	23	 If you remit the sins of any persons, they  remain remitted to them. If you bind fast the sins of any, they remain bound."
26892	43	20	24	 Thomas, one of the twelve--surnamed `the Twin' --was not among them when Jesus came.
26893	43	20	25	 So the rest of the disciples told him, "We have seen the Master!" His reply was, "Unless I see in his hands the wound made by the nails and put my  finger into the wound, and put my hand into his side, I will never believe it."
26894	43	20	26	 A week later the disciples were again in the house, and Thomas was with them, when Jesus came--though the doors were locked--and stood in their midst, and said, "Peace be to you."
26895	43	20	27	 Then He said to Thomas, "Bring your finger here and  feel my hands; bring you hand and put it into my side; and do not be ready to disbelieve but to believe."
26896	43	20	28	 "My Lord and my God!" replied Thomas.
26897	43	20	29	 "Because you have seen me," replied Jesus, "you have believed. Blessed are those who have not seen and yet have believed."
26898	43	20	30	  There were also a great number of other signs which Jesus performed in the presence of the disciples, which are not recorded in this book.
26899	43	20	31	 But these have been recorded in order that you may believe that He is the Christ, the Son of God, and that, through believing, you may have Life through His name.
26900	43	21	1	  After this, Jesus again showed Himself to the disciples. It was at the Lake of Tiberias. The circumstances were as follows.
26901	43	21	2	 Simon Peter was with Thomas, called the Twin, Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, the sons of Zabdi, and two others of the Master's disciples.
26902	43	21	3	 Simon Peter said to them, "I am going fishing." "We will go too," said they. So they set out and went on board their boat; but they caught nothing that night.
26903	43	21	4	 When, however, day was now dawning, Jesus stood on the beach, though the disciples did not know that it was Jesus.
26904	43	21	5	 He called to them. "Children," He said, "have you any food there?" "No," they answered.
26905	43	21	6	 "Throw the net in on the right hand side," He said, "and you will find fish." So they threw the net in, and now they could scarcely drag it along for the quantity of fish.
26906	43	21	7	 This made the disciple whom Jesus  loved say to Peter, "It is the Master." Simon Peter therefore, when he heard the words, "It is the Master," drew on his  fisherman's shirt--for  he had not been wearing it--put on his girdle, and sprang into the water.
26907	43	21	8	 But the rest of the disciples came in the  small boat (for they were not far from land--only about a hundred yards off), dragging the net full of fish.
26908	43	21	9	 As soon as they landed, they saw a charcoal fire burning there, with fish broiling on it, and bread close by.
26909	43	21	10	 Jesus told them to fetch some of the fish which they had just caught.
26910	43	21	11	 So Simon Peter went on board  the boat and drew the net ashore full of large fish, 153 in number; and yet, although there were so many, the net had not broken.
26911	43	21	12	 "Come this way and have breakfast," said Jesus. But not one of the disciples ventured to question Him as to who He was, for they felt sure that it was the Master.
26912	43	21	13	 Then Jesus came and took the bread and gave them some, and the fish in the same way.
26913	43	21	14	 This was now the third occasion on which Jesus showed Himself to the disciples after He had risen from among the dead.
26914	43	21	15	 When they had finished breakfast, Jesus asked Simon Peter, "Simon, son of John, do you  love me  more than these others do?" "Yes, Master," was his answer; "you know that you  are dear to me."  "Then feed my lambs," replied Jesus.
26915	43	21	16	 Again a second time He asked him, "Simon, son of John, do you love me?" "Yes, Master," he said, "you know that you are dear to me." "Then be a shepherd to my sheep," He said.
26916	43	21	17	 A third time Jesus put the question: "Simon, son of John, am I dear to you?" It grieved Peter that Jesus asked him the third time, "Am I dear to you?" "Master," he replied, "you know everything, you can see that you are dear to me." "Then feed my  much-loved sheep," said Jesus.
26917	43	21	18	 "In most solemn truth I tell you that whereas, when you were young, you used to put on your girdle and walk whichever way you chose, when you have grown old you will stretch out your arms and  some one else will put  a girdle round you and  carry you where you have no wish to go."
26918	43	21	19	 This He said to indicate the kind of death by which that disciple would bring glory to God; and after speaking thus He said to him, "Follow me."
26919	43	21	20	 Peter turned round and noticed the disciple whom Jesus loved following--the one who at the supper had leaned back on His breast and had asked, "Master, who is it that is betraying you?"
26920	43	21	21	 On seeing him, Peter asked Jesus, "And, Master, what about him?"
26921	43	21	22	 "If I desire him to remain  till I come," replied Jesus, "what concern is that of yours? You, yourself, must follow me."
26922	43	21	23	 Hence the report spread among the brethren that that disciple would never die. Yet Jesus did not say, "He is not to die," but, "If I desire him to remain till I come,  what concern is that of yours?"
26923	43	21	24	 That is the disciple who gives his testimony as to these matters, and has written this history; and we know that his testimony is true.
26924	43	21	25	  But there are also many other things which Jesus did--so vast a number indeed that if they were all described in detail, I suppose that the world itself could not contain the books that would have to be written.
26925	44	1	1	 My former narrative, Theophilus, dealt with all that Jesus did and taught  as a beginning, down to the day on which,
26926	44	1	2	 after giving instruction through the Holy Spirit to the Apostles whom He had chosen, He was  taken up to Heaven.
26927	44	1	3	 He had also, after He suffered,  shown Himself alive to them with many sure  proofs,  appearing to them at intervals during forty days, and speaking of the Kingdom of God.
26928	44	1	4	 And  while in their company He charged them not to leave Jerusalem, but to wait for the Father's promised gift. "This you have heard of," He said, "from me.
26929	44	1	5	 For John indeed baptized with water, but before many days have passed you shall be baptized with the Holy Spirit."
26930	44	1	6	  Once when they were with Him, they asked Him, "Master, is this the time at which you are about to restore the kingdom of Israel?"
26931	44	1	7	 "It is not for you," He replied, "to know  times or epochs which  the Father has reserved within His own authority;
26932	44	1	8	  and yet you  will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judaea and Samaria and to the remotest parts of the earth."
26933	44	1	9	 When He had said this, and while they were looking at Him, He was carried up, and a cloud closing beneath Him hid Him from their sight.
26934	44	1	10	 But, while they stood intently gazing into the sky as He went, suddenly there were two men in white garments standing by them,
26935	44	1	11	 who said, "Galilaeans, why stand looking into  the sky? This same Jesus who has been taken up from you into  Heaven will come  in just the same way as you have seen Him going into Heaven."
26936	44	1	12	 Then they returned to Jerusalem from the mountain called the Oliveyard, which is near Jerusalem,  about a mile off.
26937	44	1	13	 They entered the city, and they went up  to the upper room which was now their fixed place for meeting. Their names were Peter and  John, James and Andrew, Philip and Thomas, Bartholomew and Matthew, James the son of Alphaeus, Simon the Zealot, and Judas the brother of James.
26938	44	1	14	 All of these with one mind continued earnest in prayer, together with some women, and Mary the mother of Jesus, and His brothers.
26939	44	1	15	 It was on one of these days that Peter stood up in the midst of the brethren--the entire number of persons present being about 120--and said,
26940	44	1	16	  "Brethren, it was necessary that the Scripture should be fulfilled--the prediction, I mean, which the Holy Spirit uttered by the lips of David, about Judas, who acted as guide to those who arrested Jesus.
26941	44	1	17	 For Judas was reckoned as one of our number, and  a share in this ministry was allotted to him."
26942	44	1	18	  (Now having bought a piece of ground with the money paid for his wickedness he fell there with his face downwards, and, his body bursting open, he became disembowelled.
26943	44	1	19	 This fact became widely known to the people of Jerusalem, so that the place received the name, in their language, of Achel-damach, which means `The Field of Blood.')
26944	44	1	20	 "For it is written in the Book of Psalms, <"`Let his  encampment be desolate: let there be no one to dwell there';> and <"`His  work let another take up.'>
26945	44	1	21	 "It is necessary, therefore, that of the men who have been with us all the time that the Lord Jesus went in and out among us--
26946	44	1	22	 beginning from His baptism by John down to the day on which He was taken up  again from us into Heaven--one should be appointed to become a witness with us as to His resurrection."
26947	44	1	23	 So  two names were proposed, Joseph called Bar-sabbas--and surnamed  Justus--and Matthias.
26948	44	1	24	 And the brethren prayed, saying, "Thou, Lord,  who knowest the hearts of all, show clearly which of these two Thou hast chosen
26949	44	1	25	 to occupy the place in this ministry and Apostleship  from which Judas  through transgression fell, in order to go to his own place."
26950	44	1	26	 Then they drew lots between them. The lot fell on Matthias, and a place among the eleven Apostles was voted to him.
26951	44	2	1	  At length, on the day of the Harvest Festival, they had all met in one place;
26952	44	2	2	 when suddenly there came from the sky a sound as of a strong rushing blast of wind. This filled the whole house where they were sitting;
26953	44	2	3	 and they saw tongues of what looked like fire  distributing themselves over the assembly, and on the head of each person a tongue alighted.
26954	44	2	4	 They were all filled with the Holy Spirit, and began to speak  in foreign languages according as the Spirit gave them words to utter.
26955	44	2	5	 Now there were Jews  residing in Jerusalem, devout men from every part of the world.
26956	44	2	6	 So when  this noise was heard, they came crowding together, and were amazed because everyone heard his own language spoken.
26957	44	2	7	 They were beside themselves with wonder, and exclaimed, "Are not all these speakers Galilaeans?
26958	44	2	8	 How then does each of us hear his own native language spoken by them?
26959	44	2	9	 Some of us are  Parthians, Medes, Elamites. Some are  inhabitants of Mesopotamia, of Judaea or Cappadocia, of Pontus or  the Asian Province, of Phrygia or Pamphylia,
26960	44	2	10	 of Egypt or of the parts of Africa towards Cyrene. Others are visitors from Rome--being either Jews or converts from heathenism--and others are Cretans or Arabians.
26961	44	2	11	 Yet we all alike hear these Galilaeans speaking in our own language about the wonderful things which God has done."
26962	44	2	12	 They were all astounded and bewildered, and asked one another, "What can this mean?"
26963	44	2	13	 But others, scornfully jeering, said, "They are brim-full of  sweet wine."
26964	44	2	14	 Peter however, together with the Eleven, stood up and addressed them in a loud voice. "Men of Judaea, and all you inhabitants of Jerusalem," he said, "be in no uncertainty about this matter but pay attention to what I say.
26965	44	2	15	 For this is not intoxication, as you suppose, it being only the  third hour of the day.
26966	44	2	16	 But that which was predicted through the Prophet Joel has happened:
26967	44	2	17	 <"And it shall come to pass in  the last days, God says, that I will pour out  My Spirit upon all  mankind; and your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, and your young men shall see visions, and your old men shall have dreams;
26968	44	2	18	 and even upon My bondservants, both men and women, at that time, I will pour out  My Spirit, and they shall prophesy.
26969	44	2	19	 I will display marvels in the sky above, and signs on the earth below, blood and fire, and pillars of smoke.
26970	44	2	20	 The sun shall be turned into darkness and the moon into blood, to usher in the day of the Lord--  that great and illustrious day;
26971	44	2	21	 and every one who calls on the name of the Lord shall be saved.'>
26972	44	2	22	 "Listen, Israelites, to what I say. Jesus, the Nazarene, a man accredited to you  from God by miracles and marvels and signs which God did among you through Him, as you yourselves know, Him--
26973	44	2	23	 delivered up through God's settled purpose and foreknowledge--you by the hands of  Gentiles have nailed to a cross and have put to death.
26974	44	2	24	 But God has raised Him to life, having   terminated the throes of death, for in fact it was not possible for Him to be held fast by death.
26975	44	2	25	 For David says in reference to Him, <"`I constantly fixed my eyes upon the Lord, because He is at my right hand in order that I may continue unshaken.
26976	44	2	26	 For this reason my heart  is glad and my tongue  exults. My body also  shall rest in hope.
26977	44	2	27	 For Thou wilt not leave me in  the Unseen World forsaken, nor give up Thy holy One to undergo  decay.
26978	44	2	28	 Thou hast made known to me the ways of Life: Thou wilt fill me with gladness  in Thy presence.'>
26979	44	2	29	 "As to the patriarch David, I need hardly remind you, brethren, that he died and was buried, and that we still have his tomb among us.
26980	44	2	30	 Being a Prophet, however, and knowing that God had solemnly sworn to him  to seat a descendant of his upon his throne,
26981	44	2	31	 with prophetic foresight he spoke of the resurrection of  the Christ, to the effect that He was not left forsaken in the Unseen World, nor did His body undergo decay.
26982	44	2	32	 This Jesus, God has raised to life--  a fact to which all of us testify.
26983	44	2	33	 "Being therefore lifted high  by the mighty hand of God, He has received from the Father the promised Holy Spirit and has poured out this which you  see and hear.
26984	44	2	34	 For David  did not ascend into Heaven, but he says himself, <"`The Lord said to my Lord, Sit at My right hand
26985	44	2	35	 until I make thy foes a footstool under thy feet.'>
26986	44	2	36	 "Therefore let  the whole House of Israel know beyond all doubt that God has made Him both LORD and CHRIST--this Jesus whom you crucified."
26987	44	2	37	  Stung to the heart by these words, they said to Peter and the rest of the Apostles, "Brethren, what are we to do?"
26988	44	2	38	 "Repent," replied Peter, "and be baptized, every one of you, in the name of Jesus Christ,  with a view to the remission of your sins, and you shall receive  the gift of the Holy Spirit.
26989	44	2	39	 For to you belongs the promise, and to your children, and to all who are  far off, whoever the Lord our God  may call."
26990	44	2	40	 And with many more appeals he solemnly warned and entreated them, saying,  "Escape from this crooked generation."
26991	44	2	41	 Those, therefore, who joyfully welcomed his Message were baptized; and on that one day about three thousand persons were added to them;
26992	44	2	42	 and they were constant in listening to the teaching of the Apostles and in their attendance at the  Communion, that is, the Breaking of the Bread, and  at prayer.
26993	44	2	43	 Fear came upon every one, and many marvels and signs  were done by the Apostles.
26994	44	2	44	 And all the believers kept together, and had everything in common.
26995	44	2	45	 They sold their  lands and other property, and distributed the proceeds among all, according to every one's necessities.
26996	44	2	46	 And, day by day, attending constantly in the  Temple with one accord, and breaking bread  in private houses, they took their meals with great happiness and single-heartedness,
26997	44	2	47	 praising God and being regarded with favour by all the people. Also, day by day, the Lord added  to their number those  whom He was saving.
26998	44	3	1	 One day Peter and John were going up to the Temple for  the hour of prayer--the ninth hour--and, just then,
26999	44	3	2	 some men were carrying there one who had been lame from birth, whom they were wont  to place every day close to the Beautiful  Gate (as it was called) of the Temple, for him to beg from the people as they went in.
27000	44	3	3	 Seeing Peter and John about to go into the Temple, he asked them for alms.
27001	44	3	4	 Peter fixing his eyes on him, as John did also, said, "Look at us."
27002	44	3	5	 So he looked and waited, expecting to receive something from them.
27003	44	3	6	 "I have no silver or gold," Peter said, "but what I have, I give you. In the name of Jesus Christ, the Nazarene--  walk!"
27004	44	3	7	 Then taking his hand Peter lifted him up, and immediately his  feet and ankles were  strengthened.
27005	44	3	8	 Leaping up, he stood upright and began to walk, and went into the Temple with them, walking, leaping, and praising God.
27006	44	3	9	 All the people saw him walking and praising God;
27007	44	3	10	 and  recognizing him as the man who used to sit at the Beautiful Gate of the Temple asking for alms, they were filled with awe and amazement at what had happened to him.
27008	44	3	11	 While he still clung to Peter and John, the people, awe-struck, ran up crowding round them in what was known as Solomon's Portico.
27009	44	3	12	 Peter, seeing this,  spoke to the people. "Israelites," he said, "why do you wonder at  this man? Or why gaze at us, as though by any power or piety of our own we had enabled him to walk?
27010	44	3	13	 The God of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, the God of our forefathers, has conferred this honour on His  Servant Jesus, whom you delivered up and disowned in the presence of Pilate, when he had decided to let Him go.
27011	44	3	14	 Yes, you disowned the holy and righteous One, and asked as a favour the release of  a murderer.
27012	44	3	15	 The Prince of Life you put to death; but God has raised Him from the dead, and we are witnesses as to that.
27013	44	3	16	 It is His name--  faith in that name being the condition--which has strengthened this man whom you behold and know; and the faith which He has given has made this man sound and strong again,  as you can all see.
27014	44	3	17	 "And now, brethren, I know that it was in ignorance that you did it, as was the case with your rulers also.
27015	44	3	18	 But in this way God has fulfilled the declarations He made through all the Prophets, that His Christ would suffer.
27016	44	3	19	 Repent, therefore, and  reform your lives, so that the record of your sins may be cancelled, and that there may come  seasons of revival from the Lord,
27017	44	3	20	 and that He may send the Christ  appointed beforehand for you--even Jesus.
27018	44	3	21	  Heaven must receive Him until those times of which God has spoken  from the earliest ages through the lips of His holy Prophets--the times of the  reconstitution of all things.
27019	44	3	22	 Moses  declared, <"`The Lord your God will raise up a Prophet for you from among your brethren as He has raised me. In all that He says to you, you must listen to Him.
27020	44	3	23	 And every one, without exception, who refuses to listen to that Prophet shall be utterly destroyed from among the People.'>
27021	44	3	24	  Yes, and all the Prophets, from Samuel onwards--all who have spoken--have also  announced the coming of this present time.
27022	44	3	25	 "You are the  heirs of the Prophets, and of the  Covenant which God made with your forefathers when He said to Abraham, <`And through your posterity all the families of the world shall be blessed.'>
27023	44	3	26	 It is to you first that God, after raising His Servant from the grave, has sent Him to bless you, by causing every one of you to turn from your wickedness."
27024	44	4	1	 While they were saying this to the people, the Priests, the  Commander of the Temple Guard, and the Sadducees came upon them,
27025	44	4	2	 highly incensed at their teaching the people and proclaiming in the case of Jesus the Resurrection from among the dead.
27026	44	4	3	 They arrested the two Apostles and lodged them in custody till the next day; for it was already evening.
27027	44	4	4	 But many of those who had listened to their preaching believed; and the number of the adult men had now grown to be about 5,000.
27028	44	4	5	 The next day a meeting was held in Jerusalem of their Rulers, Elders, and Scribes,
27029	44	4	6	 with  Annas the High Priest, Caiaphas, John, Alexander, and the other members of the high-priestly family.
27030	44	4	7	 So they made the Apostles stand  in the centre, and demanded of them,  "By  what power or  in  what name have you done this?"
27031	44	4	8	 Then Peter was filled with the Holy Spirit, and he replied, "Rulers and Elders of the people,
27032	44	4	9	 if we to-day are under examination concerning  the benefit conferred on a man helplessly lame, as to how  this man  has been cured;
27033	44	4	10	 be it known to you all, and to all the people of Israel, that  through the name of Jesus  the Anointed, the Nazarene, whom *you* crucified, but whom *God* has raised from among the dead--  through that name this man stands here before you in perfect health.
27034	44	4	11	 This Jesus is <the Stone treated with contempt by you the builders, but it has been made the Cornerstone.>
27035	44	4	12	 And in no other is  the great salvation to be found; for, in fact, there is no second name under Heaven that has been given among men through which we are to be saved."
27036	44	4	13	 As they looked on  Peter and John so fearlessly outspoken--and also discovered that they were illiterate persons, untrained in the schools--they were surprised; and  now they recognized them as having been with Jesus.
27037	44	4	14	 And seeing the man standing with them--the man who had been cured--they had no reply to make.
27038	44	4	15	 So they ordered them to withdraw from the Sanhedrin while they conferred among themselves.
27039	44	4	16	 "What are we to do with these men?" they asked one another; for the fact that a remarkable  miracle has been performed  by them is well known to every one in Jerusalem, and we cannot deny it.
27040	44	4	17	 But to prevent  the matter spreading any further among the people, let us stop them by threats from speaking in the future  in this name to any one whatever."
27041	44	4	18	 So they recalled the Apostles, and ordered them altogether to give up  speaking or teaching in the name of Jesus.
27042	44	4	19	 But Peter and John replied,  "Judge whether it is right in God's sight to listen to you instead of listening to God.
27043	44	4	20	 As for us, what we have seen and heard we cannot help speaking about."
27044	44	4	21	 The Court added further threats and then let them go, being quite unable to find any way of punishing them on account of the people, because all gave God the glory for the thing that had happened.
27045	44	4	22	 For the man was over forty years of age on whom this miracle of restoration to health had been performed.
27046	44	4	23	 After their release the two Apostles went to their friends, and told them all that the High Priests and Elders had said.
27047	44	4	24	 And they, upon hearing the story,  all lifted up their voices to God and said, "O Sovereign Lord, it is Thou who didst make Heaven and earth and sea, and all that is in them,
27048	44	4	25	 and didst say  through the Holy Spirit by the lips of our forefather David Thy  servant, <"`Why have the nations  stamped and raged, and the peoples formed futile plans?
27049	44	4	26	 The  kings of the  earth came near, and the rulers assembled together against the Lord and against His Anointed.'">
27050	44	4	27	 "They did indeed assemble  in this city in hostility to Thy holy Servant Jesus whom Thou hadst anointed--Herod and Pontius Pilate with the Gentiles and also the  tribes of Israel--
27051	44	4	28	 to do all that Thy  power and Thy will had predetermined should be done.
27052	44	4	29	 And now, Lord,  listen to their threats, and enable Thy servants to proclaim Thy Message with fearless courage,
27053	44	4	30	  whilst Thou stretchest out Thine arm to cure men, and to give signs and marvels through the name of Thy holy Servant Jesus."
27054	44	4	31	 When they had prayed, the place in which they were assembled shook, and they were, one and all, filled with the Holy Spirit, and proceeded to tell God's Message with boldness.
27055	44	4	32	 Among all those who had embraced the faith there was but one heart and soul, so that none of them claimed any of his possessions as his own, but everything they had was common property;
27056	44	4	33	 while the Apostles with great force of conviction delivered their testimony as to the resurrection of the Lord Jesus; and great grace was upon them all.
27057	44	4	34	 And, in fact, there was not a needy man among them, for  all who were possessors of lands or houses  sold them, and  brought the money which they realised,
27058	44	4	35	 and  gave it to the Apostles, and distribution was made to every one according to his wants.
27059	44	4	36	 In this way Joseph, whom the Apostles gave the name of Bar-nabas--signifying `Son of  Encouragement' --a Levite,  a native of Cyprus,
27060	44	4	37	 sold  a farm which he had, and brought the money and  gave it to the Apostles.
27061	44	5	1	 There was a man of the name of  Ananias who, with his wife Sapphira, sold some property but,
27062	44	5	2	 with her full knowledge and consent,  dishonestly kept back part of the price which he received for it, though he brought the rest and gave it to the Apostles.
27063	44	5	3	 "Ananias," said Peter, "why  has Satan taken possession of your heart, that you should try to deceive the Holy Spirit and dishonestly keep back part of the price paid you for this land?
27064	44	5	4	 While it remained unsold, was not the land your own? And when sold, was it not at your own disposal? How is it that you have  cherished this design in your heart?  It is not to men you have told this lie, but to God."
27065	44	5	5	 Upon hearing these words Ananias fell down dead, and all who heard the words were awe-struck.
27066	44	5	6	 The younger men, however, rose, and wrapping the body up, carried it out and buried it.
27067	44	5	7	 About three hours had passed, when his wife came in, knowing nothing of what had happened.
27068	44	5	8	 Peter at once  questioned her. "Tell me," he said, "whether you sold the land for so much." "Yes," she replied, "for so much."
27069	44	5	9	 "How was it," replied Peter, "that you two agreed  to try an experiment upon the Spirit of the Lord?  The men who have buried your husband are already at the door, and they will carry you out."
27070	44	5	10	 Instantly she fell down dead at his feet, and the young men  came in and found her dead. So they carried her out and buried her by her husband's side.
27071	44	5	11	 This incident struck terror into the whole Church, and into the hearts of all who heard of it.
27072	44	5	12	 Many signs and marvels continued to be done among the people by the Apostles; and by common consent they all met in Solomon's Portico.
27073	44	5	13	 But  none of the others dared to attach themselves to them. Yet the people held them in high honour--
27074	44	5	14	 and more and more believers in the Lord joined them, including great numbers both of men and women--
27075	44	5	15	 so that they  would even bring out  their sick friends into the streets and lay them on light couches or mats, in order that when Peter came by, at least his shadow might fall on one or other of them.
27076	44	5	16	 The inhabitants, too, of the towns in the neighbourhood of Jerusalem  came in crowds, bringing sick persons and some who were harassed by foul spirits, and they were cured, one and all.
27077	44	5	17	 This roused the High Priest. He and all his party--the sect of the Sadducees--were filled with angry jealousy
27078	44	5	18	 and laid hands upon the Apostles, and put them into the public jail.
27079	44	5	19	 But during the night an angel of the Lord opened the prison doors and brought them out, and said,
27080	44	5	20	 "Go and stand in the Temple, and go on proclaiming to the people all  this Message of Life."
27081	44	5	21	 Having received that command they went into the Temple, just before daybreak, and began to teach: So when the High Priest and his party came, and had called together the Sanhedrin as well as all the  Elders of the  descendants of Israel, they sent to the jail to fetch the Apostles.
27082	44	5	22	 But the officers went and could not find them in the prison. So they came back and brought word,
27083	44	5	23	 saying, "The jail we found quite safely locked, and the warders were on guard at the doors, but  upon going in we found no one there."
27084	44	5	24	 When the Commander of the Temple Guards and the High Priests heard this statement, they were utterly at a loss with regard to it, wondering what would happen next.
27085	44	5	25	 And some one came and brought them word, saying,  "The men you put in prison are actually in the Temple, standing there, teaching the people."
27086	44	5	26	 Upon this the Commander went with the officers, and brought the Apostles; but without using violence; for they were afraid of being stoned by the people.
27087	44	5	27	 So they brought them and made them stand  in front of the Sanhedrin. And then the High Priest questioned them.
27088	44	5	28	 "We strictly forbad you to teach in that name--did we not?" he said. "And see, you have filled Jerusalem with your teaching, and are trying to make us responsible for that man's death!"
27089	44	5	29	 Peter and the other Apostles replied, "We must obey God rather than man.
27090	44	5	30	 The God of our forefathers has  raised Jesus to life, whom you crucified and put to death.
27091	44	5	31	 God has exalted Him  to His right hand as Chief Leader and as Saviour, to give Israel repentance and forgiveness of sins.
27092	44	5	32	 And we--and the Holy Spirit whom God has given to those who obey Him--are witnesses as to these things."
27093	44	5	33	  Infuriated at getting this answer, they  were disposed to kill the Apostles.
27094	44	5	34	 But a Pharisee of the name of Gamaliel, a teacher of the Law, held in honour by all the people, rose from his seat and requested that  they should be sent outside the court for a few minutes.
27095	44	5	35	 "Israelites," he said, "be careful what you are about to do in dealing with these men.
27096	44	5	36	 Years ago Theudas appeared, professing to be a person of importance, and a body of men, some four hundred in number, joined him. He was killed, and all his followers were dispersed and annihilated.
27097	44	5	37	 After him, at the time of the Census, came Judas, the Galilaean, and was the leader in a revolt. He too perished, and all his followers were scattered.
27098	44	5	38	 And now I tell you to hold aloof from these men and leave them alone--for if this scheme or work is of human origin, it will come to nothing.
27099	44	5	39	 But if it is really from God, you will be powerless to put them down--lest perhaps you find yourselves to be actually fighting against God."
27100	44	5	40	 His advice carried conviction. So they called the Apostles in, and--after  flogging them--ordered them not to speak in the name of Jesus, and then let them go.
27101	44	5	41	 They, therefore,  left the Sanhedrin and went their way,  rejoicing that they had been deemed worthy to suffer disgrace on behalf of  the NAME.
27102	44	5	42	 But they did not desist from teaching every day, in the Temple or in private houses, and telling the Good News about Jesus, the Christ.
27103	44	6	1	 About this time, as the number of disciples was increasing, complaints were made by  the Greek-speaking Jews against the  Hebrews because their widows were habitually overlooked in the daily  ministration.
27104	44	6	2	 So the Twelve called together the general body of the disciples and said, "It does not seem  fitting that  we Apostles should neglect the delivery of God's Message and  minister at tables.
27105	44	6	3	 Therefore, brethren, pick out from among yourselves seven men of good repute, full of the Spirit and of wisdom, and we will appoint them to undertake this duty.
27106	44	6	4	 But, as for us, we will devote ourselves to prayer and to the  delivery of the Message."
27107	44	6	5	 The suggestion met with general approval, and they selected Stephen, a man full of faith and of the Holy Spirit, Philip, Prochorus, Nicanor, Timon, Parmenas, and Nicolas, a proselyte of Antioch.
27108	44	6	6	 These men they brought to the Apostles, and, after prayer, they laid their hands upon them.
27109	44	6	7	 Meanwhile God's Message continued to spread, and the number of the disciples in Jerusalem very greatly increased, and  very many priests obeyed the faith.
27110	44	6	8	 And Stephen, full of grace and power, performed great marvels and signs among the people.
27111	44	6	9	 But some members of the so-called `Synagogue of the Freed-men,' together with some Cyrenaeans, Alexandrians, Cilicians and  men from Roman Asia, were roused to encounter Stephen in debate.
27112	44	6	10	 They were quite unable, however, to resist the wisdom and the Spirit with which he spoke.
27113	44	6	11	 Then they privately put forward men who declared, "We have heard him speak blasphemous things against Moses and against God."
27114	44	6	12	 In this way they excited the people, the Elders, and the Scribes. At length they came upon him, seized him with violence, and took him  before the Sanhedrin.
27115	44	6	13	 Here they brought forward false witnesses who declared, "This fellow is incessantly speaking against the Holy Place and the Law.
27116	44	6	14	 For we have heard him say that Jesus, the Nazarene, will pull  this place down to the ground and will change the customs which Moses handed down to us."
27117	44	6	15	 At once the eyes of all who were sitting in the Sanhedrin were fastened on him, and they saw his face looking just like the face of an angel.
27118	44	7	1	 Then the High Priest asked him, "Are these statements true?"
27119	44	7	2	 The reply of Stephen was, "Sirs--brethren and fathers--listen to me.  God Most Glorious appeared to our forefather Abraham when he was living in Mesopotamia, before he settled in Haran,
27120	44	7	3	 and said to him, "`Leave your country and your relatives, and go into whatever land I point out to you.'
27121	44	7	4	 "Thereupon he left Chaldaea and settled in Haran till after the death of his father, when God caused him to remove into this country where  you now live.
27122	44	7	5	 But he gave him no inheritance in it, no, not a single  square yard of ground. And yet He promised to bestow the land as a permanent possession on him and his posterity after him--and promised this at a time when Abraham was childless.
27123	44	7	6	 And God declared that Abraham's posterity should for four hundred years make their home in a country not their own, and be reduced to slavery and be oppressed.
27124	44	7	7	 "`And the nation, whichever it is, that enslaves them, I will judge,' said God; `and afterwards they shall come out, and they shall worship Me in this place.'
27125	44	7	8	 "Then He gave him the Covenant of circumcision, and under this Covenant he became the father of Isaac--whom he circumcised on the eighth day. Isaac became the father of Jacob, and Jacob became the father of the twelve Patriarchs.
27126	44	7	9	 "The Patriarchs were jealous of Joseph and sold him into slavery in Egypt. But God was with him
27127	44	7	10	 and delivered him from all his afflictions, and gave him favour and wisdom when he stood before Pharaoh, king of Egypt, who appointed him governor over Egypt and all the royal household.
27128	44	7	11	 But there came a famine throughout the whole of Egypt and Canaan--and great distress--so that our forefathers could find no food.
27129	44	7	12	 When, however, Jacob heard that there was wheat to be had, he sent our forefathers into Egypt; that was the first time.
27130	44	7	13	 On their second visit Joseph made himself known to his brothers, and Pharaoh was informed of Joseph's parentage.
27131	44	7	14	 Then Joseph sent and invited his father Jacob and all his family, numbering  seventy-five persons, to come to him,
27132	44	7	15	 and Jacob went down into Egypt. There he died, and so did our forefathers,
27133	44	7	16	 and they were taken to  Shechem and were laid in the tomb which  Abraham had bought from the sons of Hamor at Shechem for a sum of money paid in silver.
27134	44	7	17	 "But as the time drew near for the fulfilment of the promise which God had made to Abraham, the people became many times more numerous in Egypt,
27135	44	7	18	 until there arose a foreign king over Egypt who knew nothing of Joseph.
27136	44	7	19	 He adopted a crafty policy towards our race, and oppressed our forefathers, making them cast out their infants so that they might not  be permitted to live.
27137	44	7	20	 At this time Moses was born--a  wonderfully beautiful child; and for three months he was cared for in his father's house.
27138	44	7	21	 At length he was cast out, but Pharaoh's daughter adopted him, and brought him up as her own son.
27139	44	7	22	 So Moses was educated in all the learning of the Egyptians, and possessed great influence through his eloquence and his achievements.
27140	44	7	23	 "And when he was just forty years old, it occurred to him to visit his brethren the descendants of Israel.
27141	44	7	24	 Seeing one of them wrongfully treated he took his part, and secured justice for the ill-treated man by striking down the Egyptian.
27142	44	7	25	 He supposed his brethren to be aware that by him God was sending them deliverance; this, however, they did not understand.
27143	44	7	26	 The next day, also, he came and found two of them fighting, and he endeavoured to make peace between them. "`Sirs,' he said, `you are brothers. Why are you wronging one another?'
27144	44	7	27	 "But the man who was doing the wrong  resented his interference, and asked, "`Who appointed you magistrate and judge over us?
27145	44	7	28	 Do you mean to kill me as you killed the Egyptian yesterday?'
27146	44	7	29	 "Alarmed at this question, Moses fled from the country and went to live in the land of Midian. There he became the father of two sons.
27147	44	7	30	 "But at the end of forty years there appeared to him in the Desert of Mount Sinai an angel in the middle of a flame of fire in a bush.
27148	44	7	31	 When Moses saw this he wondered at the sight; but on his going up to look further, the voice of the Lord was heard, saying,
27149	44	7	32	 "`I am the God of your forefathers, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Jacob.' "Quaking with fear Moses did not dare gaze.
27150	44	7	33	 "`Take off your shoes,' said the Lord, `for the spot on which you are standing is holy ground.
27151	44	7	34	 I have seen, yes, I have seen the oppression of My people who are in Egypt and have heard their groans, and I have come down to deliver them. And now  I will send you to Egypt.'
27152	44	7	35	 "The Moses whom they rejected, asking him, `Who appointed you magistrate and judge?' --that same Moses  we find God sending as a magistrate and a  deliverer by the help of the angel who appeared to him in the bush.
27153	44	7	36	 This was he who brought them out,  after performing marvels and signs in Egypt and at the Red Sea, and in the Desert for forty years.
27154	44	7	37	 This is the Moses who said to the descendants of Israel, <"`God will raise up a Prophet for you, from among your brethren, just as He raised me up.'>
27155	44	7	38	 `This is he who was among the  Congregation in the Desert, together with the angel who spoke to him on Mount Sinai and with our forefathers, who received  ever-living  utterances to hand on  to us.
27156	44	7	39	 "Our forefathers, however, would not submit to him, but spurned his authority and in their hearts turned back to Egypt.
27157	44	7	40	 They said to Aaron, "`Make  gods for us, to march in front of us; for as for this Moses who brought us out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.'
27158	44	7	41	 "Moreover they made a calf at that time, and offered a sacrifice to the idol and kept rejoicing in the gods which their own hands had made.
27159	44	7	42	 So God turned from them and gave them up to the worship of the Host of Heaven, as it is written in the Book of the Prophets, <"'Were they victims and sacrifices which you  offered Me, forty years in the Desert, O House of Israel?
27160	44	7	43	  Yes, you  lifted up  Moloch's tent and the Star of the God Rephan--the images which you made in order to worship them; and I will remove you beyond Babylon.'>
27161	44	7	44	 "Our forefathers had  the Tent of the Testimony in the Desert, built as He who spoke to Moses had instructed him to make it in imitation of the model which he had seen.
27162	44	7	45	 That Tent was bequeathed to the next generation of our forefathers. Under Joshua they brought it with them when they were taking possession of the land of the Gentile nations, whom God drove out before them. So it continued till David's time.
27163	44	7	46	 David obtained favour with God, and asked leave to provide a dwelling-place for the God of Jacob.
27164	44	7	47	 But it was Solomon who built a house for Him.
27165	44	7	48	 Yet the Most High does not dwell in buildings erected by men's hands. But, as the Prophet declares,
27166	44	7	49	 <"`The sky is My throne, and earth is the footstool for My feet. What kind of house will you build for Me, says the Lord, or what resting place shall I have?
27167	44	7	50	 Did not My hand form this universe.'>
27168	44	7	51	 "O stiff-necked men, uncircumcised in heart and ears, you also are continually  at strife with the Holy Spirit--just as your forefathers were.
27169	44	7	52	 Which of the Prophets did not your forefathers persecute? Yes, they killed those who announced beforehand the advent of the righteous One, whose betrayers and murderers you have now become--
27170	44	7	53	 you who received the Law  given through angels, and yet have not obeyed it."
27171	44	7	54	 As they listened to these words, they became infuriated and gnashed their teeth at him.
27172	44	7	55	 But,  full of the Holy Spirit and looking up to Heaven,  Stephen  saw the glory of God, and Jesus standing at God's right hand.
27173	44	7	56	  "I can see Heaven wide open," he said, "and the Son of Man standing at God's right hand."
27174	44	7	57	 Upon this, with a loud outcry they stopped their ears, rushed upon Stephen in a body,
27175	44	7	58	 dragged him out of the city, and  stoned him, the witnesses throwing off their outer garments and giving them into the care of a young man called Saul.
27176	44	7	59	 So they  stoned Stephen,  while he prayed,  "Lord Jesus, receive my spirit."
27177	44	7	60	 Then, rising on his knees, he cried aloud,  "Lord, do not reckon this sin against them." And with these words he fell asleep.
27178	44	8	1	 And Saul fully approved of his murder. At this time a great persecution broke out against the Church in Jerusalem, and  all except the Apostles were scattered throughout Judaea and Samaria.
27179	44	8	2	 A party of  devout men, however,  buried Stephen, and made loud lamentation over him.
27180	44	8	3	 But Saul cruelly harassed the Church. He went into house after house, and, dragging off both men and women, threw them into prison.
27181	44	8	4	 Those, however, who were scattered abroad went from place to place spreading the Good News of God's Message;
27182	44	8	5	 while Philip went down to the city of Samaria and proclaimed Christ there.
27183	44	8	6	 Crowds of people, with one accord, gave attention to what they heard from him, listening, and witnessing the signs which he did.
27184	44	8	7	 For, with a loud cry, foul spirits came out of many possessed by them, and many paralytics and lame persons were restored to health.
27185	44	8	8	 And there was great joy in that city.
27186	44	8	9	 Now for some time past there had been a man named Simon living there, who had been practising magic and astonishing  the Samaritans, pretending that he was more than human.
27187	44	8	10	 To him people of all classes paid attention, declaring, "This man is the Power of God, known as the great Power."
27188	44	8	11	 His influence over them arose from their having been, for a long time, bewildered by his sorceries.
27189	44	8	12	 But when Philip began to tell the Good News about the Kingdom of God and about the Name of Jesus Christ, and they embraced the faith, they  were baptized, men and women alike.
27190	44	8	13	 Simon himself also  believed, and after being baptized remained in close attendance on Philip, and was full of amazement at seeing such signs and such great miracles performed.
27191	44	8	14	 When the Apostles in Jerusalem heard that the Samaritans had accepted God's Message, they sent Peter and  John to visit them.
27192	44	8	15	 They, when they came down, prayed for them that they might receive the Holy Spirit:
27193	44	8	16	 for He had not as yet fallen upon any of them. They  had only been baptized  into the name of the Lord Jesus.
27194	44	8	17	 Then the Apostles  placed their hands upon them, and they  received the Holy Spirit.
27195	44	8	18	 When, however, Simon saw that it was through the laying on of the Apostles' hands that the Spirit was bestowed, he offered them money.
27196	44	8	19	 "Give me too," he said, "that power, so that every one on whom I place my hands will receive the Holy Spirit."
27197	44	8	20	 "Perish your money and yourself," replied Peter, "because you have imagined that you can obtain God's free gift with money!
27198	44	8	21	  No part or lot have you in this  matter, for your heart is not right in God's sight.
27199	44	8	22	  Repent, therefore, of this wickedness of yours, and pray to the Lord,  in the hope that the  purpose which is in your heart may perhaps be forgiven you.
27200	44	8	23	 For I perceive that you  have fallen into the bitterest bondage of unrighteousness."
27201	44	8	24	 "Pray, both of you, to the Lord for me," answered Simon, "that nothing of what you have said may come upon me."
27202	44	8	25	 So the Apostles, after giving a solemn charge and delivering the Lord's Message, travelled back to Jerusalem, making known the Good News also in many of the Samaritan villages.
27203	44	8	26	 And an angel of the Lord said to Philip, "Rise and proceed  south to  the road that runs down from Jerusalem to Gaza,  crossing the Desert."
27204	44	8	27	 Upon this he rose and went. Now,  as it happened, an Ethiopian eunuch who was in a position of high authority with Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, as her treasurer, had visited Jerusalem to worship there,
27205	44	8	28	 and was now on his way home; and as he sat in his chariot he was  reading the Prophet Isaiah.
27206	44	8	29	 Then the Spirit said to Philip, "Go and  enter that chariot."
27207	44	8	30	 So Philip ran up and heard the eunuch reading the Prophet Isaiah.  "Do you understand what you are reading?" he asked.
27208	44	8	31	 "Why, how can I," replied the eunuch, "unless some one explains it to me?" And he earnestly invited Philip to come up and sit with him.
27209	44	8	32	 The passage of Scripture which he was reading was this: <"Like a sheep He was led to slaughter, and just as a lamb before its shearer is dumb so He opened not His mouth.
27210	44	8	33	 In His humiliation justice was denied Him.  Who will make known His posterity? For He is destroyed from among men.">
27211	44	8	34	 "Pray, of whom is the Prophet speaking?" inquired the eunuch; "of himself or of some one else?"
27212	44	8	35	 Then Philip  began to speak, and, commencing with that same portion of Scripture, told him the Good News about Jesus.
27213	44	8	36	 So they proceeded on their way till they came to some water; and the eunuch exclaimed, "See, here is water; what is there to prevent my being baptized?"
27214	44	8	37	  []
27215	44	8	38	 So he stopped the chariot; and both of them--Philip and the eunuch--went down into the water, and Philip baptized him.
27216	44	8	39	 But no sooner had they come up out of the water than  the Spirit of the Lord caught Philip away, and the eunuch did not see him again. With a glad heart he resumed his journey;
27217	44	8	40	 but Philip found himself at  Ashdod. Then visiting town after town he everywhere made known the Good News until he reached Caesarea.
27218	44	9	1	 Now Saul, whose every breath was a threat of destruction for the disciples of the Lord,
27219	44	9	2	 went to the High Priest and begged from him letters addressed to the synagogues in Damascus, in order that if he found  any believers there, either men or women, he might bring them in chains to Jerusalem.
27220	44	9	3	 But on the journey, as he was getting near Damascus, suddenly there flashed round him a light from Heaven;
27221	44	9	4	 and falling to the ground he heard a voice which said to him,  "Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting Me?"
27222	44	9	5	 "Who art thou, Lord?" he asked. "I am Jesus, whom you are persecuting," was the reply.
27223	44	9	6	  "But rise and go to the city, and you will be told what you are to do.
27224	44	9	7	 Meanwhile the men who travelled with Saul were standing dumb with amazement, hearing a  sound, but seeing no one.
27225	44	9	8	 Then he rose from the ground, but when he  had opened his eyes, he could not see, and they led him by the  arm and brought him to Damascus.
27226	44	9	9	 And  for two days he remained without sight, and did not eat or drink anything.
27227	44	9	10	 Now in Damascus there was a disciple of the name of Ananias. The Lord spoke to him in a vision, saying, "Ananias!" "I am here, Lord," he answered.
27228	44	9	11	 "Rise," said the Lord, "and go to Straight Street, and inquire at the house of Judas for a man called Saul, from Tarsus, for he is actually praying.
27229	44	9	12	 He has seen a man called Ananias  come and lay his hands upon him so that he may recover his sight."
27230	44	9	13	 "Lord," answered Ananias, "I have heard about that man from many, and I have heard of the great mischief he has done to Thy  people in Jerusalem;
27231	44	9	14	 and here he is authorized by the High Priests to arrest all who call upon Thy name."
27232	44	9	15	 "Go," replied the Lord; "he is a chosen  instrument of Mine to carry My name  to the Gentiles and to kings and to the descendants of Israel.
27233	44	9	16	 For I will let him know the great sufferings which he must pass through for My sake."
27234	44	9	17	 So Ananias went and entered the house; and, laying his two hands upon Saul, said, "Saul, brother, the Lord--even Jesus who appeared to you on your journey--has sent me, that you may recover your sight and be filled with the Holy Spirit."
27235	44	9	18	 Instantly there dropped from his eyes what seemed to be scales, and he could see once more. Upon this he rose and received baptism;
27236	44	9	19	 after which he took food and regained his strength. Then he remained  some little time with the disciples in Damascus.
27237	44	9	20	 And in the synagogues he began at once to proclaim Jesus as the Son of God;
27238	44	9	21	 and his hearers were all amazed, and began to ask one another, "Is not this the man who in Jerusalem  tried to exterminate those who called upon that Name, and  came here on purpose to carry them off in chains to the High Priests?"
27239	44	9	22	 Saul, however,  gained more and more influence, and as for the Jews living in Damascus, he bewildered them with his proofs that Jesus is the Christ.
27240	44	9	23	  At length the Jews plotted to kill Saul;
27241	44	9	24	 but information of their intention was given to him. They even watched the gates, day and night, in order to murder him;
27242	44	9	25	 but his disciples took him by night and let him down  through the wall, lowering him in a  hamper.
27243	44	9	26	 So he came to Jerusalem and made several attempts to associate with the disciples, but they were all afraid of him, being in doubt as to whether he himself was a disciple.
27244	44	9	27	 Barnabas, however, came to his assistance. He brought Saul to the Apostles, and related to them how, on his journey, he had seen the Lord, and that the Lord had spoken to him, and how in Damascus he had fearlessly taught in the name of Jesus.
27245	44	9	28	 Henceforth Saul was one of them, going in and out of the city,
27246	44	9	29	 and speaking fearlessly in the name of the Lord. And he often talked with the Hellenists and had discussions with them.
27247	44	9	30	 But they kept trying to take his life. On learning this, the brethren brought him down to Caesarea, and then  sent him by sea to Tarsus.
27248	44	9	31	 The Church, however, throughout the whole of Judaea, Galilee and Samaria, had peace and was spiritually built up; and grew in numbers,  living in the fear of the Lord and  receiving  encouragement from the Holy Spirit.
27249	44	9	32	 Now Peter, as he went to town after town, came down also to  God's people at Lud.
27250	44	9	33	 There he found a man of the name of Aeneas, who for eight years had kept his  bed, through being paralysed.
27251	44	9	34	 Peter said to him, "Aeneas, Jesus Christ cures you. Rise and  make your own bed." He at once rose to his feet.
27252	44	9	35	 And all the people of Lud and Sharon saw him; and they turned to the Lord.
27253	44	9	36	 Among the disciples at  Jaffa was a woman called Tabitha, or, as the name may be translated,  `Dorcas.'  Her life was wholly devoted to the good and charitable actions which she was constantly doing.
27254	44	9	37	 But, as it happened, just at that time she was taken ill and died. After washing her body they laid it out in a room upstairs.
27255	44	9	38	 Lud, however, being near Jaffa, the disciples, who had heard that Peter was at Lud, sent two men to him with an urgent request that he would come across to them without delay.
27256	44	9	39	 So Peter rose and went with them. On his arrival they took him upstairs, and the widow women all came and stood by his side, weeping and showing him the underclothing and cloaks and garments of all kinds which Dorcas used to make while she was still with them.
27257	44	9	40	 Peter, however, putting every one out of the room, knelt down and prayed, and then turning to the body, he said, "Tabitha, rise." Dorcas at once opened her eyes, and seeing Peter, sat up.
27258	44	9	41	 Then, giving her his hand, he raised her to her feet and, calling to him God's people and the widows, he  gave her back to them alive.
27259	44	9	42	 This incident became known throughout Jaffa, and many  believed in the Lord;
27260	44	9	43	 and Peter remained for a considerable time at Jaffa, staying at the house of a man called Simon, a tanner.
27261	44	10	1	 Now a Captain of the Italian Regiment, named Cornelius, was quartered at Caesarea.
27262	44	10	2	 He was religious and God-fearing--and so was every member of his household. He was also liberal in his charities to the people, and continually offered prayer to God.
27263	44	10	3	 About three o'clock one afternoon he had a vision, and distinctly saw an angel of God  enter  his house, who called him by name, saying, "Cornelius!"
27264	44	10	4	 Looking steadily at him, and being much alarmed, he said,  "What do you want, Sir?" "Your prayers and charities," he replied, "have gone up and have been recorded before God.
27265	44	10	5	 And now send to Jaffa and fetch Simon, surnamed Peter.
27266	44	10	6	 He is staying as a guest with Simon, a tanner, who has a house close to the sea."
