28821	47	1	20	 For all the promises of God, whatever their number, have  their confirmation in Him; and for this reason through Him also our "Amen" acknowledges their truth  and promotes the glory of God through our faith.
28822	47	1	21	 But He who is making us as well as you stedfast through union with  the Anointed One, and has anointed us, is God,
28823	47	1	22	 and He has also set His seal upon us, and has  put  His Spirit into our hearts as a pledge and foretaste of future blessing.
28824	47	1	23	 But as for me, as my soul shall answer for it, I appeal to God as my witness, that it was to spare you pain that I gave up my visit to Corinth.
28825	47	1	24	  Not that we want to lord it over you in respect of your faith--we do, however, desire to help your joy--for in the matter of your faith you are standing firm.
28826	47	2	1	 But, so far as I am concerned, I have resolved not to have a painful visit the next time I come to see you.
28827	47	2	2	 For if I of all men give you pain, who then is there to gladden my heart, but the very persons to whom I give pain?
28828	47	2	3	 And I write this to you in order that when I come I may not receive pain from those who ought to give me joy, confident as I am as to all of you that my joy is the joy of you all.
28829	47	2	4	 For with many tears I write to you, and in deep suffering and depression of spirit, not in order to grieve you, but in the hope of showing you how brimful my heart is with love for you.
28830	47	2	5	 Now if any one has caused sorrow, it has been caused not so much to me, as in some degree--for I have no wish to exaggerate--to all of you.
28831	47	2	6	 In the case of such a person the punishment which was inflicted by the majority of you is enough.
28832	47	2	7	 So that you may now take the opposite course, and forgive him  rather and comfort him, for fear he should perhaps be driven to despair by his excess of grief.
28833	47	2	8	 I beg you therefore fully to reinstate him in your love.
28834	47	2	9	 For in writing to you I have also this object in view--to discover by experience whether you are prepared to be obedient in every respect.
28835	47	2	10	 When you forgive a man an offence I also forgive it; for in fact what I have forgiven, if I have forgiven anything, has always been for your sakes in the presence of Christ,
28836	47	2	11	 for fear Satan should gain an advantage over us. For we are not ignorant of his  devices.
28837	47	2	12	 Now when I came into  the Troad to spread there the Good News about the Christ, even though in the Lord's providence a door stood open before me,
28838	47	2	13	 yet, obtaining no relief for my spirit because I did not find our brother Titus, I bade them farewell and went on into Macedonia.
28839	47	2	14	 But to God be the thanks who in Christ ever heads our  triumphal procession, and by our hands waves in every place that sweet incense, the knowledge of Him.
28840	47	2	15	 For we are a fragrance of Christ grateful to God in those  whom He is saving and in those who are perishing;
28841	47	2	16	 to the last-named an odor of death predictive of death, and to the others an odor of life predictive of life. And for such service as this who is competent?
28842	47	2	17	  We are; for,  unlike most teachers, we are not fraudulent hucksters of God's Message; but with  transparent motives, as commissioned by God, in God's presence and in communion with Christ, so we speak.
28843	47	3	1	 Do you say that this is self-recommendation once more? Or do we need, as some do, letters of recommendation to you or from you?
28844	47	3	2	 Our letter of recommendation is yourselves--a letter written on our hearts and everywhere known and read.
28845	47	3	3	 For all can see that you are a letter of Christ entrusted to our care, and written not with ink, but with the Spirit of the  ever-living God--and not on tablets of stone, but on  human hearts as tablets.
28846	47	3	4	 Such is the confidence which we have through Christ in the presence of God;
28847	47	3	5	 not that of ourselves we are competent to decide anything by our own reasonings, but our competency comes from God.
28848	47	3	6	 It is He also who has made us competent to serve Him in connexion with a new  Covenant, which is not a written code but a Spirit; for the written code inflicts death, but the Spirit gives Life.
28849	47	3	7	 If, however, the service  that proclaims death--its code being engraved in writing upon stones--came with glory, so that the children of Israel could not look steadily on the face of Moses because of the brightness of his face--a vanishing brightness;
28850	47	3	8	 will not the service of the Spirit be far more glorious?
28851	47	3	9	 For if the service which pronounces doom  had glory, far more glorious still is the service which tells of righteousness.
28852	47	3	10	 For, in fact, that which was once resplendent in glory has no glory at all in this respect, that it pales before the glory which surpasses it.
28853	47	3	11	 For if that which was to be abolished came with glory, much more is that which is permanent arrayed in glory.
28854	47	3	12	 Therefore, cherishing a hope like this, we speak without reserve, and we do not imitate Moses,
28855	47	3	13	 who used to throw a veil over his face to hide from the gaze of the children of Israel the passing away of what was but transitory.
28856	47	3	14	 Nay, their minds were made dull; for to this very day during the reading of the book of the  ancient Covenant, the same veil  remains unlifted, because it is only in Christ that it is to be abolished.
28857	47	3	15	 Yes, to this day, whenever Moses is read, a veil lies upon their  hearts.
28858	47	3	16	 But whenever  the heart of the nation shall have returned to the Lord, the veil will be withdrawn.
28859	47	3	17	 Now by "the Lord" is meant the Spirit; and where the Spirit of the Lord is,  freedom is enjoyed.
28860	47	3	18	 And all of us, with unveiled faces, reflecting like bright mirrors the glory of the Lord, are being transformed into the same likeness, from one degree of radiant holiness to another, even as derived from the Lord the Spirit.
28861	47	4	1	 Therefore, being engaged in this service and being mindful of the mercy which has been shown us, we are not cowards.
28862	47	4	2	 Nay, we have renounced the secrecy which marks a feeling of shame. We practice no cunning tricks, nor do we adulterate God's Message. But by a full clear statement of the truth we strive to commend ourselves in the presence of God to every human conscience.
28863	47	4	3	 If, however, the meaning of our Good News has been veiled,  the veil has been on the hearts of those who are on the way to perdition,
28864	47	4	4	 in whom the god of this present age has blinded their unbelieving minds so as to shut out the sunshine of the Good News of the glory of the Christ, who is the image of God.
28865	47	4	5	 (For we do not proclaim ourselves, but we proclaim Christ Jesus as Lord, and ourselves as your bondservants for the sake of Jesus.)
28866	47	4	6	 For God who said, "Out of darkness let light shine," is He who has shone in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God's glory, which is radiant on the face of Christ.
28867	47	4	7	 But we have  this treasure in  a fragile vase of clay, in order that the surpassing greatness of the power may be seen to belong to God, and not to originate in us.
28868	47	4	8	  We are hard pressed, yet never in absolute distress; perplexed, yet never utterly baffled;
28869	47	4	9	 pursued, yet never left unsuccoured; struck to the ground, yet never slain;
28870	47	4	10	 always, wherever we go, carrying with us in our bodies the putting to death of Jesus, so that in our bodies it may also be clearly shown that Jesus lives.
28871	47	4	11	 For we, alive though we are, are continually surrendering ourselves to death for the sake of Jesus, so that in this mortal nature of ours it may also be clearly shown that Jesus lives.
28872	47	4	12	 Thus we are constantly dying, while you are in full enjoyment of Life.
28873	47	4	13	 But possessing the same Spirit of faith as he who wrote, <"I believed, and therefore I have spoken,"> we also believe, and therefore we speak.
28874	47	4	14	 For we know that He who  raised the Lord Jesus from the dead will raise us also to be with Jesus, and will cause  both us and you to stand in His own presence.
28875	47	4	15	 For  everything is for your sakes, in order that grace, being more richly bestowed because of the thanksgivings of the increased number, may more and more promote the glory of God.
28876	47	4	16	 Therefore we are not cowards. Nay, even though our outward man is wasting away, yet our inward man is being renewed day by day.
28877	47	4	17	 For this  our light and transitory burden of suffering is achieving for us a preponderating, yes, a vastly preponderating, and eternal weight of glory;
28878	47	4	18	 while  we look not at things seen, but things unseen; for things seen are temporary, but things unseen are eternal.
28879	47	5	1	 For we know that if this poor tent, our earthly house, is taken down, we have in Heaven a building which God has provided, a house not built by human hands, but eternal.
28880	47	5	2	 For in this one we sigh, because we long to put on over it our dwelling which comes from Heaven--
28881	47	5	3	  if indeed having really put on a  robe we shall not be found to be unclothed.
28882	47	5	4	 Yes, we who are in this tent certainly do sigh under our burdens, for  we do not wish to lay aside that with which we are now clothed, but to put on more, so that our mortality may be  absorbed in Life.
28883	47	5	5	 And He who formed us with this very end in view is God, who has given us His Spirit as  a pledge and foretaste of that bliss.
28884	47	5	6	 We have therefore a cheerful confidence. We know that while we are at home in the body we are banished from the Lord;
28885	47	5	7	 for we are living a life of faith, and not one of sight.
28886	47	5	8	 So we have a cheerful confidence, and we anticipate with greater delight being banished from the body and going home to the Lord.
28887	47	5	9	 And for this reason also we make it our ambition, whether at home or in exile, to please Him perfectly.
28888	47	5	10	 For we must all of us appear before Christ's judgement-seat in our true characters, in order that each may then receive an award for his actions in this life, in accordance with what he has done, whether it be good or whether it be  worthless.
28889	47	5	11	 Therefore, because we realize how greatly the Lord is to be feared, we are endeavouring to win men over, and God recognizes what our motives are, and I hope that you, in your hearts, recognize them too.
28890	47	5	12	 We are not again commending ourselves to your favour, but are furnishing you with a ground of boasting on our behalf, so that you may have a reply ready for those with whom superficial appearances are everything and sincerity of heart counts for nothing.
28891	47	5	13	 For if we have been beside ourselves, it has been for God's glory; or if we are now in our right senses, it is in order to be of service to you.
28892	47	5	14	 For the love of Christ overmasters us, the conclusion at which we have arrived being this--that One having died for all, His death was their death,
28893	47	5	15	 and that He died for all in order that the living may no longer live to themselves, but to Him who died for them and rose again.
28894	47	5	16	 Therefore for the future we know no one simply as a man. Even if we have known Christ as a man, yet now we do so no longer.
28895	47	5	17	 So that if any one is in Christ,  he is a new creature: the old state of things has passed away; a new state of things has come into existence.
28896	47	5	18	 And all this is from God, who has reconciled us to Himself through Christ, and has appointed us to serve in the ministry of reconciliation.
28897	47	5	19	 We are to tell how God was in Christ reconciling the world to Himself, not charging men's transgressions to their account, and that He has entrusted  to us the Message of this reconciliation.
28898	47	5	20	 On Christ's behalf therefore we come as ambassadors, God, as it were, making entreaty through our lips: we, on Christ's behalf, beseech men to be reconciled to God.
28899	47	5	21	 He has made Him who knew nothing of sin to be sin for us, in order that in Him we may become the righteousness of God.
28900	47	6	1	 And you also we, as God's fellow workers, entreat not to be found to have received His grace to no purpose.
28901	47	6	2	 For He says, <"At a time of welcome I have listened to you, and on a day of salvation I have succoured you."> Now is the time of loving welcome! Now is the day of salvation!
28902	47	6	3	  We endeavour to give people no cause for stumbling in anything, lest the work we are doing should fall into discredit.
28903	47	6	4	 On the contrary, as God's servants, we seek their full approval--by unwearied endurance, by afflictions, by distress, by helplessness;
28904	47	6	5	 by floggings, by imprisonments; by facing riots, by toil, by sleepless watching, by hunger and thirst;
28905	47	6	6	 by purity of life, by knowledge, by patience, by kindness, by the Holy Spirit, by sincere love;
28906	47	6	7	 by the proclamation of the truth, by the power of God; by the weapons of righteousness, wielded in both hands;
28907	47	6	8	 through honour and ignominy, through calumny and praise. We are looked upon as impostors and yet are true men;
28908	47	6	9	 as obscure persons, and yet are well known; as on the point of death, and yet, strange to tell, we live; as under God's discipline, and yet we are not deprived of life;
28909	47	6	10	 as sad, but we are always joyful; as poor, but we bestow wealth on many; as having nothing, and yet we securely possess all things.
28910	47	6	11	 O Corinthians, our lips are unsealed to you: our heart is expanded.
28911	47	6	12	 There is no narrowness in our love to you: the narrowness is in your own feelings.
28912	47	6	13	 And in just requital--I speak as to my children--let your hearts expand also.
28913	47	6	14	 Do not come into close association with unbelievers, like oxen yoked with asses. For what is there in common between righteousness and lawlessness? Or what partnership has light with darkness?
28914	47	6	15	 Where can harmony between Christ and Belial be found? Or what participation has a believer with an unbeliever?
28915	47	6	16	 And what compact has the Temple of God with idols? For *we* are the Temple of the  ever-living God; as God has said, <"I will dwell among them, and walk about among them; and will be their God, and it is they who shall be My people.">
28916	47	6	17	 Therefore, <"`Come out from among them and separate yourselves,' says the Lord, `and touch nothing impure; and I will receive you, and will be a Father to you,
28917	47	6	18	 and you shall be My sons and daughters,' says the Lord the Ruler of all.">
28918	47	7	1	 Having therefore these promises, beloved friends, let us purify ourselves from all defilement of body and of spirit, and secure perfect holiness through the fear of God.
28919	47	7	2	 Make room for us in your hearts. There is not one of you whom we have wronged, not one to whom we have done harm, not one over whom we have gained any selfish advantage.
28920	47	7	3	 I do not say this  to imply blame, for, as I have already said, you have such a place in our hearts that we would die with you or live with you.
28921	47	7	4	 I have great confidence in you: very loudly do I boast of you. I am filled with comfort: my heart overflows with joy amid all our affliction.
28922	47	7	5	 For even after our arrival in Macedonia we could get no relief such as human nature craves. We were greatly harassed; there were conflicts without and fears within.
28923	47	7	6	 But He who comforts the depressed--even God--  comforted us by the coming of Titus, and not by his coming only,
28924	47	7	7	 but also by the fact that he had felt comforted on your account, and by the report which he brought of your eager affection, of your grief, and of your jealousy on my behalf, so that I rejoiced more than ever.
28925	47	7	8	 For if I gave you pain by that letter, I do not regret it, though I did regret it then.  I see that that letter, even though for a time it gave you pain,  had a salutary effect.
28926	47	7	9	 Now I rejoice, not in your grief, but because the grief led to repentance; for you sorrowed with a godly sorrow, which prevented you from receiving injury from us in any respect.
28927	47	7	10	 For godly sorrow produces repentance leading to salvation, a repentance not to be regretted; but the sorrow of the world finally produces death.
28928	47	7	11	 For mark the effects of this very thing--your having sorrowed with a godly sorrow--what earnestness it has called forth in you,  what eagerness to clear yourselves, what indignation, what alarm, what longing affection, what jealousy, what meting out of justice! You have completely wiped away reproach from yourselves in the matter.
28929	47	7	12	 Therefore, though I wrote to you, it was not to punish the offender, nor to secure justice for him who had suffered the wrong, but it was chiefly in order that your earnest feeling on our behalf might become manifest to yourselves in the sight of God.
28930	47	7	13	 For this reason we feel comforted; and--in addition to this our comfort--we have been filled with all the deeper joy at Titus's joy, because his spirit  has been set at rest by you all.
28931	47	7	14	 For however I may have boasted to him about you, I have no reason to feel ashamed; but as we have in all respects spoken the truth to you, so also our boasting to Titus about you has turned out to be the truth.
28932	47	7	15	 And his strong and tender affection is all the more drawn out towards you when he recalls to mind  the obedience which all of you manifested by the timidity and nervous anxiety with which you welcomed him.
28933	47	7	16	 I rejoice that I have absolute confidence in you.
28934	47	8	1	 But we desire to let you know, brethren, of the grace of God which has been bestowed on the Churches of Macedonia;
28935	47	8	2	 how, while passing through great trouble, their boundless joy even amid their deep poverty has overflowed to increase their generous liberality.
28936	47	8	3	 For I can testify that to the utmost of their power, and even beyond their power, they have of their own free will given help.
28937	47	8	4	 With earnest entreaty they begged from us the  favour of being allowed to share in the service now being rendered to God's people.
28938	47	8	5	 They not only did this, as we had expected, but first of all in obedience to God's will they gave  their own selves to the Lord and to us.
28939	47	8	6	 This led us to urge Titus that, as he had previously been the one who commenced the work, so he should now go and complete among you this act of beneficence also.
28940	47	8	7	 Yes, just as you are already  very rich in faith, readiness of speech, knowledge, unwearied zeal, and in the love  that is in you, implanted by us, see to it that this grace of liberal giving also flourishes in you.
28941	47	8	8	 I am not saying this by way of command, but to test by the standard of other men's earnestness the genuineness of your love also.
28942	47	8	9	 For you know the condescending goodness of our Lord Jesus Christ--how for your sakes He became poor, though He was rich, in order that you through His poverty might grow rich.
28943	47	8	10	 But in this matter I give you an opinion; for my doing this helps forward your own intentions, seeing that not only have you begun operations, but a year ago you already had the desire to do so.
28944	47	8	11	 And now complete the doing also, in order that, just as there was then the eagerness in desiring, there may now be the accomplishment in proportion to your means.
28945	47	8	12	 For, assuming the earnest willingness, the gift is acceptable according to whatever a man has, and not according to what he has not.
28946	47	8	13	 I do not urge you to give in order that others may have relief while you are unduly pressed,
28947	47	8	14	 but that, by equalization of burdens, your superfluity having in the present emergency supplied their deficiency, their superfluity may in turn be a supply for your deficiency later on, so that there may be equalization of burdens.
28948	47	8	15	 Even as it is written, <"He who gathered much had not  too much, and he who gathered little had not  too little.">
28949	47	8	16	 But thanks be to God that He inspires the heart of Titus with the same deep interest in you;
28950	47	8	17	 for Titus welcomed our request, and, being thoroughly in earnest, comes to you of his own free will.
28951	47	8	18	 And we send with him the brother whose  praises for his earnestness in proclaiming the Good News are heard throughout all the Churches.
28952	47	8	19	 And more than that, he is the one who was chosen by the  vote of the Churches to travel with us, sharing our commission in the administration of this generous gift to promote the Lord's glory and gratify our own strong desire.
28953	47	8	20	 For against one thing we are on our guard--I mean against blame being thrown upon us in respect to these large and liberal contributions which are under our charge.
28954	47	8	21	 For we seek not only God's approval of our integrity, but man's also.
28955	47	8	22	 And we send with them our brother, of whose zeal we have had frequent proof in many matters, and who is now more zealous than ever through the strong confidence which he has in you.
28956	47	8	23	 As for Titus, remember that he is a partner with me, and is my comrade in my labours for you. And as for our brethren, remember that they are  delegates from the Churches, and are men in whom Christ is glorified.
28957	47	8	24	 Exhibit therefore to the Churches a proof of your love, and a justification of our boasting to these brethren about you.
28958	47	9	1	 As to the services which are being rendered to God's people, it is really unnecessary for me to write to you.
28959	47	9	2	 For I know your earnest willingness, on account of which I habitually boast of you to the Macedonians, pointing out to them that for a whole year you in Greece have been ready; and the greater number of them have been spurred on by your ardour.
28960	47	9	3	 Still I send the brethren in order that in this matter our boast about you may not turn out to have been an idle one; so that, as I have said, you may be ready;
28961	47	9	4	 for fear that, if any Macedonians come with me and find you unprepared, we--not to say you yourselves--should be put to the blush in respect to this confidence.
28962	47	9	5	 I have thought it absolutely necessary therefore to request these brethren to visit you before I myself come, and to make sure beforehand that the  gift of love which you have already promised may be ready as a gift of love, and may not seem to have been something which I have extorted from you.
28963	47	9	6	 But do not forget that he who sows with a niggardly hand will also reap a niggardly crop, and that he who sows  bountifully will also reap bountifully.
28964	47	9	7	 Let each contribute  what he has decided upon in his own mind, and not do it reluctantly or under compulsion. <"It is a cheerful giver that God loves.">
28965	47	9	8	 And God is able to bestow every blessing on you in abundance, so that  richly enjoying all sufficiency at all times, you may have ample means for all good works.
28966	47	9	9	 As it is written, <"He has scattered abroad, he has given to the poor, his  almsgiving remains for ever.">
28967	47	9	10	 And God who  continually supplies seed for the sower and bread for eating,  will supply you with seed and multiply it, and will cause your almsgiving to yield a plentiful harvest.
28968	47	9	11	 May you be  abundantly enriched so as to show all liberality, such as through our instrumentality brings thanksgiving to God.
28969	47	9	12	 For the service rendered in this sacred gift not only helps to relieve the wants of God's people, but it is also rich in its results and awakens a chorus of thanksgiving to God.
28970	47	9	13	  For,  by the practical proof of it which you exhibit in this service, you cause God to be extolled for your  fidelity to your professed adherence to the Good News of the Christ, and for the liberality of your contributions for them and for  all who are in need,
28971	47	9	14	 while they themselves also in supplications on your behalf pour out their longing love towards you because of God's surpassing grace which is resting upon you.
28972	47	9	15	 Thanks be to God for His  unspeakably precious  gift!
28973	47	10	1	 But as for me Paul, I entreat you by the gentleness and self-forgetfulness of Christ--I who when among you have not an imposing personal presence, but when absent am fearlessly outspoken in dealing with you.
28974	47	10	2	 I beseech you not to compel me when present to make a bold display of the confidence with which I reckon I shall show my `courage' against some who reckon that we are guided by worldly principles.
28975	47	10	3	 For, though we are still living in the world, it is no worldly warfare that we are waging.
28976	47	10	4	 The weapons with which we fight are not human weapons, but are mighty for God in overthrowing strong fortresses.
28977	47	10	5	 For we overthrow arrogant `reckonings,' and every stronghold that towers high in defiance of the knowledge of God, and we carry off every thought as if into slavery--into subjection to Christ;
28978	47	10	6	 while we hold ourselves in readiness to punish every act of disobedience, as soon as ever you  as a Church have fully shown your obedience.
28979	47	10	7	 Is it outward appearances you look to? If any man is confident as regards himself that he specially belongs to Christ, let him consider again and reflect that just as he belongs to Christ, so also do we.
28980	47	10	8	 If, however, I were to boast more loudly of our  Apostolic authority, which the Lord has given us that we may build you up, not  pull you down, I should have no reason to feel ashamed.
28981	47	10	9	 Let it not seem as if I wanted to frighten you by my letters.
28982	47	10	10	 For they say "His letters are authoritative and forcible, but his personal presence is unimpressive, and as for eloquence, he has none."
28983	47	10	11	 Let such people take this into their reckoning, that whatever we are in word by our letters when absent, the same are we also in act when present.
28984	47	10	12	 For we have not the `courage' to rank ourselves among, or compare ourselves with, certain persons distinguished by their self-commendation. Yet they are not wise, measuring themselves, as they do, by one another and comparing themselves with one another.
28985	47	10	13	 We, however, will not exceed due limits in our boasting, but will keep within the limits of the sphere which God has assigned to us as a limit, which reaches even to you.
28986	47	10	14	 For there is no undue stretch of authority on our part, as though it did not extend to you. We pressed on even to Corinth, and were the first to proclaim to you the Good News of the Christ.
28987	47	10	15	 We do not exceed our due limits, and take credit for other men's labours; but we entertain the hope that, as your faith grows, we shall gain promotion among you--still keeping within our own sphere--promotion to a larger field of labour,
28988	47	10	16	 and shall tell the Good News in the districts beyond you, not boasting in another man's sphere about work already done by him.
28989	47	10	17	 But <"whoever boasts, let his boast be in the Lord.">
28990	47	10	18	 For it is not the man that commends himself who is really approved, but he whom the Lord commends.
28991	47	11	1	 I wish you could have borne with a little  foolish boasting on my part. Nay, do bear with me.
28992	47	11	2	 I am jealous over you with God's own jealousy. For I have betrothed you to Christ to present you to Him like a faithful bride to her one husband.
28993	47	11	3	 But I am afraid that, as the serpent in his craftiness deceived Eve, so your minds may be led astray from their single-heartedness and their fidelity to Christ.
28994	47	11	4	 If indeed  some visitor is proclaiming among you another Jesus whom we did not proclaim, or if you are receiving a Spirit different from the One you have already received or a Good News different from that which you have already welcomed, your toleration is admirable!
28995	47	11	5	 Why, I reckon myself in no respect inferior to those superlatively great Apostles.
28996	47	11	6	 And if in the matter of speech I am no orator, yet in knowledge I am not deficient. Nay, we have in every way made that  fully evident to you.
28997	47	11	7	 Is it a sin that I abased myself in order for you to be exalted, in that I proclaimed God's Good News to you without fee or reward?
28998	47	11	8	 Other Churches I robbed, receiving pay from them in order to do you service.
28999	47	11	9	 And when I was with you and my resources failed, there was no one to whom I became a burden--for the brethren when they came from Macedonia fully supplied my wants--and I kept myself from being in the least a burden to you, and will do so still.
29000	47	11	10	 Christ knows that it is true when I say that I will not be stopped from boasting of this anywhere in Greece.
29001	47	11	11	 And why? Because I do not love you? God knows that I do.
29002	47	11	12	 But I will persist in the same line of conduct in order to cut the ground from under the feet of those who desire an opportunity of getting themselves recognized as being on a level with us in the matters about which they boast.
29003	47	11	13	 For men of this stamp are sham apostles, dishonest workmen, assuming the garb of Apostles of Christ.
29004	47	11	14	 And no wonder.  Satan, their master, can disguise himself as an angel of light.
29005	47	11	15	 It is therefore no great thing for his servants also to disguise themselves as servants of righteousness. Their end will be in accordance with their actions.
29006	47	11	16	 To return to what I was saying. Let no one suppose that I am  foolish. Or if you must, at any rate make allowance for me as being foolish, in order that I, as well as they, may boast a little.
29007	47	11	17	 What I am now saying, I do not say by the Lord's command, but as a fool in his folly might, in this reckless boasting.
29008	47	11	18	 Since many boast for merely human reasons, I too will boast.
29009	47	11	19	 Wise as you yourselves are, you find pleasure in tolerating fools.
29010	47	11	20	 For you tolerate it, if any one enslaves you, lives at your expense, makes off with your property, gives himself airs, or  strikes you on the face.
29011	47	11	21	 I use the language of self-disparagement, as though I were admitting our own feebleness. Yet for whatever reason any one is `courageous' --I speak in mere folly--I also am courageous.
29012	47	11	22	 Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelites? So am I. Are they descendants of Abraham? So am I.
29013	47	11	23	 Are they servants of Christ? (I speak as if I were out of my mind.) Much more am I His servant; serving Him more thoroughly than they by my labours, and more thoroughly also by my imprisonments, by excessively cruel floggings, and with risk of life many a time.
29014	47	11	24	 From the Jews I five times have received forty lashes all but one.
29015	47	11	25	 Three times I have been beaten with Roman rods, once I have been stoned, three times I have been shipwrecked, once for full four and twenty hours  I was floating on the open sea.
29016	47	11	26	 I have served Him by frequent travelling, amid dangers in crossing rivers, dangers from robbers; dangers from my own countrymen, dangers from the Gentiles; dangers in the city, dangers in the Desert, dangers by sea, dangers from spies in our midst;
29017	47	11	27	 with labour and toil, with many a sleepless night, in hunger and thirst, in frequent fastings, in cold, and with insufficient clothing.
29018	47	11	28	 And besides other things, which I pass over, there is that which presses on me daily--my anxiety for all the Churches.
29019	47	11	29	 Who is weak, and I am not weak? Who is  led astray into sin, and I am not aflame with indignation?
29020	47	11	30	 If boast I must, it shall be of things which display my weakness.
29021	47	11	31	 The God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ--He who is blessed throughout the Ages--knows that I am speaking the truth.
29022	47	11	32	 In Damascus the governor under King Aretas kept guards at the gates of the city in order to apprehend me,
29023	47	11	33	 but through an  opening in the wall I was let down in a basket, and so escaped his hands.
29024	47	12	1	 I am compelled to boast. It is not a profitable employment, but I will proceed to  visions and revelations  granted me by the Lord.
29025	47	12	2	 I know a Christian man who fourteen years ago--  whether in the body I do not know, or out of the body I do not know; God knows--was caught up (this man of whom I am speaking) even to the highest Heaven.
29026	47	12	3	 And I know that this man--  whether in the body or apart from the body I do not know;
29027	47	12	4	 God knows--was caught up into Paradise and heard unspeakable things which no human being is permitted to repeat.
29028	47	12	5	 Of such a one I will boast; but of myself I will not boast, except in my weaknesses.
29029	47	12	6	 If however I  should choose to boast, I should not be a fool for so doing, for I should be speaking the truth. But I forbear, lest any one should be led to estimate me more highly than what his own eyes attest, or more highly than what he hears from my lips.
29030	47	12	7	 And  judging by the stupendous grandeur of the revelations--therefore lest I should be over-elated there has been sent to me, like the agony of impalement, Satan's angel dealing blow after blow, lest I should be over-elated.
29031	47	12	8	 As for this, three times have I besought the Lord to rid me of him;
29032	47	12	9	 but His reply has been, "My grace suffices for you, for  power matures in weakness." Most gladly therefore will I boast of my infirmities rather than complain of them--in order that Christ's power may overshadow me.
29033	47	12	10	 In fact I take pleasure in infirmities, in the bearing of insults, in distress, in persecutions, in grievous difficulties--for Christ's sake; for when I am weak, then I am strong.
29034	47	12	11	 It is foolish of me to write all this, but you have compelled me to do so. Why, you ought to have been my vindicators; for in no respect have I been inferior to these superlatively great Apostles, even though in myself I am nothing.
29035	47	12	12	 The signs that characterize the true Apostle have been done among you, accompanied by unwearied fortitude, and by tokens and marvels and displays of power.
29036	47	12	13	 In what respect, therefore, have you been worse dealt with than other Churches, except that I myself never hung as  a dead weight upon you? Forgive the injustice I thus did you!
29037	47	12	14	 See, I am now for the third time prepared to visit you, but I will not be  a dead weight to you. I desire not your money, but yourselves; for children ought not to put by for their parents, but parents for their children.
29038	47	12	15	 And as for me, most gladly will I spend all I have and be utterly spent for your salvation.
29039	47	12	16	  If I love you  so intensely, am I the less to be loved? Be that as it may: I was not a burden to you. But  being by no means scrupulous, I entrapped you, they say!
29040	47	12	17	 Have I gained any selfish advantage over you through any one of the messengers I have sent to you?
29041	47	12	18	 I begged Titus to visit you, and sent our other brother with him. Did Titus gain any selfish advantage over you? Were not  he and I guided by one and the same Spirit, and did we not walk in the same steps?
29042	47	12	19	 You are imagining, all this time, that we are making our defense at your bar. In reality it is as in God's presence and in communion with Christ  that we speak; but, dear friends, it is all with a view to your progress in goodness.
29043	47	12	20	 For I am afraid that perhaps when I come I may not find you to be what I desire, and that you may find me to be what you do not desire; that perhaps there may be contention, jealousy, bitter feeling, party spirit, ill-natured talk, backbiting, undue eulogy, unrest;
29044	47	12	21	 and that upon re-visiting you I may be humbled by my God in your presence, and may have to mourn over many  whose hearts still cling to their old sins, and who have not repented of the impurity, fornication, and gross sensuality, of which they have been guilty.
29045	47	13	1	 This intended visit of mine is my third visit to you. <"On the evidence of two or three witnesses every charge shall be sustained.">
29046	47	13	2	 Those who cling to their old sins, and indeed all of you, I have forewarned and still forewarn (as I did on my second visit when present, so I do now, though absent) that, when I come again, I shall not spare you;
29047	47	13	3	 since you want a practical proof of the fact that Christ speaks by my lips--He who is not feeble towards you, but powerful among you.
29048	47	13	4	 For though it is true that He was crucified through weakness, yet He now lives through the power of God. We also are weak,  sharing His weakness, but with Him we shall be full of life to deal with you through the power of God.
29049	47	13	5	 Test yourselves to discover whether you are true believers: put your own selves under examination. Or do you not know that Jesus Christ is within you, unless you are insincere?
29050	47	13	6	 But I trust that you will recognize that we are not insincere.
29051	47	13	7	 And our prayer to God is that you may do nothing wrong; not in order that our sincerity may be demonstrated, but  that you may do what is right, even though our sincerity may seem to be doubtful.
29052	47	13	8	  For we have no power against the truth, but only for the furtherance of the truth;
29053	47	13	9	 and it is a joy to us when we are powerless, but you are strong. This we also pray for--the perfecting of your characters.
29054	47	13	10	 For this reason I write thus while absent, that when present I may not have to act severely in the exercise of the authority which the Lord has given me for building up, and not for pulling down.
29055	47	13	11	 Finally, brethren,  be joyful, secure perfection of character, take courage, be of one mind, live in peace. And then God who gives love and peace will be with you.
29056	47	13	12	 Salute one another with a holy kiss.
29057	47	13	13	 All God's people here send greetings to you.
29058	47	13	14	 May the grace of the Lord Jesus Christ, the love of God, and  the fellowship of the Holy Spirit, be with you all.
29059	48	1	1	 Paul, an Apostle sent not from men nor by any man, but by Jesus Christ and by God the Father, who raised Jesus from among the dead--
29060	48	1	2	 and all the brethren who are with me: To the Churches of Galatia.
29061	48	1	3	 May grace and peace be granted to you from God the Father, and from our Lord Jesus Christ,
29062	48	1	4	 who gave Himself to suffer for our sins in order to rescue us from the present wicked age in accordance with the will of our God and Father.
29063	48	1	5	 To Him be the glory to the Ages of the Ages! Amen.
29064	48	1	6	 I marvel that you are so readily leaving Him who called you by the grace of Christ, and are adhering to a different Good News.
29065	48	1	7	 For other "Good News" there is none; but there are some persons who are troubling you, and are seeking to distort the Good News concerning Christ.
29066	48	1	8	 But if even we or an angel from Heaven should bring you a Good News different from that which we have already brought you, let him be accursed.
29067	48	1	9	 What I have just said I repeat--if any one is preaching to you a Good News other than that which you originally received, let him be accursed.
29068	48	1	10	 For is it man's favour or God's that I aspire to? Or am I seeking to please men? If I were still a man-pleaser, I should not be Christ's bondservant.
29069	48	1	11	 For I must tell you, brethren, that the Good News which was proclaimed by me is not such as man approves of.
29070	48	1	12	 For, in fact, it was not from man that I received or learnt it, but by a revelation from Jesus Christ.
29071	48	1	13	 For you have heard of my early career in Judaism--how I furiously persecuted the Church of God, and made havoc of it;
29072	48	1	14	 and how in devotion to Judaism I outstripped many men of my own age among my people, being far more zealous than they on behalf of the traditions of my forefathers.
29073	48	1	15	 But when He who set me apart even from my birth, and called me by His grace,
29074	48	1	16	 saw fit to reveal His Son within me in order that I might tell among the Gentiles the Good News concerning Him, at once I did not confer with any human being,
29075	48	1	17	 nor did I go up to Jerusalem to those who were my seniors in the Apostleship, but I went away into Arabia, and afterwards came back to Damascus.
29076	48	1	18	 Then, three years later, I went up to Jerusalem to inquire for  Peter, and I spent a fortnight with him.
29077	48	1	19	 I saw none of the other Apostles, except James, the Lord's brother.
29078	48	1	20	 In making these assertions I am speaking the truth, as in the sight of God.
29079	48	1	21	 Afterwards I visited Syria and Cilicia.
29080	48	1	22	 But to the Christian Churches in Judaea I was personally unknown.
29081	48	1	23	 They only heard it said, "He who was once our persecutor is now telling the Good News of the faith of which he formerly made havoc."
29082	48	1	24	 And they gave glory to God on my account.
29083	48	2	1	 Later still, after an interval of fourteen years, I again went up to Jerusalem in company with Barnabas, taking Titus also with me.
29084	48	2	2	 I went up in obedience to a revelation of God's will; and I explained to them the Good News which I proclaim among the Gentiles. To the leaders of the Church this explanation was made in private, lest by any means I should be running, or should already have run, in vain.
29085	48	2	3	  But although my companion Titus was a Greek they did not insist upon even his being circumcised.
29086	48	2	4	 Yet there was danger of this through the false brethren secretly introduced into the Church, who had stolen in to spy out the  freedom which is ours in Christ Jesus, in order to rob us of it.
29087	48	2	5	 But not for an hour did we give way and submit to them; in order that the Good News might continue with you in its integrity.
29088	48	2	6	 From those leaders I gained nothing new. Whether they were men of importance or not, matters nothing to me--God recognizes no external distinctions. To me, at any rate, the leaders imparted nothing new.
29089	48	2	7	  Indeed, when they saw that I was entrusted with the preaching of the Good News to the Gentiles as Peter had been with that to the Jews--
29090	48	2	8	 for He who had been at work within Peter with a view to his Apostleship to the Jews had also been at work within me with a view to my Apostleship to the Gentiles--
29091	48	2	9	 and when they perceived the  mission which was graciously entrusted to me, they (that is to say, James,  Peter, and John, who were considered to be the pillars of the Church) welcomed Barnabas and me to their fellowship on the understanding that we were to go to the Gentiles and they to the Jews.
29092	48	2	10	 Only they urged that we should remember their poor--a thing which was uppermost in my own mind.
29093	48	2	11	 Now when  Peter visited Antioch, I remonstrated with him to his face, because he had incurred just censure.
29094	48	2	12	 For until certain persons came from James he had been accustomed to eat with Gentiles; but as soon as these persons came, he withdrew and separated himself for fear of the Circumcision party.
29095	48	2	13	 And along with him the other Jews also concealed their real opinions, so that even Barnabas was carried away by their lack of straightforwardness.
29096	48	2	14	 As soon as I saw that they were not walking uprightly in the spirit of the Good News, I said to  Peter, before them all, "If you, though you are a Jew, live as a Gentile does, and not as a Jew, how can you make the Gentiles follow Jewish customs?
29097	48	2	15	 You and I, though we are Jews by birth and not Gentile sinners,
29098	48	2	16	 know that it is not through obedience to Law that a man can be declared free from guilt, but only through faith in Jesus Christ. We have therefore believed in Christ Jesus, for the purpose of being declared free from guilt, through faith in Christ and not through obedience to Law. For through obedience to Law no human being shall be declared free from guilt.
29099	48	2	17	 But if while we are seeking in Christ acquittal from guilt we ourselves are convicted of sin, Christ then encourages us to sin! No, indeed.
29100	48	2	18	 Why, if I am now rebuilding that structure of sin which I had demolished, I am thereby constituting myself a transgressor;
29101	48	2	19	 for it is by the Law that I have died to the Law, in order that I may live to God.
29102	48	2	20	 I have been crucified with Christ, and it is no longer I that live, but Christ that lives in me; and the life which I now live in the body I live through faith in the Son of God who loved me and gave Himself up to death on my behalf.
29103	48	2	21	 I do not nullify the grace of God; for if acquittal from guilt is obtainable through the Law, then Christ has died in vain."
29104	48	3	1	 You foolish Galatians! Whose sophistry has bewitched you--you to whom Jesus Christ has been vividly portrayed  as on the Cross?
29105	48	3	2	 Answer me this one question, "Is it on the ground of your obedience to the Law that you received the Spirit, or is it because, when you heard, you believed?"
29106	48	3	3	 Are you so foolish? Having begun by the Spirit, are you now going to reach perfection through what is external?
29107	48	3	4	 Have you  endured such sufferings to no purpose--if indeed it has been to no purpose?
29108	48	3	5	 He who gives you His Spirit and works miracles among you--does He do so on the ground of your obedience to the Law, or is it the result of your having heard and believed:
29109	48	3	6	 even as <Abraham believed God, and his faith was placed to his account as righteousness?>
29110	48	3	7	 Notice therefore that those who possess faith are true sons of Abraham.
29111	48	3	8	 And the Scripture, foreseeing that in consequence of faith God would declare the nations to be free from guilt, sent beforehand the Good News to Abraham, saying, <"In you all the nations shall be blessed.">
29112	48	3	9	 So we see that it is those who possess faith that are blessed with believing Abraham.
29113	48	3	10	 All who are depending upon their own obedience to the Law are under a curse, for it is written, <"Cursed is every one who does not remain faithful to all the precepts of the Law, and practise them.">
29114	48	3	11	 It is evident, too, that no one can find acceptance with God simply by obeying the Law, because <"the righteous shall live by faith,">
29115	48	3	12	 and the Law has nothing to do with faith. It teaches that <"he who does these things shall live by doing them.">
29116	48	3	13	 Christ has purchased our freedom from the curse of the Law by becoming accursed for us--because <"Cursed is every one who is hanged upon a tree.">
29117	48	3	14	 Our freedom has been thus purchased in order that in Christ Jesus the blessing belonging to Abraham may come upon the nations, so that through faith we may receive the promised Spirit.
29118	48	3	15	 Brethren, even a covenant made by a man--to borrow an illustration from daily life--when once formally sanctioned is not liable to be set aside or added to.
29119	48	3	16	 (Now the promises were given to Abraham and to his seed. God did not say "and to seeds," as if speaking of many, but "and to your seed," since He spoke of only one--and this is Christ.)
29120	48	3	17	 I mean that the Covenant which God had already formally made is not abrogated by the Law which was given four hundred and thirty years later--so as to annul the promise.
29121	48	3	18	 For if the inheritance comes through obedience to Law, it no longer comes because of a promise. But, as a matter of fact, God has granted it to Abraham in fulfilment of a promise.
29122	48	3	19	 Why then was the Law given? It was imposed later on for the sake of  defining sin, until the seed should come to whom God had made the promise; and its details were laid down by a mediator with the help of angels.
29123	48	3	20	 But there cannot be a mediator where only one individual is concerned.
29124	48	3	21	  God, however, is only one. Is the Law then opposed to the promises of God? No, indeed; for if a Law had been given which could have conferred Life, righteousness would certainly have come by the Law.
29125	48	3	22	 But Scripture has shown that all mankind are the prisoners of sin, in order that the promised blessing, which depends on faith in Jesus Christ, may be given to those who believe.
29126	48	3	23	 Before this faith came, we Jews were perpetual prisoners under the Law, living under restraints and limitations in preparation for the faith which was soon to be revealed.
29127	48	3	24	 So that the Law has acted the part of a tutor-slave  to lead us to Christ, in order that through faith we may be declared to be free from guilt.
29128	48	3	25	 But now that this faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor-slave.
29129	48	3	26	 You are all sons of God through faith in Christ Jesus;
29130	48	3	27	 for all of you who have been baptized  into Christ, have clothed yourselves with Christ.
29131	48	3	28	  In Him the distinctions between Jew and Gentile, slave and free man, male and female, disappear; you are all one in Christ Jesus.
29132	48	3	29	 And if you belong to Christ, then you are indeed true descendants of Abraham, and are heirs in fulfilment of the promise.
29133	48	4	1	 Now I say that so long as  an heir is a child, he in no respect differs from a slave, although he is the owner of everything,
29134	48	4	2	 but he is under the control of guardians and trustees until the time his father has appointed.
29135	48	4	3	 So we also, when spiritually we were children, were subject to the world's rudimentary notions, and were enslaved.
29136	48	4	4	 But, when the time was fully come, God sent forth His Son, born of a woman, born subject to Law,
29137	48	4	5	 in order to purchase the freedom of all who were subject to Law, so that we might receive recognition as sons.
29138	48	4	6	 And because you are sons, God has sent out the Spirit of His Son to enter your hearts and cry "Abba! our Father!"
29139	48	4	7	 Therefore you are no longer a slave, but a son; and if a son, then an heir also through God's own act.
29140	48	4	8	 But at one time, you Gentiles, having no knowledge of God, were slaves to gods which in reality do not exist.
29141	48	4	9	 Now, however, having come to know God--or rather to be known by Him--how is it you are again turning back to weak and worthless rudimentary notions to which you are once more willing to be enslaved?
29142	48	4	10	 You scrupulously observe days and months, special seasons, and years.
29143	48	4	11	 I am alarmed about you, and am afraid that I have perhaps bestowed labour upon you to no purpose.
29144	48	4	12	 Brethren, become as I am, I beseech you; for I have also become like you. In no respect did you behave badly to me.
29145	48	4	13	 And you know that in those early days it was on account of  bodily infirmity that I proclaimed the Good News to you,
29146	48	4	14	 and yet the bodily infirmity which was such a trial to you, you did not regard with contempt or loathing, but you received me as if I had been an angel of God or Christ Jesus Himself!
29147	48	4	15	 I ask you, then, what has become of your  self-congratulations? For I bear you witness that had it been possible you would have torn out your own eyes and have given them to me.
29148	48	4	16	 Can it be that I have become your enemy through speaking the truth to you?
29149	48	4	17	 These men pay court to you, but not with honourable motives. They want to exclude you, so that you may pay court to them.
29150	48	4	18	 It is always an honourable thing to be courted in an honourable cause; always, and not only when I am with you, my children--
29151	48	4	19	 you for whom I am again, as it were, undergoing the pains of childbirth, until Christ is fully formed within you.
29152	48	4	20	 Would that I were with you and could  change my tone, for I am perplexed about you.
29153	48	4	21	 Tell me--you who want to continue to be subject to Law--will you not listen to the Law?
29154	48	4	22	 For it is written that Abraham had two sons, one by the slave-girl and one by the free woman.
29155	48	4	23	 But we see that the child of the slave-girl was born in the common course of nature; but the child of the free woman in fulfilment of the promise.
29156	48	4	24	 All this is allegorical; for the women represent two Covenants. One has its origin on Mount Sinai, and bears children destined for slavery.
29157	48	4	25	 This is Hagar;  for the name Hagar stands for Mount Sinai in Arabia, and corresponds to the present Jerusalem, which is in bondage together with her children.
29158	48	4	26	 But the Jerusalem which is above is free, and *she* is *our* mother.
29159	48	4	27	 For it is written, <"Rejoice, thou  barren woman that bearest not, break forth into a joyful cry, thou that dost not travail with child. For the desolate woman has many children--more indeed than she who has the husband.">
29160	48	4	28	 But you, brethren, like Isaac, are children born in fulfilment of a promise.
29161	48	4	29	 Yet just as, at that time, the child born in the common course of nature persecuted the one whose birth was due to the power of the Spirit, so it is now.
29162	48	4	30	 But what says the Scripture? <"Send away the slave-girl and her son, for never shall the slave-girl's son share the inheritance with the son of the free woman.">
29163	48	4	31	 Therefore, brethren, since we are not the children of a slave-girl, but of the free woman--
29164	48	5	1	 Christ having made us gloriously free--stand fast and do not again be hampered with the yoke of slavery.
29165	48	5	2	 Remember that it is I Paul who tell you that if you receive circumcision Christ will avail you nothing.
29166	48	5	3	 I once more protest to every man who receives circumcision that he is under obligation to obey the whole Law of Moses.
29167	48	5	4	  Christ has become nothing to any of you who are seeking acceptance with God through the Law: you have fallen away from grace.
29168	48	5	5	 *We* have not, for through the Spirit we wait with longing hope for an  acceptance with God which is to come through faith.
29169	48	5	6	 For in Christ Jesus neither circumcision nor uncircumcision is of any importance; but only faith working through love.
29170	48	5	7	 You were running the race nobly! Who has interfered and caused you to swerve from the truth?
29171	48	5	8	  No such teaching ever proceeded from Him who is calling you.
29172	48	5	9	 A little  yeast  corrupts the whole of the dough.
29173	48	5	10	 For my part I have  strong confidence in you in the Lord that you will adopt my view of the matter. But the man--be he who he may--who is troubling you, will have to bear the full weight of the judgement to be pronounced on him.
29174	48	5	11	 As for me, brethren, if I am still a preacher of circumcision, how is it that I am still suffering persecution? In that case the Cross has ceased to be a stumbling-block!
29175	48	5	12	 Would to God that those who are unsettling your faith would even  mutilate themselves.
29176	48	5	13	 You  however, brethren, were called to  freedom. Only do not turn your freedom into an excuse for giving way to your lower natures; but become bondservants to one another in a spirit of love.
29177	48	5	14	 For the entire Law has been obeyed when you have kept the single precept, which says, <"You are to love your  fellow man equally with yourself.">
29178	48	5	15	 But if you are perpetually snarling and snapping at one another, beware lest you are destroyed by one another.
29179	48	5	16	 This then is what I mean. Let your lives be guided by the Spirit, and then you will certainly not  indulge the cravings of  your lower natures.
29180	48	5	17	 For the cravings of the lower nature are opposed to those of the Spirit, and the cravings of the Spirit are opposed to those of the lower nature; because these are antagonistic to each other, so that you cannot do everything to which you are inclined.
29181	48	5	18	 But if  the Spirit is leading you, you are not subject to Law.
29182	48	5	19	 Now you know full well the doings of our lower natures. Fornication, impurity, indecency, idol-worship, sorcery;
29183	48	5	20	 enmity, strife, jealousy, outbursts of passion, intrigues, dissensions, factions,  envyings;
29184	48	5	21	 hard drinking, riotous feasting, and the like. And as to these I forewarn you, as I have already forewarned you, that those who are guilty of such things will have no share in the Kingdom of God.
29185	48	5	22	 The Spirit, on the other hand, brings a harvest of love, joy, peace; patience towards others, kindness, benevolence;
29186	48	5	23	 good faith, meekness, self-restraint.
29187	48	5	24	 Against such things as these there is no law. Now those who belong to Christ Jesus have crucified their lower nature with its passions and appetites.
29188	48	5	25	 If we are living by the Spirit's power, let our conduct also be governed by the Spirit's power.
29189	48	5	26	 Let us not become vain-glorious, challenging one another, envying one another.
29190	48	6	1	 Brethren, if anybody be detected in any misconduct, you who are spiritual should restore such a one in a spirit of meekness. And let each of you keep watch over himself, lest  he also fall into temptation.
29191	48	6	2	 Always carry one another's burdens, and so  obey the whole of Christ's Law.
29192	48	6	3	 For if there is any one who thinks himself to be somebody when he is nobody, he is deluding himself.
29193	48	6	4	 But let every man scrutinize his own conduct, and then he will find out, not with reference to another but with reference to himself, what he has to boast of.
29194	48	6	5	 For every man will have to carry his own load.
29195	48	6	6	 But let those who receive instruction in Christian truth share with their instructors all temporal blessings.
29196	48	6	7	 Do not deceive yourselves. God is not to be scoffed at. For whatever a man sows, that he will also reap.
29197	48	6	8	 He who sows in the field of his lower nature, will from that nature reap  destruction; but he who sows to serve the Spirit will from the Spirit reap the Life of the Ages.
29198	48	6	9	 Let us not abate our courage in doing what is right; for in due time we shall reap a reward, if we do not faint.
29199	48	6	10	 So then,  as we have opportunity, let us labour for the good of all, and especially of those who belong  to the household of the faith.
29200	48	6	11	 See in what large letters  I am writing to you with my own hand.
29201	48	6	12	 All who desire to display their zeal for external observances try to compel you to receive circumcision, but their real object is simply to escape being persecuted for the Cross of Christ.
29202	48	6	13	 For these very men do not really keep the Law of Moses, but they would have you receive circumcision in order that they may glory in *your* bodies.
29203	48	6	14	 But as for me, God forbid that I should glory in anything except the Cross of our Lord Jesus Christ,  upon which the world  is crucified to me, and I am crucified to the world.
29204	48	6	15	  For neither circumcision nor uncircumcision is of any importance; but only a renewed nature.
29205	48	6	16	 And all who  shall regulate their lives by this principle--may peace and mercy be given to them--and to the true Israel of God.
29206	48	6	17	 From this time onward let no one trouble me; for, as for me, I bear, branded on my body,  the scars of Jesus as my Master.
29207	48	6	18	 May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirits, brethren. Amen.
29208	49	1	1	 Paul, an Apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God: To God's people who are in Ephesus--believers in Christ Jesus.
29209	49	1	2	 May grace and peace be granted to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
29210	49	1	3	 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who has crowned us with every spiritual blessing in the heavenly realms in Christ;
29211	49	1	4	 even as, in His love,  He chose us as His own in Christ before the creation of the world, that we might be holy and without blemish in His presence.
29212	49	1	5	 For He pre-destined us to be adopted by Himself as sons through Jesus Christ--such being His gracious will and pleasure--
29213	49	1	6	 to the praise of the splendour of His grace with which He has  enriched us in the beloved One.
29214	49	1	7	 It is in Him, and through the shedding of His blood, that we have our  deliverance--the forgiveness of our offences--so abundant was God's grace,
29215	49	1	8	 the grace which He, the possessor of all wisdom and understanding, lavished upon us,
29216	49	1	9	 when He made known to us the secret of His will. And this is in harmony with God's merciful purpose
29217	49	1	10	 for the government of the world when the times are ripe for it--the purpose which He has cherished in His own mind  of restoring the whole creation to find its one Head in Christ; yes, things in Heaven and things on earth, to find their one Head in Him.
29218	49	1	11	 In Him we Jews have been made heirs, having been chosen beforehand in accordance with the intention of Him whose might carries out in everything the design of His own will,
29219	49	1	12	 so that we should be devoted to the extolling of His glorious attributes--we who were the first to fix our hopes on Christ.
29220	49	1	13	 And in Him you Gentiles also, after listening to the Message of the truth, the Good News of your salvation--having believed in Him--were sealed with the promised Holy Spirit;
29221	49	1	14	 that Spirit being a pledge and foretaste of our inheritance, in anticipation of its full redemption--the inheritance which He has purchased  to be specially His for the extolling of His glory.
29222	49	1	15	 For this reason I too, having heard of the faith in the Lord Jesus which prevails among you, and  of your love for all God's people,
29223	49	1	16	 offer never ceasing thanks on your behalf while I make mention of you in my prayers.
29224	49	1	17	 For I always beseech the God of our Lord Jesus Christ--the Father  most glorious--to give you  a spirit of wisdom and penetration through an intimate knowledge of Him,
29225	49	1	18	 the eyes of your  understanding being enlightened so that you may know what is the hope which His call to you inspires, what the wealth of the glory of His inheritance in God's people,
29226	49	1	19	 and what the transcendent greatness of His power  in us believers as seen in the working of His infinite might
29227	49	1	20	 when He displayed it in Christ by raising Him from the dead and seating Him at His own right hand in the heavenly realms,
29228	49	1	21	  high above all other government and authority and power and dominion, and every title of sovereignty used either in this Age or in the Age to come.
29229	49	1	22	 God has put all things under His feet, and has appointed Him universal and supreme Head of the Church, which is His Body,
29230	49	1	23	  the completeness of Him who everywhere fills the universe with Himself.
29231	49	2	1	 To you Gentiles also, who were dead through your offences and sins,
29232	49	2	2	 which were once habitual to you while you walked in the ways of this world and obeyed the Prince of the  powers of the air, the spirits that are now at work in the hearts of the sons of disobedience--to you God has given Life.
29233	49	2	3	 Among them all of us also formerly passed our lives, governed by the inclinations of our  lower natures, indulging the cravings of those  natures and of our own thoughts, and were in our original state  deserving of anger like all others.
29234	49	2	4	 But God, being rich in mercy, because of the intense love which He bestowed on us,
29235	49	2	5	 caused us, dead though we were through our offences, to live with Christ--it is by grace that  you have been saved--
29236	49	2	6	 raised us with Him from the dead, and enthroned us with Him in the heavenly realms as being in Christ Jesus,
29237	49	2	7	 in order that, by His goodness to us in Christ Jesus, He might display in the Ages to come the transcendent riches of His grace.
29238	49	2	8	 For it is by grace that  you have been saved through faith; and that not of yourselves. It is God's gift, and is not on the ground of merit--
29239	49	2	9	 so that it may be impossible for any one to boast.
29240	49	2	10	 For we are God's own handiwork, created in Christ Jesus for good works which He has  pre-destined us to practise.
29241	49	2	11	 Therefore, do not forget that formerly you were Gentiles as to your bodily condition. You were called the Uncircumcision by those who style themselves the Circumcised--their circumcision being one which the knife has effected.
29242	49	2	12	 At that time you were living apart from Christ, estranged from the Commonwealth of Israel, with no share by birth in the Covenants which are based on the Promises, and you had no hope and no God, in all the world.
29243	49	2	13	 But now in Christ Jesus you who once were so far away have been brought near through the death of Christ.
29244	49	2	14	 For He is our peace--He who has made  Jews and Gentiles one, and in His own human nature has broken down the hostile dividing wall,
29245	49	2	15	 by setting aside the Law with its commandments, expressed, as they were, in definite decrees. His design was to unite the two sections of humanity in Himself so as to form one new man,
29246	49	2	16	 thus effecting peace, and to reconcile Jews and Gentiles in one body to God, by means of His cross--slaying by it their mutual enmity.
29247	49	2	17	 So He came and proclaimed good news of peace to you who were so far away, and peace to those who were near;
29248	49	2	18	 because it is through Him that Jews and Gentiles alike have  access through one Spirit to the Father.
29249	49	2	19	 You are therefore no longer mere foreigners or persons excluded from civil rights. On the contrary you share citizenship with God's people and are members of His family.
29250	49	2	20	 You are a building which has been reared on the foundation of the Apostles and Prophets, the cornerstone being Christ Jesus Himself,
29251	49	2	21	 in union with whom  the whole fabric, fitted and closely joined together, is growing so as to form a holy sanctuary in the Lord;
29252	49	2	22	 in whom you also are being built up together to become a fixed abode for God through the Spirit.
29253	49	3	1	  For this reason I Paul, the prisoner of Christ Jesus on behalf of you Gentiles--
29254	49	3	2	 if, that is, you have heard of the  work which God has graciously entrusted to me for your benefit,
29255	49	3	3	 and that by a revelation the truth hitherto kept secret was made known to me as I have already briefly explained it to you.
29256	49	3	4	 By means of that explanation, as you read it, you can judge of my insight into the truth of Christ
29257	49	3	5	 which in earlier ages was not made known to the human race, as it has now been revealed to His holy Apostles and Prophets through the Spirit--
29258	49	3	6	 I mean the truth that the Gentiles are joint heirs with us Jews, and that they form one body with us, and have the same interest as we have in the promise which has been made good in Christ Jesus through the Good News,
29259	49	3	7	 in which I have been appointed to serve, in virtue of the work which God, in the exercise of His power within me, has graciously entrusted to me.
29260	49	3	8	 To me who am  less than the least of all God's people has this work been graciously entrusted--to proclaim to the Gentiles the Good News of the  exhaustless wealth of Christ,
29261	49	3	9	 and to show  all men in a clear light what my stewardship is. It is the stewardship of the truth which from all the Ages lay concealed in the mind of God, the Creator of all things--
29262	49	3	10	 concealed in order that the Church might now be used to display to the powers and authorities in the heavenly realms the innumerable aspects of God's wisdom.
29263	49	3	11	 Such was the  eternal purpose which He had formed in Christ Jesus our Lord,
29264	49	3	12	 in whom we have this bold and confident access through our faith in Him.
29265	49	3	13	 Therefore I entreat you not to lose heart in the midst of my sufferings on your behalf, for they bring you honour.
29266	49	3	14	 For this reason, on bended knee I beseech the Father,
29267	49	3	15	 from whom  the whole family in Heaven and on earth derives its name,
29268	49	3	16	 to grant you--in accordance with the wealth of His glorious perfections--to be strengthened by His Spirit with power penetrating to your inmost being.
29269	49	3	17	 I pray that Christ may make His home in your hearts through your faith; so that having your roots deep and your foundations strong, in love, you may become mighty to grasp the idea,
29270	49	3	18	 as it is grasped by all God's people, of the breadth and length, the height and depth--
29271	49	3	19	 yes, to attain to a knowledge of the knowledge-surpassing love of Christ, so that you may be made complete in accordance with God's own standard of completeness.
29272	49	3	20	 Now to Him who, in exercise of His power that is at work within us, is able to do infinitely beyond all our highest prayers or thoughts--
29273	49	3	21	 to Him be the glory in the Church and in Christ Jesus to all generations, world without end! Amen.
29274	49	4	1	 I, then, the prisoner for the Master's sake, entreat you to live and act as becomes those who have received the call that you have received--
29275	49	4	2	 with all lowliness of mind and unselfishness, and with patience, bearing with one another lovingly, and earnestly striving to maintain,
29276	49	4	3	 in the uniting bond of peace, the unity given by the Spirit.
29277	49	4	4	 There is but one body and but one Spirit, as also when you were called you had one and the same hope held out to you.
29278	49	4	5	 There is but one Lord, one faith, one baptism,
29279	49	4	6	 and one God and Father of all, who rules over all, acts through all, and dwells in all.
29280	49	4	7	 Yet to each of us individually  grace was given, measured out with the munificence of Christ.
29281	49	4	8	 For this reason Scripture says: <"He  re-ascended on high, He led captive  a host of captives,  and gave gifts to men.">
29282	49	4	9	 (Now this "re-ascended" --what does it mean but that He had first descended into  the lower regions of the earth?
29283	49	4	10	 He who descended is the same as He who ascended again far above all the Heavens in order  to fill the universe.)
29284	49	4	11	 And He Himself appointed some to be Apostles, some to be Prophets, some to be evangelists, some to be pastors and teachers,
29285	49	4	12	 in order fully to equip His people for the work of serving--for the building up of Christ's body--
29286	49	4	13	  till we all of us arrive at oneness in faith and in the knowledge of the Son of God, and at mature manhood and the stature of full-grown men in Christ.
29287	49	4	14	 So we shall no longer be babes nor shall we resemble mariners tossed on the waves and carried about with every changing wind of doctrine according to men's cleverness and unscrupulous cunning, making use of every shifting device to mislead.
29288	49	4	15	 But we shall lovingly hold to the truth, and shall in all respects grow up into union with Him who is our Head, even Christ.
29289	49	4	16	 Dependent on Him, the whole body--its various parts closely fitting and firmly adhering to one another--  grows by the aid of every  contributory link, with power proportioned to the need of each individual part, so as to build itself up in a spirit of love.
29290	49	4	17	 Therefore I  warn you, and I implore you in the name of the Master, no longer to live as the Gentiles in their perverseness live,
29291	49	4	18	 with darkened understandings, having by reason of the ignorance which is deep-seated in them and the insensibility of their moral nature, no share in the Life which God gives.
29292	49	4	19	 Such men being past feeling  have abandoned themselves to impurity, greedily indulging in every kind of profligacy.
29293	49	4	20	 But these are not the lessons which you have learned from Christ;
29294	49	4	21	 if at least you have heard His voice and in Him have been taught--and this is true Christian teaching--
29295	49	4	22	 to put away, in regard to your former mode of life, your original evil nature which  is doomed to perish as befits its misleading impulses,
29296	49	4	23	 and to get yourselves renewed in the temper of your minds and clothe yourselves
29297	49	4	24	 with that new and better self which has been created to resemble God in the righteousness and holiness which come from the truth.
29298	49	4	25	 For this reason, laying aside falsehood, every one of you should speak the truth to his fellow man; for we are, as it were, parts of one another.
29299	49	4	26	 If angry, beware of sinning. Let not your irritation last until the sun goes down;
29300	49	4	27	 and do not leave room for the Devil.
29301	49	4	28	 He who has been a thief must steal no more, but, instead of that, should work with his  own hands in honest industry, so that he may have something of which he can give the needy a share.
29302	49	4	29	 Let no unwholesome words ever pass your lips, but let all your words be good for benefiting others according to the need of the moment, so that they may be a means of blessing to the hearers.
29303	49	4	30	 And beware of grieving the Holy Spirit of God, in whom you have been sealed in preparation for the day of Redemption.
29304	49	4	31	 Let all bitterness and all passionate feeling, all anger and loud insulting language, be unknown among you--and also every kind of malice.
29305	49	4	32	 On the contrary learn to be kind to one another, tender-hearted, forgiving one another, just as God in Christ  has also forgiven you.
29306	49	5	1	 Therefore be imitators of God, as His dear children.
29307	49	5	2	 And live and act lovingly, as Christ also loved you and gave Himself up to death on our behalf as an offering and sacrifice to God, yielding a fragrant odor.
29308	49	5	3	 But fornication and every kind of impurity, or covetousness, let them not even be mentioned among you, for they  ought not to be named among God's people.
29309	49	5	4	 Avoid shameful and foolish talk and low jesting--they are all alike discreditable--and in place of these give thanks.
29310	49	5	5	 For be well assured that no fornicator or immoral person and no money-grubber--or in other words idol-worshipper--has any share awaiting him in the Kingdom of Christ and of God.
29311	49	5	6	 Let no one deceive you with empty words, for it is on account of these very sins that God's anger is coming upon the  disobedient.
29312	49	5	7	 Therefore do not become sharers with them.
29313	49	5	8	 There was a time when you were nothing but darkness. Now, as Christians, you are Light itself.
29314	49	5	9	 Live and act as sons of Light--for the effect of the Light is seen in every kind of goodness, uprightness and truth--
29315	49	5	10	 and learn in your own experiences what is fully pleasing to the Lord.
29316	49	5	11	 Have nothing to do with the barren unprofitable deeds of darkness, but, instead of that,  set your faces against them;
29317	49	5	12	 for the things which are done by these people in secret it is disgraceful even to speak of.
29318	49	5	13	 But everything can be tested by the light and thus be shown in its true colors; for whatever shines of itself is light.
29319	49	5	14	 For this reason it is said, "Rise, sleeper; rise from among the dead, and Christ will shed light upon you."
29320	49	5	15	 Therefore be very careful how you live and act. Let it not be as unwise men, but as wise.
29321	49	5	16	 Buy up your opportunities, for these are evil times.
29322	49	5	17	 On this account do not prove yourselves wanting in sense, but try to understand what the Lord's will is.
29323	49	5	18	 Do not over-indulge in wine--a thing in which excess is so easy--
29324	49	5	19	 but  drink deeply of God's Spirit. Speak to one another with psalms and hymns and spiritual songs. Sing and offer praise in your hearts to the Lord.
29325	49	5	20	 Always and for everything let your thanks to God the Father be presented in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ;
29326	49	5	21	 and submit to one another out of reverence for Christ.
29327	49	5	22	 Married women, submit to your own husbands as if to the Lord;
29328	49	5	23	 because a husband is the Head of his wife as Christ also is the Head of the Church, being indeed the Saviour of this His Body.
29329	49	5	24	 And just as the Church submits to Christ, so also married women should be entirely submissive to their husbands.
29330	49	5	25	 Married men, love your wives, as Christ also loved the Church and gave Himself up to death for her;
29331	49	5	26	 in order to make her holy, cleansing her with  the baptismal water by the word,
29332	49	5	27	 that He might present the Church to Himself a glorious bride, without spot or wrinkle or any other defect, but to be holy and unblemished.
29333	49	5	28	 So too married men ought to love their wives as much as they love themselves. He who loves his wife loves himself.
29334	49	5	29	 For never yet has a man hated his own body. On the contrary he feeds and cherishes it, just as Christ feeds and cherishes the Church;
29335	49	5	30	 because we are, as it were, parts of His Body.
29336	49	5	31	 <"For this reason a man is to leave his father and his mother and be united to his wife, and the two shall be as one.">
29337	49	5	32	 That is a great truth hitherto kept secret: I mean the truth concerning Christ and the Church.
29338	49	5	33	 Yet I insist that among you also, each man is to love his own wife as much as he loves himself, and let a married woman see to it that she treats her husband with respect.
29339	49	6	1	 Children,  be obedient to your parents as a Christian duty, for it is a duty.
29340	49	6	2	 <"Honour your father and your mother"> --this is the first Commandment which has a promise added to it--
29341	49	6	3	 <"so that it may be well with you, and that you may live long on the earth.">
29342	49	6	4	 And you, fathers, do not  irritate your children, but bring them up tenderly with true Christian training and advice.
29343	49	6	5	 Slaves,  be obedient to your earthly masters, with respect and eager anxiety to please and with simplicity of motive as if you were obeying Christ.
29344	49	6	6	 Let it not be in acts of eye-service as if you had but to please men, but as Christ's bondservants who are doing God's will from the heart.
29345	49	6	7	 With right good will, be faithful to your duty as service rendered to the Lord and not to man.
29346	49	6	8	 You well know that whatever right thing any one does, he will receive a requital for it from the Lord, whether he is a slave or a free man.
29347	49	6	9	 And you masters, act towards your slaves on the same principles, and refrain from threats. For you know that in Heaven there is One who is your Master as well as theirs, and that  merely earthly distinctions there are none with Him.
29348	49	6	10	 In conclusion, strengthen yourselves in the Lord and in the power which His supreme might imparts.
