29349	49	6	11	 Put on the complete armour of God, so as to be able to stand firm against all the stratagems of the Devil.
29350	49	6	12	 For ours is not a conflict with mere flesh and blood, but with the despotisms, the empires, the forces that control and govern this dark world--the spiritual hosts of evil arrayed against us in the heavenly warfare.
29351	49	6	13	 Therefore put on the complete armour of God, so that you may be able to stand your ground on  the day of battle, and, having fought to the end, to remain victors on the field.
29352	49	6	14	 Stand therefore, first fastening round you the girdle of truth and putting on the breastplate of uprightness
29353	49	6	15	 as well as the shoes of the Good News of peace--  a firm foundation for your feet.
29354	49	6	16	 And  besides all these take the great shield of faith, on which you will be able to quench all the flaming darts of the Wicked one;
29355	49	6	17	 and  take the helmet of salvation, and the sword of the Spirit which is the word of God.
29356	49	6	18	 Pray with  unceasing prayer and entreaty on every fitting occasion in the Spirit, and be always on the alert to seize opportunities for doing so, with  unwearied persistence and entreaty on behalf of all God's people,
29357	49	6	19	 and ask on my behalf that words may be given to me so that, outspoken and fearless, I may make known the truths (hitherto kept secret) of the Good News--
29358	49	6	20	 to spread which I am an ambassador in chains--so that when telling them I may speak out boldly as I ought.
29359	49	6	21	 But in order that you also may know how I am doing, Tychicus our dearly-loved brother and faithful helper in the Lord's service will tell you everything.
29360	49	6	22	 I have sent him to you for the very purpose--that you may know about us and that he may encourage you.
29361	49	6	23	 Peace be to the brethren, and love combined with faith, from God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
29362	49	6	24	 May grace be with all who love our Lord Jesus Christ with perfect sincerity.
29363	50	1	1	 Paul and Timothy, bondservants of Christ Jesus: To all God's people in Christ Jesus who are at Philippi, with  the ministers of the Church and their assistants.
29364	50	1	2	  May grace and peace be granted to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
29365	50	1	3	 I thank my God at  my every remembrance of you--
29366	50	1	4	 always when offering any prayer on behalf of you all, finding a joy in offering it.
29367	50	1	5	 I thank my God, I say, for your cooperation in spreading the Good News, from the time it first came to you even until now.
29368	50	1	6	 For of this I am confident, that He who has begun a good work within you will go on to perfect it in preparation for the day of Jesus Christ.
29369	50	1	7	 And I am justified in having this confidence about you all, because, both during my imprisonment and when I stand up in  defence of the Good News or to confirm its truth, I have you in my heart, sharers as you all are in the same grace as myself.
29370	50	1	8	 For God is my witness how I yearn over all of you with tender Christian affection.
29371	50	1	9	 And it is my prayer that your love may be more and more accompanied by clear knowledge and keen perception, for  testing things that differ,
29372	50	1	10	 so that you may be men of transparent character, and may be blameless, in preparation for the day of Christ,
29373	50	1	11	 being filled with these fruits of righteousness which come through Jesus Christ--  to the glory and praise of God.
29374	50	1	12	 Now I would have you know, brethren, that what I have gone through has turned out to the furtherance of the Good News rather than otherwise.
29375	50	1	13	 And thus it has become notorious among all the Imperial Guards, and everywhere, that it is  for the sake of Christ that I am a prisoner;
29376	50	1	14	 and the greater part of the brethren, made confident in the Lord  through my imprisonment, now speak of God's Message without fear, more boldly than ever.
29377	50	1	15	 Some indeed actually preach Christ out of envy and contentiousness but there are also others who do it from good will.
29378	50	1	16	 These latter preach Him from love to me, knowing that I am here for the defence of the Good News;
29379	50	1	17	 while  the others proclaim Him from motives of rivalry, and insincerely, supposing that by this they are embittering my imprisonment.
29380	50	1	18	 What does it matter, however? In any case Christ is preached--either perversely or in honest truth; and in that I rejoice, yes,  and will rejoice.
29381	50	1	19	 For I know that it will result in my  salvation through your prayers and a bountiful supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,
29382	50	1	20	 in fulfilment of my  eager expectation and hope that I shall never have reason to feel ashamed, but that by my perfect freedom of speech Christ will be glorified in me, now as always, either by my life or by my death.
29383	50	1	21	 For, with me, to live is Christ and to die is gain.
29384	50	1	22	  But since to live means a longer stay on earth, that implies more labour for me--and not unsuccessful labour; and which I am to choose I cannot tell.
29385	50	1	23	 I am in a dilemma, my earnest desire being to depart and be with Christ, for that is far, far better.
29386	50	1	24	 But for your sakes it is more important that I should still remain in the body.
29387	50	1	25	 I am convinced of this, and I know that I shall remain, and shall go on working side by side with you all, to promote your progress and joy in the faith;
29388	50	1	26	 so that, as Christians, you may have additional reason for glorying about me as the result of my being with you again.
29389	50	1	27	 Only let the lives you live be worthy of the Good News of the Christ, in order that, whether I come and see you or, being absent, only hear of you, I may know that you are standing fast in one spirit and with one mind, fighting shoulder to shoulder  for the faith of the Good News.
29390	50	1	28	 Never for a moment quail before your antagonists. Your fearlessness will be to them a sure token of impending destruction, but to you it will be a sure token of your salvation--a token coming from God.
29391	50	1	29	 For you have had the privilege granted you on behalf of Christ--not only to believe in Him, but also to suffer on His behalf;
29392	50	1	30	 maintaining, as you do, the same kind of conflict that  you once saw in me and which you still hear  that I am engaged in.
29393	50	2	1	  If then I can appeal to you as the followers of Christ, if there is any persuasive power in love and any common sharing of the Spirit, or if you have any tender-heartedness and compassion, make my joy complete by being of one mind,
29394	50	2	2	 united by mutual love, with harmony of feeling giving your minds to one and the same object.
29395	50	2	3	 Do nothing in a spirit of factiousness or of vainglory, but, with true humility, let every one regard the rest as being of more account than himself;
29396	50	2	4	 each fixing his attention, not simply on his own  interests, but on those of others also.
29397	50	2	5	 Let the same disposition be in you which was in Christ Jesus.
29398	50	2	6	  Although from the beginning He  had the nature of God He did not reckon His equality with God a treasure to be tightly grasped.
29399	50	2	7	 Nay,  He stripped Himself of His glory, and took on Him the nature of  a bondservant by becoming a man like other men.
29400	50	2	8	 And  being recognized as truly human, He humbled Himself and even stooped to die; yes, to die on a cross.
29401	50	2	9	 It is in consequence of this that God has also so highly exalted Him, and has conferred on Him the Name which is supreme above every other,
29402	50	2	10	 in order that in the Name of JESUS every knee should bow, of beings in Heaven, of those on the earth, and of those in the underworld,
29403	50	2	11	 and that every tongue should confess that JESUS CHRIST is LORD, to the glory of God the Father.
29404	50	2	12	 Therefore, my dearly-loved friends, as I have always found you obedient, labour earnestly with fear and trembling--not merely as though I were present with you, but much more now since I am absent from you--labour earnestly, I say, to make sure of your own salvation.
29405	50	2	13	 For it is God Himself whose power creates within you the desire to do His gracious will and also brings about the accomplishment of the desire.
29406	50	2	14	 Be ever on your guard against a grudging and contentious spirit,
29407	50	2	15	 so that you may always prove yourselves to be blameless and spotless--irreproachable children of God in the midst of a crooked and perverse generation, among whom you are seen as heavenly lights  in the world,
29408	50	2	16	  holding out to them a Message of Life. It will then be my glory on the day of Christ that I did not run my race in vain nor toil in vain.
29409	50	2	17	 Nay, even if my life is to be poured as a libation upon the sacrificial offering of your faith, I rejoice, and I congratulate you all.
29410	50	2	18	 And I bid you also share my gladness, and congratulate me.
29411	50	2	19	 But, if the Lord permits it, I hope before long to send Timothy to you, that I, in turn, may be cheered by getting news of you.
29412	50	2	20	 For I have no one likeminded with him, who will cherish a genuine care for you.
29413	50	2	21	 Everybody concerns himself about his own interests, not about those of Jesus Christ.
29414	50	2	22	 But you know Timothy's approved worth--how, like a child working with his father, he has served with me in furtherance of the Good News.
29415	50	2	23	 So it is he that I hope to send as soon as ever I see how things go with me;
29416	50	2	24	 but trusting, as I do, in the Lord, I believe that I shall myself also come to you before long.
29417	50	2	25	 Yet I  deem it important to send Epaphroditus to you now--he is my brother and comrade both in labour and in arms, and is your messenger who has ministered to my needs.
29418	50	2	26	 I send him because he is longing  to see you all and is distressed at your having heard of his illness.
29419	50	2	27	 For it is true that he has been ill, and was apparently at the point of death; but God had pity on him, and not only on him, but also on me, to save me from having sorrow upon sorrow.
29420	50	2	28	 I am therefore all the more eager to send him, in the hope that when you see him  again you may be glad and I may have the less sorrow.
29421	50	2	29	 Receive him therefore with heartfelt Christian joy, and hold in honour men like him;
29422	50	2	30	 because it was for the sake of Christ's work that he came so near death, hazarding, as he did, his very life in endeavouring to make good any deficiency that there might be in your gifts to me.
29423	50	3	1	 In conclusion, my brethren, be joyful in the Lord. For me to give you the same warnings as before is not irksome to me, while so far as you are concerned it is a safe precaution.
29424	50	3	2	 Beware of `the dogs,' the  bad workmen, the self-mutilators.
29425	50	3	3	 For we are the true circumcision--we who  render to God a spiritual worship and make our boast in Christ Jesus and have no confidence in  outward ceremonies:
29426	50	3	4	 although I myself might have some excuse for confidence in outward ceremonies. If any one else claims a right to trust in them, far more may I:
29427	50	3	5	 circumcised, as I was, on the eighth day, a member of the race of Israel and of the tribe of Benjamin, a Hebrew sprung from Hebrews; as to the Law a Pharisee;
29428	50	3	6	 as to zeal, a persecutor of the Church; as to the righteousness which comes through Law, blameless.
29429	50	3	7	 Yet all that was gain to me--for Christ's sake I have reckoned it loss.
29430	50	3	8	 Nay, I even reckon all things as  pure loss because of the priceless privilege of knowing Christ Jesus my Lord. And for His sake I have suffered the loss of everything, and reckon it all as mere refuse, in order that I may win Christ and be found in union with Him,
29431	50	3	9	 not having a righteousness of my own, derived from the Law, but that which arises from faith in Christ--the righteousness which comes from God through faith.
29432	50	3	10	 I long to know Christ and the power which is in His resurrection, and to share in His sufferings and die even as He died;
29433	50	3	11	 in the hope that I may attain to  the resurrection from among the dead.
29434	50	3	12	 I do not say that I have already won the race or have already  reached perfection. But I am pressing on, striving to lay hold of the prize for which also Christ has laid hold of me.
29435	50	3	13	 Brethren, I do not imagine that I have yet laid hold of it. But this one thing I do--forgetting everything which is past and stretching forward to what lies in front of me,
29436	50	3	14	 with my eyes fixed on the goal I push on to secure the prize of God's  heavenward call in Christ Jesus.
29437	50	3	15	 Therefore let all of us who are mature believers cherish these thoughts; and if in any respect you think differently, that also God will make clear to you.
29438	50	3	16	 But whatever be the point that we have already reached, let us persevere in the same course.
29439	50	3	17	 Brethren, vie with one another in imitating me, and carefully observe those who follow the example which we have set you.
29440	50	3	18	 For there are  many whom I have often described to you, and I now even with tears describe them, as being enemies to the Cross of Christ.
29441	50	3	19	 Their end is destruction, their bellies are their God, their glory is in their shame, and their minds are devoted to earthly things.
29442	50	3	20	 We, however, are free citizens of Heaven, and we are waiting with longing expectation for the coming from Heaven of  a Saviour, the Lord Jesus Christ,
29443	50	3	21	 who, in the exercise of the power which He has even to subject all things to Himself, will transform this body of our humiliation until it resembles His own glorious body.
29444	50	4	1	 Therefore, my brethren, dearly loved and longed for, my joy and crown, so stand firm in the Lord, my dearly-loved ones.
29445	50	4	2	 I entreat Euodia, and I entreat Syntyche, to be of one mind,  as sisters in Christ.
29446	50	4	3	 Yes, and I beg you also, my faithful yoke-fellow, to help these women who have shared my toil in connection with the Good News, together with Clement and the rest of my fellow labourers, whose names are recorded in the Book of Life.
29447	50	4	4	 Always be glad in the Lord: I will repeat it, be glad.
29448	50	4	5	 Let your  forbearing spirit be known to every one--the Lord is near.
29449	50	4	6	 Do not be over-anxious about anything, but by prayer and earnest pleading, together with thanksgiving, let your request be unreservedly made known in the presence of God.
29450	50	4	7	 And then the peace of God, which transcends all our powers of thought, will be a garrison to guard your hearts and minds in union with Christ Jesus.
29451	50	4	8	 Finally, brethren, whatever is  true, whatever wins respect, whatever is just, whatever is pure, whatever is lovable, whatever is of good repute--if there is any virtue or anything deemed worthy of praise--cherish the thought of these things.
29452	50	4	9	 The doctrines and  the line of conduct which I taught you--both what you heard and what you saw in me--  hold fast to them; and God who gives peace will be with you.
29453	50	4	10	 But I rejoice with a deep and holy joy that now at length you have revived your thoughtfulness for my welfare. Indeed you have always been thoughtful for me, although opportunity failed you.
29454	50	4	11	 I do not refer to this through fear of privation, for (for my part) I have learned, whatever be my outward experiences, to be content.
29455	50	4	12	 I know both how to live in humble circumstances and how to live amid abundance. I am  fully initiated into all the mysteries both of fulness and of hunger, of abundance and of want.
29456	50	4	13	 I have strength for anything through Him who gives me power.
29457	50	4	14	 Yet I thank you for taking your share in my troubles.
29458	50	4	15	 And you men and women of Philippi also know that at the first preaching of the Good News, when I had left Macedonia, no other Church except yourselves held communication with me about giving and receiving;
29459	50	4	16	 because even in Thessalonica you sent several times to minister to my needs.
29460	50	4	17	 Not that I crave for gifts from you, but I do want to see abundant fruit bring you honour.
29461	50	4	18	 I have enough of everything--and more than enough. My wants are fully satisfied now that I have received from the hands of Epaphroditus the generous gifts which you sent me--they are a fragrant odor, an acceptable sacrifice, truly pleasing to God.
29462	50	4	19	 But my God--so great is His  wealth of glory in Christ Jesus--will fully supply every need of yours.
29463	50	4	20	 And to our God and Father be the glory throughout the Ages of the Ages! Amen.
29464	50	4	21	 My Christian greetings to every one of God's people. The brethren who are with me send their greetings.
29465	50	4	22	 All God's people here greet you--especially the members of Caesar's household.
29466	50	4	23	 May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirits.
29467	51	1	1	 Paul, an Apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God--and Timothy our brother:
29468	51	1	2	 To the people of God and the believing brethren at  Colossae who are in Christ. May grace and peace be granted to you from God our Father.
29469	51	1	3	 We give thanks  to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, constantly praying for you as we do,
29470	51	1	4	 because we have heard of your faith in Christ Jesus and of the love which you cherish towards all God's people,
29471	51	1	5	 on account of the hope treasured up for you in Heaven. Of this hope you have already heard in the Message of the truth of the Good News.
29472	51	1	6	 For it has reached you, and remains with you, just as  it has also spread through the whole world, yielding fruit there and increasing, as it has done among you from the day when  first you heard it and came really to know the grace of God,
29473	51	1	7	 as you learned it from Epaphras our dearly-loved fellow servant. He is to you a faithful minister of Christ in our stead,
29474	51	1	8	 and moreover he has informed us of your love, which is inspired by the Spirit.
29475	51	1	9	 For this reason we also, from the day we  first received these tidings,  have never ceased to pray for you and to entreat that you may be filled with a clear knowledge of His will accompanied by thorough wisdom and discernment in spiritual things;
29476	51	1	10	 so that your lives may be worthy of the Lord and perfectly pleasing to Him, while you exhibit the results of right action of every sort and grow into a fuller knowledge of God.
29477	51	1	11	 Since His power is so glorious, may you be strengthened with strength of every kind, and be prepared for cheerfully enduring all things with patience and long-suffering;
29478	51	1	12	 and give thanks to the Father who has made us fit to receive our share of the inheritance of God's people in Light.
29479	51	1	13	 It is God who has delivered us out of the dominion of darkness, and has transferred us into the Kingdom of His dearly-loved Son,
29480	51	1	14	 in whom we have our redemption--the forgiveness of our sins.
29481	51	1	15	 Christ is the  visible representation of the invisible God,  the Firstborn and Lord of all creation.
29482	51	1	16	 For  in Him was created the universe of things in heaven and on earth, things seen and things unseen,  thrones, dominions, princedoms, powers--all were created,  and exist through and for Him.
29483	51	1	17	 And  HE IS before all things and in and through Him the universe is a harmonious whole.
29484	51	1	18	 Moreover He is the Head of His Body, the Church. He is the Beginning, the Firstborn from among the dead, in order that He Himself may in all things occupy the foremost place.
29485	51	1	19	 For it was the Father's gracious will that the whole of the divine perfections should dwell in Him.
29486	51	1	20	 And God purposed through Him to reconcile the universe to Himself, making peace through His blood, which was shed upon the Cross--to reconcile to Himself through Him, I say, things on earth and things in Heaven.
29487	51	1	21	 And you, estranged as you once were and even hostile in your minds, amidst your evil deeds,
29488	51	1	22	  He has now, in His human body, reconciled to God by His death, to bring you, holy and faultless and irreproachable, into His presence;
29489	51	1	23	 if, indeed, you are still firmly holding to faith as your foundation, without ever shifting from your hope that rests on the Good News that you have heard, which has been proclaimed in the whole creation under Heaven, and in which I Paul have been appointed to serve.
29490	51	1	24	 Now I can find joy amid my sufferings for you, and I fill up in my own person whatever is lacking in Christ's afflictions on behalf of His Body, the Church.
29491	51	1	25	 I have been appointed to serve the Church in the position of responsibility entrusted to me by God for your benefit, so that I may fully deliver God's Message--
29492	51	1	26	 the truth which has been kept secret from all ages and generations, but has now been revealed to His people,
29493	51	1	27	 to whom it was His will to make known how vast a wealth of glory for the Gentile world is implied in this truth--the truth that `Christ is in you, the hope of glory.'
29494	51	1	28	 Him we preach, admonishing every one and instructing every one, with all possible wisdom, so that we may bring every one into God's presence, made perfect through Christ.
29495	51	1	29	 To this end, like an earnest wrestler, I exert all my strength in reliance upon the power of Him who is mightily at work within me.
29496	51	2	1	 For I would have you know in how severe a struggle I am engaged on behalf of you and the brethren in Laodicea and of all who have not known me personally,
29497	51	2	2	 in order that their hearts may be cheered, they themselves being welded together in love and enjoying all the advantages of a reasonable certainty, till at last they attain the full knowledge of God's truth, which is Christ Himself.
29498	51	2	3	 In Him all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge are stored up, hidden from view.
29499	51	2	4	 I say this to prevent your being misled by any one's plausible sophistry.
29500	51	2	5	 For although, as you say, I am absent from you in body, yet in spirit I am present with you and am delighted to witness your good  discipline and the  solid front presented by your faith in Christ.
29501	51	2	6	 As therefore you have received the Christ, even Jesus our Lord,  live and act in vital union with Him;
29502	51	2	7	 having the roots of your being firmly planted in Him, and continually building yourselves up in Him, and always being increasingly confirmed in the faith as you were taught it, and abounding  in it with thanksgiving.
29503	51	2	8	 Take care lest there be some one who leads you away as prisoners by means of his philosophy and idle fancies, following human traditions and the world's crude notions instead of following Christ.
29504	51	2	9	 For it is in Christ that the fulness of God's nature dwells embodied, and in Him you are made complete,
29505	51	2	10	 and He is the  Lord of all  princes and rulers.
29506	51	2	11	 In Him also you were circumcised with a circumcision not performed by hand, when you threw off your sinful nature in true Christian circumcision;
29507	51	2	12	 having been buried with Him in your baptism, in which you were also raised with Him through faith produced within you by God who raised Him from among the dead.
29508	51	2	13	 And to you--dead as you once were in your transgressions and in the uncircumcision of your natural state--He has nevertheless given Life with Himself, having forgiven us all our transgressions.
29509	51	2	14	 The bond,  with its requirements, which was in force against us and was hostile to us, He cancelled, and cleared it out of the way, nailing it to His Cross.
29510	51	2	15	  And the hostile princes and rulers He shook off from Himself, and boldly displayed them as His conquests, when by the Cross He triumphed over them.
29511	51	2	16	  Therefore suffer no one to sit in judgement on you as to eating or drinking or with regard to a festival, a new moon or a sabbath.
29512	51	2	17	 These were a shadow of things that were soon to come, but the substance belongs to Christ.
29513	51	2	18	 Let no one defraud you of your prize,  priding himself on his humility and on his worship of the angels, and taking his stand on the visions he has seen, and idly puffed up with his unspiritual thoughts.
29514	51	2	19	 Such a one does not keep his hold upon Christ, the Head, from whom the Body, in all its parts nourished and strengthened by its points of contact and its connections, grows with a divine growth.
29515	51	2	20	 If you have died with Christ and have escaped from the world's rudimentary notions, why, as though your life still belonged to the world, do you submit to such precepts as
29516	51	2	21	 "Do not handle this;" "Do not taste that;" "Do not touch that other thing" --
29517	51	2	22	 referring to things which are all intended to be used up and perish--in obedience to mere human injunctions and teachings?
29518	51	2	23	 These rules have indeed an appearance of wisdom where self-imposed worship exists, and an affectation of humility and an ascetic severity. But not one of them is of any value in combating the indulgence of our lower natures.
29519	51	3	1	  If however you  have risen with Christ,  seek the things that are above, where Christ is, enthroned at God's right hand.
29520	51	3	2	 Give your minds to the things that are above, not to the things that are on the earth.
29521	51	3	3	 For you have died, and your life is hidden with Christ in God.
29522	51	3	4	 When Christ appears--He is  our true Life--then you also will appear with Him in glory.
29523	51	3	5	 Therefore put to death your earthward inclinations--fornication, impurity, sensual passion, unholy desire, and all greed, for that is a form of idolatry.
29524	51	3	6	 It is on account of these very sins that God's anger is coming,
29525	51	3	7	 and you also were once addicted to them, while you were living under their power.
29526	51	3	8	 But now you must rid yourselves of every kind of sin--angry and passionate outbreaks, ill-will, evil speaking, foul-mouthed abuse--so that these may never soil your lips.
29527	51	3	9	 Do not speak falsehoods to one another, for you have stripped off the old self with its doings,
29528	51	3	10	 and have clothed yourselves with the new self which is being remoulded into full knowledge so as to become like Him who created it.
29529	51	3	11	 In that new creation  there is neither Greek nor Jew, circumcision nor uncircumcision, barbarian, Scythian, slave nor free man, but Christ is everything and is  in all of us.
29530	51	3	12	 Clothe yourselves therefore, as God's own people holy and dearly loved, with tender-heartedness, kindness, lowliness of mind, meekness, long-suffering;
29531	51	3	13	 bearing with one another and readily forgiving each other, if any one has a grievance against another. Just as  the Lord has forgiven you, you also must forgive.
29532	51	3	14	 And over all these put on love, which is the perfect bond of union;
29533	51	3	15	 and let the peace which Christ gives settle all questionings in your hearts, to which peace indeed you were called as belonging to His one Body; and be thankful.
29534	51	3	16	 Let the teaching  concerning Christ remain as a rich treasure in your hearts.  In all wisdom teach and admonish one another with psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, and sing with grace in your hearts to God.
29535	51	3	17	 And whatever you do, in word or in deed, do everything  in the name of the Lord Jesus, and let it be through Him that you give thanks to God the Father.
29536	51	3	18	 Married women, be submissive to your husbands, as is fitting in the Lord.
29537	51	3	19	 Married men, be affectionate to your wives, and do not treat them harshly.
29538	51	3	20	 Children be obedient to your parents in everything; for that is right for Christians.
29539	51	3	21	 Fathers, do not fret and harass your children, or you may make them sullen and morose.
29540	51	3	22	 Slaves, be obedient in everything to your earthly masters; not  in acts of eye service, as aiming only to please men, but with simplicity of purpose, because you fear the Lord.
29541	51	3	23	 Whatever you are doing, let your hearts be in your work, as a thing done for the Lord and not for men.
29542	51	3	24	 For you know that it is from the Lord you will receive the inheritance as your reward. Christ is the Master whose bondservants you are.
29543	51	3	25	 The man who perpetrates a wrong will find the wrong repaid to him; and with God there are  no merely earthly distinctions.
29544	51	4	1	 Masters, deal justly and equitably with your slaves, knowing that you too have a Master in Heaven.
29545	51	4	2	 Be earnest and unwearied in prayer, being on the alert in it and in your giving of thanks.
29546	51	4	3	 And pray at the same time for us also, that God may open for us a door for preaching, for us to tell the truth concerning Christ for the sake of which I am even a prisoner.
29547	51	4	4	 Then I shall proclaim it fully, as it is my duty to do.
29548	51	4	5	 Behave wisely in relation to the outside world, buying up your opportunities.
29549	51	4	6	 Let your language be always seasoned with the salt of grace, so that you may know how to give every man  a fitting answer.
29550	51	4	7	 Tychicus, our much-loved brother, a trusty assistant and fellow servant with us in the Lord's work, will give you every information about me.
29551	51	4	8	 And for this very purpose I send him to you that you may know how we are faring; and that he may cheer your hearts.
29552	51	4	9	 And with him I send our dear and trusty brother Onesimus, who is one of yourselves. They will inform you of everything here.
29553	51	4	10	 Aristarchus my fellow prisoner sends greeting to you, and so does Barnabas's cousin Mark. You have received instructions as to him; if he comes to you, give him a welcome.
29554	51	4	11	 Jesus, called Justus, also sends greeting. These three are Hebrew converts. They alone among such have worked loyally with me for the Kingdom of God--they are men who have been a comfort to me.
29555	51	4	12	 Epaphras, who is one of yourselves, a bondservant of Jesus Christ, sends greetings to you, always wrestling on your behalf in his prayers, that you may stand firm--Christians of ripe character and of clear conviction as to everything which is God's will.
29556	51	4	13	 For I can bear witness to the deep interest he takes in you and in the brethren at Laodicea and in those at Hierapolis.
29557	51	4	14	 Luke, the dearly-loved physician, salutes you, and so does Demas.
29558	51	4	15	 Christian greetings to the brethren at Laodicea, especially to Nymphas, and to  the Church that meets at their house.
29559	51	4	16	 And when this Letter has been read  among you, let it be read also in the Church of the Laodiceans, and you in turn must read the one I am sending to Laodicea.
29560	51	4	17	 And tell Archippus to discharge carefully the duties devolving upon him as a servant of the Lord.
29561	51	4	18	 I Paul add with my own hand this final greeting. Be mindful of me in my imprisonment. Grace be with you.
29562	52	1	1	 Paul,  Silas, and Timothy: To the Church  of the Thessalonians which is in God the Father and the Lord Jesus Christ. May grace and peace be granted to you.
29563	52	1	2	 We continually give thanks to God because of you all, while we make mention of you in our prayers.
29564	52	1	3	 For we never fail to remember your works of faith and labours of love and your persistent and unwavering hope in our Lord Jesus Christ in the presence of our God and Father;
29565	52	1	4	 knowing as we do, brethren, that you are beloved by God and that He has chosen you.
29566	52	1	5	 The Good News that we brought you did not come to you in words only, but also with power and with the Holy Spirit and with much certainty, for you know the sort of men we became among you, as examples for your sakes.
29567	52	1	6	 And you followed the pattern set you by us and by the Master, after you had received the Message amid severe persecution, and yet with the joy which the Holy Spirit gives,
29568	52	1	7	 so that you became a pattern to all the believers throughout Macedonia and  Greece.
29569	52	1	8	 For it was not only from you that the Master's Message  sounded forth throughout Macedonia and  Greece; but everywhere your faith in God has become known, so that it is unnecessary for us to say anything about it.
29570	52	1	9	 For when  others speak of us they report the reception we had from you, and how you turned from your idols to God, to be bondservants of the true and ever-living God,
29571	52	1	10	 and to await the return from Heaven of His Son, whom He raised from among the dead--even Jesus, our Deliverer from God's coming anger.
29572	52	2	1	 For you yourselves, brethren, know that our visit to you  did not fail of its purpose.
29573	52	2	2	 But, as you will remember, after we had already met with suffering and outrage at Philippi, we summoned up boldness, by the help of our God, to tell you God's Good News amid much opposition.
29574	52	2	3	 For our  preaching was not grounded on a delusion, nor prompted by mingled motives, nor was there fraud in it.
29575	52	2	4	 But as God tested and approved us before entrusting us with His Good News, so in what we say we are seeking not to please men but to please God, who tests and approves our motives.
29576	52	2	5	 For, as you are well aware, we have never used the language of flattery nor have we found pretexts for enriching ourselves--God is our witness;
29577	52	2	6	 nor did we seek glory either from you or from any other mere men, although we might have stood on our dignity as Christ's Apostles.
29578	52	2	7	 On the contrary, in our relations to you  we showed ourselves as gentle as a mother is when she tenderly nurses her own children.
29579	52	2	8	 Seeing that we were thus drawn affectionately towards you, it would have been a joy to us to have imparted to you not only God's Good News, but to have given our very  lives also, because you had become very dear to us.
29580	52	2	9	  For  you remember, brethren, our labour and toil: how, working night and day so as not to become a burden to any one of you, we came and proclaimed among you God's Good News.
29581	52	2	10	 You yourselves are witnesses--and God is witness--how holy and upright and blameless our dealings with you believers were.
29582	52	2	11	 For you know that we acted towards every one of you as a father does towards his own children, encouraging and cheering you,
29583	52	2	12	 and imploring you to live lives worthy of fellowship with God who is inviting you to share His own Kingship and glory.
29584	52	2	13	 And for this further reason we render unceasing thanks to God, that when you received God's Message from our lips, it was as no mere message from men that you embraced it, but as--what it really is--God's Message, which also does its work  in the hearts of you who believe.
29585	52	2	14	 For you, brethren, followed the example of the Churches of God in Christ Jesus which are in Judaea; seeing that you endured the same ill-treatment at the hands of your countrymen, as they did at the hands of the Jews.
29586	52	2	15	 Those Jewish persecutors killed both the Lord Jesus and the Prophets, and drove us out of their midst. They are displeasing to God, and are the enemies of all mankind;
29587	52	2	16	 for they still try to prevent our preaching to the Gentiles so that they may find salvation. They thus continually fill up the measure of their own sins, and God's anger in its severest form has overtaken them.
29588	52	2	17	 But we, brethren, having been for a short time separated from you in bodily presence, though not in heart, endeavoured all the more earnestly, with intense longing, to see you face to face.
29589	52	2	18	 On this account we wanted to come to you--at least I Paul wanted again and again to do so--but Satan hindered us.
29590	52	2	19	 For what is our hope or joy, or the crown of which we boast? Is it not you yourselves in the presence of our Lord Jesus at His Coming?
29591	52	2	20	 Yes, you are our glory and our joy.
29592	52	3	1	 So when we could endure it no longer, we decided to remain behind in Athens alone;
29593	52	3	2	 and sent Timothy our brother and  God's minister in the service of Christ's Good News, that he might help you spiritually and encourage you in your faith;
29594	52	3	3	 that none of you might be unnerved by your present trials: for you yourselves know that they are our appointed lot.
29595	52	3	4	 For even when we were with you, we forewarned you, saying, "We are soon to suffer affliction;" and this actually happened, as you well know.
29596	52	3	5	 For this reason I also, when I could no longer endure the uncertainty, sent to know the condition of your faith, lest perchance the Tempter might have tempted you and our labour have been lost.
29597	52	3	6	 But now that Timothy has recently come back to us from you, and has brought us the happy tidings of your faith and love, and has told us how you still cherish a constant and affectionate recollection of us, and are longing to see us as we also long to see you--
29598	52	3	7	 for this reason in our distress and trouble we have been comforted about you, brethren, by your faith.
29599	52	3	8	 For now life is for us life indeed, since you are standing fast in the Lord.
29600	52	3	9	 For what thanksgiving on your behalf can we possibly offer to God in return for all the joy which fills our souls before our God for you,
29601	52	3	10	 while night and day, with intense earnestness, we pray that we may see your faces, and may bring to perfection whatever may be still lacking in your faith?
29602	52	3	11	 But may our God and Father Himself--and our Lord Jesus--guide us on our way to you;
29603	52	3	12	 and as for you, may the Lord teach you to love one another and all men, with a growing and a glowing love, resembling our love for you.
29604	52	3	13	 Thus He will build up your characters, so that you will be faultlessly holy in the presence of our God and Father at the Coming of our Lord Jesus with all His  holy ones.
29605	52	4	1	  Moreover, brethren, as you learnt from our lips the lives which you ought to live, and do live, so as to please God, we beg and exhort you in the name of the Lord Jesus to live them more and more truly.
29606	52	4	2	 For you know the commands which we laid upon you by the authority of the Lord Jesus.
29607	52	4	3	 For this is God's will--your purity of life, that you abstain from fornication;
29608	52	4	4	 that each man among you shall know how to procure a  wife who shall be his own in purity and honour;
29609	52	4	5	 that you be not overmastered by lustful cravings, like the Gentiles who have no knowledge of God;
29610	52	4	6	 and  that in this matter there be no encroaching on the rights of a brother Christian and no overreaching him. For the Lord is an avenger in all such cases, as we have already taught you and solemnly warned you.
29611	52	4	7	 God has not called us to an unclean life, but to one of purity.
29612	52	4	8	 Therefore  a defiant spirit in such a case provokes not man but God, who puts His Holy Spirit into your hearts.
29613	52	4	9	 But on the subject of love for the brotherhood it is unnecessary for me to write to you, for you yourselves have been taught by God to love one another;
29614	52	4	10	 and indeed you do love all the brethren throughout Macedonia. And we exhort you to do so more and more,
29615	52	4	11	 and to vie with one another in eagerness for peace, every one minding his own business and working with his hands, as we ordered you to do:
29616	52	4	12	 so as to live worthy lives in relation to outsiders, and  not be a burden to any one.
29617	52	4	13	 Now, concerning  those who from time to time pass away, we would not have you to be ignorant, brethren, lest you should mourn as others do who have no hope.
29618	52	4	14	 For if we believe that Jesus has died and risen again, we also believe that, through Jesus, God will bring with Him those who shall have passed away.
29619	52	4	15	 For this we declare to you on the Lord's own authority--that  we who are alive and continue on earth until the Coming of the Lord, shall certainly not forestall those who  shall have previously  passed away.
29620	52	4	16	 For the Lord Himself will come down from Heaven with a loud word of command, and with an archangel's voice and the trumpet of God, and the dead in Christ will rise first.
29621	52	4	17	 Afterwards we who are alive and are still on earth will be  caught up in their company amid clouds to meet the Lord in the air.
29622	52	4	18	 And so we shall be with the Lord for ever. Therefore encourage one another with these words.
29623	52	5	1	 But as to times and dates it is unnecessary that anything be written to you.
29624	52	5	2	 For you yourselves know perfectly well that the day of the Lord comes like a thief in the night.
29625	52	5	3	 While they are saying "Peace and safety!" then in a moment destruction falls upon them, like birth-pains on a woman who is with child; and escape there is none.
29626	52	5	4	 But you, brethren, are not in darkness, that daylight should surprise you like a thief;
29627	52	5	5	 for all of you are sons of Light and sons of the day. We belong neither to the night nor to darkness.
29628	52	5	6	 So then let us not sleep, like the rest of the world, but let us keep awake and be sober.
29629	52	5	7	 For those who sleep, sleep at night, and those who drink freely, drink at night.
29630	52	5	8	 But let us, belonging--as we do--to the day, be sober, putting on the breastplate of faith and love, and for a helmet the hope of salvation.
29631	52	5	9	 For God has not pre-destined us to meet His anger, but to obtain salvation through our Lord Jesus Christ;
29632	52	5	10	 who died on our behalf, so that whether we are  awake or are sleeping we may share His Life.
29633	52	5	11	 Therefore encourage one another, and let each one help to strengthen his friend, as in fact you do.
29634	52	5	12	 Now we beg you, brethren, to  show respect for those who labour among you and are your leaders in Christian work, and are your advisers;
29635	52	5	13	 and to esteem them very highly in love for their work's sake. Be at peace among yourselves.
29636	52	5	14	 And we exhort you, brethren, admonish the unruly, comfort the timid, sustain the weak, and be patient towards all.
29637	52	5	15	 See to it that no one ever repays another with evil for evil; but always seek opportunities of doing good both to one another and to all the world.
29638	52	5	16	 Be always joyful.
29639	52	5	17	 Be unceasing in prayer.
29640	52	5	18	 In every circumstance of life be thankful; for this is God's will in Christ Jesus respecting you.
29641	52	5	19	 Do not quench the Spirit.
29642	52	5	20	 Do not think meanly of utterances of prophecy;
29643	52	5	21	 but test all such, and retain hold of the good.
29644	52	5	22	 Hold yourselves aloof from every form of evil.
29645	52	5	23	 And may God Himself who gives peace, make you entirely holy; and may your spirits, souls and  bodies be preserved complete and be found blameless at the Coming of our Lord Jesus Christ.
29646	52	5	24	 Faithful is He who calls you, and He will also perfect His work.
29647	52	5	25	 Brethren, pray for us.
29648	52	5	26	 Greet all the brethren with a holy kiss.
29649	52	5	27	 I solemnly charge you in the Lord's name to have this Letter read to all the brethren.
29650	52	5	28	 May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.
29651	53	1	1	 Paul,  Silas, and Timothy: To the Church of the Thessalonians which is in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
29652	53	1	2	 May grace and peace be granted to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
29653	53	1	3	 Unceasing thanks are due from us to God on your behalf, brethren. They are appropriate because your faith is growing greatly, and the love of every one of you for all the others goes on increasing.
29654	53	1	4	 It so increases that we ourselves make honourable mention of you among the Churches of God because of your patience and faith amid all your persecutions and amid the afflictions which you are enduring.
29655	53	1	5	 For these are a plain token of God's righteous judgement, which has in view your being deemed worthy of admission to God's Kingdom, for the sake of which, indeed, you are sufferers.
29656	53	1	6	 A plain token of God's righteous judgement, I say, since it is a righteous thing for Him to requite with affliction those who are now afflicting you;
29657	53	1	7	 and to requite with rest you who are suffering affliction now--rest with us at the  re-appearing of the Lord Jesus from Heaven, attended by His mighty angels.
29658	53	1	8	 He will come in flames of fire to take vengeance on those who have no knowledge of God, and do not obey the Good News as to Jesus, our Lord.
29659	53	1	9	 They will pay the penalty of eternal destruction, being banished from the presence of the Lord and from  His glorious majesty,
29660	53	1	10	 when He  comes on that day to be glorified in His people and to be wondered at among all who  have believed, including you--because you believed the testimony which we brought for your acceptance.
29661	53	1	11	 It is with this view also that we continually pray to our God for you, asking that He will count you worthy of His call, and by His mighty power fully gratify your every desire for what is truly good and make your work of faith complete;
29662	53	1	12	 in order that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you, and that you may be glorified in Him--so wonderful is the grace of our God and of the Lord Jesus Christ!
29663	53	2	1	 But with respect to the Coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and  our being  gathered to meet Him, we entreat you, brethren,
29664	53	2	2	 not readily to become unsettled in mind or troubled--either by any pretended spiritual revelation or by any message or letter claiming to have been sent by us--through fancying that the day of the Lord is now here.
29665	53	2	3	 Let no one in any way deceive you, for that day cannot come without the coming of the apostasy first, and  the appearing of  the man of sin, the son of perdition, who sets himself against,
29666	53	2	4	 and exalts himself above, every so-called `god' or object of worship, and goes the length of taking his seat in the very temple of God, giving it out that he himself is God.
29667	53	2	5	 Do you not remember that while I was still with you I used to tell you all this?
29668	53	2	6	 And now you know  what restrains him, in order that his true character may be revealed at his appointed time.
29669	53	2	7	 For lawlessness is already at work in secret; but only until the man who is now exercising a restraining influence is removed,
29670	53	2	8	 and then the Lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus will sweep away with the  tempest of His anger, and utterly overwhelm by the awful splendour of His Coming.
29671	53	2	9	 The appearing of the Lawless one will be attended by various miracles and tokens and delusive marvels--for so Satan works--
29672	53	2	10	 and by every kind of wicked deception for those who are on the way to perdition because they did not welcome into their hearts the love of the truth, so that they might be saved.
29673	53	2	11	 And for this reason God sends them a misleading influence that they may believe  the lie;
29674	53	2	12	 in order that all may come under judgement who have refused to believe the truth and have taken pleasure in unrighteousness.
29675	53	2	13	 And from us thanks are always due to God on your behalf--brethren whom the Lord loves--because God  from the beginning has chosen you for salvation  through the Spirit's sanctifying influence and your belief in the truth.
29676	53	2	14	 To this blessing God has called you by our Good News, so that you may have a share in the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.
29677	53	2	15	 So then, brethren, stand your ground, and hold fast to the teachings which you have received from us, whether by word of mouth or by letter.
29678	53	2	16	 And may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself--and God our Father who has loved us and has given us in His grace eternal consolation and a bright hope--
29679	53	2	17	 comfort your hearts and make you stedfast in every good work and word.
29680	53	3	1	 Finally, brethren, pray for us, asking that the Lord's Message  may be spread rapidly and its glory be displayed, as it was displayed among you;
29681	53	3	2	 and that we may be delivered from wrong-headed and wicked men; for it is not everybody who has faith.
29682	53	3	3	 But the Lord is faithful, and He will make you stedfast and will guard you from the Evil one.
29683	53	3	4	 And we have confidence in the Lord in regard to you that you are doing, and will do, what we command.
29684	53	3	5	 And may the Lord guide your hearts into the love of God and into the patience of Christ.
29685	53	3	6	 But,  by the authority of  the Lord, we command you, brethren, to stand aloof from every brother whose life is disorderly and not in accordance with the teaching which all received from us.
29686	53	3	7	 For you yourselves know that it is your duty to follow our example. There was no disorder in our lives among you,
29687	53	3	8	 nor did we eat any one's bread  without paying for it, but we laboured and toiled, working hard night and day in order not to be a burden to any of you.
29688	53	3	9	 This was not because we had not  a claim upon you, but it arose from a desire to set you an example--for you to imitate us.
29689	53	3	10	 For even when we were with you, we laid down this rule for you: "If a man does not choose to work, neither shall he eat."
29690	53	3	11	 For we hear that there are some of you who live disorderly lives and are mere idle busybodies.
29691	53	3	12	 To persons of that sort our injunction--and our command by the authority of the Lord Jesus Christ--is that they are to work quietly and eat their own honestly-earned bread.
29692	53	3	13	 But you, brethren, must not grow weary  in the path of duty;
29693	53	3	14	 and if any one refuses to obey these our written instructions, mark that man and hold no communication with him--so that he may be made to feel ashamed.
29694	53	3	15	 And yet do not regard him as an enemy, but caution him as a brother.
29695	53	3	16	 And may the Lord of peace Himself continually grant you peace in every sense. The Lord be with you all.
29696	53	3	17	 I Paul add the greeting with my own hand, which is the credential in every letter of mine.
29697	53	3	18	 This is my handwriting. May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
29698	54	1	1	 Paul, an Apostle of Christ Jesus by the will of God our Saviour and Christ Jesus our hope:
29699	54	1	2	 To Timothy, my own true son in the faith. May grace, mercy and peace be granted to you from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
29700	54	1	3	 When I was on my journey to Macedonia I begged you to remain on in Ephesus that you might remonstrate with certain persons because of their  erroneous teaching
29701	54	1	4	 and the attention they bestow on mere fables and endless  pedigrees, such as lead to controversy rather than to a true stewardship for God, which only exists where there is faith. And I make the same request now.
29702	54	1	5	 But the end sought to be secured by exhortation is the love which springs from a pure heart, a clear conscience and a sincere faith.
29703	54	1	6	 From these some have  drifted away, and have wandered into empty words.
29704	54	1	7	 They are ambitious to be teachers of the Law, although they do not understand either their own words or what the things are about which they make such confident assertions.
29705	54	1	8	 Now we know that the Law is good, if a man uses it in the way it should be used,
29706	54	1	9	 and remembers that a law is not enacted to control a righteous man, but for the lawless and rebellious, the irreligious and sinful, the godless and profane--for those who strike their fathers or their mothers, for murderers,
29707	54	1	10	 fornicators, sodomites, slave-dealers, liars and false witnesses; and for whatever else is opposed to wholesome teaching
29708	54	1	11	 and is not in accordance with the Good News of the blessed God with which I have been entrusted.
29709	54	1	12	 I am thankful to Him who made me strong--even Christ Jesus our Lord--because He has judged me to be faithful and has put me into His service,
29710	54	1	13	 though I was previously a blasphemer and a persecutor and had been insolent in outrage. Yet mercy was shown me, because  I had acted ignorantly, not having as yet believed;
29711	54	1	14	 and the grace of our Lord came to me in overflowing fulness, conferring faith on me and the love which is in Christ Jesus.
29712	54	1	15	 Faithful is the saying, and deserving of universal acceptance, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; among whom I stand  foremost.
29713	54	1	16	 But mercy was shown me in order that in me as the foremost of sinners Christ Jesus might display the fulness of His long-suffering patience as an example to encourage those who would  afterwards be resting their faith on Him with a view to the Life of the Ages.
29714	54	1	17	 Now to the immortal and invisible King of the Ages, who alone is God, be honour and glory to the Ages of the Ages! Amen.
29715	54	1	18	 This is the charge which I entrust to you, my son Timothy, in accordance with the inspired instructions concerning you which were given me long ago, that being equipped with them as your armour you may be continually fighting the good fight,
29716	54	1	19	 holding fast to faith and a clear conscience, which some have cast aside and have made shipwreck of their faith.
29717	54	1	20	 Among these are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I have delivered to Satan so that they may be  taught not to blaspheme.
29718	54	2	1	 I exhort then, first of all, that  supplications, prayers, intercessions and thanksgivings be offered on behalf of all men;
29719	54	2	2	 including kings and all who are in high station, in order that we may live peaceful and tranquil lives with all godliness and  gravity.
29720	54	2	3	 This is right, and is pleasing in the sight of God our Saviour,
29721	54	2	4	 who is willing for  all mankind to be saved and come to a full knowledge of the truth.
29722	54	2	5	 For there is but one God and but one Mediator between God and men--Christ Jesus,  Himself man;
29723	54	2	6	 who gave Himself as the redemption price for all--a fact testified to at its own appointed time,
29724	54	2	7	 and of which I have been appointed a herald and an Apostle (I am speaking the truth: it is not a fiction), a teacher of the Gentiles in faith and truth.
29725	54	2	8	 So then I would have  the men  everywhere pray, lifting to God holy hands which are  unstained with anger or strife;
29726	54	2	9	 and I would have the women dress becomingly, with modesty and self-control, not with plaited hair or gold or pearls or costly clothes,
29727	54	2	10	 but--as befits women making a claim to godliness--with the ornament of good works.
29728	54	2	11	  A woman should quietly learn from others with entire submissiveness.
29729	54	2	12	 I do not permit  a woman to teach, nor have authority over  a man, but she must remain silent.
29730	54	2	13	 For Adam was formed first, and then Eve;
29731	54	2	14	 and Adam was not deceived, but his wife was thoroughly deceived, and so  became involved in transgression.
29732	54	2	15	 Yet a woman will be  brought safely through childbirth if  she and her husband continue to live in faith and love and growing holiness, with habitual self-restraint.
29733	54	3	1	 Faithful is the saying, "If any one is eager to have the oversight of a Church, he desires a noble work."
29734	54	3	2	 A  minister then must be a man of irreproachable character,  true to his one wife, temperate, sober-minded, well-behaved,  hospitable to strangers, and with a gift for teaching;
29735	54	3	3	 not a hard drinker nor given to blows; not selfish or quarrelsome or covetous;
29736	54	3	4	 but ruling his own household wisely and well, with children kept under control with true dignity.
29737	54	3	5	 (If a man does not know how to rule his own household, how shall he have the Church of God given into his care?)
29738	54	3	6	 He ought not to be a new convert, for fear he should be blinded with pride and come under the same condemnation as the Devil.
29739	54	3	7	 It is needful also that he bear a good character with people outside the Church, lest he fall into reproach or a snare of the Devil.
29740	54	3	8	 Deacons, in the same way, must be men of serious demeanour, not double-tongued, nor addicted to much wine, nor greedy of base gain,
29741	54	3	9	 but holding the secret truths of the faith with a clear conscience.
29742	54	3	10	 And they must also be well-tried men, and when found to be of unblemished character then let them serve as deacons.
29743	54	3	11	 Deaconesses, in the same way, must be sober-minded women, not slanderers, but in every way temperate and trustworthy.
29744	54	3	12	 A deacon must be  true to his one wife, and rule his children and his own household wisely and well.
29745	54	3	13	 For those who have filled the deacon's office wisely and well, are already gaining for themselves  an honourable standing, and are acquiring great freedom of speech in proclaiming the faith which rests on Christ Jesus.
29746	54	3	14	 All this I write to you, though I am hoping before long to come to see you.
29747	54	3	15	 But, for fear I may be hindered, I now write, so that you may have rules to guide you in dealing with God's household.  For this is what the Church of the  ever-living God is, and it is the pillar and foundation-stone of the truth.
29748	54	3	16	 And, beyond controversy, great is the mystery of our religion--  that Christ appeared in human form, and His claims justified by the Spirit, was seen by angels and proclaimed among Gentile nations, was believed on in the world, and received up again into glory.
29749	54	4	1	 Now  the Spirit expressly declares that in  later times some will fall away from the faith, giving heed to deceiving spirits and the teachings of demons;
29750	54	4	2	 through the hypocrisy of men who teach falsely and have their own consciences seared as with a hot iron;
29751	54	4	3	 forbidding people to marry, and insisting on abstinence from foods which God has created to be partaken of, with thankfulness, by those who believe and have a clear knowledge of the truth.
29752	54	4	4	 For everything that God has created is good, and nothing is to be cast aside, if only it is received with thanksgiving.
29753	54	4	5	 For it is made holy by the word of God and by prayer.
29754	54	4	6	 If you warn the brethren of these dangers you will be a good and faithful servant of Christ Jesus, inwardly feeding on the lessons of the faith and of the sound teaching of which you have been, and are, so close a follower.
29755	54	4	7	 But worldly stories, fit only for credulous old women, have nothing to do with.
29756	54	4	8	 Train yourself in godliness. Exercise for the body is not useless, but godliness is useful in every respect, possessing, as it does, the promise of Life now and of the Life which is soon coming.
29757	54	4	9	 Faithful is this saying and deserving of universal acceptance:
29758	54	4	10	 and here is the motive of our toiling and  wrestling, because  we have our hopes fixed on the  ever-living God, who is the Saviour  of all mankind, and especially of believers.
29759	54	4	11	 Command this and teach this.
29760	54	4	12	 Let no one think slightingly of you because you are a young man; but in speech, conduct, love, faith and purity, be an example for your fellow Christians to imitate.
29761	54	4	13	 Till I come, bestow your attention on  reading, exhortation and teaching.
29762	54	4	14	 Do not be careless about the gifts with which you are endowed, which were conferred on you through a divine revelation when the hands of the elders were placed upon you.
29763	54	4	15	 Habitually practise these duties, and be absorbed in them; so that your growing proficiency in them may be evident to all.
29764	54	4	16	 Be on your guard as to yourself and your teaching. Persevere in these things; for by doing this you will make certain your own salvation and that of your hearers.
29765	54	5	1	 Never administer a sharp reprimand to a man older than yourself; but entreat him as if he were your father, and the younger men as brothers;
29766	54	5	2	 the elder women too as mothers, and the younger women as sisters, with perfect modesty.
29767	54	5	3	 Honour widows who are  really in need.
29768	54	5	4	 But if a widow has children or grandchildren, let these learn  first to show piety towards their own homes and to prove their gratitude to their parents; for this is well pleasing in the sight of God.
29769	54	5	5	 A widow who is  really in need, friendless and desolate,  has her hopes fixed on God, and continues at her supplications and prayers, night and day;
29770	54	5	6	 but a pleasure-loving widow is dead even while still alive.
29771	54	5	7	 Press these facts upon them, so that they may live lives free from reproach.
29772	54	5	8	 But if a man makes no provision for  those dependent on him, and especially for his own family, he has disowned the faith and is behaving worse than an unbeliever.
29773	54	5	9	 No widow is to be put on the roll who is under sixty years of age.
29774	54	5	10	 She must have been  true to her one husband, and well reported of for good deeds, as having brought up children, received strangers hospitably, washed the feet of God's people, given relief to the distressed, and devoted herself to good works of every kind.
29775	54	5	11	 But the younger widows you must not enrol; for as soon as they begin to chafe against the yoke of  Christ, they want to marry,
29776	54	5	12	 and they incur disapproval for having broken their original vow.
29777	54	5	13	 And at the same time they also learn to be idle as they go round from house to house; and they are not only idle, but are gossips also and busybodies, speaking of things that ought not to be spoken of.
29778	54	5	14	 I would therefore have the younger women marry, bear children, rule in domestic matters, and furnish the Adversary with no excuse for slander.
29779	54	5	15	 For already some of them have gone astray, following Satan.
29780	54	5	16	 If a believing woman has widows dependent on her, she should relieve their wants, and save the Church from being burdened--so  that the Church may relieve the widows who are really in need.
29781	54	5	17	 Let the Elders who perform their duties wisely and well be held worthy of double  honour, especially those who labour in  preaching and teaching.
29782	54	5	18	 For the Scripture says, <"You are not to muzzle the ox while it is treading out the grain;"> and the workman deserves his pay.
29783	54	5	19	 Never entertain an accusation against an Elder except on the evidence of two of three witnesses.
29784	54	5	20	 Those  who persist in sin reprove in the presence of all, so that it may also be a warning to the rest.
29785	54	5	21	 I solemnly call upon you, in the presence of God and of Christ Jesus and of the elect angels, to carry out these instructions of mine without prejudice, and to do nothing from  partiality.
29786	54	5	22	 Do not ordain any one hastily; and do not be a partaker in the sins of others; keep *yourself*  pure.
29787	54	5	23	 (No longer be a water-drinker; but take a little wine for the sake of your digestion and your frequent  ailments.)
29788	54	5	24	 The sins of some men are evident to the world, leading the way to  your estimate of their characters, but the sins of others lag behind.
29789	54	5	25	 So also the right actions of some are evident to the world, and those that are not cannot remain for ever out of sight.
29790	54	6	1	 Let all who are under the yoke of slavery hold their own masters to be deserving of honour, so that the name of God and the Christian teaching may not be spoken against.
29791	54	6	2	 And those who have believing masters should not be wanting in respect towards them because they are their brethren, but should serve them all the more willingly because those who profit by the faithful service rendered are believers and are friends.
29792	54	6	3	 So teach and exhort. If any one is a teacher of any other kind of doctrine, and  refuses assent to wholesome instructions--those of our Lord Jesus Christ--and the teaching that harmonizes with true godliness,
29793	54	6	4	 he is puffed up with pride and has no true knowledge, but is crazy over discussions and controversies about words which give rise to envy, quarrelling, revilings, ill-natured suspicions,
29794	54	6	5	 and persistent wranglings on the part of people whose intellects are disordered and they themselves blinded to all knowledge of the truth; who imagine that godliness means gain.
29795	54	6	6	 And godliness *is* gain, when associated with contentment;
29796	54	6	7	 for we brought nothing into the world, nor can we carry anything out of it;
29797	54	6	8	 and if we have food and clothing, with these we will be satisfied.
29798	54	6	9	 But people who are determined to be rich fall into temptation and a snare, and into many unwise and pernicious ways which sink mankind in destruction and ruin.
29799	54	6	10	 For from love of money all sorts of evils arise; and some have so hankered after money as to be led astray from the faith and be pierced through with countless sorrows.
29800	54	6	11	 But you, O man of God, must flee from  these things; and strive for uprightness, godliness,  good faith, love, fortitude, and a forgiving temper.
29801	54	6	12	 Exert all your strength in the honourable  struggle for the faith; lay hold of the Life of the Ages, to which you were called, when you made your noble profession of faith  before many witnesses.
29802	54	6	13	 I charge you--as in the presence of God who gives life to all creatures, and of Christ Jesus who at the bar of Pontius Pilate made a noble profession of faith--
29803	54	6	14	 that you keep God's commandments stainlessly and without reproach till the Appearing of our Lord Jesus Christ.
29804	54	6	15	  For, as its appointed time, this will be brought about by the blessed and only Sovereign, the King of kings and Lord of lords,
29805	54	6	16	 who alone possesses immortality, dwelling in unapproachable light, and whom no man has seen or can see. To Him be eternal honour and power! Amen.
29806	54	6	17	 Impress on those who are rich in the present age that they must not be haughty nor set their hopes on riches--that unstable foundation--but on God who provides us richly with all things for our enjoyment.
29807	54	6	18	 They must be beneficent, rich in noble deeds, open-handed and liberal;
29808	54	6	19	 storing up for themselves that which shall be a solid foundation for  the future, that they may lay hold of the Life which is life indeed.
29809	54	6	20	 O Timothy, guard the truths entrusted to you, shunning irreligious and frivolous talk, and controversy with what is falsely called `knowledge';
29810	54	6	21	 of which some have spoken boastfully  in connexion with the true faith, and have erred. Grace be with  you all.
29811	55	1	1	 Paul, an Apostle of Christ Jesus, by the will of God, for proclaiming the promise of the Life which is in Christ Jesus:
29812	55	1	2	 To Timothy my dearly-loved child. May grace, mercy and peace be granted to you from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.
29813	55	1	3	 I thank God, whom I serve with a pure conscience--as my forefathers did--that night and day I unceasingly remember you in my prayers,
29814	55	1	4	 being always mindful of your tears, and longing to see you that I may be filled with joy.
29815	55	1	5	 For I recall the sincere faith which is in your heart--a faith which dwelt first in your grandmother Lois and then in your mother Eunice, and, I am fully convinced, now dwells in you also.
29816	55	1	6	 For this reason let me remind you to rekindle God's gift which is yours through the laying on of my hands.
29817	55	1	7	 For the Spirit which God has given us is not a spirit of cowardice, but one of power and of love and of  sound judgement.
29818	55	1	8	 Do not be ashamed then to bear witness for our Lord and for me His prisoner; but rather share suffering with me in the service of the Good News,  strengthened by the power of God.
29819	55	1	9	 For He saved us and called us with a holy call, not in accordance with our desserts, but in accordance with His own purpose and the free grace which He bestowed on us in Christ Jesus before the commencement of the Ages,
29820	55	1	10	 but which has now been plainly revealed through  the Appearing of our Saviour, Christ Jesus. He has put an end to death and has brought Life and Immortality to light through the Good News,
29821	55	1	11	  of which I have been appointed a preacher, Apostle and  teacher, to the Gentiles.
29822	55	1	12	 That indeed is the reason why I suffer as I do. But I am not ashamed, for I know in whom my trust reposes, and I am confident that He has it in His power to keep what I have entrusted to Him safe until that day.
29823	55	1	13	  Provide yourself with an  outline of the sound teaching which you have heard from my lips,  and be true to the faith and love which are in Christ Jesus.
29824	55	1	14	 That precious treasure which is in your charge, guard through the Holy Spirit who has His home in our hearts.
29825	55	1	15	 Of this you are aware, that all the Christians in Roman Asia have deserted me: and among them Phygelus and Hermogenes.
29826	55	1	16	 May the Lord show mercy to the  household of Onesiphorus; for many a time he cheered me and he was not ashamed of my chain.
29827	55	1	17	 Nay, when he was here in Rome, he took great pains to inquire where I was living, and at last he found me.
29828	55	1	18	 (The Lord grant that he may obtain mercy at His hands on that day!) And you yourself well know all the services which he rendered me in Ephesus.
29829	55	2	1	 You then, my child, must  be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus.
29830	55	2	2	 All that you have been taught by me in the hearing of many witnesses, you must hand on to trusty men who shall themselves, in turn, be competent to instruct others also.
29831	55	2	3	 As a good soldier of Christ Jesus accept your share of suffering.
29832	55	2	4	 Every one who serves as a soldier keeps himself from becoming entangled in the world's business--so that he may satisfy the officer who enlisted him.
29833	55	2	5	 And if any one takes part in an athletic contest, he gets no prize unless he obeys the rules.
29834	55	2	6	 The harvestman who labours in the field must be the first to get a share of the crop.
29835	55	2	7	 Mark well what I am saying: the Lord will give you discernment in everything.
29836	55	2	8	 Never forget that Jesus Christ has risen from among the dead and is a descendant of David, as is declared in the Good News which I preach.
29837	55	2	9	 For preaching the Good News I suffer, and am even put in chains, as if I were a criminal: yet the word of God is not imprisoned.
29838	55	2	10	 For this reason I endure all things for the sake of God's own people; so that they also may obtain salvation--even the salvation which is in Christ Jesus--and with it eternal glory.
29839	55	2	11	 Faithful is  the saying: "If we died with Him, we shall also live with Him;
29840	55	2	12	 "If we patiently endure pain, we shall also share His Kingship; "If we disown Him, He will also disown us;
29841	55	2	13	 "And even if *our* faith fails, He remains true--He cannot prove false to Himself."
29842	55	2	14	 Bring all this to men's remembrances, solemnly charging them in the presence of  God not to waste time in wrangling about mere words, a course which is altogether unprofitable and tends only to the ruin of the hearers.
29843	55	2	15	 Earnestly seek to commend yourself to God as a servant who, because of his straightforward  dealing with the word of truth, has no reason to feel any shame.
29844	55	2	16	 But from irreligious and frivolous talk hold aloof, for those who indulge in it will proceed from bad to worse in impiety,
29845	55	2	17	 and their teaching will spread like a running sore. Hymenaeus and Philetus are men of that stamp.
29846	55	2	18	 In the matter of the truth they have  gone astray, saying that the Resurrection  is already past, and so they are overthrowing the faith of some.
29847	55	2	19	 Yet God's solid foundation stands unmoved, bearing this inscription, <"The Lord knows those who really belong to Him."> And this also, <"Let every one who names the Name of the Lord renounce all wickedness.">
29848	55	2	20	 Now in a great house there are not only articles of gold and silver, but also others of wood and of earthenware; and some are for specially honourable, and others for common use.
29849	55	2	21	 If therefore a man keeps himself clear of these latter, he himself will be for specially honourable use, consecrated, fit for the Master's service, and fully equipped for every good work.
29850	55	2	22	 Keep a strong curb, however, on your youthful cravings; and strive for integrity, good faith, love, peace, in company with all who pray to the Lord with pure hearts.
29851	55	2	23	 But  avoid foolish discussions with ignorant men, knowing--as you do--that these lead to quarrels;
29852	55	2	24	 and a bondservant of the Lord must not quarrel, but must be inoffensive towards all men, a skilful teacher, and patient under wrongs.
29853	55	2	25	 He must speak in a gentle tone when correcting the errors of opponents, in the hope that God will at last give them repentance, for them to come to a full knowledge of the truth
29854	55	2	26	 and recover sober-mindedness and freedom from the Devil's snare,  though they are now entrapped by him to do his will.
29855	55	3	1	 But of this be assured: in  the last days grievous times will set in.
29856	55	3	2	 For men will be lovers of self, lovers of money, boastful, haughty, profane. They will be disobedient to parents, thankless, irreligious,
29857	55	3	3	 destitute of natural affection, unforgiving, slanderers. They will have no self-control, but will be brutal, opposed  to goodness,
29858	55	3	4	 treacherous, headstrong, self-important. They will love pleasure instead of loving God,
29859	55	3	5	 and will keep up a make-believe of piety and yet live in defiance of its power. Turn away from people of this sort.
29860	55	3	6	 Among them are included the men who make their way into private houses and carry off weak women as their prisoners--women who, weighed down by the burden of their sins, are led by ever-changing caprice,
29861	55	3	7	 and are always learning something new, and yet are never able to arrive at real knowledge of the truth.
29862	55	3	8	 And just as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses, so also these false teachers withstand the truth--being, as they are, men of debased intellects, and of no real worth so far as faith is concerned.
29863	55	3	9	 But they will have no further success; for their folly will be as clearly manifest to all men, as that of the opponents of Moses came to be.
29864	55	3	10	 But you have  intimately known my teaching, life, aims, faith, patience, love, resignation,
29865	55	3	11	 and the persecutions and sufferings which I have endured; the things which happened to me in Antioch, Iconium and Lystra. You know the persecutions I endured, and how the Lord delivered me out of them all.
29866	55	3	12	 And indeed every one who is determined to live a godly life  as a follower of Christ Jesus will be persecuted.
29867	55	3	13	 But bad men and impostors will go on from bad to worse, misleading and being misled.
29868	55	3	14	 But you must cling to the things which you have learnt and have been taught to believe, knowing who your teachers were,
29869	55	3	15	  and that from infancy you have known the sacred writings which are able to  make you wise to obtain salvation through faith in Christ Jesus.
29870	55	3	16	  Every  Scripture  is inspired by God and is useful for teaching, for convincing, for correction of error, and for instruction in right doing;
29871	55	3	17	 so that the man of God may himself be complete and may be perfectly equipped for every good work.
29872	55	4	1	 I solemnly implore you, in the presence of God and of Christ Jesus who is about to judge the living and the dead, and by His Appearing and His Kingship:
29873	55	4	2	 proclaim God's message, be zealous in season and out of season; convince, rebuke, encourage, with the utmost patience as a teacher.
29874	55	4	3	 For a time is coming when they will not tolerate wholesome instruction, but, wanting to have their ears tickled, they will find a multitude of teachers to satisfy their own fancies;
29875	55	4	4	 and will turn away from listening to the truth and will turn aside to fables.
29876	55	4	5	 But as for you, you must exercise habitual self-control, and not live a self-indulgent life, but do the duty of an evangelist and fully discharge the obligations of your office.
29877	55	4	6	 I for my part am like a  drink-offering which is already being poured out; and the time for my departure is now close at hand.
29878	55	4	7	 I have  gone through the glorious contest; I have run the race; I have guarded the faith.
29879	55	4	8	 From this time onward there is reserved for me the crown of righteousness which the Lord, the righteous Judge, will award to me on that day, and not only to me, but also to all who love the thought of His Appearing.
29880	55	4	9	 Make an effort to come to me speedily.
29881	55	4	10	 For Demas has deserted me--loving, as he does,  the present age--and has gone to Thessalonica; Crescens has gone to Galatia, and Titus to Dalmatia.
29882	55	4	11	 Luke is the only friend I now have with me. Call for Mark on your way and bring him with you, for he is a great help to me in my ministry.
29883	55	4	12	 Tychicus I have sent to Ephesus.
29884	55	4	13	  When you come, bring with you the cloak which I left behind at Troas at the house of Carpus, and the books, but especially the parchments.
29885	55	4	14	 Alexander the  metal-worker showed bitter hostility towards me: the Lord will requite him according to his doings.
29886	55	4	15	 You also should beware of him; for he has violently opposed our preaching.
29887	55	4	16	 At my first defence I had no one at my side, but all deserted me. May it not be laid to their charge.
29888	55	4	17	 The Lord, however, stood by me and filled me with inward strength, that through me the Message might be fully proclaimed and that all the Gentiles might hear it; and I was rescued  from the lion's jaws.
29889	55	4	18	 The Lord will deliver me from every cruel attack and will keep me safe in preparation for His heavenly Kingdom. To Him be the glory until the Ages of the Ages! Amen.
29890	55	4	19	 Greet Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
29891	55	4	20	 Erastus stayed in Corinth; Trophimus I left behind me at Miletus, ill.
29892	55	4	21	 Make an effort to come before winter. Eubulus greets you, and so do Pudens, Linus, Claudia, and all the brethren.
29893	55	4	22	 The Lord be with your spirit. Grace be with you all.
29894	56	1	1	 Paul, a bondservant of God and an Apostle of Jesus Christ for building up the faith of God's own people and spreading a full knowledge of the truths of religion,
