29895	56	1	2	 in hope of the Life of the Ages which God, who is never false to His word, promised before the commencement of the Ages.
29896	56	1	3	 And at the appointed time He clearly made known His Message in the preaching with which I was entrusted by the command of God our Saviour:
29897	56	1	4	 To Titus my own true child in  our common faith. May grace and peace be granted to you from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Saviour.
29898	56	1	5	 I have left you behind in Crete in order that you may set right the things which still require attention, and appoint Elders in every town, as I directed you to do;
29899	56	1	6	 wherever there is a man of blameless life,  true to his one wife, having children who are themselves believers and are free from every reproach of profligacy or of stubborn self-will.
29900	56	1	7	 For, as God's steward,  a minister must be of blameless life, not over-fond of having his own way, not a man of a passionate temper nor a hard drinker, not given to blows nor greedy of gain,
29901	56	1	8	 but hospitable to strangers, a lover  of goodness, sober-minded, upright, saintly, self-controlled;
29902	56	1	9	 holding fast to the faithful Message  which he has received, so that he may be well qualified both to encourage others with sound teaching and to reply successfully to opponents.
29903	56	1	10	 For there are many that spurn authority--idle, talkative and deceitful persons, who, for the most part, are adherents of the Circumcision.
29904	56	1	11	 You must stop the mouths of such men, for they overthrow the faith of whole families, teaching what they ought not, just for the sake of making money.
29905	56	1	12	 One of their own number--a Prophet who is a countryman of theirs--has said, "Cretans are always liars, dangerous animals, idle gluttons."
29906	56	1	13	 This testimony is true. Therefore sternly denounce them, that they may be robust in their faith,
29907	56	1	14	 and not give attention to Jewish legends and the  maxims of men who turn their backs on the truth.
29908	56	1	15	 To the pure everything is pure; but to the polluted and unbelieving nothing is pure, but on the contrary their very minds and consciences are polluted.
29909	56	1	16	 They profess to know God; but in their actions they disown Him, and are detestable and disobedient men, and for any good work are utterly useless.
29910	56	2	1	 But as for you, you must speak in a manner that befits wholesome teaching.
29911	56	2	2	 Exhort aged men to be temperate, grave, sober-minded, robust in their faith, their love and their patience.
29912	56	2	3	 In the same way exhort aged women to let their conduct be such as becomes consecrated persons. They must not be slanderers nor enslaved to wine-drinking. They must be teachers of what is right.
29913	56	2	4	 They should school the young women to be  affectionate to their husbands and to their children, to be sober-minded, pure in their lives,
29914	56	2	5	 industrious in their homes, kind, submissive to their husbands, so that the Christian teaching may not be exposed to reproach.
29915	56	2	6	 In the same way exhort the younger men to be discreet,
29916	56	2	7	 and above all make your own life a pattern of right conduct, having in your teaching no taint of insincerity, but a serious tone,
29917	56	2	8	 and healthy language which no one can censure, so that our opponents may feel ashamed at having nothing evil to say against us.
29918	56	2	9	 Exhort slaves to be always obedient to their owners, and to give them satisfaction in everything, not contradicting and not pilfering,
29919	56	2	10	 but manifesting perfect fidelity and kind feeling, in order to bring honour to the teaching of our Saviour, God, in all things.
29920	56	2	11	 For the grace of God has displayed itself with healing power to all mankind,
29921	56	2	12	 training us to renounce ungodliness and all the pleasures of this world, and to live sober, upright, and pious lives at the present time,
29922	56	2	13	 in expectation of the fulfilment of our blessed hope--the  Appearing in glory of our great God and Saviour Jesus Christ;
29923	56	2	14	 who gave Himself for us to purchase our freedom from all iniquity, and purify for Himself a people who should be  specially His own, zealous for doing good works.
29924	56	2	15	 Thus speak, exhort, reprove, with all impressiveness. Let no one make light of your authority.
29925	56	3	1	 Remind people that they must submit to the rulers who are in authority over them; that they must obey the magistrates, be prepared for every right action,
29926	56	3	2	 not speak evil of any one, nor be contentious, but yield unselfishly to others and constantly manifest a forgiving spirit towards all men.
29927	56	3	3	 For there was a time when we also were deficient in understanding, obstinate, deluded, the slaves of various cravings and pleasures, spending our lives in malice and envy, hateful ourselves and hating one another.
29928	56	3	4	 But when the goodness of God our Saviour, and His love to man,  dawned upon us, not in consequence of things which we,
29929	56	3	5	 as righteous men, had done, but as the result of His own mercy He saved us by means of the bath of regeneration and the renewal of our natures by the Holy Spirit,
29930	56	3	6	 which He poured out on us richly through Jesus Christ our Saviour;
29931	56	3	7	 in order that having been declared righteous through His grace we might become heirs to the Life of the Ages in fulfilment of our hopes.
29932	56	3	8	 This is a faithful saying, and on these various points I would have you insist strenuously, in order that those who have their faith fixed on God may be careful to set an example of good actions. For these are not only good in themselves, but are also useful to mankind.
29933	56	3	9	 But hold yourself aloof from foolish controversies and  pedigrees and discussions and wrangling about the Law, for they are useless and vain.
29934	56	3	10	 After a first and second admonition, have nothing further to do with any one  who will not be taught;
29935	56	3	11	 for, as you know, a man of that description has turned aside from the right path and is a sinner self-condemned.
29936	56	3	12	 After I have sent Artemas or Tychicus to you, lose no time in joining me at Nicopolis; for I have decided to pass the winter there.
29937	56	3	13	 Help Zenas the lawyer forward on his journey with special care, and Apollos, so that they may have all they require.
29938	56	3	14	 And let our people too learn to set a good example in following honest occupations for the supply of their necessities, so that they may not live useless lives.
29939	56	3	15	 Every one here sends you greeting. Greet the believers who hold us dear. May grace be with you all.
29940	57	1	1	 Paul, a prisoner for Christ Jesus, and Timothy our brother: To Philemon our dearly-loved fellow labourer--
29941	57	1	2	 and to our sister Apphia and our comrade Archippus--as well as to the  Church in your house.
29942	57	1	3	  May grace be granted to you all, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.
29943	57	1	4	 I give continual thanks to my God while making mention of you, my brother, in my prayers,
29944	57	1	5	 because I hear of your love and of the faith which you have towards the Lord Jesus and which you manifest towards all God's people;
29945	57	1	6	 praying as I do, that their participation in your faith may result in others fully recognizing all the right affection that is in us toward Christ.
29946	57	1	7	 For I have  found great  joy and comfort in your love, because the  hearts of God's people have been, and are, refreshed through you, my brother.
29947	57	1	8	 Therefore,  though I might with Christ's authority speak very freely and order you to do what is fitting,
29948	57	1	9	 it is for love's sake that--instead of that--although I am none other than Paul the aged, and am now also a prisoner for Christ Jesus,
29949	57	1	10	 I entreat you on behalf of my own child whose father I have become while in my chains--I mean Onesimus.
29950	57	1	11	 Formerly he was useless to you, but now--true to his name--he is of great use to you and to me.
29951	57	1	12	 I  am sending him back to you, though in so doing I send part of myself.
29952	57	1	13	 It was my wish to keep him at my side for him to attend to my wants, as your representative, during my imprisonment for the Good News.
29953	57	1	14	 Only I wished to do nothing without your consent, so that his kind action of yours might not be done under pressure, but might be a voluntary one.
29954	57	1	15	 For perhaps it was  for this reason he was parted from you for a time, that you might receive him back wholly and for ever yours;
29955	57	1	16	 no longer as a slave, but as something better than a slave--a brother peculiarly dear to me, and even dearer to you, both as a servant and as a fellow Christian.
29956	57	1	17	 If therefore you regard me as a comrade, receive him as if he were I myself.
29957	57	1	18	 And if he was ever dishonest or is in your debt,  debit me with the amount.
29958	57	1	19	 I Paul write this with my own hand--I will pay you in full. (I say nothing of the fact that you owe me even your own self.)
29959	57	1	20	 Yes, brother, do me this favour for the Lord's sake. Refresh my heart in Christ.
29960	57	1	21	 I write to you in the full confidence that you will meet my wishes, for I know you will do even more than I say.
29961	57	1	22	 And at the same time provide accommodation for me; for I hope that through your prayers I shall be permitted to come to you.
29962	57	1	23	 Greetings to you, my brother, from Epaphras my fellow prisoner for the sake of Christ Jesus;
29963	57	1	24	 and from Mark, Aristarchus, Demas, and Luke, my fellow workers.
29964	57	1	25	 May the grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with the spirit of  every one of you.
29965	58	1	1	 God, who in ancient days spoke to our forefathers in many distinct messages and by various methods  through the Prophets,
29966	58	1	2	 has  at the end of these days spoken to us  through a Son, who is the pre-destined Lord of the universe, and through whom He made the Ages.
29967	58	1	3	 He brightly reflects God's glory and is the exact representation of His  being, and upholds the universe by His all-powerful word. After securing  man's purification from sin He took His seat at the right hand of the Majesty on high,
29968	58	1	4	 having become as far superior to the angels as the Name He possesses by inheritance is more excellent than theirs.
29969	58	1	5	 For to which of the angels did God ever say, <"My Son art Thou: I have this day become Thy Father;"> and again, <"I will be a Father to Him, and He shall be My Son"?>
29970	58	1	6	 But speaking of the time when He  once more brings His Firstborn into the world, He says, <"And let all God's angels worship Him.">
29971	58	1	7	 Moreover of the angels He says,  <"He changes His angels into winds, and His ministering servants into a flame of fire.">
29972	58	1	8	 But of His Son, He says, <"Thy throne, O God,  is for ever and for ever, and the sceptre of Thy Kingdom is  a sceptre of absolute justice.
29973	58	1	9	 Thou hast loved righteousness and hated lawlessness;  therefore God, Thy God, has anointed Thee with the oil of gladness beyond  Thy companions.">
29974	58	1	10	 It is also of His Son that God says, <"Thou, O Lord, in the beginning didst lay the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of Thy hands.
29975	58	1	11	 The heavens will perish, but Thou remainest; and they will all grow old like a garment,
29976	58	1	12	 and,  as though they were a mantle Thou wilt roll them up; yes, like a garment, and they will undergo change. But Thou art the same, and Thy years will never come to an end.">
29977	58	1	13	 To which of the angels has He ever said, <"Sit at My right hand till I make Thy foes a footstool for Thy feet"?>
29978	58	1	14	 Are not all angels spirits that serve Him--whom He sends out to render service for the benefit of those who, before long, will inherit salvation?
29979	58	2	1	 For this reason we ought to pay the more earnest heed to the things which we have heard, for fear we should  drift away from them.
29980	58	2	2	 For if the message delivered through angels proved to be true, and every transgression and act of disobedience met with just retribution,
29981	58	2	3	 how shall *we* escape  if we are indifferent to a salvation as great as that now offered to us? This, after having first of all been announced by the Lord Himself, had its truth made sure to us by those who heard Him,
29982	58	2	4	 while God corroborated their testimony by signs and marvels and various miracles, and by gifts of the Holy Spirit distributed in accordance with His own will.
29983	58	2	5	 It is not to angels that God has assigned the sovereignty of that coming  world, of which we speak.
29984	58	2	6	 But,  as we know, a writer has solemnly said, <"How poor a creature is man, and yet Thou dost remember him, and a son of man, and yet Thou dost come to him!
29985	58	2	7	 Thou hast made him only  a little inferior to the angels; with glory and honour Thou hast crowned him,  and hast set him to govern the works of Thy hands.
29986	58	2	8	 Thou hast put everything in subjection under his feet."> For this subjecting of the universe to man implies the leaving nothing not subject to him. But we do not as yet see the universe subject to him.
29987	58	2	9	 But Jesus--who was made a little inferior to the angels in order that  through God's grace He might taste death for every human being--we already see wearing a crown of glory and honour because of His having suffered death.
29988	58	2	10	 For it was fitting that He for whom, and through whom, all things exist, after He had brought  many sons to glory, should perfect by suffering the Prince Leader who had saved them.
29989	58	2	11	 For both He who sanctifies and those whom He is sanctifying have all one Father; and for this reason He is not ashamed to speak of them as His brothers;
29990	58	2	12	 as when He says: <"I will proclaim Thy name to My brothers:  in the midst of the congregation I will hymn Thy praises;">
29991	58	2	13	 and again, <"As for Me, I will be one whose trust reposes in God;"> and again, <"Here am I, and here are the children God has given Me.">
29992	58	2	14	 Since then the children referred to are all alike sharers in  perishable human nature, He Himself also, in the same way, took on Him a share of it, in order that through death He might render powerless him who had authority over death, that is, the Devil,
29993	58	2	15	 and might set at liberty all those who through fear of death had been subject to lifelong slavery.
29994	58	2	16	 For assuredly it is not to angels that He is continually reaching a helping hand, but it is to the descendants of Abraham.
29995	58	2	17	 And for this purpose it was necessary that in all respects He should be made to resemble His brothers, so that He might become a compassionate and faithful High Priest in things relating to God, in order to atone for the sins of the people.
29996	58	2	18	 For inasmuch as He has Himself felt the pain of  temptation and trial, He is also able instantly to help those who are tempted and tried.
29997	58	3	1	 Therefore, holy brethren, sharers with others in a heavenly invitation, fix your thoughts on Jesus, the Apostle and High Priest whose followers we profess to be.
29998	58	3	2	 How faithful He was to Him who appointed Him,  just as Moses also was faithful in all God's house!
29999	58	3	3	 For Jesus has been counted worthy of greater glory than Moses, in so far as  he who has built a house has higher honour than the house itself.
30000	58	3	4	 For every house has had a builder, and the builder of all things is God.
30001	58	3	5	 Moreover, Moses was faithful in all God's house as a servant in delivering the message given him to speak;
30002	58	3	6	 but Christ was faithful as a Son having authority over God's house, and we are that house, if we hold firm to  the End the boldness and the  hope which we boast of as ours.
30003	58	3	7	 For this reason--as the Holy Spirit warns us,  <"To-day, if you hear His voice,
30004	58	3	8	 do not harden your hearts as your forefathers did in the time of the  provocation on the day of the  temptation in the Desert,
30005	58	3	9	 where your forefathers so sorely tried My patience and saw all that I did during forty years.
30006	58	3	10	 Therefore I was greatly grieved with that generation, and I said, `They are ever going astray in heart, and have not learnt to know My paths.'
30007	58	3	11	 As I swore in My anger, they shall not be admitted to My rest" -->
30008	58	3	12	 see to it, brethren, that there is never in any one of you--as perhaps there may be--a sinful and unbelieving heart, manifesting itself in revolt from the ever-living God.
30009	58	3	13	 On the contrary  encourage  one another, day after day,  so long as To-day lasts, so that not one of you may be hardened through the deceitful character of  sin.
30010	58	3	14	 For we have, all alike, become sharers with Christ, if we really hold our first confidence firm to the End;
30011	58	3	15	 seeing that the warning still comes to us, <"To-day, if you hear His voice, do not harden your hearts as your forefathers did in the time of the provocation.">
30012	58	3	16	 For who were they  that heard, and yet provoked God? Was it not  the whole of the people who had come out of Egypt under the leadership of Moses?
30013	58	3	17	 And with whom was God so greatly grieved for forty years? Was it not with those who had sinned, and whose  dead bodies fell in the Desert?
30014	58	3	18	 And to whom did He swear that they should not be admitted to His rest, if it was not to those who were disobedient?
30015	58	3	19	 And so we see that it was owing to lack of faith that they could not be admitted.
30016	58	4	1	  Therefore let us be on our guard lest perhaps, while He still leaves us a promise of being admitted to His rest, some one of you should be found to have fallen short of it.
30017	58	4	2	 For  Good News has been brought to us as truly as to them; but the message they heard failed to benefit them, because they were not one in faith with  those who gave heed to it.
30018	58	4	3	 We who have believed are soon to be admitted to  the true rest; as He has said, <"As I swore in My anger, they shall not be admitted to My rest,"> although God's works had been going on ever since the creation of the world.
30019	58	4	4	 For, as we know, when speaking of the seventh day He has used the words, <"And God rested on the seventh day from all His works;">
30020	58	4	5	 and He has also declared, <"They shall not be admitted to My rest.">
30021	58	4	6	 Since, then, it is still true that some will be admitted to that rest, and that because of disobedience those  who formerly had Good News proclaimed to them were not admitted,
30022	58	4	7	 He again definitely mentions a certain day, "To-day," saying long afterwards, by David's lips, in the words already quoted, <"To-day, if you hear His voice, do not harden your hearts.">
30023	58	4	8	 For if Joshua had given them the true rest,  we should not afterwards hear God speaking of another still future day.
30024	58	4	9	 It follows that there still remains a sabbath rest for the people of God.
30025	58	4	10	 For  He who has been admitted to His rest, has rested from His works as God did from His.
30026	58	4	11	 Let it then be our earnest endeavour to be admitted to that rest, so that no one may perish through following the same example of unbelief.
30027	58	4	12	 For  God's Message is full of life and power, and is keener than  the sharpest two-edged sword. It pierces even to the severance of soul from spirit, and penetrates between the joints and the marrow, and it can discern the secret thoughts and purposes of the heart.
30028	58	4	13	 And no created thing is able to escape its scrutiny; but everything lies bare and  completely exposed before the eyes of Him  with whom we have to do.
30029	58	4	14	 Inasmuch, then, as we have in Jesus, the Son of God, a great High Priest who has passed  into Heaven itself, let us hold firmly to our profession of faith.
30030	58	4	15	 For we have not a High Priest who is unable to feel for us in our weaknesses, but one who was tempted in every respect just as we are tempted, and yet did not sin.
30031	58	4	16	 Therefore let us come boldly to the throne of grace, that we may receive mercy and find grace to help us in our times of need.
30032	58	5	1	 For every  High Priest is chosen from among men, and is appointed to act on behalf of men in matters relating to God, in order to offer both  gifts and sin-offerings,
30033	58	5	2	 and must be one who is able to bear patiently with the ignorant and erring, because he himself also is beset with infirmity.
30034	58	5	3	 And for this reason he is required to offer sin-offerings not only for the people but also for himself.
30035	58	5	4	 And no one takes this  honourable office upon himself, but only accepts it when called to it by God, as Aaron was.
30036	58	5	5	 So Christ also did not claim for Himself the honour of being made High Priest, but was appointed to it by Him who said to Him, <"My Son art Thou: I have to-day become Thy Father;">
30037	58	5	6	 as also in another passage He says, <"Thou art a priest for ever, belonging to the order of Melchizedek.">
30038	58	5	7	 For Jesus during his earthly life offered up prayers and entreaties, crying aloud and weeping as He pleaded with Him who was able to bring Him in safety out of death, and He was delivered  from the terror from which He shrank.
30039	58	5	8	 Although He was God's Son, yet He learned obedience from the sufferings which He endured;
30040	58	5	9	 and so, having been  made perfect, He became to all who obey Him the  source and giver of eternal salvation.
30041	58	5	10	 For God Himself  addresses Him as a High Priest for ever, belonging to the order of Melchizedek.
30042	58	5	11	 Concerning Him we have much to say, and much that it would be difficult to make clear to you, since you have become  so dull of apprehension.
30043	58	5	12	 For although, considering the long time you have been believers, you ought now to be teachers of others, you really need some one to teach you over again the very rudiments of the truths of God, and you have come to require milk instead of solid food.
30044	58	5	13	 By people who live on milk I mean those who are imperfectly acquainted with the  teaching concerning righteousness.
30045	58	5	14	 Such persons are mere babes. But solid food  is for adults--that is, for those who through constant practice have their spiritual faculties carefully trained to distinguish good from evil.
30046	58	6	1	 Therefore leaving elementary instruction about the Christ, let us advance to mature manhood and not be continually re-laying a foundation of repentance from  lifeless works and of  faith in God,
30047	58	6	2	 or of teaching about  ceremonial washings, the laying on of hands, the resurrection  of the dead, and  the last judgement.
30048	58	6	3	 And advance we will, if God permits us to do so.
30049	58	6	4	 For it is impossible, in the case of those who have once for all been enlightened, and have tasted the sweetness of the heavenly gift, and have been made partakers of the Holy Spirit,
30050	58	6	5	 and have realized how good the word of God is and how mighty are the powers of the coming Age, and then fell away--
30051	58	6	6	 it is impossible, I say, to keep bringing them back to a new repentance, for,  to their own undoing, they are repeatedly crucifying the Son of God afresh and exposing Him to open shame.
30052	58	6	7	 For land which has drunk in the rain that often falls upon it, and brings forth vegetation useful to those for whose sakes, indeed, it is tilled, has a share in God's blessing.
30053	58	6	8	 But if it only yields a mass of thorns and briers, it is considered worthless, and is in danger of being cursed, and in the end will be destroyed by fire.
30054	58	6	9	 But we, even while we speak in this tone, have a happier conviction concerning you, my dearly-loved friends--a conviction of things which point towards salvation.
30055	58	6	10	 For God is not unjust so that He is unmindful of your labour and of the love which you have manifested towards Himself in having rendered services to His people and in still rendering them.
30056	58	6	11	 But we long for each of you to continue to manifest the same earnestness, with a view to your enjoying fulness of hope to the very End;
30057	58	6	12	 so that you may not  become half-hearted, but be imitators of those who through faith and patient endurance are now heirs to the promises.
30058	58	6	13	 For when God gave the promise to Abraham, since He had no one greater to swear by, He swore by Himself,
30059	58	6	14	 saying, <"Assuredly I will bless you and bless you, I will increase you and increase you.">
30060	58	6	15	 And so, as the result of patient waiting, our forefather obtained what God had promised.
30061	58	6	16	 For men swear by what is greater than themselves; and with them an oath in confirmation of a statement always puts an end to a dispute.
30062	58	6	17	 In the same way, since it was God's desire to display more convincingly to the heirs of the promise how unchangeable His purpose was,
30063	58	6	18	 He added an oath, in order that, through  two unchangeable things, in which it is impossible for Him to prove false, we may possess mighty encouragement--we who, for safety, have hastened to lay hold of the hope set before us.
30064	58	6	19	 That hope we have as an anchor of the soul--an anchor that can neither break nor drag. It passes in behind the veil,
30065	58	6	20	 where Jesus has entered as  a forerunner  on our behalf, having become, like Melchizedek, a High Priest for ever.
30066	58	7	1	 For this man, Melchizedek, King of Salem and priest of the Most High God--he who when Abraham was returning after defeating the kings met him and pronounced a blessing on him--
30067	58	7	2	 to whom also Abraham presented a tenth part of all--being first, as his name signifies, King of righteousness, and secondly King of Salem, that is, King of peace:
30068	58	7	3	  with no father or mother, and no record of ancestry: having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made a type of the Son of God--this man Melchizedek remains a priest for ever.
30069	58	7	4	 Now think how great this priest-king must have been to whom Abraham the patriarch gave a tenth part of the best of the spoil.
30070	58	7	5	 And those of the descendants of Levi who receive the priesthood are authorized by the Law to take tithes from the people, that is, from their brethren, though these have sprung from Abraham.
30071	58	7	6	 But, in this instance, one who does not trace his origin from them takes tithes from Abraham, and pronounces a blessing on him to whom the promises belong.
30072	58	7	7	 And beyond all dispute it is always the inferior who is blessed by the superior.
30073	58	7	8	 Moreover  here frail mortal men receive tithes: there one receives them about whom there is evidence that he is alive.
30074	58	7	9	 And Levi too--if I may so speak--pays tithes through Abraham:
30075	58	7	10	 for Levi was yet in the loins of his forefather when Melchizedek met Abraham.
30076	58	7	11	 Now if  the crowning blessing was attainable by means of the Levitical priesthood--for  as resting on this foundation the people received the Law,  to which they are still subject--  what further need was there for a Priest of a different kind to be raised up belonging to the order of Melchizedek instead of being said to belong to the order of Aaron?
30077	58	7	12	 For when the priesthood changes, a change of Law also of necessity takes place.
30078	58	7	13	  He, however, to whom that prophecy refers  is associated with a different tribe, not one member of which has anything to do with the altar.
30079	58	7	14	 For it is undeniable that our Lord sprang from Judah, a tribe of which Moses said nothing in connection with priests.
30080	58	7	15	  And this is still more abundantly clear when we read that it is as belonging to the order of Melchizedek that a priest of a different kind is to arise,
30081	58	7	16	 and hold His office not in obedience to any temporary Law, but by virtue of an indestructible Life.
30082	58	7	17	 For the words are in evidence, <"Thou art a priest for ever, belonging to the order of Melchizedek.">
30083	58	7	18	 On the one hand we have here the abrogation of an earlier code because it was weak and ineffective--
30084	58	7	19	 for the Law brought no perfect blessing--but on the other hand we have the bringing in of a new and better hope by means of which we draw near to God.
30085	58	7	20	 And since  it was not without an oath being taken--
30086	58	7	21	 for these men hold office without any oath having been taken, but He holds it attested by an oath from Him who said to Him, <"The Lord has sworn and will not  recall His words, Thou art a Priest for ever" -->
30087	58	7	22	 so much the more also is the Covenant of which Jesus has become the  guarantor, a better covenant.
30088	58	7	23	 And they have been appointed priests many in number, because death prevents their continuance in office:
30089	58	7	24	 but He, because He continues for ever, has a priesthood which does not pass to any successor.
30090	58	7	25	 Hence too He is able to save to the uttermost those who come to God through Him, seeing that He ever lives to plead for them.
30091	58	7	26	 Moreover we needed just such a High Priest as this--holy, guileless, undefiled, far removed from sinful men and exalted above the heavens;
30092	58	7	27	 who, unlike other High Priests, is not under the necessity of offering up sacrifices day after day, first for His own sins, and afterwards for those of the people; for this latter thing He did once for all when He offered up Himself.
30093	58	7	28	 For the Law constitutes men High Priests--men with all their infirmity--but the utterance of the oath, which came later than the Law, constitutes High Priest a Son who has been made for ever perfect.
30094	58	8	1	 Now in connexion with what we have been saying the chief point is that we have a High Priest who has taken His seat at the right hand of the throne of God's Majesty in the heavens,
30095	58	8	2	 and ministers in the Holy place and in the true tabernacle which not man, but the Lord pitched.
30096	58	8	3	 Every High Priest,  however, is appointed to offer both bloodless gifts and sacrifices. Therefore this High Priest also must have some offering to present.
30097	58	8	4	 If then He were still on earth, He would not be a priest at all, since  here there are already those who present the offerings in obedience to the Law,
30098	58	8	5	 and serve a copy and type of the heavenly things, just as Moses was divinely instructed when about to build the tabernacle. For God said, <"See that you make everything in imitation of the pattern shown you on the mountain.">
30099	58	8	6	 But, as a matter of fact, the ministry which Christ has obtained is all the nobler a ministry, in that He is at the same time the negotiator of a sublimer covenant, based upon sublimer promises.
30100	58	8	7	 For if that first Covenant had been free from imperfection, there would have been no attempt to introduce another.
30101	58	8	8	 For, being dissatisfied with His people, God says, <"`There are days coming,' says the Lord, `When I will establish with the house of Israel and with the house of Judah a new Covenant--
30102	58	8	9	 a Covenant unlike the one which I made with their forefathers on the day when I took them by the hand to lead them out from the land of Egypt; for they would not remain faithful to  that.' `So I turned from them,' says the Lord.
30103	58	8	10	 `But this is the Covenant that I will covenant with the house of Israel after those days,' says the Lord: I will put My laws into their minds and will write them upon their hearts. And I will indeed be their God and they shall be My People.
30104	58	8	11	 And there shall be no need for them to teach each one his fellow citizen and each one his brother, saying, Know the Lord. For all will know Me from the least of them to the greatest;
30105	58	8	12	 Because I will be merciful to their wrongdoings, and their sins I will remember no longer.'">
30106	58	8	13	 By using the words, "a new Covenant," He has made the first one obsolete; but whatever is decaying and showing signs of old age is not far from disappearing altogether.
30107	58	9	1	 Now even  the first Covenant had regulations for divine worship, and had also its sanctuary--a sanctuary belonging to this world.
30108	58	9	2	 For a sacred tent was constructed--the  outer one, in which were the lamp and the table and  the presented loaves; and this is called  the Holy place.
30109	58	9	3	 And behind the second veil was a sacred tent called the  Holy of holies.
30110	58	9	4	 This had a  censer of gold, and the ark of the Covenant lined with gold and completely covered with gold, and in it were a gold vase which held the manna, and Aaron's rod which budded and the tables of the Covenant.
30111	58	9	5	 And above the ark were the Cherubim  denoting God's glorious presence and overshadowing the Mercy-seat. But I cannot now speak about all these in detail.
30112	58	9	6	 These arrangements having long been completed, the priests, when conducting the divine services, continually enter the outer tent.
30113	58	9	7	 But into the second, the High Priest goes only on one day of the year, and goes alone, taking with him blood, which he offers on his own behalf and on account of the sins which the people have ignorantly committed.
30114	58	9	8	 And the lesson which the Holy Spirit teaches is this--that the way into the  true  Holy place is not yet open  so long as the outer tent still remains in existence.
30115	58	9	9	 And this is a figure--for the time now present--answering to which both gifts and sacrifices are offered, unable though they are to give complete freedom from sin to him who ministers.
30116	58	9	10	 For their efficacy depends only on meats and drinks and various washings, ceremonies pertaining to the body and imposed until a time of reformation.
30117	58	9	11	 But Christ  appeared as a High Priest of the blessings  that are soon to come by means of the greater and more perfect Tent of worship, a tent which has not been built with hands--that is to say does not belong to this material creation--
30118	58	9	12	 and once for all entered  the Holy place, taking with Him not the blood of goats and calves, but His own blood, and thus procuring eternal redemption for us.
30119	58	9	13	 For if  the blood of goats and bulls and the ashes of a heifer sprinkling those who have contracted defilement make them holy so as to bring about  ceremonial purity,
30120	58	9	14	 how much more certainly shall the blood of Christ, who  strengthened by  the eternal Spirit  offered Himself to God, free from blemish, purify  your consciences from  lifeless works for you to  serve the  ever-living God?
30121	58	9	15	  And because of this He is the negotiator of a new Covenant, in order that, since a life has been given in atonement for the offences committed under the first Covenant, those who have been called may receive the eternal inheritance which has been promised to them.
30122	58	9	16	 For where there is a  legal `will,' there must also be a death brought forward in evidence--the death of him who made it.
30123	58	9	17	 And a will is only of force in the case of a deceased person, being never of any avail so long as he who made it lives.
30124	58	9	18	 Accordingly  we find that the first Covenant was not inaugurated without blood.
30125	58	9	19	 For when Moses had proclaimed  to all the people  every commandment contained in the Law, he took the blood of the calves and of the goats and with them water, scarlet wool and hyssop, and  sprinkled both the book itself and all the people,
30126	58	9	20	 saying, <"This is the blood which confirms the Covenant that God has made binding upon you.">
30127	58	9	21	 And in the same way  he also sprinkled blood upon the Tent of worship and upon all the vessels used in the ministry.
30128	58	9	22	 Indeed we may almost say that in obedience to the Law everything is sprinkled with blood, and that apart from  the outpouring of blood there is no remission of sins.
30129	58	9	23	 It was needful therefore that the copies of the things in Heaven should be cleansed in this way, but that the heavenly things themselves should be cleansed with more costly sacrifices.
30130	58	9	24	 For not into a  Holy place built by men's hands--a mere copy of the reality--did Christ enter, but He entered Heaven itself, now to appear in the presence of God on our behalf.
30131	58	9	25	 Nor did He enter for the purpose of many times offering Himself in sacrifice, just as the High Priest enters the  Holy place, year after year, taking with him blood not his own.
30132	58	9	26	 In that case Christ would have needed to suffer many times, from the creation of the world onwards; but as a matter of fact He has appeared once for all, at  the Close of the Ages, in order to do away with sin by  the sacrifice of Himself.
30133	58	9	27	 And since it is reserved for all mankind once to die, and afterwards to be judged;
30134	58	9	28	 so the Christ also, having been once offered in sacrifice in order that He might bear the sins of  many, will appear a second time,  separated from sin,  to those who are eagerly expecting Him, to make their salvation complete.
30135	58	10	1	 For, since the Law exhibits only an outline of the blessings to come and not a perfect representation of the things themselves,  the priests can never, by repeating the same sacrifices which they continually offer year after year, give complete freedom from sin to those who draw near.
30136	58	10	2	 For then would not the sacrifices have ceased to be offered, because the consciences of the worshippers--who in that case would now have been cleansed once for all--would no longer be burdened with sins?
30137	58	10	3	 But in those sacrifices sins are recalled to memory year after year.
30138	58	10	4	 For it is impossible for the blood of bulls and goats to take away sins.
30139	58	10	5	 That is why, when He comes into the world, He says, <"Sacrifice and offering Thou has not desired, but a body Thou hast prepared for Me.
30140	58	10	6	 In whole burnt-offerings and in sin-offerings Thou hast taken no pleasure.
30141	58	10	7	 Then I said, `I have come--in the roll of the book it is written concerning Me--to do Thy will, O God.'">
30142	58	10	8	 After saying the words I have just quoted, <"Sacrifices and offerings or whole burnt-offerings and sin-offerings Thou hast not desired or taken pleasure in"> --all such being offered in obedience to the Law--
30143	58	10	9	 He then  adds, <"I have come to do Thy will."> He does away with the first in order to establish the second.
30144	58	10	10	 It is through that divine will that we  have been set free from sin, through the offering of Jesus Christ as our sacrifice once for all.
30145	58	10	11	 And while every  priest stands ministering, day after day, and constantly offering the same sacrifices--though such can never rid us of our sins--
30146	58	10	12	 this Priest, on the contrary, after offering for sins a single sacrifice of perpetual efficacy, took His seat at God's right hand,
30147	58	10	13	 waiting from that time onward until His enemies be put as a footstool under His feet.
30148	58	10	14	 For by a single offering He has for ever completed the blessing for those whom He is setting free from sin.
30149	58	10	15	 And the Holy Spirit also gives us His testimony; for when He had said,
30150	58	10	16	 <"`This is the Covenant that I will make with them after those days,' says the Lord: `I will put My laws upon their hearts and will write them on their minds;'">
30151	58	10	17	 He adds, <"And their sins and offences I will remember no longer.">
30152	58	10	18	 But where these have been forgiven no further offering for sin is required.
30153	58	10	19	  Since then, brethren, we have  free access to the Holy place through the blood of Jesus,
30154	58	10	20	 by the new and  ever-living way which He opened up for us through the rending of the veil--that is to say, of His earthly nature--
30155	58	10	21	 and since we have a great Priest who has authority over the house of God,
30156	58	10	22	 let us draw near with sincerity and unfaltering faith, having had our hearts sprinkled, once for all, from consciences oppressed with sin, and our bodies bathed in pure water.
30157	58	10	23	 Let us hold firmly to an unflinching avowal of our hope, for He is faithful who gave us the promises.
30158	58	10	24	 And let us bestow thought on one another with a view to arousing one another to brotherly love and right conduct;
30159	58	10	25	 not neglecting--as some habitually do--to meet together, but encouraging one another, and doing this all the more since you can see  the day of Christ approaching.
30160	58	10	26	 For if we wilfully persist in sin after having received the full knowledge of the truth, there no longer remains in reserve any other sacrifice for sins.
30161	58	10	27	 There remains nothing but a certain awful expectation of judgement, and the fury of a fire which before long will  devour  the enemies of the truth.
30162	58	10	28	 Any one who bids defiance to the Law of Moses is put to death without mercy on the testimony of two or three witnesses.
30163	58	10	29	 How much  severer punishment, think you, will he be held to deserve who has trampled under foot the Son of God, has not regarded as holy that Covenant-blood with which he was set free from sin, and has insulted the Spirit from whom comes grace?
30164	58	10	30	 For we know who it is that has said, <"Vengeance belongs to Me: I will pay back;"> and again, <"The Lord will be His people's judge.">
30165	58	10	31	 It is an awful thing to fall into the hands of the  ever-living God.
30166	58	10	32	 But continually recall to mind the days now past, when on being first enlightened you went through a great conflict and many sufferings.
30167	58	10	33	 This was partly through allowing yourselves to be made a public spectacle amid reproaches and persecutions, and partly through coming forward to share the sufferings of those who were thus treated.
30168	58	10	34	 For you not only showed sympathy with those who were imprisoned, but you even submitted with joy when your property was taken from you, being well aware  that you have in your own selves a more valuable possession and one which will remain.
30169	58	10	35	 Therefore do not cast from you your confident hope, for it will receive a vast reward.
30170	58	10	36	 For you stand in need of patient endurance, so that, as the result of having done the will of God, you may receive the promised blessing.
30171	58	10	37	 For there is still but a short time and then <"The coming One will come and will not delay.
30172	58	10	38	 But it is by faith that My righteous servant shall live; and if he shrinks back, My soul takes no pleasure in him.">
30173	58	10	39	  But we are not people who shrink back and perish, but are among those who believe and gain possession of their souls.
30174	58	11	1	 Now  faith is a well-grounded assurance of that for which we hope, and a conviction of the reality of things which we do not see.
30175	58	11	2	 For by it the saints of old won God's approval.
30176	58	11	3	 Through faith we understand that  the worlds  came into being, and still exist, at the command of God, so that what is seen does not owe its existence to that which is visible.
30177	58	11	4	 Through faith Abel offered to God a  more acceptable sacrifice than Cain did, and  through this faith he obtained testimony that he was righteous, God giving the testimony by accepting his gifts; and  through it,  though he is dead, he still speaks.
30178	58	11	5	 Through faith Enoch was taken from the earth so that he did not see death, and he could not be found, because God had taken him; for before he was taken we have evidence that he truly pleased God.
30179	58	11	6	 But where there is no faith it is impossible truly to please Him; for the man who draws near to God must believe that there is a God and that He proves Himself a rewarder of those who earnestly try to find Him.
30180	58	11	7	 Through faith Noah, being divinely taught about things as yet unseen, reverently gave heed and built an ark for the safety of his family, and by this act he condemned the world, and became  an heir of the righteousness which depends on faith.
30181	58	11	8	 Through faith Abraham,  upon being called to leave home and go into a land which he was soon to receive for an inheritance, obeyed; and he went out, not knowing where he was going to.
30182	58	11	9	 Through faith he came and made his home for a time in a land which had been promised to him, as if in a foreign country, living in tents together with Isaac and Jacob, sharers with him in the same promise;
30183	58	11	10	 for he continually looked forward to  the city which has  the foundations, whose architect and builder is God.
30184	58	11	11	 Through faith even Sarah herself received strength to become a mother--although she was past  the time of life for this--because she judged Him faithful who had given the promise.
30185	58	11	12	 And thus there sprang from one man, and him practically dead, a nation like the stars of the sky in number, and like the sands on the sea shore which cannot be counted.
30186	58	11	13	 All these died in the possession of faith. They had not received the promised blessings, but had seen them from a distance and had greeted them, and had acknowledged themselves to be foreigners and strangers here on earth;
30187	58	11	14	 for men who acknowledge this make it manifest that they are seeking  elsewhere a country of their own.
30188	58	11	15	 And if they had cherished the remembrance of the country they had left, they would have found an opportunity to return;
30189	58	11	16	 but, as it is,  we see them eager for a better land, that is to say, a heavenly one. For this reason God is not ashamed to be called their God, for He has  now  prepared a city for them.
30190	58	11	17	 Through faith Abraham, as soon as God put him to the test,  offered up Isaac. Yes, he who had joyfully welcomed the promises was on the point of sacrificing his only son
30191	58	11	18	 with regard to whom he had been told, <"It is through Isaac that your posterity shall be traced.">
30192	58	11	19	 For he reckoned that God is even able to raise a man up from among the dead, and, figuratively speaking, it was from among the dead that he received Isaac again.
30193	58	11	20	 Through faith Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau, even in connexion with things soon to come.
30194	58	11	21	 Through faith Jacob, when dying, blessed each of Joseph's sons, and, leaning on the top of his staff,  worshipped God.
30195	58	11	22	 Through faith Joseph, when he was near his end,  made mention of the departure of the descendants of Israel, and gave orders about  his own body.
30196	58	11	23	  Through faith the child Moses was hid for three months by his parents, because they saw  his rare beauty; and the king's edict had no terror for them.
30197	58	11	24	 Through faith Moses, when he grew to manhood, refused to be known as Pharaoh's daughter's son,
30198	58	11	25	 having determined to endure ill-treatment along with the people of God rather than enjoy the short-lived pleasures  of sin;
30199	58	11	26	 because he deemed  the reproaches which he might meet with in the service of the Christ to be greater riches than all the treasures of Egypt; for he  fixed his gaze on the coming reward.
30200	58	11	27	 Through faith  he left Egypt, not being frightened by the king's anger; for he held on his course as seeing the unseen One.
30201	58	11	28	 Through faith he  instituted the Passover, and the sprinkling with blood so that the destroyer of the firstborn might not touch the Israelites.
30202	58	11	29	 Through faith they passed through the Red Sea as though they were passing over dry land, but the Egyptians, when they tried to do the same, were swallowed up.
30203	58	11	30	 Through faith the walls of Jericho fell to the ground after being surrounded for seven days.
30204	58	11	31	 Through faith the notorious sinner Rahab did not perish along with the disobedient, for she had welcomed the spies and had sheltered them.
30205	58	11	32	 And why need I say more? For time will fail me if I tell the story of  Gideon,  Barak,  Samson,  Jephthah, and of  David and  Samuel and the Prophets;
30206	58	11	33	 men who, as the result of faith, conquered whole kingdoms, brought about true justice, obtained  promises from God, stopped lions' mouths,
30207	58	11	34	 deprived fire of its power, escaped being killed by the sword, out of weakness were made strong, became mighty in war, put to flight foreign armies.
30208	58	11	35	 Women received back their dear ones alive from the dead; and others were  put to death with torture, refusing the deliverance offered to them--that they might secure  a better resurrection.
30209	58	11	36	 Others again were tested by cruel mockery and by scourging; yes, and by chains and imprisonment.
30210	58	11	37	 They were stoned, they were sawn asunder, they were tried by temptation, they were killed with the sword. They went from place to place in sheepskins or goatskins, enduring want, oppression and cruelty.
30211	58	11	38	 (They were men of whom the world was not worthy.) They wandered across deserts and mountains, or hid themselves in caves and in holes in the ground.
30212	58	11	39	 And although by their faith all these people won God's approval,  none of them received the fulfilment of  His great promise;
30213	58	11	40	 for God had provided for them and us something better, so that apart from us they were not to  attain to full blessedness.
30214	58	12	1	 Therefore, surrounded as we are by such a vast cloud of  witnesses, let us fling aside every encumbrance and  the sin that so readily entangles our feet. And let us run with patient endurance the race that lies before us,
30215	58	12	2	  simply fixing our gaze upon Jesus,  our Prince Leader in the faith, who will also award us the prize. He, for the sake of the joy which lay before Him, patiently endured the cross, looking with contempt upon its shame, and afterwards seated Himself--  where He still sits--at the right hand of the throne of God.
30216	58	12	3	 Therefore, if you would escape becoming weary and faint-hearted, compare your own sufferings with those of Him who endured such hostility directed  against Him by sinners.
30217	58	12	4	 In your struggle against sin you have not yet resisted so as to endanger your lives;
30218	58	12	5	 and you have quite forgotten the encouraging words which are addressed to you as sons, and which say, <"My son, do not think lightly of the Lord's discipline, and do not faint when He corrects you;
30219	58	12	6	 for those whom the Lord loves He disciplines: and He scourges every son whom He acknowledges.">
30220	58	12	7	 The sufferings that you are enduring are for your discipline. God is dealing with you as sons; for what son is there whom his father does not discipline?
30221	58	12	8	 And if you are left without discipline, of which every true son has had a share, that shows that you are bastards, and not true sons.
30222	58	12	9	 Besides this,  our earthly fathers used to discipline us and we treated them with respect, and shall we not be still more submissive to the Father of our spirits, and live?
30223	58	12	10	 It is true that they disciplined us for a few years according as they thought fit; but He does it for our certain good, in order that we may become sharers in His own holy character.
30224	58	12	11	 Now, at the time, discipline seems to be a matter not for joy, but for grief; yet it afterwards yields to those who have passed through its training a result full of peace--namely, righteousness.
30225	58	12	12	  Therefore strengthen the drooping hands and paralysed knees,
30226	58	12	13	 and make straight paths for your feet, so that what is lame may not be put entirely out of joint
30227	58	12	14	 but may rather be restored. Persistently strive for peace with all men, and for that  growth in holiness apart from which  no one will  see the Lord.
30228	58	12	15	 Be carefully on your guard lest there be any one who falls back from the grace of God; lest any root bearing bitter fruit spring up and cause trouble among you, and through it  the whole brotherhood be defiled;
30229	58	12	16	 lest there be a fornicator, or an ungodly person like Esau, who, in return for a single meal, parted with the birthright which belonged to him.
30230	58	12	17	 For you know that even afterwards, when he wished to secure  the blessing, he was rejected; for he found no opportunity for undoing what he had done, though he sought the blessing earnestly with tears.
30231	58	12	18	 For you have not come to a  material  object all ablaze with fire, and to gloom and darkness and storm and trumpet-blast and the sound of words--
30232	58	12	19	 a sound of such a kind that those who heard it entreated that no more should be added.
30233	58	12	20	 For they could not endure the order which had been given, <"Even a wild beast, if it touches the mountain, shall be stoned to death;">
30234	58	12	21	 and so terrible was the scene that Moses said, <"I tremble with fear.">
30235	58	12	22	 On the contrary you have come to Mount Zion, and to the city of the  ever-living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, to countless hosts of angels,
30236	58	12	23	 to the great festal gathering and Church of the first-born, whose names are recorded in Heaven, and to a Judge who is God of all, and to the spirits of righteous men  made perfect,
30237	58	12	24	 and to Jesus the negotiator of a new Covenant, and to the sprinkled blood which speaks in  more gracious tones than that of Abel.
30238	58	12	25	 Be careful not to refuse to listen to Him who is speaking to you. For if they of old did not escape unpunished when they refused to listen to him who spoke on earth,  much less shall we escape who turn a deaf ear to Him who now speaks from Heaven.
30239	58	12	26	 His voice then shook the earth, but now we have His promise, <"Yet again I will, once for all, cause not only the earth to tremble, but Heaven also.">
30240	58	12	27	 Here the words "Yet again, once for all" denote the removal of the things which can be shaken--created things--in order that the things which cannot be shaken may remain.
30241	58	12	28	 Therefore, receiving,  as we now do, a kingdom which cannot be shaken, let us cherish thankfulness so that we may  ever offer to God an acceptable service, with godly reverence and awe.
30242	58	12	29	 For our God is  also a consuming fire.
30243	58	13	1	 Let brotherly love  always continue.
30244	58	13	2	 Do not neglect to show kindness to strangers; for, in this way, some, without knowing it, have had angels as their guests.
30245	58	13	3	  Remember prisoners, as if you were in prison with them; and remember those suffering ill-treatment, for you yourselves also are still in the body.
30246	58	13	4	 Let marriage be held in honour among all, and let the marriage bed be unpolluted; for fornicators and adulterers God will judge.
30247	58	13	5	 Your lives should be untainted by love for money. Be content with what you have; for God Himself has said, <"I will never, never  let go your hand: I will never never forsake you.">
30248	58	13	6	 So that we fearlessly say, <"The Lord is my helper; I will not be afraid: what can man do to me?">
30249	58	13	7	 Remember your former leaders--it was they who brought you God's Message. Bear in mind how they ended their lives, and imitate their faith.
30250	58	13	8	  Jesus Christ is the same yesterday and to-day--yes, and to the ages to come.
30251	58	13	9	 Do not be drawn aside by all sorts of strange teaching; for it is well to have the heart  made stedfast through God's grace, and not by special kinds of food, from which those who scrupulously attend to them have derived no benefit.
30252	58	13	10	 We Christians have  an altar from which the ministers of  the Jewish Tent have no right to eat.
30253	58	13	11	 For the bodies of those animals of which the blood is carried by the High Priest into  the Holy place as an offering for sin, are burned outside the camp.
30254	58	13	12	 And for this reason Jesus also, in order, by His own blood, to set the people free from sin, suffered outside the gate.
30255	58	13	13	 Therefore let us go to Him outside  the camp, sharing the insults directed against Him.
30256	58	13	14	 For we have no permanent  city here, but we are longing for the city which is soon to be ours.
30257	58	13	15	 Through Him, then, let us continually lay on the altar a sacrifice of praise to God, namely, the utterance of lips that give thanks to His Name.
30258	58	13	16	 And do not forget to be kind and liberal; for with sacrifices of that sort God is greatly pleased.
30259	58	13	17	 Obey your leaders and be submissive to them. For they are keeping watch over your souls as those who will have to give account; that they may do this with joy and not with lamentation. For that would be of no advantage to you.
30260	58	13	18	 Keep on praying for us; for  we are sure that we have clear consciences, and we desire to live nobly in every respect.
30261	58	13	19	 I specially urge this upon you in order that I may be the more speedily restored to you.
30262	58	13	20	 Now may God who gives peace, and brought Jesus, our Lord, up again from among the dead--even Him who, by virtue of the blood of the eternal Covenant, is the great Shepherd of the sheep--
30263	58	13	21	 fully equip you with every grace that you may need for the doing of His will, producing in us that which will truly please Him through Jesus Christ. To Him be the glory to the Ages of the Ages! Amen.
30264	58	13	22	 Bear with me, brethren, when I thus exhort you; for, in fact, it is but a short letter that I have written to you.
30265	58	13	23	  You will rejoice to hear that our brother Timothy has been set at liberty. If he comes soon, I will see you with him.
30266	58	13	24	 Greet all your leaders and all God's people. The brethren from Italy send you greetings.
30267	58	13	25	 Grace be with you all! Amen.
30268	59	1	1	 James, a bondservant of God and of the Lord Jesus Christ: to the  twelve tribes who are scattered over the world. All good wishes.
30269	59	1	2	 Reckon it nothing but joy, my brethren, whenever you find yourselves hedged in by various  trials.
30270	59	1	3	 Be assured that the testing of your faith leads to power of endurance.
30271	59	1	4	 Only let endurance have perfect results so that you may become perfect and complete, deficient in nothing.
30272	59	1	5	 And if any one of you is deficient in wisdom, let him ask God for it, who gives with open hand to all men, and without upbraiding; and it will be given him.
30273	59	1	6	 But let him ask in faith and have no doubts; for he who has doubts is like the surge of the sea, driven by the wind and tossed into spray.
30274	59	1	7	 A person of that sort must not expect  to receive anything from the Lord--
30275	59	1	8	 such a one is a man of two minds, undecided in every step he takes.
30276	59	1	9	 Let a brother in humble life rejoice when raised to a higher position;
30277	59	1	10	 but a rich man should rejoice in being brought low, for like flowers among the herbage rich men will pass away.
30278	59	1	11	 The sun rises with his scorching heat and dries up the herbage, so that its flowers drop off and the beauty of its appearance perishes, and in the same way rich men with all their prosperity will fade away.
30279	59	1	12	 Blessed is he who patiently endures  trials; for when he has stood the test, he will gain the victor's crown--even the  crown of Life--which the Lord has promised to those who love Him.
30280	59	1	13	 Let no one say when passing through  trial, "My temptation is from God;" for God is incapable of being tempted to do evil, and He Himself tempts no one.
30281	59	1	14	 But when a man is tempted, it is his own passions that carry him away and  serve as a bait.
30282	59	1	15	 Then  the passion conceives, and becomes the parent of sin; and sin,  when fully matured, gives birth to death.
30283	59	1	16	 Do not be deceived, my dearly-loved brethren.
30284	59	1	17	 Every gift which is good, and every perfect boon, is from above, and comes down from the Father, who is the source of all Light. In Him there is no variation nor the slightest suggestion of change.
30285	59	1	18	 In accordance with His will He made us His children through the Message of the truth, so that we might, in a sense, be the Firstfruits of the things which He has created.
30286	59	1	19	 You know this, my dearly-loved brethren. But let every one be quick to hear, slow to speak, and slow to be angry.
30287	59	1	20	 For a man's anger does not lead to action which God regards as righteous.
30288	59	1	21	  Ridding yourselves, therefore, of all that is vile and of the evil influences which prevail around you, welcome in a humble spirit the Message implanted within you, which is able to save your souls.
30289	59	1	22	 But prove yourselves obedient to the Message, and do not be mere hearers of it, imposing a delusion upon yourselves.
30290	59	1	23	 For if any one listens but does not obey, he is like a man who carefully looks at  his own face in a mirror.
30291	59	1	24	 Although he  has looked carefully at himself, he goes away, and has immediately forgotten the sort of man  he is.
30292	59	1	25	 But he who  looks closely into the perfect Law--the Law of freedom--and continues looking, he, being not a hearer who forgets, but an obedient doer, will as the result of his obedience be blessed.
30293	59	1	26	 If a man  thinks that he is scrupulously religious, although he is not curbing his tongue but is deceiving  himself, his religious service is worthless.
30294	59	1	27	 The religious service which is pure and stainless in the sight of our God and Father is to visit fatherless children and widowed women in their time of trouble, and to keep one's own self unspotted from the world.
30295	59	2	1	 My brethren, you must not  make distinctions between one man and another while you are striving to maintain faith in the Lord Jesus Christ,  who is our glory.
30296	59	2	2	 For suppose a man comes into one of your meetings wearing gold rings and fine clothes, and there also comes in a poor man wearing shabby clothes,
30297	59	2	3	 and you pay court to the one who wears the fine clothes, and say, "Sit here; this is a good place;" while to the poor man you say, "Stand there, or sit on the floor at my feet;"
30298	59	2	4	 is it not plain that in your hearts you  have little faith, seeing that you have become judges full of wrong thoughts?
30299	59	2	5	 Listen, my dearly-loved brethren. Has not God chosen those whom the world regards as poor to be rich in faith and heirs of  the Kingdom which He has promised to those that love Him?
30300	59	2	6	 But *you* have put dishonour upon the poor man. Yet is it not the rich who grind you down? Are not they the very people who drag you into the Law courts? --
30301	59	2	7	 and the very people who speak evil of the noble Name by which you are called?
30302	59	2	8	 If, however, you are keeping the Law  as supreme, in obedience to the Commandment which says <"You are to love your fellow man just as you love yourself,"> you are acting rightly.
30303	59	2	9	 But if you are making distinctions between one man and another, you are guilty of sin, and are convicted by the Law as offenders.
30304	59	2	10	 A man who has kept the Law as a whole, but has  failed to keep some one command, has become guilty of violating all.
30305	59	2	11	 For He who said, <"Do not commit adultery,"> also said, <"Do not commit murder,"> and if you are a murderer, although not an adulterer, you have become an offender against the Law.
30306	59	2	12	 Speak and act as those should who are expecting to be judged by the Law of freedom.
30307	59	2	13	 For he who shows no mercy will have judgement given against him without mercy; but mercy triumphs over judgement.
30308	59	2	14	 What good is it, my brethren, if a man professes to have faith, and yet his actions do not correspond? Can such faith save him?
30309	59	2	15	 Suppose a Christian brother or sister is poorly clad or lacks daily food,
30310	59	2	16	 and one of you says  to them,  "I wish you well;  keep yourselves warm and well fed," and yet you do not give them what they need; what is the use of that?
30311	59	2	17	 So also faith, if it is unaccompanied by obedience, has no life in it--so long as it stands alone.
30312	59	2	18	 Nay, some one will say, "You have faith, I have actions: prove to me your faith apart from corresponding actions and I will prove mine to you by my actions.
30313	59	2	19	 You believe that  God is one, and you are quite right: evil spirits also believe this, and shudder."
30314	59	2	20	 But, idle boaster, are you willing to be taught how it is that faith apart from obedience is worthless? Take the case of Abraham our forefather.
30315	59	2	21	 Was it, or was it not, because of his actions that he was declared to be righteous as the result of his having offered up his son Isaac upon the altar?
30316	59	2	22	  You notice that his faith was co-operating with his actions, and that by his actions his faith was perfected;
30317	59	2	23	 and the Scripture was fulfilled which says, <"And Abraham believed God, and his faith was placed to his credit as righteousness,"> and he received the name of `God's friend.'
30318	59	2	24	 You all see that it is because of actions that a man is pronounced righteous, and not simply because of faith.
30319	59	2	25	 In the same way also was not the notorious sinner Rahab declared to be righteous because of her actions when she welcomed the  spies and hurriedly helped them to escape another way?
30320	59	2	26	 For  just as a human body without a spirit is lifeless, so also faith is lifeless if it is unaccompanied by obedience.
30321	59	3	1	 Do not be eager, my brethren, for many among you to become teachers; for you know that we teachers shall undergo severer judgement.
30322	59	3	2	 For we often  stumble and fall, all of us. If there is any one who never stumbles in speech, that man has reached maturity of character and is able to curb his whole nature.
30323	59	3	3	  Remember that we put the horses' bit into their mouths to make them obey us, and so we turn their whole bodies round.
30324	59	3	4	 So too with ships, great as they are, and often driven along by strong gales, yet they can be steered with a very small rudder in whichever direction the caprice of the man at the helm chooses.
30325	59	3	5	 In the same way the tongue is an insignificant part of the body, but it is immensely boastful. Remember how a mere spark may set a vast  forest in flames.
30326	59	3	6	 And the tongue is a fire. That world of iniquity, the tongue, is placed within us  spotting and soiling our whole nature, and setting the whole round of our lives on fire, being itself set on fire by Gehenna.
30327	59	3	7	 For brute nature under all its forms--beasts and birds, reptiles and fishes--can be subjected and  kept in subjection by human nature.
30328	59	3	8	 But the tongue no man or woman is able to tame. It is an ever-busy mischief, and is full of deadly poison.
30329	59	3	9	 With it we bless the Lord and Father, and with it we curse men, who  are made in God's likeness.
30330	59	3	10	 Out of the same mouth there proceed blessing and cursing. My brethren, this ought not to be.
30331	59	3	11	 In a fountain, are fresh water and bitter sent forth from the same opening?
30332	59	3	12	  Can a fig-tree, my brethren, yield olives, or a vine yield figs? No; and neither can salt water yield sweet.
30333	59	3	13	 Which of you is a wise and well-instructed man? Let him prove it by a right life with conduct guided by a wisely teachable spirit.
30334	59	3	14	 But if in your hearts you have bitter feelings of envy and rivalry, do not speak boastfully and falsely, in defiance of the truth.
30335	59	3	15	  That is not the wisdom which comes down from above: it belongs to earth, to the  unspiritual nature, and to evil spirits.
30336	59	3	16	 For where envy and rivalry are, there also are unrest and every vile deed.
30337	59	3	17	 The wisdom from above is first of all pure, then peaceful, courteous, not self-willed, full of compassion and kind actions,  free from favouritism and from all insincerity.
30338	59	3	18	  And peace, for those who strive for peace, is the seed of which the harvest is righteousness.
30339	59	4	1	 What causes wars and contentions  among you? Is it not the cravings which are ever at war within you for various pleasures?
30340	59	4	2	  You covet things and yet cannot get them; you commit murder; you have passionate desires and yet cannot gain your end; you begin to fight and make war. You have not, because you do not pray;
30341	59	4	3	 or you pray and yet do not receive, because you pray wrongly, your object being to waste what you get on some pleasure or another.
30342	59	4	4	  You unfaithful women, do you not know that friendship with the world means enmity to God? Therefore whoever is bent on being friendly with the world makes himself an enemy to God.
30343	59	4	5	 Or do you suppose that it is to no purpose that the Scripture says, "The Spirit which  He has caused to dwell in our hearts yearns jealously  over us"?
30344	59	4	6	 But He gives more abundant grace, as is implied in His saying, <"God sets Himself against the haughty, but to the lowly He gives grace.">
30345	59	4	7	 Submit therefore to God: resist the Devil, and he will flee from you.
30346	59	4	8	 Draw near to God, and He will draw near to you. Cleanse your hands, you sinners, and make your hearts pure, you who are half-hearted towards God.
30347	59	4	9	 Afflict yourselves and mourn and weep aloud; let your laughter be turned into grief, and your gladness into shame.
30348	59	4	10	 Humble yourselves in the presence of the Lord, and He will exalt you.
30349	59	4	11	 Do not speak evil of one another, brethren. The man who speaks evil of a brother-man or judges his brother-man speaks evil of the Law and judges the Law. But if you judge the Law, you are no longer one who obeys the Law, but one who judges it.
30350	59	4	12	 The only real Lawgiver and Judge is He who is able to save or to destroy. Who are you to sit in judgement on your fellow man?
30351	59	4	13	 Come, you who say, "To-day or to-morrow we will go to this or that city, and spend a year there and carry on a successful business,"
30352	59	4	14	 when, all the while, you do not even know what will happen to-morrow. For what is the nature of your life? Why, it is but a mist, which appears for a short time and then is seen no more.
30353	59	4	15	 Instead of that you ought to say, "If it is the Lord's will, we shall live and do this or that."
30354	59	4	16	 But, as the case stands, it is in mere self-confidence that you boast: all such boasting is evil.
30355	59	4	17	 If,  however, a man knows what it is right to do and yet does not do it, he commits a sin.
30356	59	5	1	 Come, you rich men, weep aloud and howl for your sorrows which will soon be upon you.
30357	59	5	2	 Your treasures  have rotted, and your piles of clothing  are moth-eaten;
30358	59	5	3	 your gold and your silver have become covered with rust, and the rust on them will give evidence against you, and will eat your flesh like fire. You have hoarded up wealth in  these last days.
30359	59	5	4	 I tell you that the pay of the labourers who have gathered in your crops--pay which you are keeping back--is calling out against you; and the outcries of those who have been your reapers have entered into the ears of the Lord of the armies of Heaven.
30360	59	5	5	 Here on earth you have lived self-indulgent and profligate lives. You have  stupefied yourselves with gross feeding; but a day of slaughter has come.
30361	59	5	6	 You have condemned--you have murdered--  the righteous man: he offers no resistance.
30362	59	5	7	  Be patient therefore, brethren, until the Coming of the Lord. Notice how eagerly a farmer waits for a valuable crop! He is patient over it till it has received the early and the later rain.
30363	59	5	8	 So you also must be patient: keeping up your courage; for the Coming of the Lord is now close at hand.
30364	59	5	9	 Do not cry out in condemnation of one another, brethren, lest you come under judgement. I tell you that the Judge is standing at the door.
30365	59	5	10	 In illustration, brethren, of persecution patiently endured take the Prophets who have spoken as messengers from the Lord.
30366	59	5	11	 Remember that we call those blessed who endured what they did. You have also heard of Job's patient endurance, and have seen the issue of the Lord's dealings with him--how full of tenderness and pity the Lord is.
30367	59	5	12	 But above all things, my brethren,  do not swear, either by Heaven or by the earth, or with any other oath. Let your `yes' be simply `yes,' and your `no' be simply `no;' that you may not come under condemnation.
30368	59	5	13	 Is one of you suffering? Let him pray. Is any one in good spirits? Let him sing a psalm.
30369	59	5	14	 Is any one ill? Let him send for the Elders of the Church, and let them pray over him,  after anointing him with oil in the name of the Lord.
30370	59	5	15	 And the prayer of faith will restore the sick man, and the Lord will raise him up to health; and if he  has committed sins, they shall be forgiven.
30371	59	5	16	 Therefore  confess your sins to one another, and pray for one another, so that you may be cured. The  heartfelt supplication of a righteous man exerts a mighty influence.
30372	59	5	17	 Elijah was a man with a nature similar to ours, and he earnestly prayed that there might be no rain: and no rain fell on the land for three years and six months.
30373	59	5	18	 Again he prayed, and the sky gave rain and the land yielded its crops.
30374	59	5	19	 My brethren, if one of you strays from the truth and some one brings him back,
30375	59	5	20	  let him know that he who brings a sinner back from his evil ways will save the man's soul from death and throw a veil over a multitude of sins.
30376	60	1	1	 Peter, an Apostle of Jesus Christ: To God's own people scattered over the earth, who are living as foreigners in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia,  Roman Asia, and Bithynia,
30377	60	1	2	 chosen in accordance with the foreknowledge of God the Father, through the sanctifying work of the Spirit, with a view to their obedience and to their being sprinkled with the blood of Jesus Christ. May more and more grace and peace be granted to you.
30378	60	1	3	 Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ, who in His great mercy has begotten us anew to an  ever-living hope through the resurrection of Jesus Christ from the dead,
30379	60	1	4	 to an inheritance imperishable, undefiled and unfading, which has been reserved in Heaven for you,
30380	60	1	5	 whom God in His power is guarding through faith for a salvation that even now stands ready for unveiling  at the End of the Age.
30381	60	1	6	  Rejoice triumphantly  in the prospect of this, even if now,  for a short time, you are compelled to sorrow amid various trials.
30382	60	1	7	 The sorrow comes in order that the testing of your faith--being more  precious than that of gold, which perishes and yet  is proved by fire--may be found to result in praise and glory and honour at the re-appearing of Jesus Christ.
30383	60	1	8	 Him you love, though  your eyes have never looked on Him. In Him, though at present you cannot see Him, you nevertheless trust, and triumph with a joy which is unspeakable and is crowned with glory,
30384	60	1	9	 while you are securing as the outcome of your faith the  salvation of your souls.
30385	60	1	10	 There were Prophets who earnestly inquired about that salvation, and closely searched into it--even those who spoke beforehand of the grace which was to come to you.
30386	60	1	11	 They were eager to know the time which the Spirit of Christ within them kept indicating, or the characteristics of that time, when they solemnly made known beforehand the sufferings that were to come upon Christ and the glories which would follow.
30387	60	1	12	 To them it was revealed that they were serving not themselves but you, when they foretold the very things which have now been openly declared to you  by those who, having been taught by the Holy Spirit which had been sent from Heaven, brought you the Good News. Angels long to  stoop and look into these things.
30388	60	1	13	 Therefore gird up your minds and fix your hopes calmly and unfalteringly upon the boon that is soon to be yours, at the re-appearing of Jesus Christ.
30389	60	1	14	 And, since you delight in obedience, do not shape your lives by the cravings which used to dominate you in the time of your ignorance,
30390	60	1	15	 but--in imitation of the holy One who has called you--you also must be holy in all your habits of life.
30391	60	1	16	 Because it stands written, <"You are to be holy, because I am holy.">
30392	60	1	17	 And if you address as your Father Him who judges  impartially in accordance with each man's actions, then spend in fear the time of your stay here on earth,
30393	60	1	18	 knowing, as you do, that it was not with a ransom of perishable wealth, such as silver or gold, that you were set free from your frivolous habits of life which had been handed down to you from your forefathers,
30394	60	1	19	 but with the precious blood of Christ--as of an  unblemished and spotless lamb.
30395	60	1	20	 He was pre-destined indeed to this work, even before the creation of the world, but has been plainly manifested  in these last days for the sake of you who, through Him,
30396	60	1	21	  are faithful to God, who raised Him from among the dead and gave Him glory, so that  your faith and hope are resting upon God.
30397	60	1	22	 Now that, through your obedience to the truth, you  have purified your souls for cherishing sincere brotherly love, you must love another heartily and fervently.
30398	60	1	23	 For you have been begotten again by God's  ever-living and enduring word from a germ not of perishable, but of imperishable life.
30399	60	1	24	 <"All mankind  resemble the herbage, and all their beauty is like its flowers. The herbage dries up, and its flowers drop off;
30400	60	1	25	 But the word of the Lord remains for ever."> And that means the Message which has been proclaimed among you in the Good News.
30401	60	2	1	 Rid yourselves therefore of all  ill-will and all deceitfulness, of insincerity and envy, and of all evil speaking.
30402	60	2	2	 Thirst,  like newly-born infants, for pure milk for the soul, that by it you may  grow up to salvation;
30403	60	2	3	 if you have had any experience of the goodness of the Lord.
30404	60	2	4	 Come to Him, the ever-living Stone, rejected indeed by men as worthless, but in God's esteem chosen and  held in honour.
30405	60	2	5	 And be yourselves also like living stones that are being built up into a spiritual house, to become a holy priesthood to offer spiritual sacrifices acceptable to God through Jesus Christ.
30406	60	2	6	 For it is contained in Scripture, <"See, I am placing on Mount Zion a Cornerstone, chosen, and held in honour, and he whose faith rests on Him shall never have reason to feel ashamed.">
30407	60	2	7	 To you believers, therefore, that honour belongs; but for unbelievers-- <"A Stone which the builders rejected has been made the Cornerstone,">
