30408	60	2	8	 and <"a Stone for the foot to strike against, and a Rock to stumble over."> Their foot strikes against it because they are disobedient to God's Message, and to this they were appointed.
30409	60	2	9	 But you are a chosen race, a priesthood of kingly lineage, a holy nation, a people belonging specially to God, that you may  make known the perfections of Him who called you out of darkness into His marvellous light.
30410	60	2	10	 Once you were not a people, but now you are the people of God. Once you had not found mercy, but now you have.
30411	60	2	11	 Dear friends, I entreat you as pilgrims and foreigners not to indulge the cravings of your lower natures: for all such cravings wage war upon the  soul.
30412	60	2	12	 Live honourable lives among the Gentiles, in order that, although they now speak against you as evil-doers, they may yet witness your good conduct, and may glorify God on the  day of reward and retribution.
30413	60	2	13	 Submit, for the Lord's sake, to every authority set up by man, whether it be to the  Emperor as supreme ruler,
30414	60	2	14	 or to  provincial Governors as sent by  him for the punishment of evil-doers and the encouragement of those who do what is right.
30415	60	2	15	 For it is God's will that by doing what is right you should thus  silence the  ignorant talk of foolish persons.
30416	60	2	16	 Be free men, and yet do not make your freedom  an excuse for base conduct, but be God's bondservants.
30417	60	2	17	 Honour every one. Love the brotherhood, fear God, honour the Emperor.
30418	60	2	18	 Household servants,  be submissive to your masters, and show them the utmost respect--not only if they are kind and thoughtful, but also if they are unreasonable.
30419	60	2	19	 For it is an acceptable thing with God, if, from a sense of duty to Him, a man patiently submits to wrong, when treated unjustly.
30420	60	2	20	  If you do wrong and receive  a blow for it,  what credit is there in your bearing it patiently? But if when you do right and suffer for it you bear it patiently, this is an acceptable thing with God.
30421	60	2	21	 And it is to this you were called; because Christ also suffered on your behalf, leaving you an example so that you should follow in His steps.
30422	60	2	22	 He never sinned, and no deceitful language was ever heard from His mouth.
30423	60	2	23	 When He was reviled, He did not answer with reviling; when He suffered He uttered no threats, but left  His wrongs in the hands of the righteous Judge.
30424	60	2	24	 The burden of our sins He Himself carried in His own body to the Cross and bore it there, so that we, having died so far as our sins are concerned, may live righteous lives. By His  wounds yours have been healed.
30425	60	2	25	 For you were straying like lost sheep, but now you have come back to the Shepherd and  Protector of your souls.
30426	60	3	1	 Married women, in the same way,  be submissive to your husbands, so that even if some of them  disbelieve the Message, they may,  apart from the Message, be won over by the daily life of their wives, after watching your daily life--
30427	60	3	2	 so full of reverence, and so blameless!
30428	60	3	3	 Your adornment ought not to be a merely outward thing--one of plaiting the hair,  putting on jewelry, or wearing beautiful dresses.
30429	60	3	4	 Instead of that, it should be  a new nature within--the imperishable ornament of a gentle and peaceful spirit, which is indeed precious in the sight of God.
30430	60	3	5	 For in ancient times also this was the way the holy women who set their hopes upon God used to adorn themselves, being submissive to their husbands.
30431	60	3	6	 Thus, for instance, Sarah obeyed Abraham,  acknowledging his authority over her. And you have become Sarah's children if you do what is right and permit nothing whatever to terrify you.
30432	60	3	7	 Married men, in the same way, live with your wives  with a clear recognition of the fact that they are weaker than you. Yet, since you are heirs with them of God's free gift of Life, treat them with honour; so that your prayers may not be hindered.
30433	60	3	8	 In conclusion, all of you should be of one mind, quick  to sympathize, kind to the brethren, tenderhearted, lowly-minded,
30434	60	3	9	 not requiting evil with evil nor abuse with abuse, but, on the contrary, giving a blessing in return, because a blessing is what you have been called by God to inherit.
30435	60	3	10	 For <"He who wishes to be well-satisfied with life and see happy days--  let him restrain his tongue from evil, and his lips from deceitful words;
30436	60	3	11	 Let him turn from evil, and do good; Let him inquire for peace and go in pursuit of it.
30437	60	3	12	 For the eyes of the Lord are upon the righteous, and His ears are open to their supplication; but the face of the Lord is set against evil-doers.">
30438	60	3	13	 And who will be able to harm you, if you show yourselves zealous for that which is good?
30439	60	3	14	 But even if you suffer for righteousness' sake, you are to be envied. So do not be alarmed by  their threats, nor troubled;
30440	60	3	15	  but in your hearts consecrate Christ as Lord, being always ready to make your defence to any one who asks from you a reason for the hope which you cherish.
30441	60	3	16	 Yet argue modestly and cautiously, keeping your consciences free from guilt, so that, when you are spoken against, those who slander your good Christian lives may be put to shame.
30442	60	3	17	 For it is better that you should suffer for doing right, if such be God's will, than for doing evil;
30443	60	3	18	 because Christ also once for all  died for sins, the innocent One for the guilty many, in order to bring us to God. He was put to death in the flesh, but made alive in the spirit,
30444	60	3	19	 in which  He also went and proclaimed His Message to the spirits that were in prison,
30445	60	3	20	 who in ancient times had been disobedient,  while God's longsuffering was patiently waiting in the days of Noah during the building of the Ark,  in which a few persons--eight in number--were brought safely through the water.
30446	60	3	21	 And, corresponding to that figure, the water of baptism now saves you--not the washing off of material defilement, but the craving of a good conscience after God--through the resurrection of Jesus Christ,
30447	60	3	22	 who is at God's right hand, having gone into Heaven, angels and authorities and powers having been made subject to Him.
30448	60	4	1	 Since, then, Christ has suffered in the flesh, you also must arm yourselves with a determination to do the same--because he who has suffered in the flesh  has done with sin--
30449	60	4	2	 that in future you may spend the rest of your earthly lives, governed not by human passions, but by the will of God.
30450	60	4	3	 For you have given time enough in the past to the doing of the things which the Gentiles delight in--  pursuing, as you did, a course of  habitual licence, debauchery, hard drinking, noisy revelry, drunkenness and unholy image-worship.
30451	60	4	4	 At this they are astonished--that you do not run into the same excess of profligacy as they do; and they speak abusively of you.
30452	60	4	5	 But they will have to give account to Him who stands ready to pronounce judgement on  the living and the dead.
30453	60	4	6	 For it is with this end in view that  the Good News was proclaimed even to some who were dead, that they may be judged, as all mankind will be judged, in the body, but may be living a godly life in the spirit.
30454	60	4	7	 But the end of all things is now close at hand: therefore be sober-minded and temperate, so that you may give yourselves to prayer.
30455	60	4	8	 Above all continue to love one another fervently, for love throws a veil over a multitude of faults.
30456	60	4	9	 Extend ungrudging hospitality towards one another.
30457	60	4	10	 Whatever be the gifts which each has received, you must use them for one another's benefit, as good stewards of God's many-sided kindness.
30458	60	4	11	 If any one preaches, let it be as uttering God's truth; if any one renders a service to others, let it be in the strength which God supplies; so that in everything glory may be given to God in the name of Jesus Christ, to whom belong the glory and the might to the Ages of the Ages. Amen.
30459	60	4	12	 Dear friends, do not be surprised at finding that that scorching flame of persecution is raging among you to put you to the test--as though some surprising thing were accidentally happening to you.
30460	60	4	13	 On the contrary, in the degree that you share in the sufferings of the Christ, rejoice, so that at the unveiling of His glory you may also rejoice with triumphant gladness.
30461	60	4	14	 You are to be envied, if you are being reproached for bearing the name of Christ; for in that case the Spirit of glory--  even the Spirit of God--is resting upon you.
30462	60	4	15	  But let not one of you suffer as a murderer or a thief or an evil-doer, or as a spy upon other people's business.
30463	60	4	16	 If, however, any one suffers because he is a Christian, let him not be ashamed, but let him glorify God  for being permitted to bear that name.
30464	60	4	17	 For the time has come for judgement to begin, and to begin at the house of God; and if it begins with us, what will be the end of those who reject God's Good News?
30465	60	4	18	 And if it is difficult even for a righteous man to be saved, what will become of irreligious men and sinners?
30466	60	4	19	 Therefore also, let those who are suffering in accordance with the will of God  entrust their  souls in well-doing to a faithful Creator.
30467	60	5	1	 So I exhort the Elders among you--I who am their fellow Elder and have been an eye-witness of the sufferings of the Christ, and am also a sharer in the glory which is soon to be revealed.
30468	60	5	2	 Be shepherds of God's flock which is among you.  Exercise the oversight not reluctantly but eagerly, in accordance with the will of God; not for base gain but with cheerful minds;
30469	60	5	3	 not lording it over  your Churches but proving yourselves patterns for the flock to imitate.
30470	60	5	4	 And then, when the chief Shepherd appears, you will receive the never-withering wreath of glory.
30471	60	5	5	 In the same way you younger men must submit to your elders; and all of you must  gird yourselves with humility towards one another, for God sets Himself against the proud, but gives grace to the humble.
30472	60	5	6	 Humble yourselves therefore beneath the mighty hand of God, so that at the right time He may set you on high.
30473	60	5	7	 Throw the whole of your anxiety upon Him, because He Himself cares for you.
30474	60	5	8	 Curb every passion, and  be on the alert. Your  great accuser, the Devil, is going about like a roaring lion to see whom he can devour.
30475	60	5	9	 Withstand him, firm in your faith; knowing that your brethren in other parts of the world are passing through just the same experiences.
30476	60	5	10	 And God, the giver of all grace, who has called you to share His eternal glory, through Christ, after you have suffered for a short time, will Himself make you perfect, firm, and strong.
30477	60	5	11	 To Him be all power unto the Ages of the Ages! Amen.
30478	60	5	12	 I send this short letter by  Silas, our faithful brother--for such I regard him--in order to encourage you, and to bear witness that  what I have told you is the true grace of God. In it stand fast.
30479	60	5	13	  The Church in  Babylon, chosen like yourselves by God, sends greetings, and so does Mark my son.
30480	60	5	14	 Greet one another with a kiss of love. Peace be with all of you who are in Christ.
30481	61	1	1	  Simon Peter, a bondservant and Apostle of Jesus Christ: To those to whom there has been allotted the same precious faith as that which is ours through the righteousness  of our God and of our Saviour Jesus Christ.
30482	61	1	2	 May more and more grace and peace be granted to you  in a full knowledge of God and of Jesus our Lord,
30483	61	1	3	 seeing that His divine power has given us all things that are needful for life and godliness, through our knowledge of Him who has appealed to us  by His own glorious perfections.
30484	61	1	4	 It is by means of these that He has granted us His precious and  wondrous promises, in order that through them you may,  one and all, become sharers in the very nature of God, having completely escaped the corruption which exists in the world through earthly cravings.
30485	61	1	5	 But for this very reason--adding, on your part, all earnestness--  along with your faith,  manifest  also  a noble character: along with a noble character, knowledge;
30486	61	1	6	 along with knowledge,  self-control; along with self-control, power of endurance;
30487	61	1	7	 along with power of endurance, godliness; along with godliness, brotherly affection; and along with brotherly affection, love.
30488	61	1	8	 If these things exist in you, and continually increase, they prevent your being either idle or unfruitful in advancing towards a full knowledge of our Lord Jesus Christ.
30489	61	1	9	 For the man in whom they are lacking is blind and cannot see distant objects,  in that he has forgotten that he has been cleansed from his old sins.
30490	61	1	10	 For this reason, brethren, be all the more in earnest to  make sure that God has called you and chosen you; for it is certain that so long as you practise these things, you will never stumble.
30491	61	1	11	 And so  a triumphant admission into the eternal Kingdom of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ will be freely granted to you.
30492	61	1	12	 For this reason I shall always persist in reminding you of these things, although you know them and are stedfast believers in truth which you already possess.
30493	61	1	13	 But I think it right, so long as I remain in  the body, my present dwelling-place, to arouse you by such reminders.
30494	61	1	14	 For I know that the time for me to lay aside  my body is now rapidly drawing near, even as our Lord Jesus Christ has revealed to me.
30495	61	1	15	 So  on every possible occasion I will  also do my best to enable you to recall these things after my departure.
30496	61	1	16	 For when we made known to you the power and Coming of our Lord Jesus Christ, we were not eagerly following cleverly devised legends, but we had been eye-witnesses of His majesty.
30497	61	1	17	 He received honour and glory from God the Father, and out of the wondrous glory words such as these were  spoken to Him, "This is My dearly-loved Son, in whom  I take delight."
30498	61	1	18	 And we ourselves heard these words  come from Heaven, when we were with Him on the holy mountain.
30499	61	1	19	 And in the written word of prophecy we have  something more permanent; to which  you do well to pay attention--as to a lamp shining in a dimly-lighted place--until day dawns and the morning star rises in your hearts.
30500	61	1	20	 But, above all, remember that no prophecy in Scripture will be found to have come from the prophet's own prompting;
30501	61	1	21	 for never did any prophecy come by human will, but  men sent by God spoke as they were  impelled by the Holy Spirit.
30502	61	2	1	 But there were also false prophets among the people, as there will be teachers of falsehood among you also, who will cunningly introduce fatal  divisions, disowning even the Sovereign Lord who has redeemed them,  and bringing on themselves swift destruction.
30503	61	2	2	 And in their immoral ways they will have many eager disciples, through whom religion will be brought into disrepute.
30504	61	2	3	 Thirsting for riches, they will trade on you with their canting talk. From of old their judgement  has been working itself out, and their destruction  has not been slumbering.
30505	61	2	4	 For God did not spare angels when they had sinned, but hurling them down to Tartarus consigned them to  caves of darkness, keeping them in readiness for judgement.
30506	61	2	5	 And He did not spare the ancient world, although He preserved Noah, a herald of righteousness, with seven others, when He brought a deluge on the world of the ungodly.
30507	61	2	6	 He reduced to ashes the cities of Sodom and Gomorrah, and condemned them to overthrow, making them an example to people who might  in future be living godless lives.
30508	61	2	7	 But when righteous Lot was sore distressed by the gross misconduct of immoral men He rescued him.
30509	61	2	8	 (For their lawless deeds were torture, day after day, to the pure soul of that righteous man--all that he saw and heard whilst living in their midst.)
30510	61	2	9	 Since all this is so, the Lord knows how to rescue godly men from temptation, and on the other hand how to keep the unrighteous under punishment in readiness for the Day of Judgement,
30511	61	2	10	 and especially those who are abandoned to sensuality--craving, as they do, for polluted things, and scorning control.  Fool-hardy and self-willed, they do not tremble when speaking evil of glorious beings;
30512	61	2	11	 while angels, though greater than they in might and power, do not bring any insulting accusation against such  in the presence of the Lord.
30513	61	2	12	 But these men, like brute beasts, created (with their natural instincts) only to be captured  or destroyed, are abusive in matters of which they are ignorant, and in their corruption will perish,
30514	61	2	13	 being  doomed to receive a requital for their guilt. They reckon it pleasure to feast daintily in broad  daylight. They are spots and blemishes, while feeding luxuriously at their  love-feasts, and banqueting with you.
30515	61	2	14	  Their very eyes are full of adultery--being eyes which never cease from sin. These men set traps to catch unstedfast souls, their own hearts being well trained in greed.  They are fore-doomed to God's curse!
30516	61	2	15	  Forsaking the straight road, they have gone astray,  having eagerly followed in the steps of Balaam, the son of Beor, who was bent on securing the wages of unrighteousness.
30517	61	2	16	 But he was rebuked for his transgression: a dumb  ass spoke with a human voice and checked the madness of the Prophet.
30518	61	2	17	 These people are wells without water, mists driven along by a storm, men for whom the dense darkness has been reserved.
30519	61	2	18	 For, while they pour out their frivolous and arrogant talk, they use earthly cravings--every kind of immorality--as a  bait to entrap men who are just escaping from the influence of those who live in error.
30520	61	2	19	 And  they promise them freedom, although they are themselves the slaves of what is corrupt. For a man is the slave of  any one by whom he has been worsted in fight.
30521	61	2	20	 For if, after escaping from the pollutions of the world through a full knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ, people are once more entangled in these pollutions and are overcome, their last state has become worse than their first.
30522	61	2	21	 For it would have been better for them not to have fully known the way of righteousness, than, after knowing it, to turn back from the holy commandments in which they were instructed.
30523	61	2	22	 Their case is that described in the true proverb, <"A dog returns to what he has vomited,"> and also in the other proverb, "The sow has washed itself and now goes back to roll  in its filth."
30524	61	3	1	 This letter which I am now writing to you, dear friends, is my second letter. In both my letters I seek to revive in your honest minds the memory of certain things,
30525	61	3	2	 so that you may recall the words spoken long ago by the holy Prophets, and the commandments of our Lord and Saviour given you through your Apostles.
30526	61	3	3	 But, above all, remember that, in  the last days, men will come who make a mock at everything--men governed only by their own passions,
30527	61	3	4	 and, asking, "What has become of His promised  Return? For from the time our forefathers fell asleep all things continue as they have been ever since the creation of the world."
30528	61	3	5	 For they are wilfully blind to the fact that there were heavens which existed of old, and an earth, the latter  arising out of water and extending continuously through water, by the command of God;
30529	61	3	6	 and that,  by means of these, the then existing race of men was overwhelmed with water and perished.
30530	61	3	7	 But the present heavens and the present earth are,  by the command of the same God, kept stored up, reserved for fire in preparation for  a day of judgement and of destruction for the ungodly.
30531	61	3	8	 But there is one thing, dear friends, which you must not forget. With the Lord  one day resembles a thousand years and a thousand years resemble one day.
30532	61	3	9	 The Lord is not slow in fulfilling His promise, in the sense in which some men speak of slowness. But He bears patiently with you, His desire being that no one should perish but that all should come to repentance.
30533	61	3	10	 The day of the Lord will come like a thief--it will be a day on which the heavens will pass away with a rushing noise, the elements be  destroyed in the fierce heat, and the earth and all the works of man be  utterly burnt up.
30534	61	3	11	  Since all these things are thus pre-destined to dissolution,  what sort of men ought you to be found to be in all holy living and godly conduct,
30535	61	3	12	  eagerly looking forward to the coming of the day of God, by reason of which the heavens, all ablaze,  will be destroyed, and the elements will melt in the fierce heat?
30536	61	3	13	 But in accordance with His promise we are expecting  new heavens and a new earth, in which righteousness will  dwell.
30537	61	3	14	 Therefore, dear friends, since you have these expectations, earnestly seek to be found in His presence, free from blemish or reproach, in peace.
30538	61	3	15	 And  always regard the patient forbearance of our Lord as salvation, as our dear brother Paul also has written to you in virtue of the wisdom granted to him.
30539	61	3	16	 That is what he says in all his letters, when speaking in them of these things. In those letters there are some statements hard to understand, which ill-taught and unprincipled people pervert, just as they do the rest of the Scriptures, to their own ruin.
30540	61	3	17	 You, therefore, dear friends, having been warned beforehand, must  continually be on your guard so as not to be led astray by the false teaching of immoral men nor fall from your own stedfastness.
30541	61	3	18	 But be  always growing in the grace and knowledge of our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ. To Him be all glory, both now and to the day  of Eternity!
30542	62	1	1	 That which was from the beginning, which  we have listened to, which  we have seen with our own eyes, and our own hands have handled concerning the Word of Life--
30543	62	1	2	 the Life was manifested, and we have seen and bear witness, and we declare unto you the Life of the Ages which was with the Father and was manifested to us--
30544	62	1	3	 that which we have seen and listened to we now announce to you also, in order that you also may have fellowship in it with us, and this fellowship with us is fellowship with the Father and with His Son Jesus Christ.
30545	62	1	4	 And we write these things in order that our joy may be made complete.
30546	62	1	5	 This is the  Message which we have heard from the Lord Jesus and  now deliver to you--God is Light, and in Him there is no darkness.
30547	62	1	6	 If, while we are living in darkness, we profess to have fellowship with Him, we speak falsely and are not adhering to the truth.
30548	62	1	7	 But if we live in the light as He is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus, His Son, cleanses us from all sin.
30549	62	1	8	 If we claim to be already free from sin, we lead ourselves astray and the truth has no place in our hearts.
30550	62	1	9	 If we confess our sins, He is so  faithful and just that He forgives us our sins and cleanses us from all unrighteousness.
30551	62	1	10	 If we deny that we have sinned, we make Him a liar, and His Message has no place in our hearts.
30552	62	2	1	  Dear children, I write thus to you in order that you may not sin. If any one sins, we have an Advocate with the Father--Jesus Christ the righteous;
30553	62	2	2	 and He is an atoning sacrifice for our sins, and not for ours only, but also for  the sins of the whole world.
30554	62	2	3	 And by this we may know that we know Him--if we obey His commands.
30555	62	2	4	 He who professes to know Him, and yet does not obey His commands, is a liar, and the truth has no place in his heart.
30556	62	2	5	 But whoever obeys His Message, in him love for God has in very deed reached perfection. By this we can know that we are in Him.
30557	62	2	6	 The man who professes to be continuing in Him is himself also bound to live as He lived.
30558	62	2	7	 My dearly-loved friends, it is no new command that I am now giving you, but an old command which you have had from the very beginning. By the old command I mean the teaching which you have already received.
30559	62	2	8	 And yet I *am* giving you a new command, for such it really is, so far as both He and you are concerned: because  the darkness is now passing away and the light, the true light, is already beginning to shine.
30560	62	2	9	 Any one who professes to be in the light and yet hates his  brother man is still in darkness.
30561	62	2	10	 He who loves his brother man continues in the light, and  his life puts no stumbling-block in the way of others.
30562	62	2	11	 But he who hates his brother man is in darkness and is walking in darkness; and he does not know where he is going--because the darkness has blinded his eyes.
30563	62	2	12	 I am writing to you, dear children, because for His sake your sins are forgiven you.
30564	62	2	13	 I am writing to you, fathers, because you know Him who has existed from the very beginning. I am writing to you, young men, because you have overcome the Evil one. I have written to you, children, because you know the Father.
30565	62	2	14	 I have written to you, fathers, because you know Him who has existed from the very beginning. I have written to you, young men, because you are strong and God's Message still has a place in your hearts, and you have overcome the Evil one.
30566	62	2	15	  Do not love the world, nor the things in the world. If any one loves the world, there is no love in his heart for the Father.
30567	62	2	16	 For the things in the world--the cravings of the earthly nature, the cravings of the eyes, the show and pride of life--they all come, not from the Father, but from the world.
30568	62	2	17	 And the world, with its cravings, is passing away, but he who does God's will continues  for ever.
30569	62	2	18	 Dear children,  the last hour has come; and as you once heard that there was to be  an anti-Christ, so even now many anti-Christs have appeared. By this we may know that the last hour has come.
30570	62	2	19	 They have gone forth from our midst, but they did not really belong to us; for had they belonged to us, they would have remained with us. But they left us that it might be manifest that  professed believers do not all belong to us.
30571	62	2	20	 As for you, you have an anointing from the holy One  and have perfect knowledge.
30572	62	2	21	 I have written to you, not because you are ignorant of the truth, but because you know it, and you know that nothing false comes from the truth.
30573	62	2	22	 Who is  a liar compared with  him who denies that Jesus is the Christ? He who disowns the Father and the Son  is the anti-Christ.
30574	62	2	23	 No one who disowns the Son has the Father. He who acknowledges the Son has also the Father.
30575	62	2	24	 As for you, let the teaching which you have received from the very beginning continue in your hearts. If that teaching does continue in your hearts, you also will continue to be in union with the Son and with the Father.
30576	62	2	25	 And this is the promise which He Himself has given us--the Life of the Ages.
30577	62	2	26	 I have thus written to you concerning those who are leading you astray.
30578	62	2	27	 And as for you, the anointing which you received from Him remains within you, and there is no need for any one to teach you. But since His anointing gives you instruction in all things--and is true and is no falsehood--you are continuing in union with Him even as it has taught you to do.
30579	62	2	28	 And now, dear children, continue in union with Him; so that,  if He re-appears, we may have perfect confidence, and may not shrink away in shame from His presence at His Coming.
30580	62	2	29	 Since you know that He is righteous, be assured also that the man who habitually acts righteously is  a child of His.
30581	62	3	1	 See  what marvellous love the Father has bestowed upon us--that we should be called God's children: and that is what we are. For this reason the world does not recognize us--because it has not known Him.
30582	62	3	2	 Dear friends, we are now God's children, but what we are to be in the future has not yet been fully revealed. We know that  if Christ reappears we shall be like Him, because we shall see Him as He is.
30583	62	3	3	 And every man who has this hope fixed on Him, purifies himself so as to be as pure as He is.
30584	62	3	4	 Every one who is guilty of sin is also guilty of violating Law; for sin is the violation of Law.
30585	62	3	5	 And you know that He  appeared in order  to take away sins; and in Him there is no sin.
30586	62	3	6	 No one who continues in union with Him  lives in sin: no one who lives in sin has seen Him or knows Him.
30587	62	3	7	 Dear children, let no one lead you astray. The man who acts righteously is righteous, just as He is righteous.
30588	62	3	8	 He who is  habitually guilty of sin  is a child of the Devil, because the Devil has been a sinner from the very beginning. The Son of God  appeared for the purpose of undoing the work of the Devil.
30589	62	3	9	 No one who is a child of God is  habitually guilty of sin. A God-given germ of life remains in him, and he  cannot  habitually sin--because he is a child of God.
30590	62	3	10	 By this we can distinguish God's children and the Devil's children: no one who fails to act righteously is a child of God, nor he who does not love his brother man.
30591	62	3	11	 For this is the Message you have heard from the beginning--that we are to love one another.
30592	62	3	12	 We are not to resemble Cain, who was a child of the Evil one and killed his own brother. And why did he kill him? Because his own actions were wicked and his brother's actions righteous.
30593	62	3	13	 Do not be surprised, brethren, if the world hates you.
30594	62	3	14	 As for us, we know that we have already passed out of death into Life--because we love our brother men. He who is destitute of love  continues dead.
30595	62	3	15	 Every one who hates his brother man is a murderer; and you know that no murderer has the Life of the Ages continuing in him.
30596	62	3	16	 We know what love is--through Christ's having laid down His life on our behalf; and in the same way we ought to lay down our lives for our brother men.
30597	62	3	17	 But if any one has this world's wealth and sees that his brother man is in need, and yet hardens his heart against him--how can such a one continue to love God?
30598	62	3	18	 Dear children, let us not love in words only nor with the lips, but in deed and in truth.
30599	62	3	19	 And in this way we shall come to know that we are loyal to the truth, and shall  satisfy our  consciences in His presence
30600	62	3	20	 in whatever matters our hearts condemn us--because God is greater than our hearts and knows everything.
30601	62	3	21	 Dear friends, if our hearts do not condemn us, we have perfect confidence towards God;
30602	62	3	22	 and whatever we ask for we obtain from Him, because we obey His commands and do the things which are pleasing in His sight.
30603	62	3	23	 And this is His command--that we are to  believe in His Son Jesus Christ and love one another, just as He has commanded us to do.
30604	62	3	24	 The man who obeys His commands continues in union with God, and God continues in union with him; and through His Spirit whom He has given us we can know that He continues in union with us.
30605	62	4	1	 Dear friends, do not believe every spirit, but put the spirits to the test to see whether they are from God; for many false teachers have gone out into the world.
30606	62	4	2	 The test by which you may recognize the Spirit of God is that every spirit which acknowledges that Jesus Christ has come as man is from God,
30607	62	4	3	 and that no spirit is from God which does not acknowledge this about Jesus. Such is the spirit of the anti-Christ; of whose coming you  have heard, and it is already in the world.
30608	62	4	4	 As for you, dear children, you are God's children, and have successfully resisted  them; for greater is He who is in you than he who is in the world.
30609	62	4	5	 They are the world's children, and so their language is that of the world, and the world listens to them. We are God's children.
30610	62	4	6	 The man who is beginning to know God listens to us, but he who is not a child of God does not listen to us. By this test we can distinguish the Spirit of truth from the spirit of error.
30611	62	4	7	 Dear friends, let us love one another; for love has its origin in God, and every one who loves has become a child of God and is beginning to know God.
30612	62	4	8	 He who is destitute of love has never had any knowledge of God; because God is love.
30613	62	4	9	 God's love for us  has been manifested in that He  has sent His  only Son into the world so that we may have Life through Him.
30614	62	4	10	 This is love indeed--we did not love God, but He loved us and sent His Son to be an atoning sacrifice for our sins.
30615	62	4	11	 Dear friends, if God has so loved us, we also ought to love one another.
30616	62	4	12	  No one has ever yet seen God. If we love one another, God continues in union with us, and His love in all its perfection is in our hearts.
30617	62	4	13	 We can know that we are continuing in union with Him and that He is continuing in union with us, by the fact that He has given us a portion of His Spirit.
30618	62	4	14	 And we have seen and bear witness that the Father has sent the Son to be the Saviour of the world.
30619	62	4	15	 Whoever acknowledges that Jesus is the Son of God--God continues in union with him, and he continues in union with God.
30620	62	4	16	 And, as for us, we know the love which God has for us, and we confide in it. God is love, and he who continues to love continues in union with God, and God continues in union with him.
30621	62	4	17	 Our love will be manifested in all its perfection by our having complete confidence on the day of the Judgement; because just  what He is, we also are in the world.
30622	62	4	18	 Love has in it no element of fear; but  perfect love drives away fear, because fear involves pain, and if a man gives way to fear, there is something imperfect in his love.
30623	62	4	19	  We love because God first loved us.
30624	62	4	20	 If any one says that he loves God, while he hates his brother man, he is a liar; for he who does not love his brother man whom he has seen,  cannot love God whom he has not seen.
30625	62	4	21	 And the command which we have from Him is that he who loves God must love his brother man also.
30626	62	5	1	 Every one who believes that  Jesus is the Christ  is a child of God; and every one who loves the Father loves also Him who is the Father's Child.
30627	62	5	2	 The fact that we love God Himself, and obey His commands, is a proof that we love God's children.
30628	62	5	3	 Love for God means obedience to His commands; and His commands are not irksome.
30629	62	5	4	 For  every child of God overcomes the world; and the victorious principle which has overcome the world is our faith.
30630	62	5	5	 Who but the man that believes that Jesus is the Son of God overcomes the world?
30631	62	5	6	 Jesus Christ is He who came  with water and blood; not with the water only, but  with the water and with the blood. And it is the Spirit who gives testimony--  because the Spirit is the Truth.
30632	62	5	7	 For there are  three that give testimony--  the Spirit, the water, and the blood;
30633	62	5	8	 and there is complete agreement between  these three.
30634	62	5	9	 If we accept the testimony of men, God's testimony is greater: for God's testimony consists of the things which He has testified about His Son.
30635	62	5	10	 He who believes in the Son of God has the testimony in his own heart: he who does not believe God has made Him a liar, in that he has refused to accept the testimony which God has given about His Son.
30636	62	5	11	 And that testimony is to the effect that God has given us the Life of the Ages, and that this Life is in His Son.
30637	62	5	12	 He who has the Son has the Life: he who has not the Son of God has not the Life.
30638	62	5	13	 I write all this to you in order that you who believe in the Son of God may know for certain that you already have the Life of the Ages.
30639	62	5	14	 And we have an assured confidence that whenever we ask anything in accordance with His will, He listens to us.
30640	62	5	15	 And since we know that He listens to us, then whatever we ask, we know that we have the things which we have asked from Him.
30641	62	5	16	 If any one sees a brother man committing a sin which is not unto death, he shall ask and God shall give him life--for those who do not sin unto death. There is such a thing as sin unto death; for that I do not bid him make request.
30642	62	5	17	 Any kind of wrongdoing is sin; but there is sin which is not unto death.
30643	62	5	18	 We know that no one who is a child of God lives in sin,  but He who is God's Child keeps him, and the Evil one cannot touch him.
30644	62	5	19	 We know that we are children of God, and that the whole world lies  in the power of the Evil one.
30645	62	5	20	 And we know that the Son of God has come, and has given us understanding so that we know the true One, and are in union with the true One--that is, we are in union with His Son Jesus Christ. He is the true God and the Life of the Ages.
30646	62	5	21	 Dear children, guard yourselves from idols.
30647	63	1	1	 The Elder  to the elect lady and her children. Truly I love you all, and not I alone, but also all who know the truth,
30648	63	1	2	 for the sake of the truth which is continually in our hearts and will be with us  for ever.
30649	63	1	3	 Grace, mercy and peace will be with us from God the Father, and from Jesus Christ the Son of the Father, in truth and love.
30650	63	1	4	  It is an intense joy to me to have found  some of your children living true Christian lives, in obedience to the command which we have received from the Father.
30651	63	1	5	 And now, dear lady, I pray you--writing to you, as I do, not a new command, but the one which  we have had from the very beginning--let us love one another.
30652	63	1	6	 The love of which I am speaking consists in our living in obedience to God's commands. God's command is that you should live in obedience to what you all heard from the very beginning.
30653	63	1	7	 For many deceivers have gone out into the world--men who do not acknowledge Jesus as Christ who has come in human nature.  Such a one is `the deceiver' and `the anti-Christ.'
30654	63	1	8	 Keep guard over yourselves, so that you may not lose the results of your good deeds, but may receive back a full reward.
30655	63	1	9	  No one has God, who instead of remaining true to the  teaching of Christ, presses on in advance: but he who remains true to that teaching has both the Father and the Son.
30656	63	1	10	 If any one who comes to you does not bring this teaching, do not receive him under your roof nor  bid him Farewell.
30657	63	1	11	 He who bids him Farewell is a sharer in his evil deeds.
30658	63	1	12	 I have a great deal to say to you all, but will not write it with paper and ink. Yet I hope to come to see you and speak face to face, so that your happiness may be complete.
30659	63	1	13	 The children of your elect sister send greetings to you.
30660	64	1	1	 The Elder to his dear friend Gaius. Truly I love you.
30661	64	1	2	 My dear friend, I pray that you may in all respects prosper and enjoy good health, just as your soul already prospers.
30662	64	1	3	 For  it is an intense joy to me when brethren come and bear witness to your fidelity to the truth--that you live in obedience to the truth.
30663	64	1	4	 I have no greater  joy than to hear that my children are  living in obedience to the truth.
30664	64	1	5	 My dear friend, you are acting faithfully in all your behaviour towards the brethren, even when they are strangers to you.
30665	64	1	6	 They have testified, in the presence of the Church, to your love; and you will do well to help them on their journey  in a manner worthy of your fellowship with God.
30666	64	1	7	 For it is for Christ that they have gone forth, accepting nothing from the Gentiles.
30667	64	1	8	 It is therefore our duty to show hospitality to such men, so that we may be fellow workers in promoting the truth.
30668	64	1	9	  I wrote to the Church, but Diotrephes, who loves to have the first place among them, refuses to listen to us.
30669	64	1	10	 For this reason, if I come, I shall not forget his conduct, nor his idle and mischievous talk against us. And he does not stop there: he not only will not receive the brethren, but those who desire to do this he hinders, and excludes them from the Church.
30670	64	1	11	 My dear friend, do not follow wrong examples, but right ones. He who habitually does what is right is a child of God: he who habitually does what is wrong has not seen God.
30671	64	1	12	 The character of Demetrius has the approval of all men, and of the truth itself. We also express our approval of it, and you know that we only give our approval to that which is true.
30672	64	1	13	 I have a great deal to say to you, but I do not wish to go on writing it with ink and pen.
30673	64	1	14	 But I hope to see you very soon, and then we will speak face to face. Peace be with you. Our friends send greetings to you. Greet our friends individually.
30674	64	1	15	 []
30675	65	1	1	  Jude, a bondservant of Jesus Christ and  a brother of James: To those who are  in God the Father,  enfolded in His love, and kept for Jesus Christ, and called.
30676	65	1	2	  May mercy, peace and love be abundantly granted to you.
30677	65	1	3	 Dear friends, since I am eager  to begin a letter to you on the subject of  our common salvation, I find myself constrained  to write and cheer you on to the vigorous defense of the faith delivered once for all to God's people.
30678	65	1	4	  For  certain persons have crept in unnoticed--men spoken of in ancient writings as pre-destined to this condemnation--ungodly men, who pervert the grace of our God into an excuse for immorality, and disown Jesus Christ, our only Sovereign and Lord.
30679	65	1	5	  I desire to remind you--although the whole matter is already familiar to you--that the Lord saved a people out of the land of Egypt, but  afterwards destroyed those who  had no faith.
30680	65	1	6	  And angels--those who  did not keep the position originally assigned to them, but deserted their own proper abode--He reserves in everlasting bonds, in darkness, in preparation for the judgement of the great day.
30681	65	1	7	  So also Sodom and Gomorrah--and the neighboring towns in the same manner--having been guilty of gross fornication and having gone astray in pursuit of unnatural vice, are now before us as a specimen of the fire of the Ages in the punishment which they are undergoing.
30682	65	1	8	  Yet in just the same way  these dreamers also  pollute the body, while they set authority at naught and speak evil of dignities.
30683	65	1	9	  But Michael the Archangel, when contending with the Devil and arguing with him about the body of Moses, did not dare to pronounce judgement on him in abusive terms, but simply said, "The Lord rebuke you."
30684	65	1	10	  Yet these men are abusive in matters of which they know nothing, and in things which, like the brutes, they understand instinctively--in all these  they corrupt themselves.
30685	65	1	11	  Alas for them; for they have followed in the steps of Cain; for the sake of gain they have rushed on headlong in the evil ways of Balaam; and have perished in  rebellion like that of  Korah!
30686	65	1	12	  These men--sunken rocks! --are those who share the pleasure of your love-feasts, unrestrained by fear while caring only for themselves; clouds without water, driven away by the winds; trees that cast their fruit, barren, doubly dead, uprooted;
30687	65	1	13	  wild waves of the sea,  foaming out their own shame; wandering stars, for whom is reserved dense darkness of age-long duration.
30688	65	1	14	  It was also about these that Enoch, who belonged to the seventh generation from Adam, prophesied, saying, "The Lord  has come, attended by myriads of His people, to execute judgement upon all,
30689	65	1	15	 and to convict all the ungodly of all the ungodly deeds which in their ungodliness they have committed, and of all the hard words which they, ungodly sinners as they are, have spoken against Him."
30690	65	1	16	  These men are murmurers, ever bemoaning their lot. Their lives are guided by their evil passions, and their mouths are full of  big, boastful words,  while they treat  individual men with admiring reverence for the sake of the advantage they can gain.
30691	65	1	17	  But as for you, my dearly-loved friends, remember the words that before now were spoken by the Apostles of our Lord Jesus Christ--
30692	65	1	18	  how they declared to you, "In the last times there shall be scoffers,  obeying only their own ungodly passions."
30693	65	1	19	  These are those who cause divisions. They are  men of the world,  wholly unspiritual.
30694	65	1	20	  But you, my dearly-loved friends, building yourselves up on the basis of your most holy faith and praying in the Holy Spirit,
30695	65	1	21	  must keep yourselves safe in the love of God, waiting for the mercy of our Lord Jesus Christ which will result in the Life of the Ages.
30696	65	1	22	  Some, when they argue with you, you must  endeavor to convince;
30697	65	1	23	  others you must  try to save, as brands plucked  from the flames; and on others look with pity mingled with fear,  while you hate every trace of their sin.
30698	65	1	24	   But to Him who is able to keep you safe from stumbling, and cause you to stand in the presence of His glory free from blemish and full of exultant joy--
30699	65	1	25	 to the only God our Saviour--through Jesus Christ our Lord, be ascribed glory, majesty, might, and authority, as it was before all time, is now, and shall be to all the Ages! Amen.
30700	66	1	1	  The revelation  given by Jesus Christ, which God granted Him, that He might make known to His  servants certain events which must  shortly come to pass: and He sent His angel and communicated it to His  servant John.
30701	66	1	2	 This is the John who taught the truth concerning the Word of God and  the truth told us by Jesus Christ--  a faithful account of what he had seen.
30702	66	1	3	 Blessed is he who  reads and blessed are those who listen to the words of this prophecy and lay to heart what is written in it; for  the time for its fulfillment is now close at hand.
30703	66	1	4	 John sends greetings to the seven Churches in  the province of Asia. May grace be granted to you, and peace, from Him who is and was and  evermore will be; and from  the seven Spirits which are before His throne;
30704	66	1	5	 and from Jesus Christ, the truthful witness, the first of the dead to be born to Life, and the Ruler of the kings of the  earth. To Him who loves us and has freed us from our sins with His own blood,
30705	66	1	6	 and has  formed us into a Kingdom, to be priests to  God, His Father--to Him be ascribed the glory and the power until the Ages  of the Ages. Amen.
30706	66	1	7	  He is coming in the clouds, and  every eye will see Him, and  so will those who pierced Him; and all the  nations of the earth will gaze on Him and mourn. Even so. Amen.
30707	66	1	8	 "I am the Alpha and the Omega," says the Lord God, "He who is and was and  evermore will be--the Ruler of all."
30708	66	1	9	 I John, your brother, and a sharer with you in the sorrows and Kingship and patient endurance of Jesus, found myself in the island of Patmos, on account of the Word of God and the truth told us by Jesus.
30709	66	1	10	 In the Spirit I found myself present on  the day of the Lord, and I heard behind me a loud voice which resembled the blast of a trumpet.
30710	66	1	11	 It said, "Write forthwith in  a roll an account of what you see, and send it to the seven Churches--to Ephesus, Smyrna, Pergamum, Thyateira, Sardis, Philadelphia and Laodicea."
30711	66	1	12	 I turned to see  who it was that was speaking to me; and  then I saw  seven golden lampstands,
30712	66	1	13	 and in the center of the lampstands some One resembling the Son of Man, clothed in a robe which reached to His feet, and with a girdle of gold across His breast.
30713	66	1	14	 His head and His hair were white, like white wool--as white as snow; and His eyes resembled a flame of fire.
30714	66	1	15	 His feet were like silver-bronze, when it is  white-hot in a furnace; and His voice resembled the sound of many waters.
30715	66	1	16	 In His right hand He held seven stars, and a sharp, two-edged sword  was seen coming from His mouth; and His glance resembled the sun when it is shining with its full strength.
30716	66	1	17	 When I saw Him, I fell at His feet as if I were dead. But He laid His right hand upon me and said, "Do not be afraid: I am the First and the Last, and the ever-living One.
30717	66	1	18	 I died; but I am now alive until the Ages of the Ages, and I have  the keys of the gates of Death and of Hades!
30718	66	1	19	 Write down therefore the things you have just seen, and those which are now taking place, and those which are soon to follow:
30719	66	1	20	 the secret meaning of the seven stars which you have seen in My right hand, and of the seven lampstands of gold. The seven stars are the  ministers of  the seven Churches, and the seven lampstands are the seven Churches.
30720	66	2	1	 "To the  minister of the Church in Ephesus write as follows: "`This is what He who holds the seven stars in the grasp of His right hand says--He who walks to and fro among the seven lampstands of gold.
30721	66	2	2	 I know your doings and your toil and patient suffering. And I know that you cannot tolerate wicked men, but have put to the test those who say that they themselves are Apostles but are not, and you have found them to be liars.
30722	66	2	3	 And you endure patiently and have borne burdens for My sake and have never grown weary.
30723	66	2	4	 Yet I have this against you--that  you no longer love Me as you did at first.
30724	66	2	5	 Be mindful, therefore, of the height from which you have fallen. Repent at once, and act as you did at first, or else I will surely come and remove your lampstand out of its place--unless you repent.
30725	66	2	6	 Yet this you have in your favor: you hate the doings of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
30726	66	2	7	 "`Let all who have ears give heed to what the Spirit is saying to the Churches. To him who overcomes I will give the privilege of eating the fruit of the  Tree of Life, which is in the Paradise of God.'
30727	66	2	8	 "To the minister of the Church at Smyrna write as follows: "`This is what the First and the Last says--He who  died and has returned to life.
30728	66	2	9	 Your sufferings I know, and your poverty--but you are rich--and the evil name given you by those who say that they themselves are Jews, and are not, but are Satan's synagogue.
30729	66	2	10	 Dismiss your fears concerning all that you are about to suffer. I tell you that the Devil is about to throw some of you into prison that you may be put to the test, and for ten days you will have to  endure persecution.  Be faithful to the End,  even if you have to die, and then I will give you the victor's Wreath of Life.
30730	66	2	11	 "`Let all who have ears give heed to what the Spirit is saying to the Churches. He who overcomes shall be in no way hurt by  the Second Death.'
30731	66	2	12	 "To the minister of the Church at Pergamum write as follows: "`This is what He who has the sharp, two-edged sword says. I know where you dwell.
30732	66	2	13	  Satan's throne is there; and yet  you are true to Me, and did not deny your faith in Me, even in the days of Antipas My witness and faithful friend, who was put to death among you, in the place where Satan dwells.
30733	66	2	14	 Yet I have a few things against you, because you have  with you some that cling to the teaching of Balaam, who taught Balak to put a stumbling-block in the way of the descendants of Israel--to eat what had been sacrificed to idols, and commit fornication.
30734	66	2	15	 So even you have some that cling in the same way to the teaching of the Nicolaitans.
30735	66	2	16	 Repent, at once; or else I will come to you quickly, and will make war upon them with the sword which is in My mouth.
30736	66	2	17	 "`Let all who have ears give heed to what the Spirit is saying to the Churches. He who overcomes--to him I will give some of the  hidden Manna, and a white stone; and--written upon the stone and known only to him who receives it--  a new name.'
30737	66	2	18	 "To the minister of the Church at Thyateira write as follows: "`This is what the Son of God says--He who has eyes like a flame of fire, and feet resembling silver-bronze.
30738	66	2	19	 I know your doings, your love, your faith, your service, and  your patient endurance; and that  of late you have toiled harder than you did at first.
30739	66	2	20	 Yet I have this against you, that you tolerate the woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess and by her teaching leads astray My servants, so that they commit fornication and eat what has been sacrificed to idols.
30740	66	2	21	 I have given her time to repent, but she is determined not to repent of her fornication.
30741	66	2	22	 I tell you that I am about to cast her upon a bed of sickness, and I will severely afflict those who commit adultery with her, unless they repent of conduct such as hers.
30742	66	2	23	 Her children too shall surely die; and all the Churches shall come to know that I am He who searches into men's inmost thoughts; and to each of you I will give a requital which shall be in accordance with what your conduct has been.
30743	66	2	24	 But to you, the rest of you in Thyateira, all who do not hold this teaching and are not the people who have learnt the "deep things," as they call them (the deep things of Satan!) --to you I say that I lay no other burden on you.
30744	66	2	25	 Only that which you already possess, cling to  until I come.
30745	66	2	26	 "`And to him who overcomes and obeys My commands to the very end, I will give  authority over the nations of the earth.
30746	66	2	27	 And he shall be their shepherd, ruling them with a  rod of iron, just as earthenware jars are broken to pieces; and his power over them shall be like that which I Myself have received from My Father;
30747	66	2	28	 and I will give him  the Morning Star.
30748	66	2	29	 Let all who have ears give heed to what the Spirit is saying to the Churches.'
30749	66	3	1	 "To the minister of the Church at Sardis write as follows: "`This is what He who has the seven Spirits of God and the seven stars says. I know your doings--you are supposed to be alive, but in reality you are dead.
30750	66	3	2	 Rouse yourself and keep awake, and strengthen those things which remain but have well-nigh perished; for I have found no doings of yours free from imperfection in the sight of My God.
30751	66	3	3	 Be mindful, therefore, of the lessons you have received and heard. Continually lay them to heart, and repent. If, however, you fail to rouse yourself and keep awake, I shall come upon you suddenly like a thief, and you will certainly not know the hour at which I shall come to judge you.
30752	66	3	4	 Yet you have in Sardis a few who have not soiled their garments; and they shall walk with Me in white; for they are worthy.
30753	66	3	5	 "`In this way he who overcomes shall be clothed in  white garments; and I will certainly not blot out his name from the  Book of Life, but will  acknowledge him in the presence of My Father and His angels.
30754	66	3	6	 Let all who have ears give heed to what the Spirit is saying to the Churches.'
30755	66	3	7	 "To the minister of the Church at Philadelphia write as follows: "`This is what the holy One and the true says--He who has the key of David--He who opens and no one shall shut, and shuts and no one shall open.
30756	66	3	8	 I know your doings. I have  put an opened door in front of you, which no one can  shut; because you have but a little power, and yet you have guarded My word and have not disowned Me.
30757	66	3	9	 I will cause some belonging to Satan's synagogue who say that they themselves are Jews, and are not, but are liars--I will make them come and fall at your feet and know for certain that I have loved you.
30758	66	3	10	 Because  in spite of suffering you have guarded My word, I in turn will guard you from that hour of trial which is soon coming upon the whole world, to put to the test  the inhabitants of the  earth.
30759	66	3	11	 I am coming quickly: cling to that which you already possess, so that your wreath of victory be not taken away from you.
30760	66	3	12	 "`He who overcomes--I will make him a pillar in the sanctuary of My God, and he shall never go out from it again. And I will write on him the  name of My God, and the name of the city of My God, the  new Jerusalem, which is to come down out of Heaven from My God, and My own new name.
30761	66	3	13	 Let all who have ears give heed to what the Spirit is saying to the Churches.'
30762	66	3	14	 "And to the minister of the Church at Laodicea write as follows: "`This is what the Amen says--the  true and faithful witness, the Beginning and Lord of God's Creation.
30763	66	3	15	 I know your doings--you are neither cold nor hot; I would that you were cold or hot!
30764	66	3	16	 Accordingly, because you are lukewarm and neither hot nor cold, before long I will vomit you out of My mouth.
30765	66	3	17	 You say, I am rich, and have wealth stored up, and I stand in need of nothing; and you do not know that if there is a wretched creature it is *you* --  pitiable, poor, blind, naked.
30766	66	3	18	 Therefore I counsel you to buy of Me gold refined in the fire that you may become rich, and white robes to put on, so as to hide your shameful nakedness, and eye-salve to anoint your eyes with, so that you may be able to see.
30767	66	3	19	  All whom I hold dear, I reprove and chastise; therefore be in earnest and repent.
30768	66	3	20	 I am now standing at the door and am knocking. If any one listens to My voice and opens the door, I will go in to be with him and will feast with him, and he shall feast with Me.
30769	66	3	21	 "`To him who overcomes I will give the privilege of sitting down with Me  on My throne, as I also have overcome and have sat down with My Father on His throne.
30770	66	3	22	 Let all who have ears give heed to what the Spirit is saying to the Churches.'"
30771	66	4	1	 After all this I looked and saw a door in Heaven standing open, and the voice that I had previously heard, which resembled the blast of a trumpet, again spoke to me and said, "Come up here, and I will show you things which are to happen in the future."
30772	66	4	2	 Immediately I found myself in the Spirit, and  saw a throne in Heaven, and some One sitting on the throne.
30773	66	4	3	 The appearance of Him who sat there was like  jasper or sard; and encircling the throne was a  rainbow, in appearance like an emerald.
30774	66	4	4	 Surrounding the throne there were also twenty-four other thrones, on which sat  twenty-four Elders clothed in white robes, with victors' wreaths of gold upon their heads.
30775	66	4	5	 Out from the throne  there came flashes of lightning, and voices, and peals of thunder, while in front of the throne seven blazing lamps were burning, which are the seven Spirits of God.
30776	66	4	6	 And in front of the throne there seemed to be a  sea of glass, resembling crystal. And  midway between the throne and the Elders, and surrounding the throne, were  four living creatures, full of eyes in front and behind.
30777	66	4	7	 The first living creature resembled a lion, the second an ox, the third had a face like that of a man, and the fourth resembled an eagle flying.
30778	66	4	8	 And each of the four living creatures had six wings, and in every direction, and within, are full of eyes; and day after day, and night after night, they never cease saying,  "Holy, holy, holy, Lord God, the Ruler of all, who wast and art and  evermore shalt be."
30779	66	4	9	 And whenever the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to Him who is seated on the throne, and lives until the Ages of the Ages,
30780	66	4	10	 the twenty-four Elders fall down before Him who sits on the throne and worship Him who lives until the Ages of the Ages, and they cast their wreaths down in front of the throne,
30781	66	4	11	 saying, "It is fitting, O our Lord and God, That we should ascribe unto Thee the glory and the honor and the power; For Thou didst create all things, And because it was Thy will they came into existence, and were created."
30782	66	5	1	 And I saw  lying in the right hand of Him who sat on the throne  a book  written on both sides and closely sealed with seven seals.
30783	66	5	2	 And I saw a mighty angel who was exclaiming in a loud voice, "Who is worthy to open the book and break its seals?"
30784	66	5	3	 But no one in Heaven, or on earth, or under the earth, was able to open the book or look into it.
30785	66	5	4	 And while I was  weeping bitterly, because no one was found worthy to open the book or look into it,
30786	66	5	5	 one of the Elders said to me,  "Do not weep. The Lion which belongs to the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has triumphed, and will open the book and break its seven seals."
30787	66	5	6	 Then,  midway between the throne and the four living creatures, I saw  a Lamb standing among the Elders. He looked as if He had been offered in sacrifice, and He had seven horns and seven eyes. The last-named are the seven Spirits of God, and  have been sent far and wide into all the  earth.
30788	66	5	7	 So He comes, and now He has taken the book out of the right hand of Him who is seated on the throne.
30789	66	5	8	 And when He had taken the book, the four living creatures and the twenty-four Elders fell down before the Lamb, having each of them a harp and bringing golden bowls full of incense, which represent the prayers of God's people.
30790	66	5	9	 And now they sing a new song. "It is fitting," they say, "that Thou shouldst be the One to take the book And break its seals; Because Thou hast been offered in sacrifice, And hast purchased for God with Thine own blood Some out of every tribe and language and people and nation,
30791	66	5	10	 And hast formed them into a Kingdom to be priests to our God, And they  reign over the earth."
30792	66	5	11	 And I looked, and heard  what seemed to be the voices of countless angels on every side of the throne, and of the living creatures and the Elders. Their number was myriads of myriads and thousands of thousands,
30793	66	5	12	 and in loud voices they were singing, "It is fitting that the Lamb which has been offered in sacrifice should receive all power and riches and wisdom and might and honor and glory and blessing."
30794	66	5	13	 And as for every created thing in Heaven and on earth and under the earth and on the sea, and everything that was in any of these, I heard them say, "To Him who is seated on the throne, And to the Lamb, Be ascribed all blessing and honor And glory and might, Until the Ages of the Ages!"
30795	66	5	14	 Then the four living creatures said "Amen," and the Elders fell down and  worshipped.
30796	66	6	1	 And when the Lamb broke one of the seven seals I saw it, and I heard  one of the four living creatures say, as if in a voice of thunder,  "Come."
30797	66	6	2	 And I looked and a white horse appeared, and its  rider carried a bow; and a victor's wreath was given to him; and he went out conquering and in order to conquer.
30798	66	6	3	 And when the Lamb broke the second seal, I heard  the second living creature say, "Come."
30799	66	6	4	 And another horse came out--a  fiery-red one; and power was given to its rider to take peace from the  earth, and to cause men to  kill one another; and a great  sword was given to him.
30800	66	6	5	 When the Lamb broke the third seal, I heard  the third living creature say, "Come." I looked, and a black horse appeared, its rider carrying a balance in his hand.
30801	66	6	6	 And I heard what seemed to be a voice speaking in the midst of the four living creatures, and saying,  "A quart of wheat for a shilling, and three quarts of barley for a shilling; but do not injure either  the oil or the wine."
30802	66	6	7	 When the Lamb broke the fourth seal I heard  the voice of the  fourth living creature say, "Come."
30803	66	6	8	 I looked and a pale-colored horse appeared. Its rider's name was  Death, and Hades came close behind him; and authority was given to them over the fourth part of the earth, to kill with the sword or with famine or pestilence or by means of the wild beasts of the earth.
30804	66	6	9	 When the Lamb broke the fifth seal, I saw at the foot of the altar  the souls of those whose lives had been sacrificed because of the word of God and of the testimony which they had given.
30805	66	6	10	 And  now in loud voices they cried out, saying, "How long, O Sovereign Lord, the holy One and the true, dost Thou delay judgment and the taking of vengeance upon the  inhabitants of the earth for our blood?"
30806	66	6	11	 And there was given to each of them a long white robe, and they were bidden to wait patiently for a short time longer, until the full number of their fellow bondservants should also complete--namely of their brethren who were soon to be killed just as they had been.
30807	66	6	12	  When the Lamb broke the sixth seal I looked, and there was a great earthquake, and the sun became as dark as sackcloth, and the whole disc of the moon became like blood.
30808	66	6	13	 The stars in the sky also fell to the earth, as when a fig-tree, upon being shaken by a gale of wind, casts its  unripe figs to the ground.
30809	66	6	14	 The sky too passed away, as if a scroll were being rolled up, and every mountain and island was removed from its place.
30810	66	6	15	  The kings of the earth and the great men, the military chiefs, the wealthy and the powerful--all, whether slaves or free men--hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains,
30811	66	6	16	 while they called to the mountains and the rocks, saying, "Fall on us and hide us from the presence of Him who sits on the throne and from the anger of the Lamb;
30812	66	6	17	 for the day of His anger--that great day--has come, and who is able to stand?"
30813	66	7	1	 After this I saw four angels standing  at the four corners of the  earth, and holding back the four winds of the earth so that no wind should blow over the earth or the sea or upon any tree.
30814	66	7	2	 And I saw another angel  coming from the east and carrying a seal belonging to the  ever-living God. He called in a loud voice to the four angels whose work it was to injure the earth and the sea.
30815	66	7	3	  "Injure neither land nor sea nor trees," he said, "until we have sealed the bondservants of our God upon their foreheads."
30816	66	7	4	 When the sealing was finished, I heard how many were sealed out of the tribes of the descendants of Israel. They were 144,000.
30817	66	7	5	 Of the tribe of Judah, 12,000 were sealed; Of the tribe of Reuben, 12,000; Of the tribe of Gad, 12,000;
30818	66	7	6	 Of the tribe of Asher, 12,000; Of the tribe of Naphtali, 12,000; Of the tribe of Manasseh, 12,000;
30819	66	7	7	 Of the tribe of Symeon, 12,000; Of the tribe of Levi, 12,000; Of the tribe of Issachar, 12,000;
30820	66	7	8	 Of the tribe of Zebulun, 12,000; Of the tribe of Joseph, 12,000; Of the tribe of Benjamin, 12,000.
30821	66	7	9	 After this I looked, and a vast host appeared which it was impossible for anyone to  count, gathered out of every nation and from all tribes and peoples and languages, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed in long white robes, and carrying palm-branches in their hands.
30822	66	7	10	 In loud voices they were exclaiming, "It is to our God who is seated on the throne, and to the Lamb, that we owe our salvation!"
30823	66	7	11	  All the angels were standing in a circle round the throne and round the Elders and the four living creatures, and they fell on their faces in front of the throne and worshipped God.
30824	66	7	12	 "Even so!" they cried: "The blessing and the glory and the wisdom and the thanks and the honor and the power and the might are to be ascribed to our God, until the Ages of the Ages! Even so!"
30825	66	7	13	 Then, addressing me, one of the Elders said, "Who are these people clothed in the long white robes? And where have they come from?"
30826	66	7	14	 "My lord, you know," I replied. "They are those," he said, "who  have just passed through  the great distress, and have washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
30827	66	7	15	 For this reason they stand before the very throne of God, and render Him service, day after day and night after night, in His sanctuary, and He who is sitting upon the throne will shelter them in His tent.
30828	66	7	16	 They will never again be hungry or thirsty, and never again will the sun or any scorching heat trouble them.
30829	66	7	17	 For the Lamb who is  in front of the throne will be their Shepherd, and will guide them to watersprings of Life, and God will wipe every tear from their eyes."
30830	66	8	1	 When the Lamb broke the seventh seal, there was  silence in Heaven for about half an hour.
30831	66	8	2	 Then I saw the seven angels who are in the presence of God, and  seven trumpets were given to them.
30832	66	8	3	 And another angel came and stood close to the altar, carrying a censer of gold; and abundance of incense was given to him that he might place it with the prayers of all God's people upon the golden altar which was in front of the throne.
30833	66	8	4	 And the smoke of the incense rose into the presence of God from the angel's hand, and mingled with the prayers of His people.
30834	66	8	5	  So the angel took the censer and filled it with fire from the altar and flung it to the earth; and there followed peals of thunder, and voices, and flashes of lightning, and an earthquake.
30835	66	8	6	 Then the seven angels who had the seven trumpets made preparations for blowing them.
30836	66	8	7	  The first blew his trumpet; and there came hail and fire, mixed with blood, falling upon the earth; and a third part of the earth was burnt up, and a third part of the trees and all the green grass.
30837	66	8	8	  The second angel blew his trumpet; and what seemed to be a great mountain, all ablaze with fire, was hurled into the sea; and a third part of the sea was turned into blood.
30838	66	8	9	 And a third part of the creatures that were in the sea--those that had life--died; and a third part of the ships were destroyed.
30839	66	8	10	  The third angel blew his trumpet; and there fell from Heaven a great star, which was on fire like a torch. It fell upon a third part of the rivers and upon the springs of water.
30840	66	8	11	 The name of the star is `Wormwood;' and a third part of the waters were turned into wormwood, and vast numbers of the people died from drinking the water, because it had become bitter.
30841	66	8	12	  Then the fourth angel blew his trumpet; and a curse fell upon a third part of the sun, a third part of the moon, and a third part of the stars, so that a third part of them were darkened and for a third of the day, and also of the night, there was no light.
30842	66	8	13	 Then I looked, and I heard a solitary eagle crying in a loud voice, as it flew across the sky, "Alas, alas, alas, for the  inhabitants of the  earth, because of the significance of the remaining trumpets which the three angels are about to blow!"
30843	66	9	1	 The fifth angel blew his trumpet; and I saw  a Star which  had fallen from Heaven to the earth; and to him was given the key of the depths of the bottomless pit,
30844	66	9	2	 and he opened the depths of the bottomless pit. And smoke came up out of the pit resembling the smoke of a vast furnace, so that the sun was darkened, and the air also, by reason of the smoke of the pit.
30845	66	9	3	 And from the midst of the smoke there came  locusts on to the  earth, and power was given to them resembling the power which earthly scorpions possess.
30846	66	9	4	 And they were forbidden to injure the herbage of the earth, or any green thing, or any tree. They were only to injure human beings--those who have not the seal of God on their foreheads.
30847	66	9	5	 Their mission was not to kill, but to cause awful agony for  five months; and this agony was like that which a scorpion inflicts when it stings a man.
30848	66	9	6	 And at that time people will seek death, but will by no possibility find it, and will long to die, but death evades them.
30849	66	9	7	 The appearance of the locusts was like that of horses equipped for war. On their heads they had wreaths which looked like gold.
30850	66	9	8	 Their faces seemed human and  they had hair like women's hair, but their teeth resembled those of lions.
30851	66	9	9	 They had breast-plates which seemed to be made of steel; and the noise caused by their wings was like that of a vast number of horses and chariots hurrying into battle.
30852	66	9	10	 They had tails like those of scorpions, and also stings; and in their tails lay their power of injuring mankind for five months.
30853	66	9	11	 The locusts had  a king over them--the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in Hebrew is  `Abaddon,' while in the Greek he is called  `Apollyon.'
30854	66	9	12	 The first woe is past; two other woes have still to come.
30855	66	9	13	  The sixth angel blew his trumpet; and I heard a single voice speaking from among the horns of the golden incense altar which is in the presence of God.
30856	66	9	14	 It said to the sixth angel--the angel who had the trumpet, "Set at liberty the four angels who are prisoners near the great river Euphrates."
30857	66	9	15	 And the four angels who had been kept in readiness for that hour, day, month, and year, were set at liberty, so that they might kill a third part of mankind.
30858	66	9	16	 The number of the cavalry was two hundred millions; I heard their number.
30859	66	9	17	 And this was the appearance of the horses which I saw in my vision--and of their riders. The body-armour of the riders was red, blue and yellow; and the horses' heads were shaped like the heads of lions, while from their mouths there  came fire and smoke and sulphur.
30860	66	9	18	 By these three plagues a third part of mankind were destroyed--by the fire and the smoke, and by the sulphur which came from their mouths.
30861	66	9	19	 For the power of the horses is in their mouths and  in their tails; their tails being like serpents, and having heads, and it is with them that they inflict injury.
30862	66	9	20	 But the rest of mankind who were not killed by these plagues, did not even then repent and leave the things they had made, so as to cease worshipping the demons, and the idols of gold and silver, bronze, stone, and wood, which can neither see nor hear, nor move.
30863	66	9	21	  Nor did they repent of their murders, their practice of magic, their fornication, or their thefts.
30864	66	10	1	  Then I saw another strong angel coming down from Heaven. He was robed in a cloud, and over his head was the rainbow. His face was like the sun, and his feet resembled pillars of fire.
30865	66	10	2	 In his  hand he held a small scroll unrolled; and, planting his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land,
30866	66	10	3	 he cried out in a loud voice which resembled the roar of a lion. And when he had cried out, each of the seven peals of thunder uttered its own message.
30867	66	10	4	 And when the seven  peals of thunder had spoken, I was about to write down what they had said; but I heard a voice from Heaven which told me to keep secret all that the seven peals of thunder had said, and not write it down.
30868	66	10	5	 Then the angel that I saw standing on the sea and on the land, lifted his right hand toward Heaven.
30869	66	10	6	 And in the name of Him who lives until the Ages of the Ages, the Creator of Heaven and all that is in it, of the earth and all that is in it, and of the sea and all that is in it, he solemnly declared,
30870	66	10	7	 "There shall be no further  delay; but in the days when the seventh angel blows his trumpet--when he begins to do so--then the secret purposes of God are realized, in accordance with the good news which He gave to His  servants the Prophets."
30871	66	10	8	 Then the voice which I had heard speaking from Heaven once more addressed me. It said, "Go and take the little book which lies open in the hand of the angel who is standing on the sea and on the land."
30872	66	10	9	 So I went to the angel and asked him to give me the little book. "Take it," he said, "and  eat the whole of it. You will find it bitter when you have eaten it, although in your mouth it will taste as sweet as honey."
30873	66	10	10	 So I took the roll out of the angel's hand and ate the whole of it; and in my mouth it was as sweet as honey, but when I had eaten it I found it very bitter.
30874	66	10	11	 And  a voice said to me, "You must prophesy yet further concerning peoples, nations, languages, and many kings."
30875	66	11	1	 Then a reed was given me to serve as a measuring rod; and a voice said, "Rise, and measure God's sanctuary--and  the altar--and count the worshipers who are in it.
30876	66	11	2	 But as for the court which is outside the sanctuary, pass it over. Do not measure it; for it has been given to the Gentiles, and for  forty-two months they will trample the holy city under foot.
30877	66	11	3	 And I will authorize My  two witnesses to prophesy for  1,260 days,  clothed in sackcloth.
30878	66	11	4	 "These witnesses are  the two olive-trees, and they are the two lamps which stand in the presence of the Lord of the earth.
30879	66	11	5	 And if any one seeks to injure them--fire comes from their mouths and devours their enemies; and if any one seeks to injure them, he will in this way certainly be killed.
30880	66	11	6	 They have power given to them to seal up the sky, so that no rain may fall so long as they continue to prophesy; and power over the waters to turn them into blood, and to smite the  earth with various plagues whenever they choose to do so.
30881	66	11	7	 "And when they have fully delivered their testimony,  the Wild Beast which is to rise out of the bottomless pit will make war upon them and overcome them and kill them.
30882	66	11	8	 And their dead bodies are to lie in the broad street of  the great city which spiritually is designated  `Sodom' and `Egypt,' where indeed their Lord was crucified.
30883	66	11	9	 And men belonging to all peoples, tribes, languages and nations gaze at their dead bodies for three days and a half, but they refuse to let them be laid in a tomb.
